Although i have some cons i thought the hotel was fantastic from start to finish and i would definitely stay again in a heartbeat. Pros: Very fast check in, cool rock memorabilia, comfy bed, luxurious linen and towels, magnifying mirror and full length mirror, decor in room was cool and contemporary. Garden view room was lovely and quiet as opposed to the pool view which is noisy. Pool is fun with movies, lemonade at entrance, fluffy towels and a very cool water slide. Water taxi to and from the park was relaxing and convenient. I feel that the hotel exceeded my expectations and i felt like a VIP in every sense of the word. Luggage services couldn't help me enough and the service was amazing from every employee i encountered. I would actually love to live here!!! Cons: It took ages for the water to go down the plug hole, quite annoying!! When i asked to book a metered cab they booked a private car company that was extortionately priced for the distanced travelled. I would have been happy with a Mears cab but felt that my choice wasn't listened to as 'Rockstars' travel in style i guess and a metered cab would not suffice. Later on my holiday i took a Mears cab and the driver told me that the Hard Rock no longer call metered cabs and now has a contract with a private car company. If you don't want to ripped off by these private car companies call your own cab!!!! I wish i did!!! Oh and it's the 21st century wifi and fitness room should be free for the amount you pay to stay here each night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't buy the club level deal if you don't have kids.”
Reviews.Author: Virg321
Reviews.Content: Way over priced. club level couldn't keep up with demand. standing room only. too many kids. toaster oven broke. poor staff dealing with this headache and we were the only tippers getting a God Bless from one staffer. stay in regular room and save your extra pennies.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live here”
Reviews.Author: Nekolover
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hard Rock. It's a well thought out hotel, with great amenities and really cool decor (check out the saxophone chandelier). It also has the advantage of giving you front of the line access for universal studios. Do not stay at this hotel if you want a quiet experience at a pool, although I believe you can go to one of the other two universal hotel pools for that. I love the Keurig machine in the room too.

Reviews.Title: “Best decision we made!”
Reviews.Author: rbeacher1011
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at this hotel....was a suprise trip for my dd (10)...so it was me (40), dh (41) and ds (20).... They are both huge Harry Potter fans, which was the main point of our trip. The hotel itself is beautiful....very tropical/resort feel. The rock n roll artifacts are really cool. Our room was on the 7th floor (club level) I booked this level b/c of the snacks/breakfast/happy hour. We weren't dissapointed in the club level amenities. Yes, the room is basic with "Ikea" type tables and chairs, but the snacks, sodas, drinks and employees were perfect. Everyone at the hotel was extremely nice and accomodating. Our room was perfect, 2 double beds, plenty of room for us. My son and husband enjoyed being able to charge and play their ipods. Overall the decor was very cool. Didn't spend anytime at the Velvet Lounge, but did visit the Pool Bar quite a bit. The food at the beach club was good. The BEST part of staying on site is by far the Express Pass and ease of traveling back and forth to the park. We varied between walking and water taxi. The Express Pass is so much better than Disney's Fast Pass. You LITERALLY go to the front of the line! Since the hotel is only 7 stories and they have plenty of elevators, it was very easy to run up to the room from the pool and be back in no time. They provided a free shuttle to the restaurant at Portifino Bay, Bice. Very good, wonderful atmosphere but honestly overpriced. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and convenient”
Reviews.Author: starty
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at an on-site hotel and it didn't disappoint. The atmosphere is great, the staff (reception and conceirge especially) are very helpful. We were given a better view room than we had paid for. We stayed 2 nights at the end of July. The size of the room was as expected (reasonable for 2 doubles). The kids loved the tea/coffee/hot chocolate maker and were happy to make hot drinks for us (not something they would usually want to do). There's always music being played with plenty of live performances, including in the lobby and around the pool. The kids loved it, especially different music underwater from that above. We had read that room cleaning sometimes is not up to standard so that remained a little concern and on one day we returned from Universal at around 4pm to find that the room was not cleaned. However, one call to guest services meant that our room was cleaned whilst we were out for dinner and we were given free breakfast. Guest services were also very happy to bring us extra hot chocolate/tea/coffee. We only ate breakfast in the hotel which was excellent (and free!). The staff were very friendly and seemed genuinely happy. Staying in the hotel meant shorter waiting times for dinner at the citywalk which was great, as were the Express Passes. We would have paid for the Express Passes in any case so it meant the room was very good value. If you really want to optimise the stay, it's possible to stay 1 night and do the two Universal parks either side of the night. Hotel guests are let in 1 hour early (7am - is this a holiday?) to go on the Harry Potter rides. There were still queues although no where near as bad as normal. Getting to the parks is either a short walk, bus or boat ride. We walked or took the boat because we liked it. All in all, if we were to to to Universal again we would definitely consider staying at the Hard Rock again (we'd definitely stay at an on-site hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: CoachClassTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right beside Universal Studios Orlando, only a few minutes walk away. The hotel itself was impeccable; large, well cleaned rooms. Great views from any room. Staff friendly and helpful. Lots of activities in the pool area for kids inc. 'beach' area, pool, jacuzzi, slides and large tv-display screen.

Reviews.Title: “This place has a buzz about it”
Reviews.Author: Mitch1946
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay and we really love this hotel, it has a real buzz, kinda like going back in time, try and stay on the club floor for the food and drinks. I am getting a bit over the parks now and I was quite happy to stay in our room or just potter about. The restaurants are great, the pool bar even better. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Early Access and Express Pass were great.”
Reviews.Author: wienerdogsdad
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights with my two sons going to Universal Studios. Great location with easy access to the parks. The early entry and express passes were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but be careful ...!”
Reviews.Author: Munch09
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived into the Hard Rock we were impressed. The drive in and the welcome are fantastic, the lobby is amazing with pictures and memorabilia of the stars ... wow! We did a lot or research before booking our hotel and read a lot of previous reviews. the hotel did match our expectations but it also fell flat on a few occassions. When checking in, the receptionist asked if we ever stayed in Hard Rock before, when we told her that we didn't, she happily handed us over brochures of the hotel and told us about the pool, the restaurant and looked at us blankly with a smile, v disapointing. She was more interested to get us to open a tab for our stay. My one piece of advise would be DON'T! The room was fantastic, nice double beds each, so comfy, nice & big but very dusty & housekeeping didn't clean the rooms, the made the beds and replenish towels & soaps but didn't clean bathroom, skins, dust, floors, never hoovered. The pool area is fantastic, service is super, great entertainment all day & night long, they really do think of everything. The buffet breakfast is to die for, staff so friendly, we did come across a few rude ones but I suppose you would within 2 weeks! The resort really does offer you what you need without having to leave! Although, the charge to use gym and access the fridge ($15 a day!!) is crazy. Starbucks is available in hotel, but quality and prices are crazzzzzy! Overall we would come back!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for a first visit to Universal Orlando”
Reviews.Author: emindc
Reviews.Content: My ten-year-old son and I stayed here for four days in early September while making our first visit to Universal Studios. We chose this hotel so that we could take advantage of early entry into the Islands of Adventure/Wizarding World of Harry Potter. It also entitled us to â€œUniversal Expressâ€� front of the line privileges for most rides at both parks. For these reasons alone, I highly recommend this hotel for families visiting these parks. Nonetheless, we very much enjoyed the hotel even setting aside these perks. Our room was large, light and comfortable with two queen beds and plenty of amenities (though no free Wifi). The atmosphere at the hotel is cool and friendly. We enjoyed hearing the music everywhere we went, as my son is a budding classic rock fan. The pool is fantastic! We spent long afternoons there every day after we wore ourselves out in the parks. One afternoon we even heard live music. One complaint I had was that you could hear a lot of noise from the hallways in the room. Given the hotelâ€™s theme, it attracts lots of teens and young adults, so they could hardly be blamed for rolling back to their rooms in the late hours of the night, but it would have been nice to have more soundproofing for the younger and older rockers trying to get some sleep. You have several options for transportation to the parks. You can take a water taxi to the City Walk area, you can walk on a lovely path (about a quarter mile, Iâ€™m guessing) or you can take a bicycle taxi. All three options are relaxing and efficient. If you are accustomed to Disney, the Universal resorts and parks are much more compact and easy to navigate. We ate one meal at the Kitchen. While it was good, the portions were much too huge, and because the hotel rooms donâ€™t have refrigerators, we had to let that go to waste. You also have many excellent dining choices at City Walk, which we frequented at least daily. In sum, it was a great stay and we wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay here again. Rock on!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be nicer during Hurricane Irene!”
Reviews.Author: MJfromNJ
Reviews.Content: I vacationed here with my teen daughter and her friend over the Hurricane Irene weekend. Our flight home to NY was canceled and we needed to spend an extra night. The Hard Rock's front desk couldn't have been more helpful. They managed to keep us in an excellent room, and even gave us a "hurricane rate" -- about $100 less than the going rate for the room! They asked me repeatedly if there was anything else they could do to make us more comfortable. I'm truly grateful for their exceptional courtesy during a difficult couple of days. Beyond that, we had a great time. The hotel has a young, cool vibe, and while there's constant music in the lobby and at the pool, the floors where the guest rooms are located are perfectly quiet. Short, easy walk to the parks. Good restaurants on the premises. I've stayed here before, and I will stay here again. Thank you, Hard Rock! We appreciate your kindness!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay. Great location from Universal.”
Reviews.Author: ntt1010
Reviews.Content: Checked in and got a free room upgrade! Not many families when we were at the pool on Thursday. Pool/Service was great. Cocktails were ummmm.. pretty strong. :) Breakfast buffet at the "Kitchen" ran about $23 per person but the spread was very good. Had lunch there a separate time and service was pretty slow if the buffet is not readily available. Perfect location and an easy walk or boat shuttle to Universal. Fast pass was a great perk. Note that when we arrived on Thursday, it was pretty slow. They mentioned that they were only running about 40% capacity but that the weekend would pick up. Was really quiet on Thursday Night but come to find out that walls were a tad thin as more people checked in. Pretty sure conversations on either side of occupied rooms were clearly heard. Would definitely head back and stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool & Location”
Reviews.Author: barbeaujo
Reviews.Content: Amazing pool for kids with waterslide. Convienent location, walk to theme park. Only downside is the size of the room and the lack of places to sit around the pool. But for a 2 day getaway, we would probably return. Expensive if you dont plan to use your speed pass for the entire time you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrottersBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 9 nights and it was our 2nd stay. It was once again wonderful. The staff was very kind and helpfull, the check-in was very fast. They changed the room we got because it was a room communicating with the room next to it and we did'nt like that, so we got immediately another room. When we returned in the evening, their was a birthday cake for our daughter in our room! A very nice surprise :) the pool is also very nice, sometimes there is a live band playing at the pool. With your room key you get priority access to most of the attractions in both parks, which is really great! We had a very nice stay in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price for Front of the Line at US & IOA”
Reviews.Author: TinaRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock May 26th-June3rd (Memorial Day Weekend). We had a Deluxe room with 2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa. The room size was great. The bathroom was nice because it was split with 2 sinks which made getting dressed/undressed much better with 4-5 people in the room. The pool was awesome, and they showed movies at night by the pool. The walk to and from the parks was not long and was great for returning to our room for lunch and naps during the heat of the day. Having lunch in the room also saved us money which was spent on the cost of the room. We brought a microwave and refrigerator with us. There is a coffee pot in the room which was great! The beds and bedding were AWESOME. I want to buy their pillows! Our only complaint was that the room had a horrid musty/mildew smell when we arrived. I brought air freshener but it didn't help. The housekeeping staff sprayed the room, too, which still didn't fix the problem. Finally around our 4th day in the room, the hotel staff thought the problem may have been the air filter for the a/c, so they changed it. This made the smell much more tolerable. All in all, I would/will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome pool!”
Reviews.Author: BlushPell
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel to visit the Universal Studios park. The location cannot be beat. You can walk to the park in under 10 minutes. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed. We never had any trouble with noise really. Just a little louder on the weekend but nothing terrible. We stayed away from the pool area which I can tell would have some music noise if you were on that side. The Kitchen restaurant was great for breakfast but expensive. Emack and Bolio's had good ice cream and bagels for breakfast but was also pricey. The lounge was very nice with great martini's! Very chic. There is always music playing at this hotel. Sometimes (especially during an early morning breakfast) it is a little weird to be listening to "crazy train" at 7am in the morning. You also get early admission to the parks when staying here and that is really worth the price. The hotel is a little pricey as far as food is concerned. We stayed on site and did not have a car so it really added up. I would stay here again if only for the pool! It was a great pool. The waterslide was fun and there was entertainment that as well. Great scene. I would stay here again for the right price, or if I wanted to get early and easy access to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: beachbaby1981
Reviews.Content: We got a suite at the Hard Rock for a show at Hard Rock Live and had a great time and a great stay at the hotel. The suite was big: king size bed with a seperate living area and even a dining room table for 6 people. Sat poolside the next day which was nice. Lots of families around since this is Orlando and right by Universal/Islands. It was hard to sleep in because our suite was by the pool and was awoken to loud music from the pool area and screaming children. It wasn't a problem thou. I still prefer Hard Rock Hollywood, but it's a whole other animal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eco055
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but the room was very nice and the pool was perfect. We also really liked the fact that we could get into Univeral Studios 1 hour early and our room key acted as fast passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: idontdobudget
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 week in January with my sister and friend. The hotel was amazing from the moment we set foot in the lobby. We felt very spoilt and were well looked after by all the staff. Our bellhop was amazing and really funny. He told us all the great things to do, all the best rides to go on and when to go to avoid the crowds. He showed us around our room and helped us out with lifting our very heavy bags into our room. The hotel had great amenities and was in the perfect location for Universal studios (about a 5min walk). Our main reason for staying here was the location but the hotel blew us away in all aspects. Free wifi in the lobby which was great and really helpful when my friend needed to communicate urgently with home. The free tea and coffee in our room was a great addition and was used a lot. The really great thing about staying at the Hard Rock was that our room key acted as a express pass allowing us to skip all the lines for the rides. All in all we were very happy with the hotel and especially our bellhop. We would recommend the Hard Rock to anyone going on a holiday to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a brill hotel”
Reviews.Author: myra W
Reviews.Content: just got back and had to say that the three night stay at the end of our holiday was the icing on the cake with two young adults who love universal.Great hotel and friendly staff .Room was spacious and we had exit to pool that we could use to avoid reception in our wet swimwear.Gardens were lovely and just a five to ten minute walk into theme parks through shady green gardens.Pool area was very nice and lifeguards provided security.Would have been perfect but pool very shallow if you really wanted to swim.Breakfast in kitchen restaurant not cheap but really good and staff very attentive to your needs.was great place to stay for few days and ease of getting in and out of park made for fab time especially as early park entry and express pass were included !!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun! Cool place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bobthetarmac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights whilst in Orlando mainly at Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure parks. The rooms were spacious and had great photos and decor in the rooms. We stayed on the Club 7 floor which we felt offered good value in the free drinks, snacks and breakfast we used it quite a lot. The "dive in" movies at the pool were great and we saw the "Spin Doctors" play at the "Velvet Sessions" evening during our stay at which you get free cocktails, beer and nibbles included in the admission-fabulous! Another great perk of staying here is your room keys acted as "Express Pass" for the Universal them and there was also early admission to the Islands Adventure Theme Park (including Harry Potter)

Reviews.Title: “Fast Passes worth weight in gold; otherwise met expectations”
Reviews.Author: milkyway01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for 8 nights in August. The hotel met, but did not exceed expectations, and on the whole it is fair to say that the reviews on trip advisor (if the most extreme ones are ignored) are very accurate. Iâ€™ll comment first, on the positives. If you want to visit either Islands of Adventure or Universal Studios, these are seriously good positives... The main reason we chose the hotel was the proximity to these parks and the fast passes. As expected these proved to be completely invaluable, saving literally hours of queuing time, allowing multiple turns on the major attractions. It was brilliant being able to walk to the parks (and be able to come back for a change of clothes after having been totally soaked on a water ride). Hard Rock is the closest of the three hotels and a really easy stroll, mainly in the shade. The hotel's Starbucks opened at 6.15am so it was possible to take advantage of the early access to Harry Potter with some food/coffee inside. The early HP access is also a serious benefit given the popularity of the attraction but donâ€™t underestimate the early start required for the 7am entry given your days in Orlando tend to be very busy. However, perfect for British travellers for a couple of days whilst bodies adjust to the time difference. If you stay at the hotel please take the time to look around at all the memorabilia; itâ€™s everywhere and really fascinating. We only ate twice at the hotel (breakfast mentioned later in the review) and an evening meal on our last night at the Kitchen â€“ we received superb service, great food choice and excellent food. The not so good stuff: Check In: Despite a four hour delay on our flight from the UK and arriving at the hotel at 11pm it still took nearly 30 minutes to check in which was crazy. In the end the delay appeared to have been around upgrading us to a pool view room (which, in reality, we didn't really want as these rooms were definitely noisier). However, frankly I was too tired to make a fuss and the receptionist threw in a complimentary breakfast at the Kitchen for the wait (and this breakfast turned out to be exceptionally good). Room: Our room was clean, the beds big and comfy but the bathroom was very small for a family of four and the shower water power very ordinary. We never had an issue with the timing of the housekeeping; perhaps that was because we tended to be out most of the day but we did take the time to be friendly to the housekeeping staff. Pool: Iâ€™d say the pool area was ok but very busy, too many (uncomfortable) sunbeds and the water really isn't very deep (therefore not very cool and refreshing). Parking: Iâ€™d got my head round the additional $15 a day for parking, annoying but went with eyes wide open. The self parking car park is really close to the hotel so I struggle to see the need to pay for valet. In fact my husband was the perfect valet parker....dropped us off by the lobby and then went and parked the car! Gym: Again I knew there was a daily cost of c. $10 to visit the gym. To be honest Iâ€™d have struggled to find time to get to the gym but given the cost of the hotel I certainly wasnâ€™t going to pay extra for the privilege! So all in all Iâ€™d say the Hard Rock hotel was exactly the experience Iâ€™d expected it to be and worth its weight in gold if your kids want to spend much of their day upside down on rollarcoasters!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Going Back”
Reviews.Author: ktfloss
Reviews.Content: We only picked this hotel so we could have the express passes for the attractions at Universal and Islands of Adventure. But boy is this some much more. On arrival the whole feeling is of a rock star. Cool young staff at check in. No delay. Rooms ready on arrival at 9am.Dropped bags. Headed to park straightaway via shuttle boat. Went to Universal. After a few hours we had enough. Back to Hotel to explore it. Beautiful landscaping and modern design. Went to pool and dj playing hits as we swam around the warm pool. loved it. Dressed and headed to poolside bar-Beach Club. Had a beer as played a game of pool. Later we had finger food and lots of cocktails. Pina Colada not on menu but Barmaid was very helpful and made it up anyway. Have to say the staff were exceptionally friendly. Not fake friendly. Not trying to impress for tip as its inc in bill so no need to be overly friendly. Have to say majorly impressed. Kids in element as watched Shark Tale from pool. Sister even more impressed as could have cocktail in pool. Brotheri n law could smoke in bar as its officially outside so he was impressed. Eventually went to bed. So comfortable. Crashed out in seconds. TV had multiple channels so something for everyone. Up early in am as wanted to avail of early entry to parks for guests. Had opted for express check out. Dropped bags off at reception as will collect them later. headed to Islands of Adventure on foot. Only a short nice walk. Passed the Butterfly garden. Back to pool for one last time before we have to head back to our other hotel. waiters come round every few minutes doing poolside service. also brought fresh orange segments cmoplimentary. laods of fresh fluffy towels. Cabanas looked fab but didnt avail. Not there long enough. Had an ice cream in Emack and Bolios. Yum. Departed with a definite plan to return. Such a cool place. Didnt mention all the memoribilia. Everywhere. Even a seat from Partridge Family bus.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: jfitzp1741
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 great nights at The Hard Rock. The reviews have been all over the place, and I was a little hesitant. So glad we booked. Location is incredible...easy walk to the parks and City Walk. Check in was fast (30 seconds), room was ready early....room was immaculate and spacious (standard room). Our room over looked the pool and noise was not an issue. Pool had a DJ one afternoon (kids had a ball) and a live band another day. Yes, it is a party atmosphere (a family party atmosphere). If you are looking for peace and quiet and would like to read while relaxing at the pool, I would suggest the Portofino. We stayed there once before and it is a totally different atmosphere. My 10 year old wants to know when we will be returning to the Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bostonstm
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Hard Rock Hotel in late August for 4 nights. The property is immaculate and has hands down the best on site dining of any property that we have ever stayed at. The Kitchen is absolutely fabulous for breakfast or dinner. The Beach Club was terrific for a late dinner after a day at the parks. Their service around the pool was consistent and the wait staff extremely pleasant. Check in was a breeze and although our room was not ready until 4PM we had no problem finding things to do - there always seems to be something happening around the hotel and most particularly the pool area! The dive in movies at pm were wonderful after a long day in the parks. Our room was quite large and had extremely comfortable and good sized beds. We liked that we could walk from the hotel to the parks in under 15 minutes. The easy access to CityWalk was also a big plus as was the express line status you receive by staying onsite. We cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cooltuck7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days before heading to walt disney world. The resort was beautiful and clean and well decorated. The rooms were nice and the pool was fabulous. We arrived at the hotel about 9:30 p and went right up to the room to change and out to the pool. They were showing Avatar on a big blow screen. We ate at the open air restaurant overloooking the pool, the food was good and not horribly priced. We went to Universal early the next morning we took a pedicab there and took the boat home. The next day we walked, it is totally walkable, especially if you cut through the pool to the walkway (and that way you also avoid the one REALLY pushy pedicab guy who sits by the water taxi). The grounds of the hotel are beautfiul and worth walking around to see. The fast passes for Universal are included with staying at the resort and what a benefit that was!!! We ended booking a pool view room because we booked later than we wanted to because of Hurricane Irene and definitely concur with earlier reviews that the extra charge ($40 or so) for a pool view room is NOT worth it if you are deciding whether or not to splurge for it. The palm trees and foliage around the pool, although lovely, have obscured the view to the pool they should not even being to charge extra for that at this point. I thought the hotel did an excellent job making it feel like both an adult resort and a family resort. They had lots of activities at the pool, while the speakers were blaring (and I do mean blaring, at times it was hard to have a conversation, although maybe I am just getting old) nine inch nails. My only other compliant and albeit minor was that we had those splash balls (you know foamy, pool balls) which we play catch with which you aren't allowed to use, in fact no balls are permitted but beach balls and our room was directly across from the custodial supply closet. We slept in late (for our family) and starying around 8am the closet was banging and there was loud conversation, it had progressed so loud by 8:30 am that everyone was up. But overall we would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised, pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: allbax
Reviews.Content: We arrived here for a four night visit during our family holiday. The club level rooms on the 7th floor are a great size, along with the Express Pass use with your room key, this is well worth considering for the additional cost. The early evening happy hour can be like a made scramble for seats, beer, wine and food, but the quality of the complimentary club room was pretty good. Great location for Universal, if you just go with the flow, you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and Non Descript”
Reviews.Author: hoteluserNottingham
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed. Rooms were large and clean, but somewhat sterile. Baffled that a picture of the Beatles on the wall can convince people they're staying in a unique rock hotel. Pool was full of "mutton dressed as lamb" 50+ women trying to relive their youth and chatting up the waiters. I don't really consider 50+ drunken women swearing loudly around the pool area a truly family experience. However, they did totally personify the clientelle of this place - it lacked class and had no atmosphere. Not at all what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great time Hotel & with kids!!”
Reviews.Author: Robinket
Reviews.Content: My husband 3 kids & I along with my sister her husband and her 2 kids, had an awesome time!!! Kinda expensive but your only young once!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, awesome park benefits.”
Reviews.Author: Fun2travel66
Reviews.Content: Of the three on site Universal properties I would definitely recommend this location. The property is very close to the theme parks and you are able to quickly walk back and forth to the hotel! Having the express pass benefit is well worth staying at this on site property. Unlike at Disney, you can go to the rides whatever time you want. You just walk in a separate express line and you don't have to go around getting "fast pass" tickets. We went right to the front of the lines and we were able to ride over and over. The hotel pool was relaxing and they had a great band playing while we lounged around and ate snacks and drank wine. We only ate breakfast at the hotel from the convenient store, so I'm not sure how the restaurants are. We walked to City Walk and tried different places to eat every night. The wait times can get long, so if you have little kids you may want to go early.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: karin2000
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Hard Rock last night. It was wonderful, stayed on the club level 7 so we did not have to worry about breakfast, water, snacks or a mid afternoon beer. You can not beat the location, jumping the lines and early access to the park. My 13yr old thought the pool was ok but would have liked it to be deeper, he only went in once or twice. My 10 yr old loved it and I liked that she could go around the whole pool and it wasn't over her head. We hit the parks on Thursday/Friday stayed at the hotel on Saturday and rented cabanna number 7 on Sunday. Well worth the $200 to have somewhere for the entire day and night. Then back to the parks on Monday/Tuesday. We did eat in the Kitchen twice it was pretty good and had dinner on Saturday so my daughter could see Bart and Homer Simpson. The line to see them in the park was too long so that worked out. The pool food was very good, loved the fish taco. Ate at Margarittaville, good food, good service and the staff make balloons from 6-9. By chance the first night there I heard some mention coupons so I asked at the hotel and was given some for a few place and you can use the AAA card for discounts at almost everywhere in universal. Universal is not Disney but much more managable and this was a very relaxing vacation. The Hard Rock staff was wonderful. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, I would recommend the hotel without a doubt, we all had a great time..

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Go Back”
Reviews.Author: KellyMNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband last September, because we wanted to see the Harry Potter attraction at Islands of Adventure. Because our trip to the area was only to go to Universal Studios, we opted not to rent a car and just use the immediately available ameneties. The hotel is awesome -really cool and funky - tons of rock and roll odds and ends, the pool is beautiful and the restaurants within the hotel were very good (albeit a bit pricey, but we knew that going in). The staff was attentive and friendly. Check in was easy and although our room was not ready when we arrived (we were early), our bags were held, we were allowed to go to the pool, relax and have lunch while they readied our room. They called us once our room was ready and had arranged to have our bags brought up so we didn't have to pick them up from the baggage check area in the lobby. The walk to Universal Studios from the hotel was about 5 minutes through lushly landscaped grounds. I believe of the 3 hotels within Universal's grounds, this was closest to the park. The room keys allow you to bump to the from of most lines (except the Harry Potter ride in the castle), and being a hotel guest, you were allowed into the parks 1 hour before opening each day (very handy for the aforementioned HP ride, becuase the lines for that are huge once the park opens). Another bonus was anything purchased in the park gift shops can be sent to your room so you don't have to carry extra things around with you. If you go to Universal Studios for a vacation, I highly recommend staying at the Hard Rock for the convenience and the atmosphere. It is very family friendly (they actually show movies on a blow up screen at the pool a couple of nights a week) and also couple friendly. Best for kids a bit older than the Disney crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient location @ Universal”
Reviews.Author: LiveToTravelTheWorld
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed being able to walk from our room to the gates and to city walk. The hotel was so so. The pool area was surrounded by sand, which ends up in the pool. The music was so loud, you couldn't relax after a day at the park. The hallways carpets were worn and the walls needed painting. On Saturday, our room still wasn't cleaned at 5:00 after being gone all day. The housekeeping staff in the hall said "we are busy on Saturdays". Our room was clean overall and our beds were comfy. Despite the disappointments, you can't beat the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dude! One Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: outpulsed
Reviews.Content: First, when evaluating the 3 Universal hotels. Please note that Hard Rock is the CLOSEST one to the park entrances (by far!) You will need the early admission to Harry Potter if you are to enjoy the new rides (i.e. Forbidden Journey which the Express Pass does not work on.) (Also note, Hard Rock has washers and dryers on 2nd and 4th floors -- Portofino Hotel does NOT have washers/dryers.) The Hard Rock Hotel was in great condition. The room was up to date with plenty of TV stations, comfortable beds, nice furniture. A great little Keurig single cup coffeemaker in the room with an assortment of mini coffee/hot chocolate choices (no additional charge). Nice touch! There was a stocked mini-bar in the rooms with standard hotel items and charges. The staff was Terrific! Everyone from Reed who checked us in to the crazy entertainer guy at the pool (who had games for children and adults at the pool with a DJ from 4pm-7pm with movies at the pool until midnight. Totally enjoyable!) -- from the amply staffed concierge desks to the bellstaff (Mark who remembered my name hours after dropping off my luggage. Impressive.) Everyone was beyond expectation! Super! BTW, there was a Hertz rental car stand in the lobby that was super convenient for a daytrip we made to Epcot. MEERS Transporation provided a shuttle to and from the hotel to MCO Airport for $60 roundtrip. Tip: The 3rd Thursday of the Month Hard Rock has a different rock group setup into a converted lobby. We had unlimited drinks from 6:30pm - 9pm while watching The Spin Doctors play live -- all for $20 per person for hotel guests. This draws a local crowd -- a fun event for a 30plus crowd. What fun!!

Reviews.Title: “If it was cheaper I'd give it four stars...”
Reviews.Author: miumiu4me
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property, it's just not as nice as it should be for the price you pay. Positives: 1) Early entry to Islands of Adventure 2) Room keys work as Express Pass 3) Our room was not ready on time, so we got a free upgrade to club level 4) beautiful grounds and pool Negatives 1) Maybe it was just a bad weekend, but the club room at Club Level was disgusting. Wall to wall kids, food everywhere, etc. I saw a kid put his hands in his nose then reach for a muffin. Yes, it's his parents job to watch him, but the club room could stand to have a few more employees. 2) Even though we had an upgrade, our room was very standard. It also was not perfectly cleaned, although it wasn't disgusting. Just a little more dust and a few crumbs more than we expected. 3) The housekeeper was told to leave 3-4 times by us in the morning. She kept coming back anyway. She even opened the door. Even with the upgrade, I think I'd be hard pressed to say this place is worth the money. It's nice,just not as nice as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good service”
Reviews.Author: inkeho
Reviews.Content: Beside the great location and the early access/skip the lines at the parks, we were also impressed by the level of service. We used several of the restaurants/cafes and we received great service all the time. The poolarea is very impresive. My kids really enjoyed it. The hotel also seemed clean and nice. We had a Club Level-room, and was not all that impressed. It seemed like it could use an upgrade real soon, with especially the bathroom looking old. For the price we paid we also imagined the room being bigger. The Club Level-Lounge looked like a classroom with uncomfortable chairs and slow internet, Would we use it again? Probably, but we would book a cheaper room. I think it still is one of the better hotels in Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: cescotet
Reviews.Content: Overall, it is a great hotel. The service was good, although at our arrival one of the rooms for which I made a reservation and had the confirmation number was not in their system. Nevertheless, the problem was solved 20 minutes after. One of the best things of the hotel, is that the room keys work as the Express tickets for Universal Studios and Island of Adventure at no additional charge. Besides that, the Harry Potter world opens an hour early only for guests staying in any of the hotels of Universal which is great. One of the downsides of the hotel, is that they have loud rock music all day, which is pretty good at first but after a while, and when you just have woken up and you are taking your breakfast you just want to have a quiet and peaceful time. In conclusion, this will be my first choice next year if I decide to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Staying at Hard Rock and Loved it Again!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanTourista889
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel is the perfect place to stay for families with teenage age + children in Orlando to enjoy Universal Studios! Just a short walk from both Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios Park as well as City Walk- Hard Rock couldn't be more ideal! Filled with tons of music memorabilia that can be related to and appreciated across the generations your vacation begins the moment you walk through the door. We visited at Christmastime and the hotel was completely decorated for the holidays which was really nice! Great service, awesome beds, and really great ice cream on the lower level made for an excellent stay. The restaurant in the lobby also had live entertainment every night we were there. Having stayed their before I also remember their restaurant downstairs being a great alternative to all of the chains on City Walk or the park food which gets old after awhile and still being reasonably priced. You can also listen to music underwater in their pool which is really neat! 5 stars for Hard Rock -- early access to Harry Potter was also a plus. I would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great perks”
Reviews.Author: buller_6
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a garden view room with husband and 3 children before heading off on a Disney cruise. The room was very comfortable but a bit crowded for the 5 of us, which I expected. The split bathroom and vanity was great for getting ready in the morning and not having fogged mirrors. The atmosphere is very busy with music playing and parties in the lobby and poolside. Our children loved the pool and movies and games. It was very relaxing for my husband and myself to sit in the poolside lounge and have a drink and appetizer while the kids were entertained. The early entry to the Islands of Adventure park was fabulous for the Harry Potter attractions and with our children being older and lovers of amusement parks, it was easy to get both parks done in one day with the express pass. We ate a couple restaurants at CityWalk and both were very good. Walked to the parks from hotel and only took about 7-8 minutes. Will definitely return on our next Orlando trip in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: JCH_sr
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay if you want to go to Universal. Walk to everything and wait 5-10min vs. 50-100. I can't say enough about how staying there makes you a vip at the park

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: pedotap
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel....made that way by the people who are employed there. From the parking attendant, bellhop, front desk personnel (as well as the other desk personnel), waiters, waitresses, pool attendants, those who service the guestrooms all make you feel important...they cannot do enough to make your stay one to remember

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: kazandlee
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fantastic. We were treated like rock stars and felt like rock stars as the atmosphere was very welcoming and rock music played throughout hotel and even in the pool! We preferred to eat outwith the hotel which was fine as Citywalk has some great places to eat. Admittedly we mostly ate at the Hard Rock Cafe. Dont eat at Pastamore, or NBA City, the food was not great, service was very slow and no atmosphere. Latin Quarter was a fab restaurant in addition to Hard Rock Cafe. Hotel is in the perfect location for Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios. Being a huge fan of Harry Potter, this was ideal as on our first morning we were only 15 mins walk from Islands of Adventure. You can use your room key as an Express pass for both Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios. Unfotunately we didnt realise this until half way through the holiday. The rides tell you if you can use your room key - also known as an express pass. Through Virgin Holidays we hired a car and this was great for visiting Disney and shopping at the outlets. We also bought Orlando Flex Ticket which covered SeaWorld, Wet â€˜n Wild, Busch Gardens, Aquatica, Islands of Adventure and we also bought the Disney ultimate ticket which covered Magic Kingdom, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, Animal Kingdom, Typhoon Lagoon, Blizzard Beach and probably alot more but these were the only places we had time to visit. What I would say is go for more then 10 days. This wasnt enough for us to go to all parks. We will definetely come back again. Thanks Hard Rock for a fantastic holiday. Karen and Lee ,

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for grand mother's birthday and family reunion”
Reviews.Author: Hilaire2009
Reviews.Content: We are in Florida (Miami area for 3 weeks) and decided to follow our 11 year old desire to see Harry Potter's park. My mother being 72, my son 11, we booked a room on the Club 7th floor (not on the pool side) 2 days before going. Turned out to be a splendid hunch. Club is really worthwhile for the cost difference, tremendous service, continental breakfast for all, free drinks and food (quite good, beef skewers, sushi and dumplings for cocktail yesterday) plus the other perks early admission... bottled water available at all times which at 105 degrees is a plus. Staff was great, floor quiet and my mother could come and rest for a while during the day. Food at the beach level restaurant is correct but same supplier as all restaurants there son do not expect anything special. Service was very attentive. Early admission is not only a must but my son had the pleasure to be 1st in line at Ollivander's this morning and to be the Chose One for the show :-) Worth all the investment. Birthday cake for my mother upon arrival, delicate attention for our anniversary that head just gone by. I can only recommend for those with family and I am usually hard on this having visited many countries and theme parks and stayed in several on the premises hotels. Pool nice but not spectacular but my son loved the slide and the evening movies while in the pool :-) While Universal itself is much more interesting in Los Angeles, Harry Potter made it magical and Loews did too. Make sure to have the goods you buy on site delivered to the hotel, it's free and avoids the chocolate frogs turning into chocolate milk :-)

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: bountiful77
Reviews.Content: I took my grandaughter here for a week and we go back today. I'd spent a lot of time checking reviews before I booked it over 9 months ago and took absolutely no notice of the ones that said 'this isn't somewhere you'd take your grandparents', which is just as well. Everything was easy when we checked in and the room was just fine. Loads of space and the air con hardly noticeable unlike some English hotels where it sounds like a jet engine's being tested for 8 hours at a time. Music everywhere so be prepared if you go. We were quite happy with it. The pool's really nice with one slight drawback and that is the pool depth. It needs to be a bit deeper than the maximum 4ft but it didn't spoil anything. It was great to see people being able to sit in the pool with glasses of drinks served by the many servers. You need to be warned that although the prices for food aren't bad, there's always going to be extra for the tips. We had breakfast at The Kitchen each day and for the two of us, including the tip, it was $50. that sounds extortionate but it was a buffet breakfast and neither of us needed to eat again til late afternoon so it was good value and the food was excellant. There's masses to choose from. Fresh fruit, pancakes, waffles, packs of cereal, pastries, scrambled eggs, hash browns, corn beef hash, bacon and sausages. You can have hot chocolate or coffee and orange juice. It was all delicious. Best scrambled eggs I've had anywhere other than my house. We also ate at the Poolside restaurant which was also good. Bit of a wait for the food but not a problem as you can watch the evening film or the storm, whichever has priority at the time. Don't worry about the storms, they're spectacular but brilliant. All the hotel staff are helpful and respectful and seem to enjoy what they're doing. I've always thought the Americans have customer service off to a T and the Hard Rock is a good example of this. Housekeeping start really early so don't forget to put the 'leave me alone' card on your door if you don't want waking up before 9am. Good news about the shampoo. It's good quality and you don't need to wash your hair again with the one you've brought with you. Just a small thing but bottles of shampoo can be left at home. There's a shuttle bus to Wet n Wild, Sea World and Acquatica. It doesn't run that frequently and you have to make sure you book it at reception the day before you want to go or you won't be able to get on the bus. The shuttle boat is brilliant but keep in mind that if there's a hint of a storm, it doesn't run. This isn't the end of the world as it's only a 10 minute walk back to the hotel. An alternative to the boat is the small army of cyclists who will take you from the boat landing at the hotel to the entrance to Universal Studios. It'll take you beyond that if needs be. It's not far to walk but having a small limitation on my mobility, it was brilliant to be able to hop on one of these and get cycled the couple of minutes it takes to get there. There's no specific charge but they ask that you give a fair amount to cover the charge of the bike they're hiring etc. Emacks and Bolios ice cream parlour. What can I say!!! This is brilliant. When you ask for one scoop be aware it's like a spadefull compared to what we get in England. Not cheap but not an arm and a leg either. We loved it. I'd definitely do Hard Rock again but would keep it to just a few days only because we would want to stay in Florida for more than a week and I'd want to be a bit more central for the other theme parks. Excellant place. Not cheap if you're on a budget but stretch it, it's worth every penny. And don't forget. It absolutely issssssss somewhere you can take grandparents. There were loads of us there enjoying every minute. Have fun if you go.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel loved it”
Reviews.Author: susan c
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night whilst visiting Orlando primarily to get front of the line tickets for Universal. We checked in about 11 am and although room not ready we were given room keys that also acted as express passes to skip the lines . Got a call on my mobile about 2 oclock advising room ready and room number. The room was lovely with two large queen sized very comfy beds . The pool area was nice with live music being played during our brief visit. The second day we took advantage of the extra hour in the park and got there at 8am and made straight for the Harry Potter ride the queue was alraedy a 45 min wait as people were running to get there ! We joined the single riders queue and reduced the wait time to 10 mins and all came off the ride at the same time so that was great . We chose to have breakfast in the park Croissant Moon Bakery do a nice contintental breakfast for $5.99 . We left the park at 6pm second day having done all the rides thanks to the express pass. I notice that some people have mentioned the cost of parking at the hotel, we spoke to the concierge as we left as our parking pass had got ruined on a water ride . He advised just to swipe the room key through the barrier and we did and the barrier opened hence we were not charged for parking. So saved $30 on parking too which made the whole thing very economical . I paid through hotels .com and got 12% cashback via quidco too so another saving !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic perks”
Reviews.Author: PrincessJaney
Reviews.Content: Loved the fact that you did not have to queue for the rides, as unlike disney (free fastpasses) you have to pay extra for a 'fastpass' unless you stay at one of the onsite hotels. The only downside is that there are no fastpasses for the Harry Potter rides :-( !! A bit pricey for parking at $22 for 'valet parking' per night, but the entertainment onsite is excellent. The watertaxis to and from citywalk are a nice bonus too! Rooms are comfortable and clean, and the staff are friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Katmiccollou
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night only to enjoy Universal to maximum effect whilst staying in Orlando areaninna rented villa. Loved hotel, service, pool, bar service, food, rooms etc. Evening after hard day at U Studios was enjoyable at pool side. Music under water seriously cool and 'dive in' movie a great concept!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel !”
Reviews.Author: holidayfunEngland_UK
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great for family with young kids or teenagers. Couples will love it as well if you like lots going on and music around the pool. Pool bar service was fantastic. However you are paying for the service. Bedrooms were a good size with plenty of storage space. Service throughout the hotel "Spot on"!. From the moment we valet parked car we did not have to do anything, except have a wonderful time. Would definately return again. Cannot say anything negative. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel But...............”
Reviews.Author: st28ten
Reviews.Content: This a a really hard review for me to do as is rather mixed but i'll try to be as fair and honest as I can. We stayed for 2 nights 14 -16 Aug. PROS 1) They let you check in really early and will hold your luggage issuing your express passes straight away 2) lovely room- Delux very spacious- 2 comfy queen beds , sofa bed , vanity sink out side the bathroom 3) lovely and clean every where 4) we had nice food at kitchen restaurant and the pool bar 5) good sized pool and good slide- towels available plenty of sun beds although they get taken real quick 6) really friendly helpful staff 7) so close to parks about a 10min walk or regular boat shuttle CONS 1) Room was'nt ready until 5.30 2) felt really busy all the time for our two days 3) even tho we had emailed a pre booked a quiet room away from noise due to my daughters medical condition ( and we were assured this was not a problem) - we were allocated a room overlooking the pool which had loud music playing the whole time well into the evening. This was eventually sorted and staff stayed polite the whole time but it took ages we were offered some ridiculous alternatives and it was 8.30 before we got a room ( we had been up since 5am so felt like a long day) bearing in mind we were only staying for 2 nights we felt it took a big chunk of our time. However once sorted as I said the room was great and once in your room we couldn't hear any noise. I think overall I made a mistake I had read reviews so its entirely my fault. i hadn't realise how after a while the constant music would get on my nerves .I love rock music so it was great choice of music but you couldn't get away from it anywhere from morning till night. But I repeat ...... ( before people go crazy) I take full resposibility for that as that is what the hotel is known for. my kids enjoyed it too but felt the same as me. Our stay here was at the end of our 2 wk holiday so possibly we were tired and it would have been better to have stayed here first while we were all reved up and ready for action ! So while I wouldn't stay at the Hard Rock again I most definetly would stay on site at one of the other hotels as the benefits are well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: macmish
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is a great hotel. It was very clean. The rock memorabilia is very cool and it has a great environment. The best part about the hotel is the pool. Although it is very shallow it was a lot of fun. The slide is great and a lot of fun, even for adults. There is always something going on, especially later in the afternoon, so it is a good idea to go to the parks early and then come back to the pool when the fun starts. There is either a dj or live band and games to participate it. The pool is a lot of fun for all ages. At the pool there is waiter service and the Beach Club. The drinks and food are good, but expensive. One of the best parts about staying here is the convenience. The parks and City Walk are a short walk away. It feels like you are kept away from the crowds. Your room key serves as a fast pass on the rides and this is awesome. We walked on rides that had an hour wait. The only ride you can't use it on is Harry Potter. For that ride go on as single riders and it will cut the wait time significantly. I wish that Universal offered a food plan similiar to Disney's. For breakfast the only options you had were the buffet at The Kitchen, which was great, but expensive or quick food at the ice cream shop which was awful and relatively expensive for cereal and bagels. The Latin Quarter on City Walk was great. The food and atmosphere were wonderful. The HArd Rock Cafe was very cool. When you go to Islands of Adventure be prepared to get wet. There are 3 water rides and you get soaked, but they are a lot of fun! Overall this was a great vacation and I would recommend the HArd Rock to families, especially with teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money spent and not what should have been great memories”
Reviews.Author: Lori H
Reviews.Content: This trip was a weekend get away for my family and my brothers family and we were both very disappointed. We arrived early on the day of our arrival and went to the pool for lunch. We sat down ordered drinks and they were served and enjoyed by all. The food was ordered and we waited two hours before we were finally served our food. The waitress kept saying the kitchen was backed up and we accepted since we knew we had a large party and it would take some time BUT when the waitress came back to "verify what we ordered again" we knew the real problem was that the waitress either failed to turn our order in or the order was somehow lost by either the waitress or kitchen staff. The food was ok (not great) especially when you consider the outrageous price we had to pay when we FINALLY got our bill. That wasn't even the worst of it, the area smelled of old alcohol and garbage. Needless to say not a great start to the getaway. We finally got our rooms and they were a standard hotel room very overpriced. You had to pay for internet service and anything else that you may want to do when at a hotel. The bathroom was just a regular bathroom with a small sink and then an outside area with a sink. Both sinks would back up with water anytime you washed your hands, brushed your teeth, etc. I would think they could afford a much better plumbing system for the amount of money they charge for EVERYTHING. Don't get me wrong, I knew the prices were above average and I did sign up for that BUT I did not expect the poor service, horrible smells, backup of water in the sinks, or poor experience. I would not recommend this to anyone. The hotel was not even fun to explore since the only thing they had were some shops with expensive items. You can't even use the fitness center unless you PAY MORE MONEY!!! Very Poor!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock still the best for Universal”
Reviews.Author: UKMarkB
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Hard Rock in 3 years and I'm glad we stayed here again. The proximity to Universal and the perks (express lines, early entry etc) make it well worth it. The pool is a cool, fun, place to chill out and the hotel has a great vibe. Yes, the drinks aren't cheap but what do you expect? 20% service added is a bit strong though. Would like to thank luggage guy, Eggy for his top tips on the parks and friendly demeanour. One major complaint this trip however; We made our reservation direct with the hotel back in February, for a 2-bedded room for 3 nights. They duly took one night's worth of deposit and confirmed by e-mail. When we checked in we were told that they didn't have a room with 2 beds available! Not great, when you have 2 teenage kids travelling with you. I requested an upgrade to a suite, but surprise, none available. We eventually ended up in a one queen bed room with rollaway beds for the kids. Not nice after a 9 hour flight! OK, we were moved next day to a 2-bed room and the check-in manager gave us complimentary breakfasts (worth about $90) by way of apology. To cap it all they then tried to bill us for 3 nights hire of rollaways ($150), which we quickly got removed. Still a good fun hotel and ideal for Universal but could do without the over-booking policy!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KayDye
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. The pool is gigantic and nice, with lots of great seating and free big towels. The best part about the hotel is that you can walk out the back gate and be in the park almost immediately. If you don't want to walk to the park entrance you can get the water taxi or the bike taxis tp take you to the gate. This makes the day so much more pleasant because when you get too foot sore, hot and tired you can just go relax at the nice pool and let the kids use their boundless energy to slide down the water slide in the pool. Of course, the other great perks are the express line tickets and being allowed in the Harry Potter section one hour early. It was kind of thrilling to realize how many hours of waiting in lines that we avoided. The downsides are how very expensive the meals and drinks are at the restaurants. Since we had our car there we could easily drive to any of the local restaurants and bring back sodas and snacks with us so that did not matter so much. The cost of parking was high as well. The one really annoying thing was that you had to pay to use their wireless connection inside the room. My teenager spent too much time in the lobby and/or the pool when she should have been able to stay in the room and skype with all her buddies. I would think that with the high cost of this room they could provide wireless connections free since I can get that at a $56/night Econolodge! Anyway, all in all I would say that it was definietely worth it to stay in his hotel after you figure the cost of the express line tickets and park tickets for the entire family and factor in the convenience. One more comment: the last night we were there we went to the new Harry Potter movie and on the way back a bad storm blew up. The back gate gets locked when the pool is closed and the pool was closed early due to bad weather. A half dozen of us were trying to get the back gate to open when a really nice staffer opened an employee back door and motioned us in. As we entered she handed each of us a big, warm towel. Now that is service!!

Reviews.Title: “Kandace Rocks”
Reviews.Author: JSharpFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hard Rock Cafe to take advantage of the early entry into the Harry Potter attraction at Islands of Adventure. Kandace was very accommodating and had a room available when we arrived. It was worth the price to see the Harry Potter World streets with just a few people. Later in the day, you cannot take in the beautiful snow-covered street scene and castle because the crowd is overwhelming. The Hard Rock Hotel is nicely located within walking distance, but there is a boat that runs when there is no lightning, or bike taxis that cost only gratuity. The Hard Rock Hotel has nice restaurants and a night club on property. We tried out the Velvet Lounge; it is full of comfy seating in cozy niches. There are fun activities at the pool during the day for children, and when it rained they showed movies in the lobby. That was a nice touch, but they kept the rock music on while the movie played.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lsweets
Reviews.Content: After our five day honeymoon staying on Disney property, my family met up with us and we stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for the Halloween Horror Nights at Universal. The first thing I noticed upon walking into the room was the Keurig. I love my Keurig, so this excited me! The room was very clean, decorated very cool, and was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in on vacation. The pool area was the best. The nights we stayed there, they played movies on a big screen that you were able to watch from the pool. There was nothing that I did not like about this resort. Well, there was one thing, but it was in no way the resort's fault. As it's not as family-oriented as Disney resorts, there tend to be a few unsavory characters here and there. My mother and I were made very uncomfortable by some comments a couple men made to us when we were sitting in the hot tub and decided to go back to the room. But that is my only complaint for the whole trip. Very satisfied otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew R
Reviews.Content: V.Good hotel in a great location just a short boat trip or walk from both universal parks and city walk with great night life. The hotel itself was great with a huge pool and music all day. The rooms were ok! There was 4 of us 2 adults and 2 teenagers and it was just big enough the bathroom was small but all in all we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate vacation!”
Reviews.Author: marazad
Reviews.Content: Universal Orlando Hard Rock is one of our absolute favorite properties to stay at. It has everything! This visit we stayed in a Club Level room. It was myself, my husband and our two boys 14 and 18. You just cant be the proximity to the parks in a deluxe atmosphere. Club Level is wonderful and the staff is terrific. Our room was approximately 500 sq ft. It had two queen size beds along with a pull-out couch. Very large bathroom and a nice changing area with a huge closet. Nice keurig coffee maker and mini bar with all the accompaniments. The beds are ultra comfortable and the decor very appealing. Love the rooms that over-look the pool. The bath has everything you may need with excellent products such as shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, q tips, cotton balls. If you may have forgotten anything just call and ask! Nice plentiful fluffy towels. I just love entering this hotel into that grand lobby with all that terrific memorabilia! Take a stroll to each floor and see what collections await you. Lots of fun to do that. They have a well stocked store with more great rock and roll gifts. I always buy something there and usually want much more. The restaurants and snack bar, ice cream shop have never disappointed. We enjoy breakfast at The Kitchen when we aren't staying club level. Reasonable prices, great service in a nice funky atmosphere. That reminds me - the staff at this hotel are ALL so cool! They are helpful and so much fun. We have made many friends over the years as they seem to retain their staff for long periods of time. They all seem quite happy to be working there. One of my favorite locations at Hard Rock is their pool area - simply amazing and very well done. We rent a cabana one day each trip and just have the best down-time day relaxing and enjoying the music and great drinks and food. Again I cant say enough about the pool staff they are great. The pool has a fun fast slide, Jacuzzis and a very large swimming pool. There is a bar and bar service at your chairs. Nice reasonable menu at the pool too. Keep in mind gratuities are already added. Emack and Bolios for an ice cream at the end of pool day hits the spot and they have some very creative creations. My kids love this place. You can also grab a quick breakfast there in the AM if you aren't looking for a full breakfast. They have it all! If you have contemplated a stay here - do it! It is well worth it and I guarantee you will return - just the BEST! We will be returning in October for HHN and it cant come soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' holiday”
Reviews.Author: nasty81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the H.R for a week with our 2 teenage kids,absolutely loved it,great hotel,fantastic location especially when you get soaked on the water rides at islands you just hop on the water taxi back to the hotel,get changed and head back to the parks again.The pool area is so cool,always something going on,nice and quiet early in the morning but can get really crowded during the day,we ate lunch a couple of times at the beachclub,food was really good and we thought fairly priced even with the 18% gratuity automatically added,the market place is great for a bagel and a coffee in the morning if you don't want to eat a full breakfast.The early entry into Harry Potter and the fast pass were invaluable,my only complaint would be the same as many others who have stayed here is that the parking should be complimentary for residents.Would definately stay at the hard rock again.

Reviews.Title: “As a motel room and bathroom ridiculous.”
Reviews.Author: PSI31
Reviews.Content: Yes of course the hotel is large, luxurious, pleasant gardens, the room is arbitrary, not very big, like any other motel room means. But the worst of the ridiculous is the bathroom, without storage, very small, not very clean tub, only one small sink, all with a decent design and layout of the 1960s. Very disappointed. Not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip for WWHP and park benefits”
Reviews.Author: walker1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights within a 2 week break in Orlando, in order to benefit from the fastpass and Harry Potter early entrance. Hotel is as you would imagine, with loud poolside beats and memorabilia inside. Lovely poolside cabanas and waitress service for drinks; although sunbeds are jammed together, there is a great holiday vibe. Room was clean and spacious (kids suite) and The Kitchen restaurant one night was a real treat, with visits from Homer and Bart! Lovely ice-cream parlour too. Most invaluable benefit though, is the fastpass access, which allows you to get on all rides, compared to the few we've managed in the past, with having to queue. Similarly, the access to WWHP at 8am is a completely different experience to that an hour later. Managed to get on the rides within 5 mins, have a good luck in all the windows without a fight and quicker access into Olivanders - this is a magical must experience!! Great all round, even if only for the 3 full days we experienced (although you check in/out at certain times, you are allowed your fastpasses for the entire days duration - bonus!) -would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “Let Down”
Reviews.Author: TravelKing76689
Reviews.Content: My kids really wanted to stay at Hard Rock for a while now. We wanted to do WWHP, so we stayed on site to gerbil early and do express pass since it was our first universal trip. For the price it was a huge let down. Room never cooled down below 70 and that is not refreshing after spending all day in heat. Let's just say Universal is no Disney and definitely no worth the price. Fun to say we did it once, but will not be repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “location,location, location”
Reviews.Author: buddyPhila
Reviews.Content: the hotel is within walking distance to universal and city walk and you do get front of line access with room key which was great because it was extremely hot in July the rooms ars very small the bathrooms are dated the pool is fabulous for teenagers I thought the hotel was pricey for what it was but the location is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “ROCK ON! AWESOME PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: starchild101
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay on our trip to Universal Studios. Room was very comfortable. Beds were fantastic, nice big flat screen tv, and the girlfriend loved the shampoos, lotion ect. Place had a Keurig coffee maker which was very nice, especially on the mornings you got up early to hit the park. The pool and the dj there were fantastic. The dj kept the pool crowd entertained and the waterslide was great for all ages. Drinks are a little pricey, but you can bring your own in with you to save a few bucks. Only issue we had was that we had paid extra for a pool view room and when we got to our room there was a huge palm tree taking up 75% of the window. You could only see a little corner of the pool if you stood on a chair. We talked to the front desk and they resolved it by refunding the difference between our room and a garden view room (which was very nice of them to do). If you see postcard pictures of the backside of the hotel those pictures were taken a while ago when the palm trees were a lot smaller. Those trees have grown folks, and many of the "pool view" rooms are now partially to fully obstructed pool view rooms. So TIP #1: you probabally should not pay extra for a "pool view" room. Tip #2: You gotta hit the ice cream place on the first floor. It is fantastic - I got the banana split, it was huge and delicious!! Our only minor complaint it that for the price you pay to stay here parking should be included in the room cost. Cost is $15 per day, $22 if you want valet service. Other than that, it was a great stay, service was great, place very clean, and no major complaints at all. Would do it all again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGB2010
Reviews.Content: Needed to book a couple of rooms for a quick get away and from the rep who booked my rooms to the young lady who checked us in, highly satisfied. Our rooms though not adjoining as requested, given the last minute reservation I wasn't about to complain. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and the staff accommodating and friendly. Loved that we were so close to Universal and City Walk which it made it nice for quick trips for shopping and meals off the premises. We had a great time and will return, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what it is but great location”
Reviews.Author: MikeManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: Despite all the music this remains a fairly soulless hotel but it's clean and functional - really weird thing to comment on but I found the corridors particularly depressing. Positive is the breakfast in the Kitchen restaurant - a very good all you can eat buffet for 20 dollars. I know that won't seem particularly cheap but in theme park land it seemed to represent fairy good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie92
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel. We are not really fans of Universal Studios and the last time we were there were disappointed with our stay at the other hotel there - Portofino Bay. So we were not expecting much, but as our kids really wanted to visit we figured to try the Hard Rock this time. Our room was extremely comfortable and the hotel itself is very attractive - nice public areas, grounds, etc. Didn't love our meal at the Palm, but the hotel's own restaurant - The Kitchen was really very good. We ate there a few times - breakfast, lunch and dinner and were never disappointed. In terms of service, everyone we dealt with at the hotel was very good - kind, helpful and professional. It was great to see so many wonderful employees who were all quite young. The only negatives I would say are that 1- it is loud everywhere except in your room. I understand that it's the Hard Rock hotel, so that is to be expected. But just be ready that it is not the kind of place you find a quiet place to sit and relax if that's what you're looking for. 2 - we were on the Club floor and the Club was not all that comfortable. It's a nice convenience to have and the people working there were great, but during "service" hours, it was always very crowded (and loud), and not what one might expect based on other club floor experiences.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints! Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: K_The_Hon
Reviews.Content: Myself, my partner and her family stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in October of 2010. We loved it! The room was spacious and clean, the hotel's restaurant "The Kitchen" wasn't anything to nit pick over, they had a great brunch buffet and the servers were on their game. We enjoyed the pool side bar at night with multiple tv's showing every game that was on and I can't forget to mention the easy, scenic walk to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “It was good but getting a little dated”
Reviews.Author: axlrocky
Reviews.Content: Loved it because I had always wanted to stay in a Hard Rock but some of the facilities were getting a little dated and you got the feeling they didn't expect you to be in the hotel during the day as the pool was very crowded. It was very friendly but the facilities were not extensive and the food was vastly overpriced although tasty. A 22% service charge was added to anything so watch your bills. I didnt see it and the bar staff were kind enough to give me my cash tip back as they were too embarassed to take it, which was nice. Loved the boat ride straight to city walk and kinda guess thats why the food on offer is not that great at the hotel as you have a myriad of choices just across the water. The hotel key is a fast pass for the parks which is invaluable and we rode anything we wanted with no queues. Great to look at but not much there, I enjoyed it but maybe wouldnt go back to this particular venue.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry...but it was really pretty awful (and dirty)...don't be fooled by the "Rock Star" stuff...”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBBad
Reviews.Content: Look, you are going to Universal (excellent by the way) so where do you stay? In order to get the early passes (essential for sanity with the Harry Potter queues) the choices are Giant Hotel 1 (Loews), Giant Hotel 2 (also Loews) and Hard Rock (er...Loews again actually) so you are a bit stuffed. However, I thought that the Hard Rock would be fun and went with high hopes that my sons, 9 & 10 would enjoy it and that my wife and I could have some fun as well. But...stand by: The check in was (as previously mentioned) a complete and utter shambles. "the Room is not ready Sir...but we will call as soon as it is...go have fun in the park". Arrived at 1200, had lunch (couldn't charge it), went to park...tried again at 1600 (still not available)...no phone call at any point despite being promised 4 times. Got in at 1900 eventually I had come from a friend's house in Naples so I was washed and showered - if I had just got off a transatlantic flight I would have been psychotic. Don't fall for the "suite" option. A suite is simply a slightly stretched room - the bathroom is exactly the same as a regular room with a sink outside - rubbish! No perks or anything else! Furthermore the walls are paper thin - the piped music is fine but given the very early mornings for the park and the after dark teenage antics while fine are therefore err....audible...not much good if you want to sleep! The place is not clean.
