Reviews.Content: Was quite pleased I chose this hotel for a family visit to Universal Studios- pleased that the park was only a 7 minute walk away, and pleased that staying at the hotel meant I had early access to Harry Potter Wizarding World, as well as priority access to rides. I liked the quirky interior design with liberal use of musical instruments, and the staff were kind. Always fun activities at the pool such as live music and the nightly "dive-in" movies.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: clairelouise504
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel plus the best benefits for Universal & Islands of Adventure theme parks!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: CUNEOGIRLS
Reviews.Content: The hard rock is worth it, the extra hour and fast pass alone male this hotel worth every dollar. Also, I left my wallet by the pool with all of our money in it, dumb I know, the security team was on the case immediately and found the wallet with everything in it, thank you to whoever returned it out there(you saved our trip:).

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: nikop396
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really clean the beds were comfortable! there is a pool with a waterslide and a resturant right by the pool!.The whole place is kept clean! Also it is a 5 minute walk to universal!!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel -can be good value for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: fordymacc51
Reviews.Content: Our room was immaculate and spacious with a view over the pool. Free coffee and hot chocolate was repenished promptly when requested. We stayed for one night but benefitted from the free Express Pass Card on two days. You can check in as early as 6am (if your room is not ready, they will store your luggage - we were lucky, our room was ready when we arrived at 7 30am). We were given our room key which allowed us to pass most of the queues on the day we checked in and the day we checked out. We were also able to enter the park 1 hour before general entry which allowed us to do the rides not covered by the Express Pass (Harry Potter Adventure) If we had bought the cards (3 people) in the park they would have cost $70pp/day for the dates we were there, which is more than we paid for the room - great deal as we did EVERYTHING in universal in 2 days by bypassing the lines. We stayed in a decent Holiday Inn Express at the Universal end of International Drive the prevous night (this had a fridge which enabled us to take a few supplies in a cooler to Hard Rock where we topped up the ice from the hotel ice machine). We had a five minute journey to the Hard Rock from the Holiday Inn. For a quick start in the morning once at the Hard Rock and to keep cost down, taking a few muffins, fruit, cans of pepsi and yogurt to the room worked well for us. We had a short day in Universal on our first day and returned to the hotel to enjoy the pool area. After Dinner at night (the Latin Quarter on the Board Walk - very good) we returned to enjoy the 'Dive In' movie - they put up a screen at the pool bar and you can watch while in the pool or lounging at the side - the film quality wasn't great but it was a nice experience and we could also see the Universal fire work display from the pool side. We did have to pay $15 for car parking on departure, but that was our only additional expense.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a great vibe here....”
Reviews.Author: missphilly
Reviews.Content: There was just something about this hotel that we loved. The location, the layout, the vibe...We enjoyed the grounds and pool, and this was an excellent choice for the Universal theme parks. We split up the trip between Hard Rock and then a few days on the Disney property at the Beach Club Villas. Universal's parks were great. No lines at all. Unfortunately, after checking out we ventured over to Disney for a few days and the parks were absolutely mobbed. I am beginning to think Disney doesn't have any slow periods anymore. Very frustrating. Anyway, I can see where people may not like the pop/rock theme of the hotel. Its definitely not like any place I have ever stayed but thats what I loved about it. We didn't miss not having a balcony. The rooms were clean enough, but something about a hotel that allows pets really grosses me out. Just my opinion. That being said, I would definitely stay here again as a change from the Disney scene.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place even for the price”
Reviews.Author: travlr_W_kids
Reviews.Content: this was our second time staying here two years in a row, luxury at it's best! Our main goal in Orlando was Universal studios. We stayed almost a week and enjoyed every moment. The room keys gave us an advantage of not having to wait in lines at the rides, which was perfect for those long lines. The kids enjoyed the new harry potter rides & re created world. Although it was expensive, it's a vacation we wont forget!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Club Not Exclusive”
Reviews.Author: WVClairenmaddy
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel. This year we splurged and booked a club room on the 7th floor. This floor has special amenities like food, drink, appetizers, desserts and a staff member available to help you and make dining reservations. This level is located on the 7th floor and when you check in they add a "7th floor" sticker to your key card. During my stay I noticed that the door always remained open and that families/individuals not staying on the floor were coming in to get food, drinks etc. I complained 3 different times. The final time I rode up on the elevator which stopped on the 6th floor and a family of 5 got on with me. I asked them if they were staying on the 7th floor and the told me "no, we just came up to eat breakfast." I told them nicely that if they weren't staying on the floor and paying for it they couldn't eat up there. I went down to the front desk to complain in person and the lady at the desk immediately picked up the phone to call upstairs to tell them. When I went back up, there sat the family of 5 eating and there ID was never checked and they weren't asked to leave. This happened on many occasions and others were commenting about it as well. When I registered my first complaint via phone they told me it was an ongoing problem. You do need to swipe you key in a special slot on the elevator to even have access to the 7th floor but people ride up with you that don't belong up there. I have done the club level at Disney and have never had a problem. They're pretty strict about checking ID's etc so you can't go it if you aren't paying for the service. At over $500 there wasn't anything exclusive about being on that floor and I was disappointed that nothing was ever done about it or enforced after 3 complaints. I will say the hotel is conveniently located and the express passes are great. Overall, the hotel is beautiful and very clean and nice. If you stay there I would not recommend paying the extra money for the club level. Until they monitor who goes in and correct the issue it's simply not worth the extra expense.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - starting to show age”
Reviews.Author: bluffdunn
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this is my third trip to Universal staying at the Hard Rock over the past 4 years. My kids this trip were 14 and 16. I give them the choice of Disney or Universal and they now always choose Universal (that is not a knock on Disney - we used to go there and did go there during our stay and it is much cleaner - but for their age they prefer City Walk and Universal for the rides). The best part of this hotel is the fact that it is close to City Walk and the 2 parks. It is an easy 5 minute walk to each but while at the hotel you really don't know the parks are there. The rock theme of this place keeps good music piped in the lobbies, elevators and pool most of the time. Someone previous posted that the staff is young, and they actually are, but very friendly and seem to know what they are doing. Clearly there are experienced people in charge somewhere. The pool is also one of the highlights for us. It has to be the most happening pool in the area. Very large, with a beach area, very good water slide and activities for kids of all ages to adult throughout the day. Eddie, one of the pool food and drink waiters is great. Up sells a little but knows what he is talking about where he works. Keeps you occupied all day. Great guy. The DJ Scooter who is there a couple of days per week keeps everyone laughing. The pool food that we had was very good every visit - although a little pricy - it is a resort. The Cuban sandwich is wonderful - best I have had. We have been to the other hotels on property and although nice - for teens and adults this place is more fun. Old people will prefer the Portifino. I really did not find much about the Royal Pacific to like. The other great part of staying here is the fact that you can use your hotel room key card as the express pass for rides. It works in a way that you can use it as many times as you wish on any ride and bypass most of the lines. Way better than Disney fast pass or the one you buy for day trips to Universal. You can literally go on the same ride over and over all day and bypass the main lines. If I had any complaint it would be that the hotel seems the same every year. Not that it is bad in any way, but it looks like it is time to upgrade the place. They were painting the hall while there but same tired color. The carpet in the halls, which is designed to hide dirt needs to be replaced. A freshening would help in the rooms and halls. Even the pool area could use a make over. Maybe some insulation between rooms and especially in the room doors as you hear every conversation from hall to room would help. Some new paint colors wold help to freshen up the place. Every place has it's time and this is the time to re-do. Watch for the taxes and the parking fees $15 I think and figure about $40 taxes for the room additional. Overall thought this is a great place. Will come back. Hope it has changed when I come though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Universal Stay”
Reviews.Author: B4297
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four night stay at the Hard Rock Orlando. The hotel has a youthful staff which is not always a great thing but I must say that everybody I dealt with was highly professional and helpful. Rooms were modern, clean and well seized. The food was surprisingly good from the pool to room service and the location of the hotel was as close as you can get to the Universal attractions. All in all a really great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “great for teenagers but they get you coming and going”
Reviews.Author: Ginzer
Reviews.Content: We had a good time. the staff was very friendly especially "Big" the door man.However, $9.95 a day for internet access? Seems alittle excessive considering the room was over $200 a day.We had the mini bar removed from our room so we could use it for storage. That fee was $15. However, when they removed it they must have turned off the refrigeration. To rent a small frig was $25 a day. We were there for a week.Oh, they did have free coffee in the rooms I think that was the only free amenity we received.I would go only for a few days and move to a less expensive hotel where you can at least get a free frig and possibly a free breakfast. The fast pass and early admmission to Universal was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Pool and Universal Fun, but expect to Pay,Pay,Pay”
Reviews.Author: aremk
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock is the perfect place to spend a few days relaxing at the fantastic pool and enjoying Universal and Islands of Adventure. The convenience cant be beat -- a very short walk to Universal and just a bit more to Islands of Adventure. Very easy to come back and forth -- much easier than Disney. Your room key is your express pass to just about every attraction except the one main Harry Pottey ride (which is fantastic but the wait can get long). The pool is also great -- big, with plenty of loungers, plenty of towels, drinks / food, games, etc. Be warned, if you are looking for peace and quiet for your pool time, this is not the place for you. But it is lively and fun, and the music is great. I also found the pool and other common areas to be exceptionally clean and well appointed and very rock-appropriate. The staff is all very friendly -- they are mostly young and so it may be a less formal type of friendly that you'll find at other resorts -- but after all this is the Hard Rock and it does live up to its name! The rooms are a bit of a different story. The standard rooms are small and very basic. The hallways and rooms have more of a lower-end chain motel feel and they do not live up to the price. This is one of the reasons I dont think it deserves a 5. The other reason is cost / value-- you pay more here than other similar (although not as fun!) high end chains in the Orlando area, but some of that is convenience and the express pass at the parks. However, on top of the higher room rates, everything is extremely expensive -- more so than other resorts in the area. $15 a day plus tax to self park. Food and drink at the pool and other casual venues at the Hotel is really really high plus an 18% automatic tip. No free wi-fi in the rooms. All to be expected at a resort I guess, but with the daily parking charge, a few drinks/snacks at the pool and some partries, coffees and ice cream at the snack bar you'll nearly double your daily room rate each day. Even the Starbucks is double the list price. But, even with these few negatives I'd choose the Hard Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Service Charges!!!”
Reviews.Author: Psychdee
Reviews.Content: Lots of things are great at this hotel - ambience, music, tea/coffee making facilities, two sinks in rooms, toiletries, food. But you pay enough to stay here and did not expect up to 48% service charges!! Have to pay for Internet and Gym use!! Shame on them, because families love coming here and it would price me out a return visit

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: jade72171NJ
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Hard Rock ! Our 2 boys 11 and 13 had the time of their lives. Great pool with a water slide, early entry to Harry Potter, and the express pass are priceless. Some waits for the rides were up to 2 hours and we were on and off in no time. The DJ at the pool on Thursday was a blast. We had a room with a courtyard view which is close to the water taxi. It was quiet and very spacious. We will stay again. Quick walk to the parks. Try to see blue man group. Only complaint is the price of food and drink was VERY pricey. I wish there were a food plan outside of the park between the 3 hotels. If you like peace and quiet stay at Portifino Bay or Royal Pacific. If you like action and fun stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was GREAT! Best Hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth1533
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We stayed there for five nights, six days to visit the Universal/Island of Adventure theme parks. We arrive on Saturday, April 02, 2011 at 3:40 pm. We were told that our room wasn't ready yet. So we waited in the club room lounge on the 7th floor. We were supposed to get a standard room on the club floor with a roll away bed. We waited until 5:00 pm for our room, because of the wait, the hotel upgraded our room to a delux room that had a pull out couch. We saved $125.00 because we no longer needed the rollaway bed. They also gave us breakfast vouchers for the Kitchen restuarant. The staff was always very friendly, and housekeeping was great. I would recommend the club level rooms, they are well worth it. They had pop all day and free beer and wine from 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm. The teenagers took advantage of the pop, and my husband and I took advantage of the beer and wine. The club room staff always was there to help us with any questions or needs. I even needed a bandaid, and the club room staff didn't have one, so they had called security to bring on to our room. Security was there in less than 3 minutes to give us one. Room service was great, although there was a more variety of food at the Beach Club. The pool was so huge and fun. We all had a great time. If you have teenagers, this is the place to go. So far, this has been the best hotel we have ever stayed yet. I have yet to see a hotel with a more friendlier staff and service!

Reviews.Title: “My children had fun at the hotel (8years and 11 years old) a great program at pool”
Reviews.Author: 23ana23
Reviews.Content: rooms were not all that, i saw bugs on carpets. the noice from the pool can be heard inside the room, soo you can not take a power rest because the noise (music and show at the pool), speakers by windows. get a room away from pool. I loved the we could walk to the parks. shuttle is a problem, if you want to be shuttle to other parks it is a problem. so take a car and paid for parking 18.00 per day??? or wait for the only bus (once at day only) take you to other parks. i am not sure if we will stay there again. services not that good, a lots of walking inside of hotel, rooms are far from front desk or restaurant. walls too thin and you can hear people talking in rooms next doors or outside your room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool....but not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: gardenscout
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the pool and the service there. However, it was rainy for part of our stay so none of the usual activities ran. A further frustration was the lack of free in room internet service (available for an additional $10 per night). The lobby had fee wi-fi but it was a slow connection and there was a crowded rock concert taking place in the lobby (with a cover charge. The exercise room was another $10 to use per day. Seating in the hotel restaurant "The Kitchen" was very limited. There was no free breakfast as in many hotels. The final disappointment was that our room leaked in the rain and the carpet was wet. All and all, I would much rather stay elsewhere, purchase fast passes and be waiting to get in the gates at 8:45. The extra early hour, while nice, was NOT worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “nice room but felt nickeled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: Unvrno
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and the location was good for easy access to the parks. However, the food and drink prices left us feeling nickeled and dimmed. We got two cocktails at the pool, $27 and they were not super-sized like the price. The pool adds 18 percent gratuity to each check. $9 for 2 bottles of water. There were no vending machines. We were expecting more restaurant and lounge options. Overall the place was nice enough but not worth the money we paid. Free Internet was not in the room, only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time for spring break”
Reviews.Author: TTT35805
Reviews.Content: Traveled with wife and 2 children, 12 and 9. We had a great time at the pool and at both parks. Staying on site was a great decision due to the express line to most of the rides and the early entry to IOA. I always leave a tip when service provided is great but did not like the idea of 18 percent added to my bill at the Beach Club. That is the only restaurant that did that, the kitchen didn't or any where else. Even though 18 percent was automatic the service was great and so was the food!! We would go here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: shaunster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for first few days of a Florida holiday. The good: great location and short stroll into parks, room very comfortable and well equipped, by far the best thing is the advantage of being able to use your room cards to access the universal express lines for rides The bad: had to queue for over an hour at check in which seemed incredibly poorly organised and was then told our room would not be ready for another hour (this was late afternoon and after travelling for 13 hours not want you want to hear), quite expensive to eat on site

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the same standards they used to have”
Reviews.Author: trish149
Reviews.Content: This used to be one of my favorite hotels to stay at in Orlando. I have stayed here several times, but have been increasingly disappointed with the lack of cleanliness and upkeep in this hotel. It used to be a plush, clean, excellent attention to details hotel. The last three times I have stayed here I found the rooms progressively shabbier. The hotel needs a facelift and new decor in the rooms. The furnishings in our room could only be called threadbare. The service used to be impeccable, but other than the check-in staff, I did not get the feeling that the staff cared to do their jobs. If it had not been for the early entrance to Islands of Adventure, I would not have stayed here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pool 18% gratuity a rip off”
Reviews.Author: Congold1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but food/drinks expensive. Pool drink menu states 18% gratuity added automatically to every check. Last time I looked it up the definition of GRATUITY was "something given voluntarily or beyond obligation usually for some service". This 18% should be renamed HARD ROCK HOTEL POOL USE TAX. Drinks in the souvenir glasses are also a scam. Also, pets are allowed. Make sure you don't get put in that "wing" - it can get loud and smelly. Who brings a dog to an amusement park hotel???

Reviews.Title: “Cool pool and early access to Harry Potter but rooms and food overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: machine67
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here only for the early access/express pass to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter at IOA. It was worth the extra bucks for that reason only. We got up early and headed for the park at 7 am. The gates to IOA opened for hotel guests at 8 am and we went directly to The Harry Potter stuff. We had a full hour to ride and explore before the general public masses came. The Hard Rock Pool was really cool and there was fun music and entertainment for adults and kids alike (music and dancing in the water). The poolside restaraunt food and drinks were delicious. Save some cash by eating our own fruit and granola bars for breakfast while walking to the park....you won't feel so bad later in the day when you eat out. I loved City Walk at night....the lights, music and shopping was really fun. Expect to spend alot of money...basic rooms $350/night

Reviews.Title: “Cost is mostly for benefits of Universal Studios. Check out "club 7"”
Reviews.Author: Middle_ageds
Reviews.Content: Without realizing it, we booked a "club level" room, which can only be accessed via hotel room key. Club level refers to the hotel's exclusive 7th floor (also happens to be the top floor.) The 7th floor has it's own concierge, bar, and gathering room where they provide free snacks, light meals, and beverage service most of the day thru evening. The continental breakfast and evening hors d'oevres saved our family of four an average of probably $50 per day on meals. At tge club level, the service is excellent, and no one made us feel like we were a bother. Everyone was helpful and eager to please.

Reviews.Title: “not what you think”
Reviews.Author: tdhd22
Reviews.Content: we went to the hard rock for my birthday, we have never been before, the hotel is very expensive, and the food is not that great, the staff are very friendly, but i think it is because you have a 18% sur charge on everything you order, so be warned. when we checked out we paid our final bill with our card, we have now got home and our bill as arrived and to our horry the hotel as taken two payments off our american express 1 $250 2 $360 we have no idea what this is we have tried telephoning the hotel to ask why they have taken two more payments from our card, and they just put the phone down on us, lucky for us american express when we called them and told them they have, called this amount back, untill the hotel contact them, so what i am trying to say is if you are paying in this hotel by card be VERY careful, we would not return to this hotel and i am very shocked as this you think being the hard rock would be the best, but its NOT.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jemom68
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever trip to Universal and the claims that it is best to stay on site were true. It is a quick walk to both parks and the hour early and fast express are necessary. I cannot imagine standing in the lines for the rides. We had a terrific check-in experience with Heather who really helped to make our first visit here memorable for the 3 thirteen year olds we were traveling with. The room was very spacious and we loved the split sink situation with the bathrooms. Our room overlooked the pool which was a lot of fun. I have rarely been at a hotel lately where they did not charge to self-park so the $15 a day did not really surprise me. I also did not think it was a terribly long walk to get there. Overall, we had a fun spring break trip and will definitely be back to the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: awesae
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with the pros of this hotel: 1) great location-within walking distance to the parks, 2) very clean and well maintained, 3) friendly staff, 4) nice pool with a water slide for the kids, 5) restaurants on the property, 6) early entrance into the park if you stay at this property (follow the crowd to Harry Potter), 7) fast pass to rides (fast pass does not work on Harry Potter or Rip it Rocket roller coaster). Now for the cons: 1) food prices are outrageous at the restaurants on the property, 2) hotel charges $15/day to self park, 3) hotel does not like for customers to bring food to the pool area that was not purchased at one of their restaurants, 4) wifi was not included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but fair service and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Bigbacon
Reviews.Content: Third trip to this hotel. The rooms are small but nice. The grounds and lobby area are very nice. The pool is nice but extremely crowded when we went - couldn't really enjoy it. For every visit to this hotel, it has been extremely noisy in the room. The walls must be paper thin, becasue there's constant noise all day and all night. Could never get a good night's sleep. And kids play in the hallways all day long. Even my kids found it very annoying. LOOOOOONG walk to the parking lot if you need to get to your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Meigas_fora
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando for a long weekend to go to the Universal Parks. Bellboy service was perfect -he even spent some time explaining the room features, as well as important info about getting to the Parks. The room was comfortable, spacious. Facing the Woodstock lawn, very quiet. The bathroom was meagerly stocked for 2 people, but I requested some extra things and they delivered in no time. Location is unbeatable to go the Parks, and the early access is a plus -esp. for Harry Potter! Used room service for breakfast -fastest ever. Granted, there was nothing cooked in the order, but it was delivered in 20 minutes. There are so many options at the breakfast buffett that you want to have breakfast three times. Service was slightly slow -and it wasn't too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: travelman1979_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and I didn't want to leave. Not only is the hotel walking distance to Universal Studios and Adventure Islands, but the hotel is very clean and large. The restaurants were excellent. The pool was very clean and well maintained. The hotel overall is beautiful, clean, and excellent staff where everyone says hello to you when they walk past you. I will return one day as a guest when not on business.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: HillRochester_NY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three day stay at this hotel. This was our first venture off of Disney property and the kids loved it. We had a garden view (standard) room that was quiet with a lovely view. The night we checked in Sugar Ray was playing a free concert for guests in the lobby. Kids loved the pool ages (5 and 9) and they had movies on the big screen at 7p each night at the pool. Ate dinner the second night at the beach club pool bar/restaurant and the food was good (aboout $80 for nachos, two adult burgers and two kids meals plus sodas). Quick 10 minute walk to the parks and city walk. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if your going to Universal Studios and IOA”
Reviews.Author: Christina041
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for two nights in February. The hotel was great. The rooms were nicely decorated and the beds were quite comfortable. There was a stocked refrigerator in the room. However, the prices of everything was outrageous. Needless to say, we didn't touch anything in the refrigerator. A bottle of water was $7.00 plus a 20% surcharge and 6.5% tax. The pool was beautiful, it had a nice waterslide. The water wasn't very deep. The deepest part of the pool was 4ft 6in. We stayed at the hotel for the fass passes and early access to Harry Potter. It was definitely worth it. Harry Potter reached maximum capacity by noon and with the fast passes we never had to wait to get on the rides. The location can't be beat if your going to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money - just”
Reviews.Author: ChrisB0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks with our 13 year old son. The plus points for this hotel are that you get an excellent location for access to Universal, early entry to the parks and the room keys act as fast passes to the rides. The rooms are large, clean and bright and the public areas are bustling and rocking to the music all day long, even underwater in the pool! Our son loved it. The negatives are that the hotel is very large and impersonal and we didn't get the feeling that we were "valued customers". Also, the hotel is expensive, which we knew before we went, but I was not impressed when I had to pay an additional daily rate for parking, a small thing I know, but it should be complementary in a hotel like this and does add to a feeling of being fleeced. We would use this hotel again, but only for a couple of days next time when visiting the Universal parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: Briangie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel on a recent trip to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure with my family (2 parents, 3 kids 14, 12, and 8). Also on the trip were my in-laws.(2 parents, 3 kids 18, 16, and 11). The hotel is the closest LOEWS branded hotel to the two theme parks. Portofino is about a 10 minute further walk and Royal Pacific is across the highway, near Citywalk (there must be a walkway under to get to the theme parks). Hard Rock is a fun hotel, with rock music playing in all the common areas of the hotel and has a beautiful sandy beach pool, with full bar and food service at the pool area. If you are into rock and roll memorabilia, you won't be dissapointed. Preformers from all genre's, fromTwisted Sister to Elvis, have memorabilia hanging up everywhere in the hotel. We arrived early due to our flight and the hotel accomadated us right away, holding our luggage and letting us use the pool. The front desk took our cell phone number and got our room ready early for us and notified us right away when our room was ready. Our family stayed in the deluxe double queen with pull out couch. My son, age 14, slept on the pull out and he said it was comfortable.The mattress was memory foam, not the cheap, springy, thin fold up mattresses you normally find on a pull out sofa. The double queens were sufficient and the room was serviced everyday, with fresh towels and bed linens changed every third day, or on request. The room also had a nice flat screen TV and clean carpets. No wifi, which the hotel should consider adding since so many people travel with laptops now. Our only complaint about the room was the lack of hot water in the early morning (6-8am). After taking a cold shower 2 days in a row, I called the front desk and they sent someone right away to fix the problem. The maintenance man adjusted the handle on the shower. It didn't help much. We discovered if we let the water run for 5 minutes, it got hot and then we did not shut it off until everyone had showered. If you got it to get hot, it would stay hot indefinitely, we just felt bad wasting the water. The hotel did give us a free breakfast buffet to compensate us for our cold showers. This hotel is a great value if you add in the cost of the Express Pass. Without a doubt, no question, I would never visit Universal/Islands without the Express Pass. We could go on rides 3 or 4 times before people waiting in the general admission lines got on 1 time. If you purchase the Express Pass at the park and add it to your ticket (it costs around 60 dollars), you can only use it 1 time per ride. The hotel guests have UNLIMITED access to using the Express Pass. You show your room key to the attendant outside the ride, and presto, you go into a different line entirely, walking right past all the general admission ticket holders. At first, we actually felt guilty walking past the general admission people, (we got a lot of nasty looks) but we got over that quick, lol. A couple of tips if you are staying there. When you get there, take a cab or drive to the local Walmart (cab fare was 15 dollars with tip). I bought a disposable type styrofoam cooler, ( used ice from the hotel ice machine) a case of Dasani water and some beer, snacks for the kids and a loaf of bread and pb&j. We saved hundreds of dollars (I'm not kidding). The beer at the pool was 20 dollars for a 24 oz cup and waters in the room were 7 bucks a piece. OMG. That is my only complaint. Food and beverages are OUTRAGEOUSLY priced. Example, Emack and Bolios in the downstairs lobby serves a take away type breakfast. 2 bagels, 1 bottle of OJ and an egg sandwich was 28 dollars. Breakfast buffet (which is awesome) 4 adults, 6 kids, 178 dollars. Average lunch was 150 bucks. So packing a Universal Studios plastic bag with snacks, and ice and putting some beers and water in the bag when we were going to the pool really saved us $$, we were just careful not to get caught. The hotel seemed not to care of you brought any of that stuff to your rooms. All in all, our two families had an awesome time at the Hard Rock and we would stay there again. The hotel was fun for the kids, a party type atmosphere at the pool everyday, with games and a great water slide, and kids movies at night for night swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Snowtot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hard rock with close family, which included 4 children. I really recommend this hotel to anybody, but especially any families with children and teenagers. There is entertainment by the pool in the daytime and films by the pool in the evening. The hotel is fantastic and the proximity to the parks is amazing. Service at the pool bar is a+. The only unfortunate complaint i have is the service we recieved at the kitchen, we had a waiter that was so rude and scarily abrupt that the rest of our party refused to dine in the kitchen for the rest of the holiday, which was a real shame as food was fab.. We have made a complaint and hope the person in question has been dealt with. I have stayed at this hotel for the last 4 years and each time we go we love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dalaroe
Reviews.Content: Even if you like rock, the music is too loud and it inteferes with a normal discussion. The service is nice but slow both at the front desk and at the pool bar. The personel at the front desk are often talking too much and too lengthy, instead of sending questions to the concierge service. The breakfast at restaurant Kitschen is well worth the price and some of the waiters are extremely good. But the localization of the hotel is good if you are going to Universals otherwise there are better locations in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Five days in Hogwarts”
Reviews.Author: Don5617
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than expected. Great location if you have Harry Potter fan in the family. It also has a terrific pool, lots of activities around the hotel and a nice bar (for the adults). While the food is not cheap, its good and there is lots of it! Staying at the hotel removes the hassle of driving/parking daily, plus you can get an extra hour in the parks and access to the express lanes.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the HRH in Orlando. The club level was a great deal for our family. We could get a simple breakfast and be on our way; get snacks in the afternoon, and even a few sweets before bedtime. The "club" itself needs to have more staff to clean and stock. The floor always seemed to be riddled with crumbs and the tables needed to be wiped down. As for the room, it was "ok" the bathroom was really small by American standards and we were awakened every morning/night by rowdy guests going down the hall. The pool area was GREAT!!! February is a great time to go to Orlando . . . the pool always had chairs and towels available. There is also a volleyball court, water slide, and ping pong tables for entertainment. Our "club" status gave us early entry into the Universal parks (1 hour) and a fast pass on most rides. We were within walking distance of lots of fun! I would definitely stay at this facility again . . . but would ask for a room at the END of the hall!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at and will be returning!!!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireGirl123
Reviews.Content: I know I am a bit late writing this review but every small detail is still in my mind! We arrived at the Hard Rock about four o'clock on a Saturday afternoon. Our room wasn't ready yet so we asked for the Universal tickets and our keycards. We had been before so we knew that our keycards were unlimited fast passes. This is a great bonus as my DD and my DH are huge fans of the Hulk rollercoaster and went on it about thirteen times in a row. We decided we would go to Universal and go on Rip Ride RockIt. The wait was only half an hour so we queued up. We returned to the hotel and our room was ready. We asked for a room with a roll away bed as I had two teenagers and they definitely didn't want to stay in the same bed as each other. The next day we took advantage of the early entry to Harry Potter World and went straight to the ride. Wow it is amazing. We went into a few shops, went on the other rides then went out. We still had 12 days left so we didn't feel like we had to spend all day in HP world as we could do it plenty of times. We got back to the hotel and went straight to the pool. The pool is lovely and clean. It hasn't really got a deep end but that didn't matter to me because I was mostly sun bathing when I was by the pool. Every time we were at the pool the sun shined and gave us a good relaxation from the hectic parks. There was a concrete part where sun beds were and a sand part too. If you wanted to get a sand part for the day you had to get to the pool. Also if you are going in June, July or August, try and get under an umberella, as it gets extremely hot. Some days we ate at the Kitchen. It is a bit expensive but it is well worth it for the quality of the food!! They have a good breakfast and the staff are very welcoming. Talking about staff everyone of them were kind and proffesional. When we arrived the bell boy accidently broke the handle off our suitcase and offered to pay for a new one out of his tips, now that's good service!!! We didn't take the offer but at the end of the stay he apologised again. The room service was great. We tipped the maid $2 every day and she was great. She folded and put away our clothes and even dried OUR wet towels and the hotel ones. She always tidied our toiletries and makeup away, she was just amazing. At the end of the stay we gave her another $20 for all her great service. This is all together the BEST hotel I have ever stayed at and I will be returning to it again, and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: mcCalg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on the 'Harry Potter' package. This is a great hotel in an excellent location. Room was very comfortable and quiet - we were on the 'Club' floor and the breakfast and all day snacks etc were very welcome. Pool was lovely and the staff friendly and helpful. Best of all was the early admission and 'front of the line' privileges with the room key at the theme park. Highly recommended - just don't eat at Bubba Gump's...(see separate review)....

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Terri-AnnC
Reviews.Content: We arivved at the hard rock late on a Sunday night where everything was ready for us, rooms were superb with a great view of the pool and Universal studios. All the staff were super helpful especially the people dealing with the valet service. Also the water taxis are amazing so convenient was an extra plus.

Reviews.Title: “Fast Pass is a must!”
Reviews.Author: helloreb
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the HR late Monday night and were booked in with no problem. Tara hooked us up with a birthday surprise for my husband (cake, a HR pin and a free drink at the bar). We picked the Hard Rock for the early access to Harry Potter and the Fast Pass. I would highly recommend this to anyone! We surpassed quite a few line ups which allowed us to see more! The only problem I had with the room is that it was quite hot and the ac did not seem to be working. The windows did not open either - but we were not there to spend time in the room. We requested a late check out on our day of departure and were able to stay until 2! We relaxed by the pool until we had to leave. This was a great experience at Universal and I would not hesitate to book at the HR again.

Reviews.Title: “Rock on”
Reviews.Author: delightfulsuprise
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel the rooms were spacious and clean, beds were comfortable, the bartenders in the pool area were alot of fun and looked like they enjoyed the guests. The pool area was amazing and best of all its all within the park. This hotel is definately the choice if you have kids out of the 3 on property.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Hard Rock Hotel & Universal”
Reviews.Author: 00000traveler
Reviews.Content: Before booking our trip to Universal Orlando, I read a lot of reviews on TripAdvisor - thanks to those who take the time to post. Some were favorable, others not. With two teenage boys in tow, we opted for the Hard Rock Hotel. Our room was ready when we checked in (around 2pm) - clean and all in order. No problems with housekeeping during our stay. No problems with noise (we had a "garden view" room not facing the pool). Ate at The Kitchen for breakfast each day. A bit pricey but typical for resort restaurants. Food and service were good. Very easy walk to Citywalk and the two parks. Using your room key as Express Pass is the BEST benefit. We did not do the early AM entry to Harry Potter. Too many people do that so the lines wind up being long. During the regular hours we never waiting more than 30 mins. Priority seating at restaurants never was useful. Being able to charge to your room key is handy - especially when teens are on their own and need to purchase food. But watch out for limits as your cards get cut off if you exceed them. You need to work out limits with the front desk. Many restaurants in Citywalk give AAA discount so always ask. We used the Mears Shuttle from the airport. For a family I would not recommend it. Mears puts too many people in a van and makes too many stops. For a few bucks more, opt for the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AllisonKBye
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here for work for 3 days. It was awesome. There is a walkway from the hotel directly to Universal, about a 5 minute walk, if that. The hotel room was the most modern looking room I've ever been in, even had a Keurig coffee maker with coffee's and tea's. Rooms were super clean. The poolside service was awesome, drinks were a bit pricey ($8 for a Captain and coke). I would stay here for work again in a heartbeat but too expensive for a vacation. The breakfast buffet is $16...I asked to order just an english muffin because that's all I need to fill me up in the mornings. Although when Universal is right next door not much of a reason to eat/drink at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: polarspeech
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed at the Hard Rock and we will do so again. It is the closest walk (5 minutes) to Universal and Islands of Adventure. The room comes with the express pass to all the rides in the park except for Universal's Hollywood Rip Ride Rockit Rollercoaster and HP and the Forbidden Journey . But if you book any of the 3 hotels on site, you get in to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter- and all it's shops and rides- an hour before the park opens. You get a lot more time on the rides with the express pass. It is a wonderful perk. Hard Rock also sells park tickets for a small discount. The hotel has a a great coffee/icecream place. The Kitchen restaurant has good food too but we usually enjoy City Walk for dinner. If you have kids and need some down time in the evening, the hotel has movie nights at the pool and you can have a drink at the outside bar. You don't have to have kids to watch the movie, but they are kids movies:) There's also ping pong and other activities. The staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms are nice and modern. There is a coffee machine but no refrigerator. The beds are comfortable but not memorable. You have to pay for the fitness center if you stay in a regular room. However, one can run in the area between the parks and the hotel. It's a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pools/hotubs were a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ajtat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HR for benefits to take in Harry Potter at Islands of Adventure. The perks were definitely a plus. I would stay on the Universal Grounds again, just for the early admission, express passes, etc. The HR was fine... no more, no less. The hot tubs close early, so by the time we got the kids to bed (my mother in law was staying with us and was happy to stay with the kids), the hot tub was closed or very closed to closing. Additionally, the pool wasn't open one day, because they said the temp was too cold. People, on cold days, the pools actually feel warmer!! Anyway, my kids were disapointed that the pools never seemed to be opened. I did find the music everywhere a bit annoying, as well. Will stay onsite at Universal again, but will likely move to the Portofino and try that one out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dboss101
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel stayed in Nov 2010 forgot to review. Front desk was very accomodating and very nice. Arrived early morning so room wasn't ready. They gave me use of the gym locker room. It was spacious, clean, showers, changing room, amneties to use I was impressed. As I was getting ready for our day in the park They called me to let me know my room was ready wow I thought that was quick. Recieved key to room and ventured upstairs elevators were fast room was immaculate. ipod dock, flat tv, 1 cup coffe maker. Beds were comfortable, bathroom was spacious. I loved this hotel. Water taxi or walk to park very convenient aside from awesome 1 hour entry into park b4 reg guest. and unlimited rides oh that was worth the price of the hotel in itself. for onsite park entrace stay left they have special entry for hotel guests as the line starts to build up for reg guests trying to get to harry potter. 1 hour for hotel guest into harry potter area is a must. Pool was nice and had a seperate whirlpool for adults. They also play movies poolside. I wished I had stayed there longer. (2 nights :()

Reviews.Title: “The best yet”
Reviews.Author: Kward3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Orlando with another couple to celebrate our 1st anniversary. We initially chose the Hard Rock for its location near Universal Studios, which was the main reason we were in Orlando. This hotel is fabulous. It has a serious rock and roll feel and caters to the young adult crowd. While there were families here, I wouldn't bring my own children. Mostly because the hotel blares music in most of the hallways. The staff was attentive, quick and very nice. We checked in quickly, were given all the details needed and our rooms were clean on arrival. Any question we had was easily answered by the front desk. They took very good care of us. The on-site restaurants were great! My favorite was the Palm. It had incredible specials and great food. Our waiter was hilarious. I also enoyed the Kitchen, which was often bustling. Each time we ate there the foodwas great and the waiters were very attentive. The hotel's pool bar was fun as well. They had bar style food available and some serious drinks. Order a double and you'll be set for hours--but you'll see it leave your pocket, too. If I had to choose a down side to anything, I'd say most of the food and drinks were pricey. But, we were on vacation and had saved up extra cash so we didn't really mind. Though, I'd rather not spend $20 for a simple ceral breakfast again! Universal Studios was the main event for us, and it was FAB! Harry Potter World was AMAZING--make sure you get a butter beer. Staying "on-site" was even better because we got fast-passes for most rides. The longest we ever waited for a ride was probably 15 mins, something I'm so glad we paid for! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, just not families. If you don't mind spending a little extra money, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Room not memorable, but great resort property”
Reviews.Author: soonertourist
Reviews.Content: The proximity to the parks and restaurants is a great reason to stay here. But the best reason is the amazing pool area. The sand and palm trees create an illusion, and make you feel like you are at a beach resort. The music wasn't uncomfortably loud, but I don't think anyone in their 50s or above would really appreciate it. We are in our early 40s and were pleasantly surprised by the choice in music. Our teenagers really enjoyed the outdoor ping pong tables. We were there over New Year's Eve, and my 13 year old was able to kill every drunk dude who thought he could take on the "youngster" at ping pong. We enjoyed the hotel lounge one night. We would stay at the Hard Rock Resort again. We have also stayed at Portofino Bay, so feel free to check my review on that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cool for teens and so easy for Harry Potter!”
Reviews.Author: Nee33
Reviews.Content: Staying here gave us early entry to miss the lines for Harry Potter and that alone made it great, but the hotel was cool and our stay most enjoyable. The staff seemed to be having fun and were very helpful. The only small gripe was difficulty getting espressos/cappucinos after 9pm on room service! They did charge a lot for wifi- each appliance was an extra fee!

Reviews.Title: “awesome location, great hotel if going to Universal Park”
Reviews.Author: TWCCharlotte_NC
Reviews.Content: well worth the extra $100-150/night you might pay over other off-site hotels (for Universal Park) since the room key gets you in every fast pass line available as many times as you like - very helpful with kids, especially if there are long lines; this is the closest of the three hotels on-site, rooms are very nice, and the hotel has great amenities including

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffmikegordon
Reviews.Content: Arriving we were awestruck, the hotel is extremely clean and the staff were impressively friendly. The rooms are wonderful as well, high class with great amenities, impressive coffee maker and great toiletries, including q-tips. We headed for the heated pool and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly, the bar service is great and the pool with real sand, zero entry and a huge water slide makes this my favorite hotel pool I have ever visited. Location could not be better for Universal, entering the park one hour prior to the public and Express pass are such an incredible value especially if you plan on going to Wizarding World of HP. We ate at the breakfast buffet once which is delicious with a outstanding selection. Overall what a fantastic place to stay, I will be staying here whenever I plan on visiting Orlando. One side note, it is not a bad one but if you have a rental car there is a 22 dollar per day valet fee, I was not aware of this but if I had been I wouldn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Tangerine313
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Jan 19th through 22nd with my boyfriend and another couple for their 1st anniversary. I was mostly excited to visit the theme parks so I wasn't expecting anything special from the hotel and I was very pleasantly surprised. We absolutely loved this hotel! Classy decor, very nice spacious rooms with extremely comfortable beds with great pillows, wonderful view, beautiful pool. The hotel has its own arcade, the pool has a slide, and there is an adults only bar that is dimly lit and very nice. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived because we were very early but they called us with our room number within a half hour. Everyone behind the front desk is very friendly and knowledgeable and check-in was a breeze. If you are looking for a quiet getaway this is not the hotel for you. They are blasting music in the lobby and pool areas 24/7. It is definitely more of a party hotel. The hotel is conveniently located with just a short walk or water taxi ride over to Islands of Adventure, Universal Studios, and City Walk. I believe it is closer to the parks than both of the other hotels. Also it was completely worth it to stay there JUST for the hour early entry you get into Harry Potter World. It was a completely different experience being there without the crowd and walking right onto the ride in the castle as opposed to later in the day when it was packed full of rude pushy crowds. (Side note: The Forbidden Journey is AMAZING even though you will probably feel woozy by the end of it. Harry Potter World is the best part of the parks. Child like sense of wonder restored. Butterbeer and Pumpkin Juice are DELICIOUS!) Also great was having the ability to go back to our room to rest for a few hours after getting worn out at the park and being able to return a little while later. Loved staying on site! The food at the hotel restaurants was absolutely delicious. We ate at the Palms which was pricey but they give you copious amounts of food for it, and The Kitchen which was our favorite. City Walk was fun and they have some Harry Potter goodies in the Universal store if you don't feel like waiting in line at the park, but the selection is a lot more limited. We also had the chance to see Patton Oswalt perform live on stage at the Hard Rock which was great. My only critique is that everything is really overpriced, so steer clear of the awesomely stocked but ridiculously expensive mini-bar. Our friends spent $50 for2 pool side drinks (though they were doubles). The first morning I had a yogurt and tea and my bf had an egg and cheese sandwich from the little marketplace downstairs and it was $20. We also ordered room service on our last morning and it was $50 for a belgian waffle, the american breakfast(eggs, bacon, potatoes, english muffin) and a pot of tea (with 22% gratuity automatically included) but the guy who delivered it was really sweet, as were all of the staff. Just be willing to have to spend a lot of money for meals. So overall it was a great experience and I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: supasingh
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a trip to Orlando. The location of the hotel is excellent its a 5 min stroll to the Universal parks. Its the closest out the universal hotels. The hotel is very clean, glam and presentable. The rooms echo those sentiments, but can be a bit on the small side. Service is fine but we didn't use it that much. Prices at the hotel are what you expect for a hotel of this rating can be a bit pricey to eat at the restaurant, bar food is reasonably priced again not cheap. Major plus is that you can skip the queues at the parks this is a god send in peak times, lets you see more of the parks at a relaxed rate. We have also stayed at the sister hotel the Royal Pacific and would defo rate this higher standard of rooms and general feel was of a higher standard . However the pool at the Royal Pacific was so much better the water was soooo warm brill for the kids. The hard rock pool can be a bit on the cool side. Ive been to a few hotel with 4/5 rating which were disappointing more like 3*. Overall i would say that this hotel deserves its rating of 4/5 stars for its look, feel, decor and location.

Reviews.Title: “it's a Hard Rock life”
Reviews.Author: Lou7151
Reviews.Content: Traveled here Jan 14th for 3 nights. Doubt we will make It to three. So expensive - worse customer service ever. Jonathan at the front desk was helpful, Paul with room service and a handful of others. This has been a nightmare. Room by elevators - listened to dinging of elevator all night. New room reeked of smoke and febreez in the smoke free hotel , not so good for a child with allergies. Jonathan was as genorous as he could be. After getting room service- it took 4 people over thirty minutes to get us a wine tool for the $70 bottle we had ordered. The food was freezing cold once it did arrive. When we called "star service", they repeatedly answered and hung up - or sent it to voicemail. Save your money. I wish I had. I have had better customer service at a gas station. Perhaps hiring the cute young girls is backfiring........

Reviews.Title: “Great everything!!”
Reviews.Author: Nachoss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! I didn't necessarily love rock music all the time, but at least I was listening to something modern as I chilled in the jacuzzi. Everyone was extremely helpful when my brother lost his liscence and had to get his passport shipped next day... The great thing is, they said they were going to look for it and not only did they find it, but called us as soon as they did and mailed it to our house! Another great thing is that it's 5 min walk from everything universal! An your hotel room is an express pass for long lines! Just overall great experience!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME.....”
Reviews.Author: cartaynic
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip in three years to Universal. Last time we stayed at the Portofino and it was beautiful but this time we wanted something with a little more excitement. The Hard Rock was awesome. Orlando had record breaking heat the week in July we were there so we spent lots of time in the pool. The activity MC was great with the kids and adults. The pool side drinks and food were very good, music, contests, just lots of fun. The pool and beach area were very clean and inviting with lots of palm trees. It was a 10 minute walk to the park or a 5 minute boat ride so the location was second to none, literally. The express passes were worth their weight in gold. There are plenty of food choices for dinner between the 3 on site hotels and City Walk. Something for everyone and the prices were quite fair to be honest. The room was clean and the hotel rate was fine for where you are........All in all I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone from singles, couples and families with kids as long as you are looking to have a good time partying!!!! If you are the type that just wants to curl up with a nice book and have peace and quiet this place may not be for you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time, would highly recomend”
Reviews.Author: brianbrant
Reviews.Content: We stayed through the Thanksgiving holiday. When arrived, since we had an early flight and no breakfast, we checked in and then went to the Kitchen for the best breakfast buffet we've had in a long time. Friendly staff,clean rooms, and great location. We did the Luau the first night which was a good show and great food. Next day we got up early and went to the Harry Potter World. This added bonus is well worth the extra money. You see the second wave come rushing in at 9:00 and by 10:30 it had hit capacity. The pool was nice after a day at the parks. On Thanksgiving day we ate at the Kitchen. It was a great buffet with hand carved meats and pretty much anything you could think of. A couple of park characters came through which was nice. The waiters were great and we never had to wait for anything. By far this was the best hotel we've stayed in. ;

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly”
Reviews.Author: TheIndigoSpirit
Reviews.Content: The Good Check in was fabulous--prompt, friendly and efficient. Rooms were clean and promptly maintained. Lemongrass toiletries were quickly snatched up by our girls. Best part--early admissions to the parks and only a three minute walk. Also, had ferry and pedicab access for those late nights. The Kitchen Restaurant was excellent in food quality, value and service. Highly recommended. The Bad No small refrigerator in room, nor microwave. Have to pay extra for almost everything--in-room internet access, self parking, access to workout room. The Ugly Nothing. But I need to stick with theme of title.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: dereckland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable and the decor was warm and inviting. the Christmas decorations were beautiful. When we first arrived, the staff at the door was helpful, and the registration desk personnel were very polite and helpful. They told us where to go at the park, helped us with dinner reservations and were very upbeat. We only went to one hotel restaurant: The Kitchen. We had the breakfast buffet and it was delicious. The pool area was absolutely beautiful with a great family-friendly atmosphere, including an awesome water slide and night-time family movies. The best part of staying at this hotel is the proximity to the parks and the city-walk, and of course, the express ride privileges and early park admission. Without this perk, we would not have been able to access the Wizarding World of Harry Potter and ride the Forbidden Journey twice! The only thing I didn't like about the hotel is there was no free internet access in the rooms. They had free access in the business area, but we all have ipods and laptops and were unable to use that in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fun fun fun”
Reviews.Author: susanlst
Reviews.Content: My family shared two adjoining rooms at the Hard Rock Hotel. Both rooms had two queen size beds. Both beds had clean, modern, plentiful bedding, the mattresses were very comfortable, there was a variety of pillows in the room. The room was clean, had a large desk, double dresser, large LG flat screen television. It also had comfortable additional seating. Our rooms overlooked a green area and provided nice privacy. The hotel is large, well appointed, and full of rock and roll memorabilia. We especially enjoyed the close proximatey to both Universal Studio theme parks. We walked each morning to the parks and appreciated the early admittance that staying on property allowed us. We were able to ride the rides and see the attractions we wanted to before the park was open to the general public. The close proximatey to Universal and City Walk allowed us to do the parks in the morning and early afternoon, come back to the room for a rest, and then head back out for an evening trip to the parks and City Walk. It allowed us more time in the parks and a more pleasant, fun experience. We did not use the fitness center, there is a $12.00 per day/per person charge. This seemed excessive to us. I realize this probably keeps unattended children out of the workout area, but we refused to pay more for a workout. We also were surprised that the internet is still be charged for, still? really? Enough, people expect access to the internet and I don't think it should still be an extra charge. We enjoyed the Kerurig coffee maker - we have one at home and enjoyed having it on our vacation. We loved the great water pressure in the shower and the lemongrass scented toiletry items. The bathroom was clean, neat and the towels were thick and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: michman2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with family and friends. Overall the hotel was wonderful. The staff was extremely accomodating. The Express Pass alone was worth it. We ate at the Kitchen one night and food and service was great. I would highly reccommend this hotel and would definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Worst rock music from the '80's”
Reviews.Author: floridatraveldad
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how a hotel like this gets the rights to songs, but over a period of 4 days I heard some of the songs from the 70's and 80's that I would just as soon never have heard again. Can't they get rights to the good songs? Anyway, the great thing about the Hard Rock is that it's a 3 minute walk to the entrance of Universal Studios. Islands of Adventure is about a 3 minute further walk. Also, the atmosphere is really "cool". There is rock 'n roll memoribilia everywhere. The rooms were laid out weirdly, with no overhead lights and no bedside tables (there was a big headboard that had a clock and 2 lamps on it). We had a "kid's suite", which was great for the kids, but they could have added a half bath for their room--4 people in a "suite", and only 1 bathroom? 1st night, there was music blaring from the room next door at 11 pm. I called the front desk, and security came up, and it turned out to be an alarm clock that went off improperly! (The loudness was due to the excellent sound system--usually a plus). 2nd night there was a live concert downstairs that filled the room until it ended at 11 pm or so--not a problem if you are a night owl. The shops and restaurants were excellent. Maid service was superb. Grounds were gorgeous. Oh, a warning for joggers. They handed me a 3.8 mile jogging route at the concierge desk. Although none of the following was mentioned in the description, it involved crossing a major road 4 times, going through several other road intersections, down an almost hidden staircase, and (I'm telling the truth) actually running IN THE ROAD for about 200 yards. I would put a "recommend" for this hotel because it was really beautiful, but there were just too many little problems, especially considering it's high price. In the future I would stay at a local condo hotel for $200-300 less per night and buy express passes for everybody--net savings of maybe $100-200/night, more sleeping space, and a kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat value of Universal Express Pass”
Reviews.Author: MCPO-USN-2011
Reviews.Content: I have a large family (eight) and we are making this a annual Christmas Retreat for us. The weather, the location and the parks are just to much fun. VALUE: OK----you can rate this two ways: 1---Actual cost of the hotel room. YES, you can get cheaper rooms within walking distance of Universal. BUT, #2 is the value of the Universal Express Pass-----$179.99 at the gate, per person for Express Pass for 2-parks, per day. So, multiply that by EIGHT, and the VALUE of the Express Pass pays-for-the-room!!---now, that is Value in my eyes (WARNING---once you get the Express Pass option---you will NEVER stay off-property again----we can get thru Universal in 3 hours...all rides except Rock Rocket, and about 3 hours for I-O-A (excluding the Harry Potter mayhem). ROOMS: Due to our group of 8, I have to get two rooms. I had two Deluxe Queen Rooms, next to each other, on the 3rd floor. No door between, but next door. Rooms were HUGE, and for all the traffic thru these hotel rooms, the rooms are in fairly good shape. Nice bathrooms, Nice beds, sitting area/living room. Plenty of space. STAFF: Very accomodating and very friendly. WI-FI & Internet: OK----they nickel-and-dime you to death here....but, so do all resort type hotels in Orlando. WI-FI IS NOT FREE in the rooms....but, get over it. You don't come here to sit in your room and surf the internet. I am sitting on a big couch, right now, in the Velvet Lounge, with an adult beverage, fast internet. The huge lobby has all the teenagers Facebooking.....but, the internet is free in the Bar/Lounge...so, no kids here. BELL HOPS: Ob-nox-ious if you don't use them----they will guilt you into using them--and, then expect a huge tip. I mentioned it to the check-in staff and they agreed that other guests had complained in the past. RICKSHAW BIKES: More obnoxious than the bell hops. These vultures hang out at every pedestrian exit of the property, and "guilt" you into a ride (big/huge signs on bikes state that they receive no income and work for tips only)....so, they will hound you for cash. And, no matter what amount you provide....they will make you feel like you short-changed them. DO NOT use the rickshaws---Hard Rock is easy walking distance to the Theme Parks (really short distance). POOL: Outstanding!!! Just a fun place for everyone. Yes, kids everywhere----but, it is a Theme Park resort.....not an adults only resort. If you don't want kids everywhere, visit a Senior Citizen Center in Orlando. You can easily loose track of time in the pool area...with a bar, movies and water slide. Plus ping-pong and other games/events. FITNESS CENTER: I did not spend the money to utilize....instead, I jogged each day along the walking paths between Hard Rock, Portifino Hotel and City Walk. Well lit, and a fun run (and free). DOOR KEYs: Not only are the door keys used as express pass access, but you can put "amounts" on each card for your family members to spend. Kids love that option--makes them feel like a big-deal signing for food, beverages and other items. PARKING: NOT free. $15/day with in-n-out privileges. DINING: Breakfast is NOT included. But, Wendy's and McDonalds are withing 1 mile of the hotel. I made it from McDs and Wendys back to the hotel with hot food in under 15min and saved a-ton-of-money. Ate at "The Kitchen".....expensive ($175 for 8) and horrible service (just terrible......server could care less about our group....kept messing up the beverage orders EACH TIME he came to the table. Abandoned us for 15+min at a time.....just brutally horrible service).....but, great food. Ate at "The Palm"....very well known steakhouse......expensive ($150 for 2, with no bottle wine....just glass of wine each).....but exquisite steak and service. Overall, we will come back each year---forever---and stay here for our Annual Family Christmas Retreat. You cannot beat the value of the passes and the proximity of the property to the parks. It is just to convienent and fun. Be forewarned....the hotel was COMPLETELY BOOKED for the 3 days we were here.....I booked my room back in April for a December visit......and that was before the Potter mayhem. Book early to ensure that you get a room.....all 3 Universal Property Hotels were fully booked while we were here, and the parks were packed (22,23,24 Dec).

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: jbturph
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Hard Rock on 12/2 thru 12/6. This is our third time here in the last 4 years. Although the weather was brisk to say the least this was one of our best stays. We finally booked a club room for this trip. Our previous trip we included our two boys ages 12 and 10 and stayed in the regular rooms. The club rooms are nice but no different then the rooms on the floors below. The club amenities are great. It was nice to get a coffee or hot chocolate before heading to the parks. Also, coming back and grabbing a snack throughout the day. We may stay in a club room again with the boys however, it would need to be a package deal. Our boys may enjoy it more and it may seem like a better deal since they could fill up on some of the food and snacks there too. The hotel itself was of course great. They seem to be making the effort to increase customer service. I have never has so many conversations with staff while at any hotel. Everybody was kind and fun to talk too. I could really see a difference from the last time we stayed there and it did not come off like it was forced either. The beds were great and the rooms where are very well cleaned. My wife is a stickler for clean rooms and it passed her test each day. We ate at the Kitchen for breakfast when we first arrived and even though the buffet is expensive it still is cheaper then ordering individual meals. The pools were clean and we used them despite the weather. Especially the hot tub. My one concern is that there is a adult only hot tub but yet parents still allow kids into this area. What is up with that? There is a sign. Can you read it? It just bothers me when other ASSUME it will be OK for 6 younger kids to enter this area. The parks where great although dated. The grinch breakfast is a must. Great time, OK food, but the characters make up for it. The Macy's parade was nice and the Grinch show was very entertaining. Got to get on all the rides and the lines were minimal for all areas including Harry Potter. Cannot see waiting in line for any store or a wand for that matter. Did not waste our time. Frozen Butterbeer was great even though the temps in the morning was in the upper 30's. Getting into the parks an hour early was a plus since we were able to do that entire area in that hour. For the most part the parks were dead this time of year as they usually are. I was told that after the first weekend in December to a few days before Christmas the parks are quiet. The holiday village is a dissappointment. The parks were all decorated nicely but the dated rides and the unused space at Universal allows you to completely do both parks in one day. We had 4 days in the parks and started looking for things to do but that could have been since we had been there so many times prior and knew what we wanted to do and not do. Twister? really? That movie is older then my kids and not a very good one too. The parks need updating and quickly. Workers in Harry Potter did not enjoy me asking for Team Edward or Team Jacob apparel. I am not a big Harry Potter person. Bottom line is that the hotel is great, location is great and the parks are dated. If you get a chance to go to the City Walk, hit the Rising Star, karokee bar. Great time and a great concept. Have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 11/20-23 and really enjoyed it. We had a garden view room #5114 at the end of the hallway. While this location was a walk from the elevator bank the quietness was truly appreciated after a long day in the park. The room was nicely appointed and very clean. The beds are comfortable. My two teenage boys loved everything about this hotel, from the memorabilia to the pool complex. They played in pick up beach volleyball games every evening and loved playing guitar hero in the cabana. It was a short walk over to Citywalk and the parks. Staying here also allowed us early entry into Islands of Adventure which is a big plus if you want to see the Harry Potter attractions while you can still navigate with a bearable crowd. All in all a perfect place to stay..

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hard Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful birthday weekend at the Hard Rock! We had a basic room but were upgraded to one(b-day amenity??) with a great view of the pool , lush landscaping , and the twinkling lights of the Universal rides in the distance. Everyone on staff had a smile and a helpful attitude! We enjoyed food and drinks at the Velvet Bar,breakfast at The Kitchen, and drinks at the pool. The location was perfect to get to the Universal parks and it was a short drive from the airport. I think that families and romantic couples or just a bunch of friends would all have a wonderful stay in this hotel!! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Rock around the clock in convenience”
Reviews.Author: Dusty-traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked for the Thanksgiving holiday and got a great rate on a 5 night package which included Harry Potter early entrance as well as breakfast at teh Three Broomsticks. After a few nights at Disney World, we were happy to see that walking did not involve great distances or running for monorails or buses. The Hard Rock is perhaps the most concenient location of all the on-site hotels, as it literally sits next to the Universal Parks and City Walk. We booked a club level room, and while it was convenient to have drinks and snacks available to us, I wouldn't do it again. The whole set up was very basic with a limited collection of plastic chairs and tables, basic snacks and not a whole lot else. The staff, though cheerful and willing were not very good at actually assisting or particulalry knowledgeable about Univeral in general. Except for one request for a restaurant booking, the Club 7 staff referred us to the Front Desk, which sort of defeated the purpose. The rooms are lovely and good sized. Two double beds in our room with ample room for walking around, as well as an armchair and a large oval table and two chairs made for a comfortable stay. The room was clean and well-maintained. The bathroom, though nicely set up with a sink and vanity outside, and another sink, toilet, and tub/shower on the inside, it was awkward to close the door to the toliet area without stepping to one corner and performing a little dance to get to the tub without climbing over the toilet. Housekeeping was wonderful. They somehow knew when we were out of the room, cleaned and were long gone by the time we got back. One day we just relaxed in the room after a late night, and housekeeping was kind enough to look in on us before going home to see if we wanted more towels or anything else. The lovely large windows do not open in the room, which would have been nice for some freah air. Though the A/C did its job well, albeit a bit noisily at times. The internet was horrible. Bad enough you have to pay for it, but when it becomes intermittant and very slow, it is a problem. It is $10/day and really not worth the aggravation. There is a single computer available for guest use in the Club room, and it was always easy to take a few minutes to check email and reservations, etc. And even it was slow at times. The hotel itself was nicely maintained and lively with rock music playing in the public areas. It was always fun trying to "name that song" whenever in the elevators. Some have claimed the music is too loud and pervasive, though we did not find this to be so at all. The staff were ever-helpful and present, which made getting information and advice easy. We went to The Palms restaurant on site, and after hearing so much about it, thought that it was a bit over-hyped. We had dinner there one evening, and though the service was attentive and the menu diverse, the steaks themselves were quite mundane and nothing special at all. My filet mignon was nicely seasoned and well cooked, but a poor piece of meat. Period. And this was largely the case for the rest of our party.
