Sides are okay and plentiful, but nothing special (and we at additionaly cost) We went swimming at the pool and were not pleased. Too many people, not enough chairs and the pool area seemed a bit unkempt and sad. It did not help that the pool was overun by screaming and inconsiderate children. The pool is largely 3 feet deep in most places, with only one small area being around 5 feet -- which, you guessed it, was where they were holding kids games and donut eating contests. We went once and did not go back again. I cannot emphasize enough how good a location this hotel is. It is literally steps from the Universal parks via a nice walkway, or by boat. We were able to walk between both parks and Citywalk within just a few minutes. Do go and see the Blue Man show if you can -- it is fun for kids and adults alike. We also took advantage of the many movies showing at the Multiplex theatre, with a great $5 morning special for even new releases. There are plenty of restaurants to try also, including some fast food uptions. We walked over to the Portotino resort and walked around. It is nicely done, but quite spread out. We also went over to the Royal Pacific and enjoyed a lovely sushi dinner there. It's a nice hotel, but also with a shallow pool. (they don't encourage guests from one hotel to swim in the other hotel pools, but we had to go and have a look to see if there were other options) All in all, a good stay. and we were able to see and do just about all Univeral had to offer. The parks are not as extensive as Disney, and that was fine for us. If there were not other things to do in the immediate area, after 3 days of parks we would have been bored. And we also wondered why a large percentage of Universal's rides include having water thrown at you. There was hardly a ride or show that water was not a factor. From a spit or two on Spiderman and Forbidden Journey to a full soaking on Popeye's water barges and the Horror Makeup Show (do not sit in the front row unless you want to be soaked)

Reviews.Title: “Won Over!”
Reviews.Author: Portland_ORDdb
Reviews.Content: I admit I came to this place with a slight ambivalence in that I felt I was forced to stay here to get express line privileges at Universal. But, boy, was I won over! The staff were incredible, the room was beautiful and the grounds exquisite. We didnâ€™t have time to enjoy the pool but it certainly looked inviting. We loved the water taxi to CityWalk and it was only a short 10-minute walk to the parks in the morning. The express line privilege was definitely a great perk in that we never had to wait in line during our visit in November. This hotel really shined in our memories especially after staying the next two nights at Disneyâ€™s Port Orleans Riverside - what a dump! I also thought that The Wizarding World of Harry Potter was by far the best attraction between both parks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff deserves better hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: We liked the proximity of this hotel to the Universal theme parks. Staff were fantastic throughout. Our room, however, was ugly and dark (a corner king). The bathroom is very poorly designed, with a miniature basin shoved next to the toilet (there is another vanity as well, with very little storage). We did not have much for a view, but the window was so small it did not matter. We overlooked a quiet lawn area and could briefly see the shuttle boats go by. Unfortunately the shuttles did not run as often to/from this hotel as the other 2 onsite properties. When you're hot and tired after a grueling day at the parks, it is most frustrating to see 3 or 4 boats for the other hotels come and go while you are still standing in the hot sun waiting for yours. Several times we gave up and walked (10-15 minutes to the parks), or took a pedicab when they were available. We were not very impressed wih the food anywhere at the HR. There is a large but poorly designed takeout place on the 1st floor, with very limited selection. Poolside bar serves a decent mahi sandwich. For us, the music in every public space got very annoying after a few days. I realize that music is a big part of the HR philosophy, however a quiet area would be appreciated. We did not try the on-site Fulton's Crab House, as it was very noisy with drunken conventioneers. The biggest plus for us was having Express Passes for the parks and rides, and the early opening for the Harry Potter section. Happy staff made up for our few complaints. This place would be best for active young families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay up for "Poolside View"”
Reviews.Author: Jude1969
Reviews.Content: Very few rooms actually see the pool. Ours is on the 2nd floor and all we see are trees. Pool is very shallow so is dominated with kids 8 years old and younger. Location is convenient to Universal but the one hour advance entrance still means the Harry Potter exhibit is extremely busy. If Potter is a must, getting in early is a must...or go late in the evening and stay somewhere that is less expensive but even nicer than a Loews hotel. Internet access is $10 a day and per computer. Self parking adds another fee per day. The brunch at the sites "Kitchen" was not stocked up til the finish time of 11:00. When we arrived at 10:30, many items only had a few left. On the upside, the hotel staff has a laid back, fun spirit to them. They compliment by pounding fists, say "take it easy", and have a casual fun demeanor. A long haired tattooed person would be recruited to work here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- great for honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: pobrien2009
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Orlando on honeymoon in July. This was our first stop. The hotel was excellent. We were checking in at 4am after a 12 hour flight and the staff were so friendly. When the receptionist found out it was our honeymoon we were upgraded. He also explained all the facilities available in the hotel and told us all about the surrounding area- City Walk. Our cases were taken up to our room for us and when we reached the room, we were not disappointed. It was clean, spacious, tidy and fresh. The bed was huge, we had a lovely view and it was stunning. We ordered room service numerous times and it was always pipping hot. The restaurant in the hotel was expensive but the food was delicious. The pool was lovely, although you need to be there early to get a sun lounger. You are entitled to the river boat for free to the City Walk which is very handy, especially if you have spent a long day at the attractions. We had an early check out and staff were a great help for this also. They carried our bags to our taxi and were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Service”
Reviews.Author: TMan61
Reviews.Content: At the last minute we decided to change our reservation from one of the International Drive hotels to the Hard Rock at Universal. I am so glad we did, the location and walkability cannot be beat, plus the Express Pass makes all the difference if you plan on lots of rides. Our package included park-to-park passes, Blue Man Group tickets, breakfast at the 3 Broomsticks, plus overnight and Express Pass, early admission to park privledges. IT WAS WORTH IT!!! Also, I was lucky to get upgraded to Club Level which saved some money and time on breakfast each morning, and a couple of relaxing drinks after a full day at the park. The pool areas were nice and not too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMPMINFLA
Reviews.Content: As locals we would definitely return to the Hard Rock in Orlando, it is the way to go when going to the theme parks at Universal. They originally put us on the first floor where pets are allowed and I am prone to allergies but had no problem moving us to a different floor after I requested a different room. The pool is really nice, I enjoyed the fact they had movies by the pool. We didn't eat at the hotel, but definitely enjoyed the benefit of hopping on the water taxi and heading to City Walk anytime we felt like it to enjoy some of the other restaurants. Downside: I realize it is fairly normal to nickel and dime at hotels like this, but we found the parking to be a bit excessive. The lights seemed to be on daylight savings time still and were off along the pathways to the theme park for about an hour after it turned dark which made it a bit hard to see. Although, even in the dark we felt safe. I have stayed at much cheaper hotels in Orlando and some of them didn't make me feel that way. The benefits of staying at one of the three Universal Hotels is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent adventure”
Reviews.Author: bayonnemom
Reviews.Content: staff and rooms were great...the hour early entry to wizarding world of harry potter was worth staying at this hotel...rooms were spacious for my family of 4...beds comfy! the only problem i had was being charged a fee for a roll-a-way that i returned after the first night, but the staff was happy to credit my account immediately...pool was nice...food was delic! would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi1999
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel costs quite a bit more than neighboring venues but it made our trip! The hotel was beautiful, the staff was always courteous and very helpful with any questions I had, and all of the rock memorabilia was fun to look over. One of the reasons we choose the Hard Rock over the other two Universal hotels was the pool and it was everything I had hoped for -- warm water, sand "beach", and prompt poolside service (the onion rings are amazing!). The rooms were plenty big for a family of four and the bathroom had two sinks (one inside with the tub and toilet and a larger one between the bedroom and the bathroom) which was a big bonus. The park was a very short walk and we never had to wait more than five minutes to ride the boat over to CityWalk. Granted, parking is not cheap (around $15 per day), but I am used to that with all the business travel that I do. The only thing I would say could use improvement was the wireless service. You do have to pay for wireless in the rooms (free in public areas), but the signal usually was too weak to be useful. You can confirm your flight and print your plane tickets for free in the business center so who really needs a computer anyway? I looked into staying across the street but really didn't want to bother with driving or taking a shuttle to the park when we could stay so close and have all the other benefits that onsite offers. As everyone mentions, the Express Pass for the park (your room key) is such a huge benefit. We went in October when the park was less crowed and really did just walk up to the rides without waiting. Unfortunately, for some of the rides I wanted a little bit more time to change my mind, but I was shown to my seat before I could chicken out! We did not take advantage of the early entry to the park, but I could see that being quite valuable in the busy seasons. Our main reason for going to Orlando was to visit the Wizarding World and it was fantastic! I would have loved to have more than the 2 1/2 days we spent in the park to explore and really take in all the little details that are everywhere to discover. Ollivanders was well worth the wait and make sure you take time to really appreciate Hogwarts and all the details that I noticed most people were racing past to get on the ride. One other thing that we really enjoyed about the Hard Rock was being able to go to the other Universal hotels and tying out their pools! The Hard Rock pool was open until 11 PM every night we were there so we had plenty of time to relax and enjoy it after walking around the park for so long. Overall, we were very pleased with the Hard Rock and have recommended it to our friends. We are looking forward to our return visit!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler38
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 have stayed at the HRH the past two summers, 2009 and 2010. The first time in 2009, was our first visit to Universal Studios Orlando, after having always been exclusively, devoted Disney followers. Although we find the hotel pricey, we thoroughly enjoy our stays here. The pool is our kids' favorite pool I think anywhere we've ever stayed, and there have been several amazing ones for them to pick from. I think what we love about the pool is it is appealing to both the kids and the adults. There is always daily pool games for the kids, and often bands that play in the evenings. The pool has a sand beach on one side and concrete on the other for those that don't want to deal with the sand. There is a great water slide, and volleyball court adjacent to the pool. The hotel is beautiful! It is big, but easy to navigate. We've ironically never eaten in the restaurants inside the hotel, but always use the poolside restaurant and Emack and Bolio's Ice Cream Parlor. Rooms are great- big, well decorated, nice bathroom, nice shampoos, and great individual packet capsule coffee maker. Beds really comfortable. We love all the rock memorabilia throughout the lobby and public spaces- there are tons of celebrity costumes and clothing- Kiss, Elton John, Elvis. Best part of the hotel? Hands down is the short walk to the two Universal Theme parks. That is why we originally stayed here and also why we came back and will be revisiting again this coming summer. Negatives- charge per day if you want a mini frig. The first time we stayed in 2009, it was complimentary- they sent one to our room free of charge when we requested it. This past year, there was a charge, and I want to say it was $25 for the stay. Instead I made room in the minibar and added a few things, even though the sign said not to disturb the items or you would be charged. Daily parking charges, which always get me angry at any hotel, though my husband says I need to just pipe down about that! :LOL! Positives- FOTL pass at the parks, the close walk, and the pool! We love this place and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Attitude and Location”
Reviews.Author: VibeManager
Reviews.Content: We were part of a 200-person group and the reception staff treated us very well. Rooms were great and the location cannot be beat if you're going to Universal. Our poolside catered event was perfect. I came with two kids and they loved it as well.

Reviews.Title: “overrated overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nickbergh
Reviews.Content: average hotel don't phone home on the hotel phone. we paid $408 for 6 short phone calls to the uk.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: gibby2007
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We got two adjoining pool view rooms for our family of five. Normally I wouldn't pay for the view of the pool but that is all they had left. We got The Hard Rock All access card and promptly forgot to use it, but could have saved at least 100 during the length of our stay (3 days). We did show it at check in and they tried to upgrade us to a King Suite but they were unable to find another room within close proximity for my kids so we didn't take it. There were laundry facilities on our floor ($2.75 for each) which we could have used to dry our clothes after getting soaked on some of the wetter rides. There is a clothesline in the bathroom, as well as small sinks within each WC and a vanity and sink area outside of each bathroom. This worked well for our family, but having two bathrooms was worth paying for two rooms. The lobby and pool are LOUD! My family enjoyed it but if you don't like loud music you may want to stay elsewhere. You cannot escape it within the hotel or at the pool. The kid activities at the pool were great for my 10 and 13 year old girls but my 14 year old son did not participate. He had a great time swimming and going down the slide. We ate at the Kitchen once for dinner. The food was good and the waiter was fabulous. He made my kids feel like celebrities. Homer and Bart Simpson were wandering around and went to each table and posed for pictures. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. The Universal rep at the Hard Rock (next to the concierge) made us reservations for the breakfast at the Three Broomsticks . You can't make these reservations before you arrive and you must pay for them when you make them, Apparently there are only a few available because they are supposed to be part of a special Harry Potter package, but we didn't have any problem.. We had an 8:30 reservation and were able to ride several rides before we ate (wich was probably just as well for our stomachs!). The other days we ate cereal that I brought and supplemented with fruit and muffins from the small convenience area inside Emack and Bolios in the hotel. There was complimentary coffee in the rooms. The park was practically empty except for the WWOHP. We had no waits for any rides at IOA except the Harry ones and getting there at 8 am before the park officially opened meant that we encountered no waits there as well (except for Olivanders). Waits for the rides at US were longer but the express pass meant that we simply walked on. No waiting! It allowed us to go on whatever we wanted then allowed us to have several hours at the pool each day. Something we could not have done if we had to wait for each ride. The proximity of the hotel to the parks is great. We never waited for the boat. We took a rickshaw once (the kids loved this). We scheduled Mears transportation to take us from the airport to the hotel and back again. They offer a shuttle or a private SUV. The private was cheaper for 5 ($111.11). It was well worth it. We had a 4 hour delay in our arrival and they were there waiting for us when we arrived. The car was new and spotless. They were waiting for us on time for our departure as well.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: salemgirl1975
Reviews.Content: love this hotel. Your can walk to universal in 5 minutes which is great because there's always a pop up thunderstorm and you can be back at your hotel in 5 minutes or so without taking a boat. Very clean and the Kitchen Restaurant is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service Climate”
Reviews.Author: BigFiveMom
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at a Hard Rock. Recommended by a friend. Also chosen for walking distance to Universal. Using the water taxi was a bonus! Upgraded from double queen to king at no charge-there was only 2 of us and we did not need 2 beds.Got a "pool view" but don't bother about that-the vegetation has grown so tall you cannot see the pool anyway. Also, there is music quite late from the pool audible in the room, and if that would bother you, stay with the garden view. Every single staff person we encountered did an excellent job. Either they hire well or train well! Friendly, helpful, welcoming. Housekeeping came around twice every day. Never needed to ask for extra anything. Very clean.Looked like our room was missing a loveseat in one area? Or there was certainly room for one. Comfy pillows and mattress. Extra blankets in closet-along with an umbrella. Didn't need during this past hot week. However, the breakfast in the Kitchen was way overpriced! We got a very nice lunch at Universal Studios (Lombard's Landing) for less than the breakfast! So we skipped that breakfast the rest of our stay-buying cereal and Kashi bars, etc. in a small area near the restaurant. The concierge even printed out our Southwest Boarding passes right on time so we got a good boarding number. Try dinner at Mama Della's across the street -5 minute walk-at Portofino's. The Palm is very pricey. Great pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MC-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock for 5 nights and totally loved it. We booked a pool view room, and while it was very nice, I don't think it was necessarily worth the extra money. If you manage to get a special deal, then go for it, but the view wasn't great - in fact the window took up less than half the wall - even though the curtain covered the length of the entire wall (giving the impression when you first arrive that the window is huge). The room was a good size, with plenty of room, and 2 queen size beds. The bathroom was quite old and dated, but that's something we've found with a lot of US hotels... The service at check in was great and the concierge helped out with tickets to Universal Studios (bear in mind though, that you can't purchase tickets to any of the Disney parks there). Universal Studios was amazing, and the location of the Hard Rock to these parks is unbeatable. The shuttle boat was great, but it's only a 5 minute walk, if you don't time your arrival at the dock with the boat. The best thing about staying at the Hard Rock is the Fast/Express pass you have on 90% of the rides at the two parks. This saves so much time, it's difficult to calculate just how much. There were rides that had 100s of people in line, with a listed wait of 50 minutes, yet we were able to literally walk straight on without waiting at all - simply by showing our room cards. If you go with a family, it is definitely worth the extra money of staying at the Hard Rock, just for the feature of not having to wait. Although this fast access doesn't apply to the Harry Potter attractions, guests are allowed into the park at 8am, before the general public, so there's not much of a wait anyway - and even though we're not Harry Potter fans, it's worth the wait! The facilities at the Hard Rock are of an extremely high standard - the restaurants are fabulous, the pool was lovely and the service was great. Because we didn't waste time waiting in queues at the parks, we were able to spend a lot of time in the afternoons lazing by the pool, with a few drinks from the bar (you don't have to leave your lounge - the staff are constantly wandering around, asking if you want/need anything). The pool was great - music playing underwater, waterslide and movies played every night. Although there have been other comments about the lack of a 7/11 or convenience stores nearby, you can purchase small items from either the Hard Rock shop or the ice cream parlour downstairs - and the prices really aren't bad. The proximity to the restaurants and bars at the Universal area was also fantastic - so many choices and great options. And the atmosphere there was great - safe and fun for families of all ages. Also, be aware that if you don't have a hire car, it costs over $50 one way to the Disney parks, and you may have a loooong wait at the airport to get a taxi to the hotel. We arrived on a flight from Miami, which was only 35 minutes in duration, yet we waited for a taxi for an hour. We travel a lot, for both business and personal trips, and we've NEVER arrived at an airport where there isn't a mass of taxis waiting to collect passengers. There were only 10 people in the line in front of us, yet it took an hour for us to get a taxi - not good enough for a city that relies so heavily on tourism. The shuttle bus wasn't much better - 15 min wait to buy a ticket, with at least a 40 minute wait for an available bus. Overall, we loved our stay at the Hard Rock and would recommend it to people considering a trip, with a focus/preference on Universal over Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star treatment all the way!”
Reviews.Author: Chenzhan
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed for 5 nights while visiting the Wizarding World of Harry Potter and loved every minute. When we checked in I mentioned that we were there to celebrate my sister's 18th birthday, and the day after they brought up a slice of birthday cake with a candle, a card with birthday wishes and a voucher for an ice cream! She felt like a rock star. The hotel key cards worked as express passes in the Universal parks, which was great, and we also used them as credit cards which meant that we could leave wallets and cash at home. We loved it and will stay there again if visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was Beautiful, Staff brought the Image Down!”
Reviews.Author: Lunadiablo
Reviews.Content: We arrived for Holloween Horror Nights and the first thing that damaged the rep for what we paid for was we were advised by the Desk Person that check in was at 4pm and they would call us once it was ready. NEver Received that call because we went to the park and returned to the hotel the room had just been completed at 530 pm. There is a desk to the far left on check in and a set of flowers that block the view of the attendant they from customers and customers from him. We were also advised by the front desk person to go across the lobby and check in for our park tickets already purchased. We did go over and we were treated as though we were ignorant once we went over because the Desk personnel there spoke to us as though we were supposed to know we did not need to BOTHER them because we could have gotten our tickets from the poorly marked Kiosk. They either need to get rid of the personnel and mark the Kiosk or get personnel who are willing to Meet and Greet the Guest and give them personal attention. (POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE) We had to wait for service either because the Staff member was hiding or could not see. Once we checked into the room the carts were still in front of our room, it was completed but the beds were poorly made up, no soap in the bathroom, trash in the bathroom can, hair in the shower. (PAY ATTENTION to DETAIL). PILLOWS Way too Soft. Aside from this the room was very nice and was the hotel. We had cocktails by the bar and even though the gratuity is added into the bill we received very good service from our waitress. The music/Band was fair. Although we had no children with us there were many family oriented activities provided by the Hotel. The hotel was approximately 2 blocks walking distance from the Universal Theme Park and City Walk. Over all it was adequate but for the price paid for this one night it was DISAPPOINTING! It should be noted I have emailed the Hotel as soon as we returned and still have not had a Response.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Seacliff1
Reviews.Content: While this hotel has a few drawbacks such as the fee for parking and internet, you truly can not beat the convenience and perks while visiting the Universal parks. The hour early entry to IOA was invaluable for a relatively wait free tour of the Wizarding World of Harry Potter and the Express pass perk was a great at both parks. Short walk to the parks or you can opt for a pedicab which will drop you a few footsteps from the entrance of either park or the complimentary boat service which lands at City Walk. My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary during our visit which the hotel staff recognized with two champagne glasses filled with hershey kisses and a nice note. Room was not spacious, but was clean and surprisingly quiet. Would not hesitate to return to the Hard Rock for our next trip to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - awful beds...”
Reviews.Author: Tweetiepie99
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 5 nights at the end of September and as much as I enjoyed staying at the hotel it isn't something that I would do again due to the cost. We booked the Hard Rock so we could have easy access to Universal/ IOA and as we got a 'good' deal @ Â£149 a night. While I understand that this is a good deal for this hotel, for the price I have stayed at much better hotels. To have to pay for parking and internet access on top of this - I have stayed at WAY better hotels. The reception and the pool areas of the hotel are lovely and being so close to the parks was great, being able to get a boat home at the end of the night way lovely. Being able to get in to IOA before others was great but at the time we went wasn't really needed (we didn't have to use or front of the line pass once as there were no ques anyway). My main issue with the hotel was the beds, it's been years since i've been at any US hotel and had such an uncomfortable mattress (and we go the US every year). It was a standard mattress, no pillow top, meaning that every time one of you moves - so does the other. So we got very little sleep while there which is a basic for me. So while the hotel looks lovely, for the price, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location. Great Fun.”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my children and my parents. All of us really enjoyed the hotel as well as Universal. We'd been to Disney many times and were not expecting to enjoy Universal and the Universal on-site property was much, but were were more than pleasantly surprised. We had a blast. The Hard Rock hotel is fun and exciting and has a great vibe. The pool is fabulous and had a lot of activities going on to keep everyone entertained either by participating or watching. We stayed in a club room and felt it was really worth the money. Breakfast was adequate with a oatmeal, cold cereals, boiled eggs, pastries, fruit and yogurt. Evening snacks were also good and changed every night. And we took full advantage of the free evening drinks (costing only a tip!) The only downside to the lounge were some of the other patrons who showed up dressed in wet swimsuits at times and other times in their pajamas. They were the same offenders day after day. The Hard Rock is the easiest hotel on property to walk to the parks. It's a 10 minute walk for quick walkers and 15 minutes if you tend to stroll. The walk is along a nice bamboo lined path. Shuttle buses and boats are also available. We ate in The Palm and The Kitchen and had good meals at both.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LVTravelbug80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel during a recent visit to Universal. My husband and I were traveling with our 13 and 16 yr old daughters, and was our second time at this hotel. The close proximity to the Universal Parks is a major advantage of this hotel! The on-site restaurants are very good, and the staff is friendly and anxious to help. We stayed on the Concierge level and enjoyed the afternoon happy hours - nice way to wind down after a day at the park, before getting ready for dinner. Note that there is free wifi available only in the lobby area (there is a fee for in-room use). We all had a fun and relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Experience”
Reviews.Author: CWLJAX
Reviews.Content: We took our 9 year old to Hard Rock Universal for his Birthday. We reseved the Kids Suite as his best friend was coming to surprise him. The hotel surprized us with a birthday treat from room service including cake (with candles) and ice cream, a free in-room movie and popcorn. It was quite special. Both nights they had a "Dive In Movie" showing at the (Harry Potter) and the children loved it. We took advantage of the early entry to the Harry Potter section of the Park and that was definately worth it as an hour later, the lines were quite long and we had walked on to all with no or minimal wait. We chose to stay at the hotel on Sunday morning instead of going to the Park and had the pool practically to ourselves. No lines at the slide. The experience was 5 star and we will absolutely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: Dancer11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Kids Suite at the Hard Rock Hotel for a week this summer, and we loved everything about our stay. The room was perfect for our family of 4. Our girls loved not only having their own room, but not having to share a bed with each other (they each had a twin bed). They also loved the pool slide. While others have complained about noise, we didn't notice any noise. The location cannot be beat - a short 5 minute walk to Universal Studios and CityWalk. And having front of the line passes for Universal was awesome. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Club levels compared.”
Reviews.Author: familytravelor2010
Reviews.Content: My family has now stayed club level at all three on site hotels. Each year we stayed in October. FOOD: Club food at the Portifino was far and away better than the other two resorts. Club was well worth the price, with both breakfeast and 5:00 food being of high quality. Dinner was beef, chicken skewers, and antipastas. Late night sweats were actual desserts. We never had to eat anywhere else. Royal Pacific had a great breakfeast, but the nighttime food was questionable. Had creative looking asian "casseroles" that our kids wouldn't touch. Cookies and milk at night. Hard Rock had lower quality breakfeast, and nighttime food was little more than chicken wings, egg rolls, or chicken dumplings. Cookies and milk at night. Hard Rock was way overcrowded, and we always had to wait in line. CLUB LEVEL ROOM: Our favorite was the Royal Pacific. Was never crowded or loud, and we used it much like a living room. Wej ust hung out in there reading..internet surfing, or watching the big screen tvs. It was really an extention of your hotel room. Portifino's club room was large, but a litte sterile. Hard Rock's club room was way too small, always crowded, and music was too loud to do anything but eat.. CLUB LEVEL FLOOR: Royal Pacific and Hard Rock were about the same, and, well, Portifino didn't have one. At the Royal Pacific, it never seemed crowded, and you did feel like you were on a private floor. Hard Rock seemed to always be crowded and cramped. Also, noticed a lot of people walking around the floor that didn't seem to be staying on the floor. Overall, Royal Pacific had the best club level experience. If we stayed at the Portifino again, we would pay the extra money for the club level. With the Hard Rock, we thought we wasted our money on the club level, and would have been better off stopping a Wal-greens and stocking our room with pop tarts, chips, and Coke.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in perfect location for Universal Studios - awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Kevinonvacation
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and services. Enjoyed the early access to Universal as well as getting to the front of the line at most Universal rides - can't fault it! Thanks for a super stay!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: dmark522
Reviews.Content: Second Stay at this this Orlando Hotel. Love it the more I stay. Beautifully laid out hotel, nicley designed pool area, good food choices in the hotel. Rooms and lobbies are elegant, clean and nicely/tastefully decorated with its rock mementos. Excellant location with just a 10 minute walk to Universal studios with the added benefit of getting early addmmission and fast pass all day long on the rides just for staying at this hotel. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Rock music oozing from every corner but totally relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: PeteMoLuce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 22 year old daughter stayed here for 10days and enjoyed every minute of it. Theres rock music everywhere from the lift to the loos and rock memorabilia from Jimi Hendricks to Elton John. The room was very roomy, stylish and clean. We had fresh tea/coffee daily which is unusual for hotels in America at no extra cost. The hotel is not the cheapest but worth every penny. Also 'cause your staying at the Hard Rock you get to beat the queues at both Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure with Express entry. Would definitely stay here again. Also good time of year to come longes wait for ay ride here or Disney was 20mins.

Reviews.Title: “Lively fun resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJaneC69
Reviews.Content: If you like a lively hotel close to the Universal Parks then this is for you. The pool is open until Midnight or 2am every night with "Dive In" movies, and underwater music!! A few nights a week there is loud rock and roll music played by the pool, so if your after somewhere quiet at the end of the day, then go elsewhere. The rooms are not massive and are expensive for what you can get in Orlando, but for convenience for the Universal parks it cannot be beaten. Your room key acts as a fast pass all day everyday as well so that does save you some money as well. Check out the overnight car parking charges as they are very steep. A good variety of restuarants but nothing is cheap. A great meal can be had at The Palm, but this is very very expensive (compared with other Orlando restuarants), so great for a special occasion. I would recommend this hotel is you like fun, and don't expect to sit next to a quiet pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KJ85
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in the Hard Rock Hotel and loved it. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Universal Studios and City Walk. Staying in the hotel also came with the bonus of a queue jump to alot of the busier rides. Overall I loved my stay here and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: katieJohn21
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hard Rock hotel for a week, and enjoyed every moment. The staff couldnt do enough, the rooms were perfect and the facilities amazing. The early theme park access was great. I really recommend this hotel, is GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean and Rocking”
Reviews.Author: MikeAndSheila
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock at Universal Studios in Orlando, Florida is a great place to stay while enjoying the Universal Theme Parks. The Hotel is clean, modern and sleek. The staff is ready and happy to help with any requests. The food is great at the Kitchen, get the buffet itâ€™s worth it. The Palm is very expensive but they do run special deals (I had filet mignon and lobster tails with salad, desert and coffee for $49) it is a more upscale restaurant but makes a night out a bit special and the Beach Club by the pool has really good food. Its the closest hotel to the Theme Parks and Citywalk. Its a nice walk through a topical paradise path. By staying at a Universal property hotel you get into the park an hour before it opens (take advantage of that perk), packages and photos delivered to your room and the overall convenience of having everything within walking distance. Only down side is that the pool is shallow and no more than 4ft deep. but its still a really nice pool and the music is great too.

Reviews.Title: “great time at the hard rock”
Reviews.Author: bennie1970
Reviews.Content: it was the third time ive stayed there in 3 years.there must be a reason i keep going back. we have such a great time there every time.i love the distance from the park.easy drive to international drive to go to diffrent places to eat and shop. the only complaint i have year after year is why they charge so much to park your vehicle..they charged me 210.00 a night and then wanted 28 dollars to park on top of that per day..come on hard rock work with me...

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: flowrida
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed at all three Universal hotels and we have to say this is our favourite. From the moment we arrived until the day we left we have only high praise for all members of staff. The hotel itself was amazing. Very impressive lobby and very pleasant and efficient front desk. Our rooms (3) were very impressive - large extremely comfortable beds with great view of the pool and the rides of the park beyond. A nice touch was two sink areas - one closed in with the bath/shower. Excellent pool and sunbathing area. The Kitchen was very enjoyable with great food and equally great server (David - very tall very talkative and great people skills). On Friday at 4pm they have a tasting in the main lobby of one of the offerings in the Kitchen so you can "try before you buy" - what a nice treat, we had one of the nicest Mac & Cheese ever! We hope that we'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: snorklemom
Reviews.Content: There are just 3 reasons to stay here and the rest (as they say) is just icing on the cake! 1) Walking, water taxi distance from the Universal parks: walk there in the morning and ride the water taxi at the end of your day! 2) Early entrance: one hour before the general public admission! We walked onto the Harry Potter ride 3X before 9AM. 3) Express pass to all the other rides except Rip Ride Rocket? (can't remember the exact name cuz it wuz out of service all week) but you get the point... NO LINES whatsoever! Those 3 reasons ALONE justify whatever price you are paying! Especially with kids!! We were there last week (courtesy of Cobb County school system) and now that my kids are old enough to enjoy the BIG rides, will never stay anywhere else. They enjoyed the awesome pool and waterslide just as much as the parks. The only caveat I have to offer: Decide how much time you will be spending in your room before you go! I knew with 4 kids that sleep was not a priority! Therefore, when they gave us the deluxe queen on 1st floor (largest room, closest to the pool and parks) I would not complain, even though it was across the hall from the ice machine!!! The kids DON"T CARE---I PROMISE!! In fact, I took a large cooler (with wheels) into the hotel so that we had unlimited water bottles, juice, snacks, milk for cereal in the AM, etc.!! and we could replenish the ice ANYTIME!!! Be aware though, that the doggies/pets are also on the 1st floor (apparently) but we were up so early in the AM and went to bed 11-ish so it didn't bother us AT ALL! We ate at City Walk a few nights (highly rec. NBA City and Margaritaville) so can't speak to all of the restaurants on site. The Beach Club was great food and Taylor was the BEST! I was a waitress in college and these people WORK HARD!!! One night we orderred pizza from room service and my kids (who know pizza) said it was the BEST pizza they ever had! Finally, every single time we called the STAR line to ask for something (more towels, razor, etc.) they came in an INSTANT. Best service EVAHHH! Front desk was awesome... we arrived at about 5pm and the room wasn't quite ready so she gave us 5 free drink coupons and let me tell you, that was worth $40?? Parking... just factor it into your room charge and self-park. You don't need your car!! We have previous;y stayed at the Marriott Grand Lakes(?) Animal Kingdom Lodge, Polynesian and several condos, but this is THE BOMB!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel heaven”
Reviews.Author: j1lloyd
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Hard Rock Orlando & if possible it was even better than the first. The hotel itself is stunning, immaculate & contains something for everyone - young & old, the music piping throughout all common areas adds a modern yet unintrusive touch. The staff could not have been more accomadating & friendly, from the bar staff to the cleaners passing in the corridors at all times of the day. Checking in & out was particularly straight forward, as was getting taxis from the front of the hotel. The rooms were cleans, spacious & comfortable. The location in relation to the parks & City Walk along with the free express passes are undoubtable perks to staying here & add to the already incredible holiday experience.

Reviews.Title: “This "First Class" Hotel has No Class"-worst travel experience in years”
Reviews.Author: 1951traveler
Reviews.Content: Our flight on Southwest was the best part of our trip! When we got to Orlando Airport it took two hours for Mears Transportation to pick us up- AND that's with a RESERVATION based on our Arrival time which was early!! If you book a Mears Shuttle (which was recommended by the hotel (can anyone say greased palms)- be sure to look at what time you get to the shuttle stand. Make sure they write the correct time on your ticket. They pushed our time up 10 minutes and then we had to wait another 1.5 hours for another shuttle-when there were two there when we arrived. Don't stay at any of the Lowe's hotels at Universal Orlando unless you plan to take advantage of the Express admission and the early admission to the park for the Harry Potter Ride. You are just paying about $60 more per nite to be treated like dirt if you aren't a celeb or here with a special group that means moolaa to the hotel. The concierge supposedly booked a special dinner reservation for us at a dinner theatre and made a special point to tell us we had to pre-pay and it was non-refundable. When we asked if we needed to come down especially early for a cab she assured us there were always cabs out front. So our big nite arrives and guess what. First, no cabs. Then this loud mouth jerk yells that he needs a cab and presto-One suddenly appears and they usher him into it - even though we were here first. So about 20 minutes later a cab shows up and the driver is complaining because there is a parade of cabs headed to Hard Rock - "all for you" he says in his middle eastern accent. We go to the window - still relatively calm - with 20 minutes to spare before the show starts and guess what--they have no record of our reservation or payment!! So we call Hard Rock and they talk to the consierge desk and our reservation miraculously appears- however our last name is misspelled and there are two dinner shows- which the people at Hard Rock didn't bother to tell us- so we had no idea what we were looking for. Fortunately OUR show didn't start til 8pm instead of 7:30 so we finally got to go in. After the show- of course no cab- so we call Hard Rock and the girl that answers sounds totally clueless when I ask her if she can help us get a cab back to the hotel- she connects me to the Cab company line. I wouldn't stay at a Hard Rock Hotel property again if they paid ME! This place doesn't know the meaning of customer service - at least for regular folks.

Reviews.Title: “First, and not last, Universal stay”
Reviews.Author: HawgGnarly
Reviews.Content: This is my first tripadvisor review. I've gone to Orlando many times, but we'd never stayed on Universal property. We hit some of the moderate and values at WDW, and usually stay in a Hampton or similar. This hotel was awesome. We got a great deal right after the free Superbowl tickets were announced. So good, that even though our plans changed, it was cheaper to eat our first night at the Hard Rock than redo the ressie (It was aroudn $160 a night). It took them a while to find the ressie, since we were there a day late, but I had called ahead. The lobby is very opulant, and the music isn't intrusive, which seems to concern a lot of folks. The room was great. Clean, pretty big, and it had a sofa for our son to sleep on. It was also my first exposure to Keurig coffee makers, and led me to buy one a few months later. The best in-room coffee I've ever had. We shoved a few things into the mini-bar, which was against the rules, but oh well. the beds were very comfy, and the theme was great in general. We would laugh everytime we passed the N-Sync outfits in the Hard Rock Hotel. The pool is very large, with a great, long slide. Walk to the Studios park is only about 5 minutes. It would be about 1 if you could walk out the back of the pool area. There isn't much of an arcade, food options, or convenience store like the Disney resorts have with their food courts. Our only compliant was how the people that unload your bags just take them about 20 feet to bell services, who then deliver them to your room. So, you have two people to tip. Parking is another negative, you just have to figure it in to the room price for comparing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough.”
Reviews.Author: j9999
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all of the Universal hotels several times each. This is my third or fourth time at the Hard Rock. Here are the pros.. *very close to the parks and city walk. You cut out through the pool entrance and its a five minute walk to citywalk. * With room key you go to the front of line on most attractions and rides. This is key. The park was not busy at this time of year and we literally walked right on to rides without waiting one minute. When it is hot out, this is worth every penny you pay for the hotel * We stayed in a kids suite this time. One huge room with king size bed for parents, one smaller room with twin beds and tv for kids. One bathroom with toilet and bathtub and separate bathroom with 2 sinks and shower. Really a nice treat * Great pool with live bands, activities and huge slide * food choices are great here. The palm steak house (pricey but always great), the kitchen (delish!) and a self serve coffee, ice cream place to grab a bagel or muffin as you are running to make it to the park early for Harry Potter! * We ordered room service one night after my youngest soon was pooped out from the parks and it was also very good. * We had a problem in our room and the management team could not have handled it better. Cons: Property is getting old. Hallways look aged but rooms are still okay. It is pricey....If you want a bargain, don't stay here. Besides the fact that on the weekends the rooms are no bargain (especially in orlando where there are tons of rooms and you can get great deals most of the year) Valet parking is around $25 a day, internet is $10 a day, $25 for a rollaway bed, $13 bucks for a fruity drink by the pool, bottled water in sundry store is $4 a pop, and so on .... I expect to pay it at a resort but if you are on a budget, etc, you can stay somewhere else for much less. Bell service and valet parking seemed understaffed. Called for bellman and no one showed up after 15 minutes so we just carried it down ourselves. Took quite some time for valet to pull around the car (for $25 it should be much faster!) Perhaps they were understaffed that day and this is not a continuous problem. More importantly, I was told by a staff member that the hotel is having water leakage in many room when it rains. It could be a problem so check your room when you check in. All in all, the hard rock is a fun, lively hotel. The kids die for it. The not waiting in line for the rides makes everyone happy. It is pricey but it is a resort and the pool area is definitely a great free activity (if you avoid those fruity drinks!). If you are trying to make your trip to Universal special, I'd definitely stay here (or any of the lowes at universal property) If you are not heading to universal or islands of adventure, stay at Gaylord palms or the ritz. They are better and probably even less money! The advantage of staying here is the skip the line benefits.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want to spend money - stay at Motel 6 !!”
Reviews.Author: ArtimusG
Reviews.Content: Don't know why some reviewers complain about the prices. Orlando is a vacation destination and there are many discount hotels and restaurants available. Stay there and stop complaining! Stay at Motel 6 and eat at Shoney's every day and you will save plenty of money. I'm not rich, but I budgeted for a financial kick in the gut on this trip and do not regret a single dime I spent. Stayed over Labor Day weekend at the Hard Rock with my wife and 11 y/o son and loved it. The perks were great (early park entry, water taxi, free fast-pass). We upgraded to the club level (+$75 a night...was told that it is usually +$100 per night). Well worth it as we took advantage of the breakfast, snacks, drinks, and sweets. The room was super clean and well appointed. The pool was fun and very relaxing after a long day at the parks. We did the valet parking - it was more expensive, but I'm on VACATION! Check in/out was a breeze, staff was helpful and friendly. Our remote control died and I mentioned it to a housekeeping staff in the hallway as we were leaving to the parks - she got on her walkie-talkie right there and got maintenance to take care of it. We did the luau at the Royal Pacific resort and it was a good deal. The food and drinks were good and the entertainment was as well. We went to see Blue Man Group and it was a blast! I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and will likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Les enfants adorent”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsRolie
Reviews.Content: Expensive for Orlando, but the kids loved the concept ("cool!!!") and the swimming pool. Early access to Harry Potter and Express Acess on almost all rides in Universal theme parks was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock, really Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Luisa13
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start, this has been the best vacation that we had in the last 6 months. Check in, fast and efficiently Bell Boy, really helpful (hats off to you Chris you really rock) We choose to stay in the club level and it was very well worth it. Not pool vie but our room had vie to the parks. (Ama you really put yourself out there, Hats off to you too). Service in this hotel is one of the best, including room service food really good Location, 5 minutes walking distance from both parks and city walk Rooms, very spacious with separate sink from toilet and shower, coffee maker, mini bar, radio, mp3 player, flat HDTV, two queen sizes beds, soft pillows, bathrobe... Housekeeper, if this good luck or what? Fabiana our housekeeper treat us like royalties, our room was very very well kept and clean, not a sign of dust, in the bathroom everything was extremely clean, carpet, mirrors, sheets, everything clean and very well done. Pool really cool my daughter enjoy the slide and the water was really warm Arcade, small but with enough games to play Live Concert, really loud and inviting music, we really enjoy the live band. Music in the hotel is really awesome The food at the Kitchen and The Palm was really good, and with fair prices too. (the lobster at The Palm really tasty and cook to perfection). Ice cream parlour, (I can remember the name) have a good variety of flavours and yogurts too. All kind of bagels and snacks for the children Rent car service, right in the lobby and with good service as well. Laundry area, really small for the size of the hotel, expensive yes, but the machines works really good. And to finish I love the security in the club level, after 11:00 pm the floor manager and the security guard where always attentive and very friendly, even though we knew they were there for obvious reasons. So if you want to feel like you are a king or queen, visit this hotel, you will really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of room 5044!!”
Reviews.Author: PhylSam
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in all three Universal hotels and just think the world of the design and amenities offered by the brands. Each hotel offers the guests the best options in the Orlando area in terms of being able to easily walk to the Parks or take a frequent short boat ride, and the best perk is the front of the line pass. For families with teens and old rockers, we feel that the Hard Rock does it best ...that was until this past weekend. My husband had a meeting at the Portafino Bay hotel and we chose to stay at the Hard Rock due to its atmosphere, the swimming pool and its theming. During this stay, we arrived very late and was assigned room 5044. Check in was efficient although the "Hard Rock All Access Card" was barely acknowledged. We never received any of the perks so those of you who are considering this card, so don't waste your money. Our room overlooked a roof with a bunch of wires. This is not an issue for us but might be important to others. As we arrived very late, we put out the "Do not disturb" sign. During the early morning from 7am on, we heard constant banging and loud, continuous conversations. We were too tired to get out of bed and just thought we had very inconsiderate neighbors of a large group. My daughters and I enjoyed the new Harry Potter section of Islands of Adventure. (The perk of early morning entry is one not to be missed by hotel guests. ) That evening we returned to our room and we noticed that the room opposite our room had a broken door jam. The door was not locked. The next morning, it became obvious what it was. Starting the next morning after 7, constant banging of the door and loud conversations awoken us from our sleep again. This time, I wrapped a robe around me and opened the door to face a full housekeeping staff (more than 7 or 8) loading up carts, laughing, screaming for position. The room opposite our room is a storage, staging area for housekeeping. I asked them to lower their voices but nothing could muffle the constant traffic stream of workers gathering in this area for hours on end. We had requested a late check out and received an extension of 90 minutes. Housekeeping came by 3 times between 9-12 knocking on our door to see if we were checking out yet. Each time, I informed them that we had a late check out of 12:30pm After we were starting our day, I called the manager on duty, Nicole [--] and spoke to her. It was one of the most disappointing calls I have ever encountered in deals with hundreds of stays at hotels. I informed her that we had a late check out and were disturbed 3 times even with a "do not disturb" was placed on our door. When I pointed out that under no circumstances should they sell a room in that location, her response was "I am so sorry that you had a disappointing stay". She failed to recognize this location as problematic and refused to even acknowledge that this must a location that had received complaints before. As we are Florida residents, she did in the end, after I demanded some sort of restitution, offer a return stay of one night at another time, which I have no confirmation and clearly does not compensate for 2 bad nights. If I had not been so exhausted from this conversation and her lake of empathy, I would have tried to go higher up the ladder. Her poor communication and droid like responses have left our family leaving the hotel feeling like the staff doesn't care about any of the guests, their experience and the ruining of the weekend. This manager needs to get additional training in handling customers. I am warning all future guests to be VERY careful what rooms you are given. Go to the room, check out the view (if that is important to you) and look at the rooms around your rooms. Check for housekeeping closets (or hidden rooms in this case) and elevators to disturb your sleep. And most important, if your stay is not up to your standards, speak to someone who can help make a difference. Think of what would make you feel compensated for your difficulties.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: jrman66
Reviews.Content: So much has been written about this hotel, so I will try to add some value. I have stayed at all 3 Universal properties and the hard rock is by far the best for: - Kids (non-stop activities at the pool, well into the night) - Location to the parks (you can walk) - Nightlife (the beach club bar was always happening at night) - Pool food (the food at the beach club was amazing; especially the salads) - Staff (everyone here is so happy and seem to love their jobs) The best hotel for room size is the Portofino. The best hotel for elegance and quiet is the Portofino. The best hotel for the club room is the Portofino. Our room on the club floor was large enough for 3 people but may be a little crowded for 4; especially if you are staying more than 5 days. The club room was lots of fun but it is too small for the number of guests. The food at night was average at best, but the staff loved to pour you lots of drinks and seemed to have fun doing their job. Unlike the portofino, happy hour is not going to give you enough variety in the area of food to serve as your dinner. If you are looking for elegance, this is not the hotel for you. If you want to have a rocking time with your family and friends, this is definitely a place you want to spend your time. who needs the parks when a hotel is this much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mj_chan
Reviews.Content: Hard to add to what all the other reviews say, but I will hit on the high points: Breakfast buffet is to die for, if pricey; Pool was awesome with live music, sand beach area with awesome and attentive staff; Parking was meh, pricey and the design of the lots in relationship to the hotel not the smartest; Access to Universal was excellent and the price of the room made worth it for the fast pass; Rooms were average for a hotel of this class; I think they try hard to train the staff to treat you "Like a Rock Star", and for most of the staff it works.

Reviews.Title: “We Miss the Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joalexajeff
Reviews.Content: Everything about our vacation to the HRH was terrific. The hotel was running a promotion so we booked Club level rooms with a terrific pool view. Unlimited bottled water and soda all day, breakfast, dinner and desserts plus beer and wine...made it a great deal for our family of 8. Grabbing bottled water and soda before heading to the parks and pool saved lots of money. The staff at the hotel couldn't do enough for us! The walk to the theme parks is 5 minutes and the express passes made our vacation....no waiting in any lines except for Forbidden Journey and Rip Ride Rocket. The hotel itself is amazingly themed and we are still singing rock songs a week after getting home. Pool area is outstanding with lots to do every night...there is a DJ, contests, movies...food was pricey so the club level really came in handy. Loved the Kitchen breakfast buffet, too! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: sgruver1
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 1 night in Aug 2010. We were here to see Harry Potter and wanted to be guaranteed entry as we were in Orlando for only 1 day. The hotel is quite stunning. The property is gorgeous and the lobby is beautiful. There are marble floors, a huge seating area with leather arm chairs and sofas that overlooks the pool area through an entire wall of glass and french doors. There is loud rock n roll music that plays in the lobby and in the elevators 24 hrs a day, but you can't hear it in the rooms. We were given a room on the 1st floor facing the pool area. There is music played by the pool from morning until later in the evening and that can be easily heard in our room. There is no outside access from the rooms, no patio or balcony so there are no windows or doors, but you can still hear the music. The room itself is very nice, quite spacious, flat screen tv, comfortable beds, large table and chairs. The only problem during our brief stay was that about 2:30am, apparently some type of alarm was activated. We never found out if it was just our wing or the entire hotel. An announcement came over the speaker in our room that stated, "Attention guests!an alarm has been activated, please remain calm. Stay near the speaker for further instructions." We didn't know what to do. It kept buzzing and repeating the announcement. We looked out in the hallway but there was no one from the hotel around, just other guests also looking out. We all looked at one another, shrugged our shoulders and went back inside our rooms. There was no smoke or odor or hint of an emergency. The announcement repeated itself for approximately 10 min and then stopped. My wife started packing some things in case we had to evacuate. We decided to lay back down and see what happened. Just as we were falling asleep again, the announcement began again. Again we looked out, nothing. There was no further information forthcoming. No more announcements or phone call from the hotel. Nothing. The next morning during check out we asked what happened and the front desk rep said an alarm began to go off randomly and they were investigating the cause. For our inconvenience, they offered us free drink coupons (alcoholic or non-alcoholic) but as we were leaving, we turned them down. We never had the opportunity to eat in the restaurants or swim in the pool, so we can't comment on those. We did take the boat launch from the hotel to IOA and it was quick and efficient. However for those with handicapped travelers or special needs, note that the boat drops you off in City Walk and it is quite a hike from the dock to the park itself. The only other thing of note about our stay is the price for the parking. The hotel charges you 18.00 for self parking. I agree with others that have reviewed here that say for the price point of this hotel, it is ridiculous to charge your guests parking fees. Oh one last thing, when I was bringing the car around for my family, my wife waited near the valet. She observed a family arrive via shuttle and bell services load their bags onto the cart and store their luggage. Well, they neglected one bag and it sat there for quite a while until my wife pointed it out to the valet. Now I realize that the family whose bag it was should have made sure that all their bags were accounted for, it is easy during the excitement of arrival to overlook something. It is definitely bell services responsibility to make sure all bags are accounted for. Anyone could have walked off with their bag! I don't think there is any excuse for that. This hotel was full of international travelers. I believe it is a reflection of the popularity of the Harry Potter world as that is all everyone was talking about, especially the Brits. Overall this is a beautiful hotel. I would recommend it to travelers with children or teenagers or young adults. If it is just a couple such as my wife and I (in our 40's) or seniors, I would recommend somewhere quieter. Also there were no discounted rooms available at the time of our stay. We could not find a discount anywhere, so we paid $300.00 for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: terri1186
Reviews.Content: I took my children ages 20 and 23 this past weekend primarily to visit the Harry Potter portion at Islands of Adventures. I had read all the reviews and did my research prior to our vacation. I have to say this was definitely one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The management here has done a wonderful job of training the employees on customer service. Yes, it is pricey but this was a once in a lifetime experience and not to be missed. By staying on property, you get to enter the park 1 hour before anyone else. This was what made the trip so special! By 9:00 when the park opened to regular guests, it was packed beyond belief. It did thin out later in the day when we felt ourselves lured back to soak up the atmosphere of the Harry Potter genre once more.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay when visiting Islands of Adventure/Harry Potter”
Reviews.Author: mwellsVenice_CA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after hearing about all the perks â€“ front of line access, early entry to the park, close location, water taxi, the excellent pool with water slide and overall the hotel did not disappoint. Our room was not ready at 6p when we checked in but they gave us free drink passes and upgraded us to a suite when it was ready. We were able to change and put our things in lockers in the gym. Our room was HUGE. The best part was even though we only stayed one night, our hotel key allowed us access the entire next day giving us a chance to leave the park and swim during the hottest time of the day and return in the evening. The Hard Rock pool and bar is excellent and really great for families. Lots of lifeguards and good service. At $670 for one night and entry to the park, it was a bit pricey but not when you take into account the convenience and quality accommodations they provide. I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in top location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: notasmadasafish
Reviews.Content: If considering Universal Studios and the parks will be busy stay here, literally a 10 minute walk to park entrance. Front of line option with room key was invaluable as parks were very busy. Longest wait 10 minutes. Hotel itself very good and great fun: Food - Beach Club and Kitchen Restaurant good quality and friendly service. Rooms - Spacious and good quality Front/Bell desk - Very helpful, particularly when storing bags after checking-out. Rooms not ready when we arrived an hour before check-in but front desk phoned as soon as rooms available as promised Pool - Great, especially for children with lots of entertainment. Water slide ok. Music underwater a waste of time and unless you were beside the speaker it was pointless. Park tip - take advantage of early entry to Harry Potter - the queues otherwise are simply insane! By 11am people were queing just to get into Harry Potter area and were expecting to get in there at 5pm!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessJaney
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for three nights, in between a stay at Disney Pop Century. ALL the staff were brilliant... from valet parking...checking in... to housekeeping.. to the staff in Emack and Bolio's.. the waiters.. and the lifeguards!!! Checking in was quickest that I have ever experienced - no long queues like Disney!! The (pool view) room was spacious, and the beds were so comfortable. I loved the water taxi that you could take to the CityWalk. The only criticism that I have is of the pool, which is really not deep enough to 'swim' in properly. It has a fun waterslide, that the children enjoyed, but I was frustrated by the shallowness of the pool. The really cool benefit of staying on site at Universal is being able to skip the lines with the Express Pass - that is why I chose to stay on site with my two daughters - but I have booked to go back - it was so good!! Can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “3rd time there this year”
Reviews.Author: 3browndogs
Reviews.Content: We love the Hard Rock. The Valet and Bellmen are the best. The location to the park is walking distance, the Palm in the lobby is a great place to eat. We have been going there since they opened. The only issue is the noise level of the guest in the next room if you get a noise neighbor. It is a great place for families

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCabrx
Reviews.Content: Had a deluxe room for a 5 night stay. We were a little apprehensive since we normally get two rooms for the family. The room was huge and allowed us to shower and get ready early every morning without getting in each others way. My daughter usually take over one hour with her hair and makeup and she had her own little "office" to do this in. Rooms were clean, shampoo etc was stocked every day . Staff did not pass you in the hallway without acknowledging you. Convenience to park was second to none with either walking or taking the water taxi. I don't understand, however, why the water taxi captain had to look in the our bags on the way to the park? Had lunch one day around the pool, food was good. Drinks in the Velvet Bar were expensive but having been to Vegas a couple of months earlier, there was no difference.Lots going on around the pool area and the last day it was raining for most of the day so Harry Potter was being shown in the lobby. The only glitch was we were charged for Valet Parking when we self parked ,however, the error was corrected when brought to the front desks attention. Just remember to view your bill when checking out. All being said I would definitely stay at the Hard Rock again so we be in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa630
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a Disney/Universal combo trip and stayed 5 nights at each. I'm so glad we chose Universal as our second destination. What a great and relaxing way to end what could sometimes be a stressful/hot/humid/crowded vacation. The Hard Rock offered a great escape from all of the above. We kept saying that we wish we did all 10 nights there. The service was great. The staff was genuinely friendly and helpful. I was a little hesitant to stay there, thinking that it would be too loud, but everything was perfect. It's within walking distance to the theme parks so we didn't have to wait for transportation (but we often found it tempting to just stay at the resort for the day).

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: MomonMove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hard Rock for 6 days with extended intergenerational family members. Hotel fit perfectly into our needs. Great music throughout. Great service. Express Pass to Universal and location well worth it! Pool could be deeper in areas - coming down the slide you do hit bottom. Drinks on the expensive side. Burgers by poolside excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Everything's great.”
Reviews.Author: Missmyle
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock Hotel is one of the best high class hotels in Orlando. The rooms look great. The pool area is awesome. Underwater music plus live bands playing in the afternoon, then movie time on a big projector screen at night. The food is great and decent in price. Younger adult would definitely love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful start to honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: phiiiiil
Reviews.Content: We booked into the hard rock hotel through expedia. (got 10% quidco and a 15% discount). I contacted the hotel prior to arrival to order the KISS package as we were on our honeymoon. Upon arrival the front desk congratulated us on our honeymoon and upgraded us from a standard pool view to a club 7 room. This was fantastic as we got a free continental breakfast every morning and free soft drinks throughout the day. The staff were always extremely friendly. The added bonus of express passes meant we waited a maximum of 10 minutes for express pass rides. We also went into islands of adventure an hour early and so only queued for 20 mins for the Harry potter ride. overall a wonderful first week of our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: nhjimmyd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so cool and comfortable. It combines a first class hotel experience with a laid back rock-n-roll theme. Some of the museum-like displays around the hotel are worth just wandering around to view. We also loved how close it is to the parks. If we didnâ€™t want to take the 5 minute walk, thereâ€™s a water taxi that drops you off right in the city walk area. We bought our Islands of Adventure tickets right in the lobby and got in an hour early. (Beware! to beat the crowds at Harry Potter, you really need to take advantage of this.) Using our hotel key as a fast pass, we were able to get in all of our rides and have an entire afternoon to relax by the pool. The pool is huge and plays great music both above and below the surface of the water. We recommend eating at the poolside Beach Club. Our lunches there were fantastic! They also do a great job waiting on you poolside. We loved Emack and Bolioâ€™s for ice cream in the afternoon and coffee and bagels in the morning. It is located right on the pool level of the hotel. Each night, we popped into the Velvet Bar (located just off the main lobby) for happy hour before dinner and loved their frozen margaritas. The only down side to our stay was the fitness club. They charged $10 for a visit, the equipment was old and the most of the treadmills were broken. Overall, this is a great hotel and worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mommythek
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel exclusively because of its location, within walking distance of the Universal Parks. We have stayed at Loews properties before and been extremely underwhelmed, so our expectations were not high. That said, the ambiance and decor at the hotel was excellent. The room was perfectly comfortable for our needs, and (as mentioned before) the location can not be beat. The pool was terrific. The restaurants/amenities were some of our favorite national chains but priced very high. This is not a value vacation. In general the "other" parks in Orlando are a lot more fun, but I definitely thought that this hotel itself was better than their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: lydmik
Reviews.Content: The trip started off great at check-in with Amy. She could not have been more friendlier and took care of all our needs. We arrived early in the morning on the Auto Train and headed to the pool since our room was not ready. Amy contacted me at 2:30 and met me to provide me the keys to our room. Plenty of room and having two sinks came in handy. Of course staying on Universal Properties is the big key. The longest we had to wait for any ride was 5 minutes plus on-site property guest can get into the park a lot earlier. Our first day we headed to Islands of Adventures and the gate opened at 7:30 and we went straight to Harry Potter and got on the ride without any wait. Check this place out. You will be very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for $”
Reviews.Author: andrewl3895
Reviews.Content: Issue #1:Requested a club level room on floor 7. Even called to verify request, was told to arrive early so to improve chances of meeting request. Arrived at 1pm to find out that prior night all rooms were booked and would continue to be booked. Hotel knew this when I called to verify but didn't tell me. Issue #2: Room rates near $400/night and we still have to pay $15 parking + TAX? Even on club level rooms? Not good. Issue #3: Club concierge lounge is very small (occupancy of only about 60, I counted). Plastic chairs, small food offerings, and waiters looking for tips. Paid enough, not looking to tip more. Issue #4: Club level rooms are small. Traveling with family meant luggage absolutely everywhere. Issue #5: Vibe of reception area was lacking. I was expecting more high energy, activity, etc in main lobby, didn't feel it. Issue #6: How about printing out a bill and sliding it under door the night before? I didn't receive one and needed to ask at front desk. All in all, poor value for the dollar. Stayed at Portofino (club level) last year and enjoyed it MUCH more. Portofino lounge is much larger, better food, better atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: k1ptravel
Reviews.Content: We've been going here yearly for decades. Rooms are very clean. Sheets/towels are always crisp and very fresh. Love the location close to Universal. Can walk back to the hotel within 10 minutes from anywhere in the park. We love the Palm Restaurant. The Kitchen has really good food with good prices. Always something going on at the hotel but we were still able to go to sleep in quiet well before midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Insects and Insults”
Reviews.Author: venividivinci04
Reviews.Content: Great location, but the second night of our stay my wife was attacked by bedbugs. The hotel responded by having us throw all of our clothing from our suitcases into garbage bags (not laundry bags) to be cleaned. Our new room assignment overlooked the main driveway. It took eight hours for our luggage to be delivered to our new room. During that time our family was unable to retrieve medicines, toiletries, etc. Our complaints to the hotel management were met with hollow apologies, inaction and insinuations that we were fabricating the bug bites to take advantage of them!! Once the exterminator's official report on our room showed "insect infestation," our treatment improved ever so slightly, but not before one manager refused to hear our complaints, turned his back and walked away. If you need a place near Universal and nothing goes wrong with your stay, this is the place for you. If you need any service or help from the management, then the Hard Rock Hotel might be your own private "Island of Adventure."

Reviews.Title: “Fast pass really the only added value.”
Reviews.Author: beastofburdenia
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor the last week of July. There were towels scattered in the hallway as well as crumbs and small debris.
