I really think for $305.00 a night for our room, they would want staff to make sure the property was clean and should have an employee make sure it is. The bathroom door would barley shut with an adult in it~too close to the toliet. The room on average was SMALL but the decor was lovely! Ice cream and a slice of pie with roomservice will set you back $22.00 and there is not a vending machine to be found. There are washers/dryers on this floor for $2.75 but it took me 3 times to dry one load~obviously the dryer was not working. "BIGGS" the valet parking attendant(rate was $22.00 a night)was super nice. Pool is a shallow pool like the deepest is 3'9" so how would you really hear the music under water because there is not a lot of room to swim~more to gather. Slide is nice!

Reviews.Title: “In this case .... buying a suite was worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Tyra
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 ... (3 children, 2 adults) who decided to spend 4 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel Universal Orlando in order to go to Wizarding World of Harry Potter Universal Islands of Adventure. I knew that we needed a suite and that theme park hotels in Orlando are CRAZY expensive ... so i was prepared to pay top dollar. We chose Hard Rock because of its location. It is a 10 minute walk down a beautiful, garden path behind the hotel to the front gate at Universal Studios OR there are constantly running boat taxis (5 minute drive) to Universal Studios/Universal City Walk area). I have been to a few other Hard Rock Hotels before and they are slightly worn & tacky. This one is BEAUTIFUL! A true 4 to 5 star hotel from the exterior facade to the interior lobby to the restaurants, pool area, etc..... Check in was a breeze .... less than 10 minutes. We took the elevator up to the 5th floor and opened the door to our lovely room. We had a Kid's Suite. This consisted of a foyer, then a very large bathroom with separate tub & shower with double sink, then a very large (probabably 18 x 22 ft) living area with a king size bed, fold out couch, dresser & large flat screen TV. Connected to this room was another large bedroom with 2 twin beds, dresser with a flat screen TV & a small kid's dining table with 4 chairs. I think my only 'beef' would be that there is no room for a dining table in the main living room area .... and that presents a bit of a problem when you get room service as you have to sit on the bed or couch to eat. They do kind of nickel and dime you to death a bit ... My youngest (7 years) wanted to stay in the bedroom with her two siblings and so we asked for a roll away bed to be brought up (instead of her sleeping on the pull out couch in our sleeping area) .... We were told that the roll away bed would be $25/a day to rent .... I WAS FLABBERGASTED to say the least. For the amount of money being paid at this hotel per night .... that was ridiculous to me. All in all we were incredibly happy with our stay at this hotel. Not only did our keycards get us free fast pass access so we didn't have to wait in long lines for rides .... but the convenient location sold me completely !!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: hergeEurope
Reviews.Content: Would recommend for visits to Universal. Really close and had lovely stay

Reviews.Title: “nickeled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: colbuck
Reviews.Content: The only good parts are the location and the fast pass that comes with your key card and allows you to skip most lines at Universal Studios. For the rest: rooms are overpriced (we paid around USD 350 per night), food quality at The Kitchen restaurant is below average (yet pricey!), Internet rates outrageous and so is cabana rental at the poolside (USD 160 per day). Health club also requires an admission fee! Service definitely needs some improvements: the concierge was totally unhelpful!

Reviews.Title: “Love Itâ™¥”
Reviews.Author: briannakylie
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock is one of the best hotels I've ever been to! Beds are great, service is great also.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Famous, Touch Of Luxury”
Reviews.Author: KazandtheGang
Reviews.Content: Here we have the Hardrock Hotel at Universal, We stayed a couple of nights in recently June 2010 and many times before. I love this Hotel, which maybe a little pricey compared to lots of others in Orlando, But for those wanting a little luxury or to feel like a star, they have a policy at the Hotel to do exactly that. The Hotel is prestine, and beautifully designed as are the grounds which are very well maintained. The rooms are larger than the average room and decorated with memoribila of rock legeds ie The Beatles.The Pool is stunning and has everything from underwater music, a water slide, a fully serviced outside bar/ reastaurant with waiter service to your lounger so you never have to leave. Here you will get lots of entertainment for adults and kids like Live Music, Hoola competitions etc, surrounded by lushious palms and even sand all very tropical They have an excellent restaurant there called The Kitchen (even if we are not staying at the Hard Rock will still go there to eat) Theres a late night bar The Velvet Lounge, and an Emack and Bolios Ice Creams for the Kids.The BEST reason to stay at this hotel is this, you can use your room key as a fast pass in Universal and Islands of Adventure it is fantastic and worth every penny for that alone No Queing,get straight on your favourite rides!. This is one of three hotels at Universal they are owned by Leows all of them themed and in my opinion prob some of the very best in Orlando believe me I have stayed in many. For those who think its in the pricier bracket but would love to stay heres a tip on a 2 week family vacation with the family it could cost a small fortune as my family has grown its become less affordable, but if you happen to find a more reasonable place to stay you could treat yourself and stay 1 or 2 nights here ie at the end of your stay and get full use out of the parks with the room key acting as your fast pass on those days. My only negative would be car parking charges or valet as you can have either but there is no free parking remember to factor that in when planning. But you don't always need to use your car as the hotel has a boat dock where you can travel free to and from city walk and The Universal Parks. Its definately a favourite place to stay in Florida and lots of fun for Adults and children.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to The Incredible Hulk and no lines! Ever!”
Reviews.Author: LCMORENO
Reviews.Content: The ambiance of the Hotel is adequate and Hard Rock Style. You can see lyrics of Madonna or the Beatles around and lots of memorabilia. Had a Cocktail while waiting for the Check in and My table had Joe Perry's Guitar in it!!! They will give each member of the group a key card in which you can charge all your purchases in the Universal Orlando Resort and they would send all of your items to your room!! Rooms are big enough but for the price you expect bigger. Bathrooms are small too but you can deal with it. Minibar is excellent if you like late snacks. Room service for breakfast or 2-am cocktails, they are always willing to give you the best service. The one thing I hated was that for two days our rooms was really messy (you can figure it out, with a 19 year old and a 21 year old ladies who love shopping) and the housekeeping people NEVER cleaned our room. Talked to the manager, they apologized but it was the same. The pool is awesome, you can rent a Cabana or Stay around it. It has real sand on the sides and places to lay down and relax. You can hear music while underwater with their speakers. Be sure to check out the water slide, we got our 48 year old mom into it and she screamed like there was no tomorrow, really really fun. One more thing, use internet for free in the lobby, good ambiance and FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing for me but would suit young families”
Reviews.Author: sussexfella
Reviews.Content: After a heavy conference in Orlando decided to relax with some collegues for a few days and do the parks (always fun and they were !). Booked Hard Rock Hotel as had previously stayed at the Vegas one and was satsified. To be honest it is not a top end hotel and doesnt sell or pretend it is so would never be my first choice for a true vacation - there are many others in Orlando that fit that bill. It is very much a family hotel (with dogs) - loud, fun and not relaxing and I am sure many will find that appealing. What I did not like was the amount of bugs around - both in and near the pool and in my room (a king suite - sold as a junior suite but to be honest no bigger than a regular marriott hotel room and much smaller than an Embassy Suites suite/room but it is not expensive). Dogs barking at night was an issue and speaking to other guests they found that too however front desk staff seemed genuinely concerened and did try to find out their owners. Beds very cncomfortable and due to the ambient noise very difficult to get quality sleep. I hate being so negative but it just wasnt a hotel I could recommend to firinds that like me require quality and a peaceful trip - however for young couple with kids then great as long as the cleanliness improves. I hope this report comes accross as well balanced and the hotel markets it self to the clientle that would appreciate what it has to offer and not to those seeking relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Wish it had delivered.”
Reviews.Author: jabberaway
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ the Hard rock and were so disappointed with our stay. I had researched and thought this was going to be a great choice but from day 1 we were less than impressed. Andrew C. at the front was an A+ employee who works really hard to make you feel right at home. We chose club level for the upgrades but this is a waste of money. Breakfast was adequate for continental, snacks were not worth bothering, appetizers were the same 4 choices repeated over and over, meatballs one night, mini corn dogs/ corn chips the next, some sort of egg roll, and finally I'm not sure what they were bbq bites? Anyhow each night you were given sweet treats- this is a cookie and something like a stale churro? The beds were terrible and no one slept well not even the teenagers after running in the parks all day. Pool had bugs in it, probably because it rained so hard, which we not only got to see from outside the window, but from inside where it leaked all over the place. Overall the place needs some updating and a good cleaning. Should have stayed @ the Royal Pacific .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beandipshell
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through AAA in February, which included airfare, hotel stay, and theme park tickets. Originally we booked a rental car for the whole week, but later decided we would just use the water taxis at the resort. Overall, this felt like a resort. Our trip was for one full week, and I thoroughly enjoyed myself. The positive thing about this hotel is that everyone was really friendly. We got there at noon, but the rooms were not going to be ready until 3, which I knew from the website. No biggie, they immediately printed out our room keys which are also used as express passes for the theme parks, and they stored our bags until our room was ready. Once in our room, it was really clean, the maids were nice, and the other families at the hotel were all friendly and personable. I went to the pool on two separate occasions and found it to be really full (of course, it's the first week of July), but not overrun with too many unsupervised kids, or rowdy drunk adults. The pool had music playing, there is a cool waterslide, and ping pong tables. For an additional fee you can rent a cabana that has a flat screen TV, but it was just me, so I didn't need that. I read on another review that they thought the pool was dirty, but keep in mind that it did rain briefly every day I was there, so of course, there were some leaves and branches down, but not for long. At night they were showing Harry Potter movies at the pool, which was really cool. Also, the beds were so comfortable. They have down pillows and blanket, which was heavenly, especially after all the walking at the parks. Also, there is a clothes line in the shower that allows you to pull out and put back on your own. After swimming, I was able to rinse the chlorine off my suite and hand dry it before packing it away. Here are the negative things I do have to say. First off, the store on the pool level has coffee, drinks, ice cream and other goodies, but believes me, they are expensive. I bought 2 16 oz diet cokes, 3 snack size bags of chips, and a16 oz. bottled water and it was $16.50. This would cost you no more than $5.00 at any other store. There are mini fridges in the room with snacks, but if you eat from that, they will charge you. Fiji water in the room will cost you $7.00. The other negative thing is that we decided against the rental car because the website says that it is a $15.00 per night charge to park. When we got there, they have a sign posted that it is $22.00 a night. That is ridiculous. They also charged a little over $20.00 for a 3 day pass to use the gym. Overall, I do think that these things should be included in the price of paying for your hotel stay. I really feel like they are squeezing every dime they can out of their guests. My advice if you are going to use the gym, bring your sports bottle from the theme park and fill it up as many times as you would like. The gym offers free (imagine that) ice water with lemon, and also has fresh fruit. Also, take a few pieces of fruit back to your room for later. A few days at a theme park makes you crave a nice banana and apple. I did decide to rent a car for one day, which was very easy to do. The Hertz car rental has a station set up right at the front desk. We rented the car and got away for the day, but we also stopped by Wal-Mart up the street and stocked up on Gatorades, water, and other snacks for the room. We just couldn't afford to stay hydrated at these hotels prices. Bottom line, I saved for this trip, and I knew what we were in for. If you are coming to the resort for a family vacation, just be prepared, and know that you are going to be paying more than you would at your average place, but then again, it is also a lot more fun than staying at home.

Reviews.Title: “E coli food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: jcook3
Reviews.Content: As if paying $11 for a mixed drink, $13/day for parking, and having to listen to horrible bands at the pool wasn't terrible enough, add food poisoning. I write this review in between trips to the bathroom where I am cramping horribly and pooping bright red blood. Allthewhile running a fever thanks either to the unwashed lettuce or undercooked beef on my $12 burger. Needless to say, I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay been in better”
Reviews.Author: Dave361618
Reviews.Content: When we drove into the Hard Rock we were all excited about it's outside appearence and how fancy it looked. We got out the car and were greeted by a bell boy who took our cases, we thought good start. When we went to check in the nightmare began 1. our rooms would not be ready for another 3 hours. 2. our details were not faxed through to the desk form the agency so we had to stand for 1 hour trying to figure out the problem. We sat in the lobby waitng for our rooms so we decided to go a little tour. We went to the pool to find it over crowded. The pool was quite disgusting with dirt and leaves floating around along with dead insects. We eventually got our room to find it smelled of stale cigarettes. The "view" was a dying tree right infron of our window. None the less the staff helped us alot with the missing details information. On their computers it said we were supposed to be booked for 2008 a WHOLE YEAR BEFORE we actually stayed. The location is great and the food is good and where the hotel is is brilliant right next to the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price for the Express Pass to bypass theme park lines at Universal!”
Reviews.Author: Joelfan
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Staff were very polite and accomodating. Pool is nice, a bit on the "shallow side" no deeper than 4 feet which is good for the kids. Water slide at the pool is fun too. There was a DJ there who also got the crowd to play games and have contests. The room was a bit smaller than I had hoped. We had just a standard garden view, but it was clean and adequate. Maid service was excellent as room was always made up by the time we got back from the parks in the evening. Carpet in the hallways(at least on the 5th floor) seemed a bit worn and the laundry room was a bit unkept, but I guess that is being nit-picky. The express pass to bypass the lines at the parks was great! I felt like I was getting away with something just walking onto the rides or maybe waiting 10 minutes at most. Unfortunately they can't be used for Harry Potter's Forbidden Journey (Islands of Adventure) and the newest roller coaster (Universal Studios). We did take advantage of going to the park 1 hour early for hotel guests before the public is admitted. We waited for the Harry Potter ride maybe 5 to 10 minutes at most and rode it 3 times before 8:20am. That alone was worth the price of the hotel as I had heard horror stories of people waiting hours for the ride. One side note about the Harry Potter section of Islands of Adventure. If you are looking to get your kids into Ollivander's Wand shop, think twice. My kids really wanted wands and to have the "experience" of the wand choosing them. When we found the wand shop the line was 1 hour and 40 minutes long. The employee at the end of the line told us that only 20 people are admitted at a time and only 1 of the 20 get chosen for the "wand experience". Needless to say, we didn't do it. My kids were a bit disappointed but they moved on. I think maybe Universal could have come up with a better way to do that so that everyone gets a chance. Anyway, back on subject of the hotel. It was very cool with alot of rock and roll memorabelia, clean, great staff etc .....a bit pricey but as I said, that was worth it to bypass the lines and ride the Harry Potter ride so quickly. My only complaint is the $15 a day plus tax to park your car. With the amount you pay for the room I think that is a bit of a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again and I come to Orlando many times a year!”
Reviews.Author: happymommy35
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel has gone downhill... Its not even close to worth the money... beware the 'skip the lines' passes they promote... read the fine print... NEW rides are not incuded.. which was the entire point of me agreeing the spend over 300 bucks a night on a room with no free internet or anything and I donot even mind the 22 valet parking or 15 self parking charges... just gie me my skip the line option like you promote - for all rides instead of expecting me to KNOW when I book and tell res agent my plan and she does not interject I am not able to do so for new rides... what a bunch of crap... its like a bait scam!. They also say 'dive in movies' on certain nights - not happening as advertised...even though its sold out this week - (I assume Iamone of MANY who reserved their roomhoping to get skip the lines for harry potter... I even was excited about this to reservations agent who never told me the room key skip the line would not work for tat attraction... you tell people here(employees) and they sayits that way for all new rides... OH well excuse me for not knowing that - its not told to me when I book how would I know that exactly? Basially. they suck you in then rip you off.. I will never stay here again... its a total rip off (and I do not mind spending money on outstanding service- but the real deal is not ever clairifed until you check in and give your cc info.) I woud rather spend 500 bucks on a disney hotel.. or downgrade my hotel for under200 a night an go where I am not misled. ..

Reviews.Title: “Best Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoDisney
Reviews.Content: Nice enviroment, great restaurant, VIP Lounge for Velvet Sections once a month, Best Valet Service in America!!!! Awesome Concierge... ask for Mrs Bethany!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: nikkig973
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night to take advantage of the FOTL passes. We arrived at about 8.30am and they had a garden view room ready for us we headed to the room just to drop the bags off and we were very impressed the beds were huge and everything was spotless. We headed to Universal and came back at 4pm where we sat by the awesome pool drinking and chilling and listening to the music and the entertainer which my son thought was great! The pool staff were always on the go making sure you have everything you need (they add 18% on for all orders but worth every penny!) The pool area has plenty of beds and shade areas if you want and you can also hire cabanas but not sure for how much. We ate in the Kitchen that night and the food was delicious huge portions and not badly priced! The staff were very knowledgable and friendly We all slept like a dream and the next morning we headed out to WWOHP as we had access there for the morning as guests of HRH which was great, the boats were regular and it was a short journey to get to city walk That evening we ate by the pool and again the food was delicious plenty of choice for a bar menu and again huge portions Absolutely loved the HRH and next time we visit Orlando we will be booking a longer stay at HRH we were disappointed to have to head back to our disney hotel to be honest! Highly recommend this hotel do not hesitate you wont regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality, service, fun”
Reviews.Author: EmmyAsh
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the HRH in Orlando, this time only 5 nights. Chose to visit only the Universal Parks as well as Seaworld and Aquatica, which meant no transportation/taxis required as there is a free shuttle bus to Seaworld/Wet n' Wild/Aquatica daily. Note - book this the day before at the Attraction Tickets desk, we saw several people turned away, and be careful as it leaves very promptly. Easy check in, given a free Backstage Pass that was used for free gym access. Room on the 6th floor at the very end of the corridor as requested for maximum quietness. Room fresh and spotlessly clean with lovely view out over the garden, and very quiet, we heard no noise from other rooms or the corridor the entire stay (6135). Spent the first evening at Islands of Adventure on all our favourite rides again - can't miss Hulk, Spiderman, Dudley Do Right, JP, Bilge-Rat Barges, Fire & Ice. Next two days spent at Un. Studios, then at Islands again. Thoroughly recommend Rip Ride Rockit, the Mummy, Simpsons for the more adventurous, as well as the Horror Make Up show for a real laugh and breather from the heat. Breakfasts either in the kitchen - go for the buffet if you are having juice and coffee anyway, or a muffin and banana from the coffee shop. Room coffee machines very nice too. I also recommend the Kitchen for evening meals, but don't fill up on the delicious cheesy bread because the portions are enormous. Incredibly friendly wait staff, especially Emily. Never ate at the beach club, although one lazy afternoon lying by the pool I watched a parade of enormous looking dishes and frozen drinks going past. Pool wait service is also really friendly. Watch out for the Hurricane cocktails, they are lethal. Evenings spent with cocktails, wrapped up in warm towels watching a dive in movie always fun. Didn't go in the pool or hot tubs this time, but remember them being great. Free boat service to City Walk prompt and friendly as ever, but no longer between hotels, only direct to City Walk and back so any trips over to the Portofino (recommend eating at Mama Della's) or the Royal Pacific require a bike taxi or a City Walk stop off. If you get a chance ask the concierge for a guide to all the rock/pop memorabilia in the hotel, they can provide you with a print out that shows the location and histoy of everything. Would absolutely recommend this hotel for anybody wanting to visit Universal Studios or Seaworld, the front of line access is invaluable, and means you can ride several times in a row quickly. The only main rides not currently accepting this are the Rip Ride Rocket and Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey and I recommend using the single riders queue for both of these to get on 10 times faster. There is no better feeling than racing past the normal queue. In conclusion this hotel is so cool even the fountains wear sunglasses.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to enjoy Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: KearneyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This year we chose the right hotel at Universal - Hard Rock! Last time we stayed at Portofino, which is great but not really teen friendly. We stayed in concierge rooms and everything was awesome. I don't think the rooms are any different from the regular rooms, you just get access to the concierge lounge for complimentary food and drinks. We did get connecting rooms but I called several months in advance to request them when I made the reservation. I was told that the best bet for connecting rooms is to ask for both rooms with 2 queens. For breakfast it was pretty standard continental breakfast- bagels, rolls, fruit, etc. The evening cocktail time was GREAT with hot appetizers and beer and wine. One night we had Mexican theme with nachos and southwest egg rolls as well as veggies, salad and cheese plates. The next night was American night with really good chicken wings (add your own sauce so they were kid friendly) and mini corn dogs. They have a sign that says 2 drinks per person but we found out that meant for each time you visit the bar - you can drink all that you like. Honestly we ate our dinner in the lounge each night. The hotel has a great pool and is so close to walk to the parks. Also, if you stay here you get Express passes with your room charge to bypass the ride lines. The week we stayed, the new Harry Potter was not open to the general public- but as guests at Hard Rock we got to experience the area (and it was awesome!!) Highly recommend this hotel, especially if you are young at heart, have teenagers with you or have grown up in the rock 'n roll era.

Reviews.Title: “does what it says on the tin.”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamSpidercat
Reviews.Content: arrived at 3-30 pm, having parked car in car park, flight of steps up to reception, but otherwise close, check in very efficient and friendly, room not ready so they took mobile no and called me when it was (4pm). Room spotless and as prev detailed by other people. Easy stroll , water taxi or bicycle taxi (no charge, but pay fair tip as unwaged) to city walk and parks. Pool clean and large, plenty of towels/sun loungers etc, no where deep though and kids (aged 10 and 15) were underwhelmed by slide. kids easily made friends by pool to plat volley ball etc. Free wifi in lobby, relatively quick, occasionally reached as far as room despite being at furthest point (albeit on ground level). No issues with room cleaning, always done by the time we returned (as early as 3:30 for pool one day), coffees etc restocked by our favourites and extras of these left. Didn't do buffet breakfast, but tended to but doughnuts/ muffins or little cereal bowls and milk from concession in hotel and eat in room with room coffee etc. Ate in kitchen 1 night, and pool bar one night, beware huge portions esp salads. Room key invaluable in parks, walked straight on everything, whick kids thought was just great. Room key also let you in and out of car park, and I was never charged for parking which was an added bonus (? glitch with card as wouldn't work elsewhere to charge things to either).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place for a Night in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: BeccaSmith_79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after a concert at the Hard Rock Cafe. The room was great - a little view of City walk, super nice decor, iPod docking station, plenty of towels and soap, SUPER comfy bed (a big one for me since I love my tempurpedic!), and I could go on. It was also VERY clean. This is another biggie for me...I had one bad experience in a MD hotel and always check the sheets and bathroom before I settle in. Anyway, this room was impeccable. It wasn't a very big room, but just what the two of us needed after a night of dancing. We ordered a room service pizza, and it was delicious, and quick:) A MAJOR plus was the location to City Walk. It was a short (maybe 5 minute, if that) walk to the main attractions. It was well lit and meandered through a garden next to a little river/stream. The pool looked impressive from a distance, but I didn't have time to check it out in person. The hotel certainly had that commercial Hard Rock feel, and music blasting everywhere...overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with excellent standards and facilities but...”
Reviews.Author: TheHotelInspector1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a week at the Hard Rock Hotel in May 2010 and overall we were really impressed with the service and facilities at the Hotel which were excellent. We did have a few little grumbles during our stay but these were sorted out to our satisfaction although perhaps they could have been avoided. We arrived at the Hotel by coach and as a result, we were dropped off at the side by the valet car parking area which is some distance from the main reception. It was a bit of a struggle and we were disappointed that when we reached the entrance, none of the bell staff appeared to have the slightest interest in offering us any assistance! Check-in itself however was an absolute breeze. We were dealt with extremely efficiently by a very professional agent who supplied us with all the relevant information about the Hotel and genuinely appeared only too happy to answer the many questions I posed. Usually check in staff at Hotels are like robots and see customers as an inconvenience so his approach was really refreshing and very much appreciated. We made the way to our room which was on the 5th floor and sadly we had been allocated a room which was at the furthest point from the elevator which was annoying so in retrospect, I wish I had approached the disinterested bell staff!! The room itself was nice- being clean and comfortable with nice furnishings and fittings. It contained a flatscreen tv (with a wide choice of channels and pay movies), a cd player, a clock radio with i-phone dock, mini bar, safe (which was very small!), iron and board, and a nice bath with shower and separate sinks with a wide range of toiletries. As is the norm, we were supplied with the usual 5 hangers for 2 people for a weeks stay so we took the opportunity of asking a nearby housekeeper for more hangers. Unfortunately she spoke very limited english and summoned a friend who spoke even less english than she did. Another housekeeper was then called and after appearing to understand our request, knocked on our door 5 minutes later and told us to ring Housekeeping for the extra hangers which really was annoying and frustrating. We made the call and were brought an extra 6 hangers about 20 minutes later by the same person we had asked initially!!! We then had a look round the Hotel and were really impressed with all the services on offer. The pool area was really elegant with a wide range of areas to sit and relax which were spotlessly clean and inviting. It is sad that we spent such little time at the Hotel so did not use any of these excellent facilities. Whilst at the Hotel, we utilised the concierge on numerous occasions which on the whole was excellent although a couple of the staff appeared a little disinterested. A special mention to John however who was a consumate professional - an expert in his field who gave us loads of help and assistance and was dedicated to ensuring we got the most out of our stay in Orlando. We really liked Universal and the fast pass entrance with our room key to most of the rides was great although the parks were not really that busy. The river taxi from the Hotel was enjoyable as was the walk through the gardens to the parks. Again, with our busy schedule, we only spent one day at Universal/Islands of Adventure so in future we may opt to choose a Disney Resort Hotel purely because we spent the remaining time at the Disney attractions. On one particular day, we left the Hotel at 7am and returned at 11.30pm to find that our room had not been serviced at all which was very annoying and just not good enough. We rang Housekeeping and were advised that someone would service the room. In the interim, we waited in the reception area as we were both really tired after such a long day! I approached reception to make a formal complaint and whilst my concerns were dealt with, the guy who was dealing with it seemed very "un-phased" about it - almost like it was a regular thing. I told him I was still not satisfied and he gave me 2 vouchers for a free breakfast buffet which was appreciated but I felt they were only given as a last resort. When we returned to the room it had been "serviced" but to a very poor standard. The bins had not been emptied and the room was untidy and dusty but on reflection, speed was probably the key to addressing the problem. Whilst on the subject of housekeeping, I left notes regarding the broken lock on the minibar, the bulb on the bedside light needing replacement and the water being lukewarm most of the time but they were just ignored which again was disappointing. We were also frustrated that the mini-bar was only serviced once throughout our entire stay despite us requesting it! I suppose this is a good thing really as the price of all mini-bar items is rather excessive! The following morning was another early start so I took the opportunity of asking at reception for someone to check the room was serviced. The lady was very professional being sincerely apologetic for the inconvenience and genuinely concerned that the event had even occurred. It is worth mentioning that most of the staff are relatively young and one wonders how equipped they are in terms of experience/maturity to deal with any serious compalints! We ate dinner at the Hotel's restaurant "The Kitchen" which was good although nothing outstanding. The food itself was good and the service was reasonable although sometimes we feel that staff think the Brits do not know how to tip and as a result give a second rate service. This however was not true at "The Palm" restaurant were the service was absolutely outstanding and totally first class. Although the service was superb, we were not overly impressed with the food on this occasion which we thought was over-priced and nothing special. The complimentary breakfast we received (at "The Kitchen") was really nice and the service too was excellent - it is sad that we only chose to take breakfast on our last day as we may have considered taking breakfast every day had we known how good it was. On leaving the Hotel, the checkout process was very efficient and highly professional. On balance the Hotel was very good although there were a few frustrations along the way that with a little more attention to detail could be rectified with great ease. I would definitely recommend this Hotel although if you intend to do all the Disney parks, it is quite a distance away and in my opinion Downtown Disney has much more to offer than Universal's City Walk. A special mention about Mears Transport - they were absolutely fantastic and we would have been lost without them. Always on time, always with very courteous and helpful drivers and excellent customer service at all times - 10 out of 10 for Mears!

Reviews.Title: “Universal Approval From Our Family of Five”
Reviews.Author: mikepdews
Reviews.Content: Having been talked into a flight of over 8 hours (sorry I really hate flying) as it was my partners 40th birthday request ("no big parties please just take me and the kids to Disney") we decided on the Hard Rock as our hotel of choice. My family consists of my partner 40, myself 52 and three girls of 15, 12 and 10. Overall we have no real complaints about this hotel as the location and the pool are great. However, there was a layer of dust on the furniture in our room on arrival and I can't say we were over impressed with room service throughout our stay. A caricature picture my daughter had specially drawn somehow managed to get all screwed up by maid service. The other feature of this hotel is its great proximity to the Universal theme parks and the fact that you get fast track access at Universal which is a great perk and a real must if you go in the school holidays. This will spoil you though when you venture to Disney and beware Universal is some way from Disney - if you don't hire a car (we didn't) then it's a $40 cab ride each way. There is a boat that takes you to Universal from the hotel grounds although you can also walk it in around 5 minutes as well. The only negative aspects of this hotel in our opinion are breakfast is quite pricey for a family of 5 (great selection mind you) and our 15 year old was granted adult status here (always amazes me that kids can't vote, drink etc but they are classed as adults by travel companies//hotels from around the age of 11!) and the concierge obviously has an agreement with the cab firms as when we asked how to get somewhere via the Lynx bus we were given the most awkward route possible, probably in the hope that we wouldn't use the bus again. The hotel also operates a shuttle service bus (once daily and you need to get in quickly as it only holds 70 people) to Seaworld, Aquatica and Wet N Wild which we used regularly. The last thing to mention is that Americans do frequent the hotel at weekends and most come for special occasions like birthdays, hen and stag parties and we were all kept awake one Saturday night by a particularly raucous bunch. To be fair that is not the hotels fault and they did have security deal with it, once I could find someone covering the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sueshaz
Reviews.Content: After a delayed start to our stay (we were relocated to a nearby hotel for our first night) we were upgraded to a Club Level room which proved to be a great package - club lounge, continental breakfast, evening snacks and drinks. If we return I would definitely consider paying the extra for the Club level. The pool area has good facilities showing 'dive-in' movies during the evening. Universal, City Walk and Islands of Adventure are only a short walk or boat ride from the hotel. We took full advantage of the express pass perk that came with your room key which enabled us to skip the queues for most of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - staying here is a must”
Reviews.Author: 10traveltheworld10
Reviews.Content: A perfect location when visiting Disneyworld and Universal Studios. It's a short walk or a few mins boat ride across the water into the Resorts. Hotel is immaculate, relaxing atmosphere, great facilities, pool area with towels provided. Great for kids and adults

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: naback
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hard Rock Orlando. the hotel and grounds were beautiful. It took all of 5 minutes to walk to Universal. The staff went out of their way. A little pricey but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Queencapricorn22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after changing hotels. The staff was pleasant and check-in was easy. They even asked if I preferred to stay on a specific floor. The rooms were clean and spacious. The sinks were clogged for some reason but when I asked for housekeeping to come and fix them, the engineer arrived in less that 5 minutes. I loved staying at this hotel!! It is on the ground of Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. The water taxi was even enjoyable. The down side is that we paid $60 just for parking alone but will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel be careful with the transfers they offer though”
Reviews.Author: Feilser
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 4 days of our hneymoon there just a couple of weeks ago. Really great service, lovely touches here and there and the food is top notch if a bit expensive (coming from Ireland that is saying a lot!). Great music played all the time and saw a couple or great live performances. They also sent a bottle of champagne to our room as a congratulatary present. If anyone is transferring to cape canavral for a cruise don't get the mears group this hotel recommend, the consierge told us it would cost us $170 each when you can get there from Orlando airport for $36 dollars each. Total rip off so just be carefull of that. Would definately recommend this hotel though. Rock music lovers paradice. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Universal trip”
Reviews.Author: DenaVecchetti
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! the staff were great willing to help with anything we asked for. we did not have the opportunity to use the pool due to the weather. The location was perfect we were close enough to walk to so much.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: j_mac8080
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel at Universal Studios is AWESOME! My husband and I took a chance as a walk in and were able to get a King Suite for only $144 a night! I was surprised because online it was like $250. So of course we took the room :) This place is beautiful & classy and spare no expense to make the customers happy! Our room was very spacious and CLEAN!! One of the best perks about staying at Universal Studios is the Express pass for the parks. You go to the front of the line! It was awesome and so worth it! We will be staying there again the next time we go to Universal Studios!

Reviews.Title: “Standards have slipped!”
Reviews.Author: Family_JDD
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the HR Hotel in Orlando. The first trip in 2007 was faultless. Have to admit I found standards had slipped a bit this time around. Firstly - Housekeeping - they really did the bare minimum, the room was quite thick with dust in areas. Although beds were made and towels changed, I dont think anything else was done. I didn't find the staff as helpful, attentive or friendly this time around. If you weren't paying for valet parking, the guys at the front were really not even interested in looking in your direction. The breakfast buffet in the Kitchen seems to have dramatically increased in price, yet the quality of the food wasn't as good, tasted like it was reheated. Dinner in the Kitchen was average at best. Room service food same. Things are ridiculously expensive. Bottle of water in your room $7 + tax!! Parking fees ridiculous! Beside all that - the location is perfect, the pool scene is superb. The Fastpass a wonderful bonus, the water taxi a great way to get to the parks. I dont want to sound mean about it but for the price it was not as perfect as it should be - certainly wasnt as perfect as 3 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kristylee3
Reviews.Content: Just got back this afternoon from our stay at Universal Studio's Hard Rock Hotel. I was a bit skeptical about staying here after reading all of the negative reviews. I am so glad we stayed there. The staff was pleasant and very helpful. The room was clean. The staff made the beds and replaced the towels daily but at different times each day. One day the room was cleaned around 5 PM and the next day it was cleaned at noon., This sort of thing does not bother us though and we ended up having to ask for towels on the day they cleaned it late. To me it was no big deal. The hotel is a short walk to Universal Studios 2 theme parks and City Walk. The pool and sandy beach area are great. We ate the breakfast buffet at the Kitchen only once, as it was very expensive. We enjoyed Emack and Bolio's ice cream a couple of the days. I liked that the gift shop opened early and remained open until late at night so we could purchase water and snacks. The food is very expensive at the hotel as it is in the parks. We ended up spending over the budgeted vacation amount due to this expense. The hotel lobby played rock music all day and night. Our room was very close to the lobby and we couldn't hear the music. Our room overlooked the pool. The pool also played music until around 10 PM. If you like hard rock music and like a laid back atmosphere then you would enjoy this place.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin hotel - perfect location right next to Universal”
Reviews.Author: jcv1234mass
Reviews.Content: Two families - 6 teenaged girls - one night/two days -what a great time! Less than 5 minute walk to Universal, 10 minutes to Islands of Adventure. 5 minutes to Citywalk. Great pool area with sandy beach & beach volleyball & nice bar/restaurant & poolside service. Music playing everywhere so don't stay here if you don't like rock & roll. Nice adult only bar (we really appreciated after 3 days in Disney with the kids)- Velvet Bar. Ate at The Kitchen - pretty good higher end restaurant. Starbucks & ice cream place on site too. My only complaint would be that the wireless isn't free in the rooms. With 10 people there were 8 laptops @ $10/day. Kids dragged their laptops to the lobby for the evening instead. One other good thing- with your room key you cut the lines to most of the good rides at both parks. We walked by hundreds of people. Well worth staying on site.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Portofino Bay close to...”
Reviews.Author: EiboNewbury
Reviews.Content: Just like Portofino Bay close to Universal and great perk of the free fast pass . Our king suite on the Club level was also nice if a little small to be classed as a suite. The ambience in the lobby is loud and aimed at teenagers but it's well done . However that's where the good stuff ends. Car park, there is a self park area that is not big enough to accomodate all guests thus pushing you toward valet at extra cost. Not only this but to access the hotel from this car park you have to carry your luggage up a huge flight of stairs, no elevator! Having had to wait 20 mins for a car park space we weren't inclined to lose it by driving up to front of hotel to unload. The Club Lounge , oh dear, like feeding time at the zoo, appreciate that's down to the guests and not the hotel , but it is awful. Kids and adults alike falling like vultures on the buffet snacks . Pool beds are poor quality not like the Portofino at all , and again pool area is very crowded. Reception staff were pefunctory at best both on check in and check out. We originally booked 3 nights as we are stranded due to volcanic ash, but checked out after one and they didn't even ask us why! And while we appreciate high mini bar prices , paying $6 for a bottle of water in the hotel shop was just too much! Never again !

Reviews.Title: “Despite a checking in situation, we liked our stay”
Reviews.Author: conradbaines
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The theme is cool, it is close to the park (really short walk), and there is a really good restaurant in it (The Palm). But there was a problem with checking in. We got there at 10 AM and they told us our room won't be ready until 4. Thats fine, but then we got back from the park at 4:30 and our room wasn't ready. They were cleaning up an accident someone had the night before, and we tried to get another room, but none were available on the club level, so we got a room on the sixth floor but we could use all of the club level stuff. Everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: dollygirloc
Reviews.Content: this vacation was to be our BIG family vacation. We decided to stay at the Hard Rock, with the name, we thought it would be wonderful. First, our room was supposed to be ready by 4pm, and still did not have our room at 7pm. They gave us an "upgrade" to a king suite, which would be great for a couple, but my husband and son had to sleep on a VERY uncomfortable roll-out couch. Our stay was four nights, they made us move to our original reserved room on the fourth night, which was inconvenient, but more comfortable with two queens. The staff was nice, but still when spending the money, I would have expected better efficiency. BTW, the fitness room is an additional cost, which I didn't know. The pool was beautiful, but be careful when upgrading to a poolview room as we did. Some of the poolviews are blocked by the palm trees. Garden view would have been fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Universal Studios & Islands of Adventure. Fun, clean and no complaints about the service.”
Reviews.Author: HelenLikesNiceHotels
Reviews.Content: We actually won a holiday to the Hard Rock Hotel - we had two adjoining Garden Rooms, each of which had 2 queen beds. We were on the 6th floor at the end of a corridor, which meant our room was quiet. If you want to avoid other noisy residents I would strongly recommend you get a room at the end of a corridor! The pool facilities were lots of fun and we spent a couple of hours every afternoon by the pool. The food is pretty expensive, as are the cocktails, but the ice cream (3 HUGE scoops for $5 with a huge variety of flavours) seemed like good value. You can't walk anywhere from the Hard Rock Hotel. Literally. We tried to walk to International Boulevard but there's just no pavements and it's physically impossible. So we found that slightly frustrating. Friendly, clean, fun Hotel. We had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “S/B 3 star rating; convenient location with Express Pass for Universal Parks”
Reviews.Author: SingleMomNYC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at some top hotels and I would not rank Hard Rock Orlando in the 4-star category. The bathroom was a C quality on cleanliness; overall room tidiness and daily cleaning was a D. The bath towels were so hard that it was like getting a daily exfoliation! Evening room service food was horrible...food arrived only lukewarm. Mini bar prices are outrageous. Limited restaurants--only one hotel restaurant, The Kitchen and then The Palm. I don't count the poolside eatery as a restaurant. Food was average--I'm from NYC so I have high expectations when it comes to food. Not a lot of healthy choices either. Service was so-so until I actually complained, then they livened up a bit. There is no general sundry store to buy simple toiletry items such as toothpaste, Advil/Tylenol, etc. The big plus is that it is a 5 minute walk to the Universal Parks with Express Pass use with your hotel key. Other pluses were nice pool layout, nice slide for kids, decent poolside wait service (they want you to drink!), evening poolside entertainment, general ambience of the hotel/lively vibe. If you want a quiet vacation DON'T go to Hard Rock. And if you're looking for an immaculate clean room don't go to Hard Rock. All said, I would still recommend if the point of your trip is Universal Orlando theme parks. If the parks aren't your focal point, skip Hard Rock and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very sharp and appropriate for Florida!!”
Reviews.Author: dannat14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite different that your average stay. I went for a casual time with family, and we were able to reach the parks in literally minutes. Great food; The Kitchen (I believe that's what it was called) served a terrific breakfast, and an elegant dinner (although I only ate dinner there once). In terms of the room, it was adequate in size, comfy beds, large flat screen TV, clean bathroom with ample supply of towels (& pillows) and a great view of the beach pool- especially in the morning. While on the subject, might I add how great the beach and pool located directly in the front of the hotel was?! Very casual, but formally rocking hotel! Big fan of 60s Rock and Roll, so seeing various guitares from Eric Clapton and the Beatles, and passing by Elvis' platinum albums mounted on the walls were simply out of this world. Loved scolling in the late evening along the pool, and playing billiards or ping pong in the gaming room. Quick walking distance to Downtown, Islands of Adventure and Univeral Studios Parks. Truely remarkable! There is no doubt I will go back here is the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time! Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: devy69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is first class all the way. There is ongoing entertainment out at the pool that involves everyone that cares to get involved. There is a water slide enjoyed by all ages. The pool is grade level entry and one cool feature is the underwater speakers in the pool. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and comfortable. The only drawback is the cost of staying here. It is very pricey and we felt we were a little out of our league. For us it was a one time adventure and I'd recommend it to anyone that is able to afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Express Pass”
Reviews.Author: CT5kids
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for 3 nights 2/15-17, 2010.......this pretty hotel reommended to us by friends with teens for its location (walked to Universal in 5 min) and express passes for the studio rides. We had a deluxe room on the ground floor across from the pool. As it was 45-50 degrees, no pool noise. Plusses: location. Parking and walking to the Universal studio and coming back mid day was easy. Express tix a must; even on the cold breezy days we visited, there were long lines on every attraction. . With our hotel key, we never waited more than 10 min and saw all the attractions at both studios in one day (9am to 6pm) each. We had a deluxe room with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa. Room clean and spacious with sink strategically outside the WC. Very nice pool which the kids used as it was heated to 88 degrees. Problems: no housekeeping day 1 (we callled for maid service), poor sink lighting; broken toilet handle (my husband "fixed" it twice); no soda machines (expensive in on-site market that closed by 9 pm), expensive internet, and poor signage....we wandered a bit to find pathway to universal, pool towels, etc). Unable to do auto check out on tv as server "overloaded". The staff, however, was very friendly and The Kitchen restaurant meal was good but pricey (hint: portions huge; we could have fed 5 with 3 entrees). Overall, the almost $400 a night was worth it for us as the express pass would have cost $150 more per day and being on site made up for the minor hassles. I just wish it had the same price as the Marriot Fairfiield Inn it mimicked.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Cheesy.”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: The plus: was the staff, they were outstanding and very kind and went out of their way for everyone.... from front desk to bellmen to concierge people. The down side: The rooms are kind of tacky and worn...most do not have good views and room set up is cramped. Dirty glasses were left in our room....House keeping seemed kind of weak. The club floor is a joke...a cafeteria buffet for those looking to eat a lot of not so good food....loud and full of screaming kids. Over 20 when we walked by. Not what most club levels are about. The food in the hotel was not very healthy...lots of doughy, cheesy, carby, greasy foods. We had a grilled cheese and it came on white doughy bread with a tiny blob of cheese in one corner....looked like the kitchen didn't look at what they were making and didn't care. The walk over to the music venue was lovely. Universal Studios is not really my thing. Kind of Cheesy and tacky. I told my husband we probably will not bring our daughter here when she is old enough...there are too many other places to introduce her to first.

Reviews.Title: “Velvet sessions, for free!”
Reviews.Author: Adaleme
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with good, friendly staff. The communal areas blare excellent old school tunes with loads of TV screens playing the videos. The room was quite spacious, very clean with an ok bathroom. The corridors leading to the room were very well air conditioned to say the least, in fact they were freezing cold. Breakfast was expensive and not brilliant so maybe try it out one day and go elsewhere for the rest of your stay. The pool area was lovely, the pool bar really nice but didn't spend that much time there. The Velvet bar in the hotel was also a great place to chill, must say that on first night the hotel was holding it's monthly rock concert (velvet sessions) and we weren't allowed to enter the bar, had a bit of a moan to the manager and was lead straight in. We were really grateful and must say thank you to the desk manager (didn't get her name) for sorting this out for us. The hotel is part of the Universal complex and you can simply walk to the parks in 5 minutes and also to the City Walk nightlife area. The parks were surprisingly dated, particularly the original park. They were quite empty so didn't have to queue for the rides which was a massive bonus. I also think it's about time to change the Jaws boat ride, it is rubbish! Went to Emerils one evening, a supposed decent restaurant in City Walk, we had the tasting menu, it was overpriced and not very good. Go to Hard Rock Cafe instead, much better value for money. The hotel's fantastic location to Universal means its location to Disney isn't great and as we weren't driving didn't bother going this time, hopefully will get back soon. We did go to Sea World, again quite empty so didn't have to queue for the two fantastic roller coasters, two of my favourite in Orlando. Obviously went to see Shamu, so hearing the shocking news of the death of Dawn Brancheau was awful. We saw her in the show just two weeks ago. I'm sure the show will go on though. Whether you agree with holding these truly magnificent animals in captivity, or not, it is very special to just get the chance to see them. Also went to Busch gardens. An organised coach picked us up at Unversal and it took about 1.5 hours to get there. Once again, it was quiet so no queues. The tigers were a highlight as was the ride called Sheikra. If you like shopping there's a fantastic outlet called Orlando Premium Outlets, the last stop on the I-Drive trolley bus, got loads of stuff from Diesel, Levi, Armani and DKNY with a 75% reduction. The Hard Rock hotel is a decent, clean, friendly hotel that will not disappoint. Have fun! ps, if you're from England get used to being asked for ID when buying a beer or a glass of wine, fantastic for a 34 year old ego

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! This place Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: caitlina88
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando right around Christmas and stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel. It was AMAZING! They have beautiful rooms, a delicious breakfast buffett in the morning, and an awesome pool area. The location is UNBEATABLE; there's a boat shuttle that takes you right to City Walk and Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure. This was one of the coolest hotels I've ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service, Casual and Cool Fun”
Reviews.Author: MaryBeth27
Reviews.Content: We spent our winter break at the Hard Rock Orlando at Universal Studios. From the moment we arrived, everyone was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our room was beautiful, we had a Kid's Suite on the concierge level. The food selections were great and nicely varied. My only question was that no one ever checked that the people using the concierge service were actually paying for it. I suspected that many times teens were hanging out at the elevators, waiting for someone to go to the 7th floor and then partaking in the "goodies" that they had not paid for. The pool was heated (thankfully as it was unseasonably cool) and our boys really enjoyed it. The only weak link seemed to be housekeeping. Our room was consistently not cleaned before 4:00pm so I asked if we could have it cleaned after 9:00am. I was assured this would happen, but the next day, at 12:30pm when we arrived back at our room, it was not done. I called and within 15 minutes someone came to clean the room but did not do a very thorough job. The next day our room was cleaned at the time we had requested. The only other disappointment occurred when we found out that we could not order a movie because they were updating their HD system. This was really inconvenient as it was cold and we really didn't want to bundle up and head to City Walk when it was 40 degrees!!!!! However, in all, it was a great vacation. We all enjoyed the leisurely walk to the parks, the Rock Shop, and the food, including the ice cream at Emack and Bolio's.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: jerseylion
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hard Rock on our way to Ft. Lauderdale...Pretty nice place... The room was comfortable and clean...We were disappointed when there was not a refrigerator for us to use...It was the kind you had to buy the beverages and it was locked...We had the room with the view of the waterway...which was very nice..My hubby got to see the shuttle go up in the horizon from our window..It was the perfect spot to see this at 4:00 AM...We ate in the Restaurant The Kitchen...very enjoyable...We had 2 delicious meals...Waiters were a friendly bunch...They had a magician for the kids, even though we didn't have kids, but it was fun to watch...A little pricey hotel but close to Universal Studios...The Water Taxi took you back and forth to the parks and the City Walk with no charge...About the parking...We stayed at 4 hotels in Florida and 3 of them were paid parking for every day you stayed....Hard Rock was one of them...

Reviews.Title: “Expensive - be aware of hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: Gallimac74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and would definetly not stay again, our room rate was $234 per night without breakfast by the time we paid tax and car parking, internet connection it ended up $309 per night. The fitness centre was extra as well as the kids club ($80 per night per child) we have 3 children so there was no chance we were paying $240 per night for the kids to enjoy themselves. Everything there was expensive, which I suppose would be ok if the rooms etc were worth it. the receptionist did not smile once whilst checking us in. All the other staff were quiet indifferent to us as they would rather talk to their collegues....all except one bell boy he was lovely. I thought it would be a nice treat for us for the end of our holiday, I was sadly mistaken. I would recommend staying at another hotel and buying fast passes to anyone who wants the benefit of skipping the que.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for rock addicted”
Reviews.Author: EmanueleVicentini
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hard Rock hotel for 4 nights in february 2010. Room quite spacious and cleaned, few amenities in the bathroom but ok. Alle the staff was very very kind and at my disposal anytime. In the lobby there is free wi-fi service, a good plus. The workout room is cheap and well furnished with 5 tapis roulants and other cardio nd weight machines. The pool is really amazing. In a very walkable distance you could enjoy two of the best park in the city: Islands of Adventures and Universal Studios. Is quite far from downtown Orlando, ypu have to consider it if you travel for business purposes. I recommend it, especially for rock addicted!

Reviews.Title: “So, So”
Reviews.Author: msher5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night of fun to celebrate a 50th Birthday. Rooms shabby, Could stand some updating. Comforter on bed felt like it was full of marbles (no exaggeration, the down had been washed so much and it was like it was full of hundreds of different sized pebbles--completely ruined.) I made 2 calls to have it exchanged at 5pm and at 11pm but got no response. The following morning, I called the housekeeping supervisor, he showed up and did apologize, saying, "Well at least you know it's clean". I think we could have found something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “the ultimate chill hotel with 5* service”
Reviews.Author: chris09Cheshire
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hard rock for 3 nights after staying at animal kingdom lodge. we didnt want to leave animal kingdom lodge but when we arrived at hard rock it blew us away. ive never been to a new hotel and felt instantly relaxed like i did there. its like you walk through the door and someone hypnotises you, clicks there fingers and says 'and relax'. it is just so chilled out. this hotel wouldnt suite everyone. i can imagine some people being put off when theyre checked in by a guy with tattoos and a big hole in his ear, who welcomes you with 'hey man hows it going' . but that is the hard rock policy 'love all serve all'. it doesnt matter what you look like so long as your a nice person. and if you remember that you soon realise the staff are absolutely 1st class and ultimate proffesionals in what they do. and some of the nicest people we've met on any of our vacations. in fact the staff are a big reason for our return in the future. especially in the velvet bar where we spent 3 really great nights. the hotel itself is so cool. we were there at the end of september and it was really quiet so we had no problem get loungers on the sandy beach. this is a great time to go if you get lucky with the weather like we did. we stayed in a club level room which is well worth the money. free food and drinks in the club lounge which again at that time of year wasnt busy at all. the rooms were a nice size and housekeeping couldnt be faulted. all in all this hotel is by far the best weve ever seen. simply because the music, service, atmosphere and staff personality is what appeals to us. if you want a hotel that talks to you like your royalty, the staff all look like butlers and looks so posh youre scared to walk around in it, this isnt for you. if you want a hotel where the staff are genuinely very friendly, where you can feel relaxed and mega chilled out while experiencing 5* service dont bother looking anywhere else. this is the place. and just to round it off, the hotel is a 5 minute walk through beautifully kept gardens to universals parks and city walks, which amazingly you cant hear while sitting at the hotel pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: lovevacations41
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hard Rock Orlando at least 6 times. We love it! We've been there several times in June and several times in November (during Thanksgiving break). The hotel is very nice and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. We usually stay on the concierge level (7th floor). The convenience of breakfast, snacks and drinks make the concierge level worth it for us. The rooms on the concierge level are the same as the other floors. The beds are pretty comfortable. The rooms are always clean. The pool is a lot of fun. It's not very deep, but deep enough to cool off. When my kids were younger they loved the slide and playing in the sand. ( My kids are 12 and 16 now, but we started going to Hard Rock when they were little.) Our favorite part about this hotel is it's location to Universal Studios and Island's of Adventure. It is about a five minute walk to Universal Studios and Island's of Adventure is about another three minutes away. If you don't feel like walking, you can take the ferry to City Walk. The dock at City Walk is about a two minute walk to each park. We also LOVE the "Express Pass" to rides and shows using your room key. We would not go to Universal Studios or Island's of Adventure if we weren't staying at one of the three Universal hotels. We have stayed at all three but we like Hard Rock the best. (But all three of them are nice!) We don't like waiting in lines, so the Express Pass with your room key is great!! If you have any questions, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nashy727
Reviews.Content: Brilliant Hotel, food a little expensive but really nice and plentyful. The FOTL passes are the best for both parks and can be used for Hard Rock Cafe reservations. Walk to the park is 8 minutes to Universal Studios and 5 minutes on the water taxi. The pool is heated and 4ft 8inches at the deepest point. Overall this is 1 of the best hotels i have stayed in and a must for all Universal fans. You can walk to the Portifino Hotel and give this a 4.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, hotel...yet like visiting a music museum”
Reviews.Author: harpman54
Reviews.Content: Two day business meeting in Orlando just last week, staying at the Hard Rock. My first time visit here and I'd do it again. Rooms were quiet, clean, and comfortable for a pretty busy venue. In spite of the pop/rock/blues music they play in the lobby and around the commons areas of the hotel, once in a room you never heard it. The Palms Restaurant on site was a very definite plus as well. There are many exhibits of music artifacts and history on display, lending to the hotel 'theme'. Recommendable, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific for teenagers.”
Reviews.Author: Michielyn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I LOVE Universal and Florida. We are upper 20's/low 30's, and brought a 17 and 18 year old. We stayed on the 7th floor (club level) and had a 2 queen bed room. The first night we got there, they had an ant issue and we they put us in a regular room on the ground floor (I asked to be upgraded to something nice because of the issue, but they said they were nearly booked). Additionally we called and requested one of the few large double queen club level rooms that they insist doesn't exist but someone already beat us to it. :-) They ended up giving us free wifi for the week and drink coupons. I thought that was pretty cool. If you plan on going to Universal then staying on site is completely worth it. You get an Express Pass that lets you bypass all the lines for every person in the room. The teenagers loved this! The restaurants in the hotel were pricey, but that was expected. Citywalk had some good options. Having Citywalk nearby was pretty cool to the teenagers, as they had something to do after the parks closed. Citywalk also has a movie theater. It's an easy nice walk or a boat ride to the park/Citywalk. The staff was nice and helpful. The fitness center is amazing. Definitely worth a visit! We booked really early and got an incredible price. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Live Up To The Cost”
Reviews.Author: NKAWTG
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for a week. We picked the hotel because or friends were staying there and the fact it has exclusive access to the Universal parks. The hotel was extremely nice, the food was great, and the drinks were a bit pricey (but you get that with theme hotels). However, we were extremely disappointed with the house keeping. We are not high maintenance travelers, but we do expect good service when we pay for it. At $300 a night, we would have expected our room cleaned everyday and supplies for coffee and tea refilled. Nearly every day we had to "raid" the house keeping carts for supplies (carts that never seemed to leave the hallway). Every day we saw leftover room service trays in the hallway that stayed in the hallway for 12 hours at a time (one we saw sit there for two days). After four days of this sub-par service, we expressed concerns to hotel management. We were given a free breakfast coupon and were told the problem would be resolve. While we enjoyed our free breakfast, nothing on the house keeping side was fixed. We continued two more days with the bad service (we thought we would give them a two day grace period). Unfortunately, we had to complain again (and we hate complaining on vacation). We again received coupons for free breakfast and a bottle of wine (although they took the wine glasses from our room before we got to drink the wine). Again, we thanked them for their generosity (I'm not sure why because we paid $300 a night). To no avail! We check out the next day and were disappointed. But, with all that said, I want to say that the hotel was nice, the pool was beautiful (even though it was nearly freezing when we were there), and the access to Universal was worth it. We will not be staying there again, but we wouldn't discourage anyone from staying there. We would just recommend that you don't wait four days to complain about house keeping.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: Was allocated a fifth floor pool view room quickly. The large bedrom was very comfortable. The trees have grown very large now and reached our window and above. A bit too big. The amount and size of trees cuts down the sun bathing areas around the large pool. The pool area is still excellent. Taxes and parking added $34 daily to the room rate. We really like our stay

Reviews.Title: “Rock On!!! One of the best hotels I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: RacheyBaby1985
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 2 weeks stay at this fantastic hotel. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel at all. Check in was a breeze, they even upgraded us to club level for the whole of the holiday due to it being our honeymoon. With Club Level, you get continental breakfast, 2 hours of snacks and alcohol which consists of beer and wine only. And an hour in the evening for desserts. Inbetween the hours the lounge is open to get yourself a drink and/or some fruit. The room was a very nice room with a queen sized bed, a couch and tables. Large enough for the two of us. It has a 32" tv, a cd player (you can get cd's from the club lounge) an alarm clock which has an iPod attachment. Unfortunately the iPhone does not work with it. We had a problem with 2 of the channels on the tv: Fox and ABC family, my husband wanted to watch the 1st episode of season 8 of 24. One quick phone call down to reception and somebody came up to the room to try to fix it. He couldnt fix it properly, we had to put in a code each time we wanted sound for those channels. No big deal. They offered to change our room, which we politely declined. So they gave us a free film to watch from their entertainment system which was fantastic. Wi-fi in the room was available it works 1pm-1pm 24 hours. Buy anywhere inbetween and it will stop working at 1pm. The cost for this was $11.41 (including tax) They have free wi-fi in the lobby which was very useful and we used more than in the room. The location to the parks and citywalk was fantastic. Its a quick 5 minute walk, or there is a free shuttle bus that departs every 20 mins, there's also a water taxi that is free and leaves every 20 mins. Outside the hotel near the water taxi entrance not associated with the hotel are bike taxi's that work for tips only. We used these a couple of times, but mostly walked. We never went in the pool, just because we were so busy during the day we didn't have time to go in. However the pool area is large and there is plenty of space to sit. They do poolside movies on a Thursday during the week, which again we wasn't at the hotel for. The staff are extremely helpful and very friendly! The concierge desk in particular was very helpful for us. We had to book shuttles to go to Disney World, this was provided by Mears Transportation and was $18 round trip per person. The hotel has free shuttles to Seaworld, Aquatica and Wet and wild. There is only 1 departure time at 9.55 am and one pick up time which is around 6pm. We used this to go to aquatica and seaworld and had no problems with it. Coach was clean etc. They have an ice cream parlour and a starbucks on site which we used a couple of times, were reasonably priced considering price of things in the parks. They also have people come into the hotel that do caricatures, these seemed quite expensive when compared with the ones outside. Definitely recommend the one in Universal outside the Simpsons ride. They were fantastic, price was the best I'd seen the whole trip! At night you could either chill in your room, go to the velvet bar on site (which was quite pricey) or there's Citywalk where there are loads of restaurants and bars to have a good time. Again a quick 5 minute walk from the hotel. It's right opposite the parks. Just a warning, when checking out, if you have given them a credit card on file, they will withhold a nights charge on that card. We were unaware that they did this. When checking in, we didn't give a credit card for them to store as we said we would pay for everything in advance. We had a cash passport credit card with the money stored on it, we paid once for the wi fi in the room on this card. Now unbeknown to us they kept this credit card on file, so on check out they with held $220 of the cash on the card. Only realised this when trying to buy gifts and the card was declined. Went back to the hotel to ring the card company to see if any fraud or anything had happened. They told me straight away that the hotel is withholding cash and it could take up to 7 working days to get it back. I asked them how to get it back and was told that the hotel needed to fax them saying that we can have the money back however it can still take 7 working days. So my husband went to speak with the person (that happened to be the manager) to ask them to fax the company and also say that we happy with our stay and thank you very much for the upgrade, but also that we wasn't very happy that we did not know this was going to happen. They apologised and said that when we gave a card in at check in that they should have explained this. We told them that we understand why they do it etc, however we never gave a card in at check in, just to pay for the wi fi in the room. Again she apologised and sent the fax off straight away. She then came back and gave us $100 as compensation so hat we could buy the gifts we wanted to. So just a warning, when they ask for a credit card, give one you aren't going to use for the holiday. Im glad it just happened at the end of the holiday. In terms of value at the hotel, the actual cost of staying there without any deals is quite expensive. We got a fantastic price for the hotel. We would definitely stay here again without a doubt. You certainly will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lolasmom08
Reviews.Content: Whenever we decide we're going to take a trip to Universal we always stay at least one night at one of the 3 on property hotels. The benefits of staying onsite are seriously worth the additional cost to my normally conservative travel budget. With a Universal Annual pass there are also great discounts on the rate. This hotel is absolutly beautiful. We arrived early - 8 am - and our room was already ready. We were able to get our room keys for 5 (they allow you to sleep 5 in a standard room) and head over the parks. The boat ride from this hotel to Universal is so quick and the walking distance is very short. The biggest plus of staying here is the use of the Express line to hotel guests from the day of your check-in to the day of your check-out. We were able to do every attraction at both parks easily - some of them several times. The rooms were comfortable, clean, and the ammenities are great. We ate breakfast at The Kitchen and it was good - a bit too expensive but what isn't at a theme park area. The pool are was gorgeous but all we got to do was look around. I called during the day from the parks and was told the hotel would be open until 10 but when we went to go at 9 they were closing. It was slightly upsetting for the kids - but I didn't let it get to me. We had a wonderful time and the ipod dock in the room is a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
