Reviews.Author: cubbish86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best i have ever stayed at in the Orlando area. Perfectly situated within Universal Studios, which take five minutes to walk to (or you could take the bike-cab or river boat!). We stayed on the 'Club Floor', which were extremely well decorated and comfortable with clean and modern furnishings. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly, and really do make you feel at welcome. What I like most about this hotel is how it's quite 'edgy' (compared to the saccharin Disney) whilst still being family friendly. I would definitely recommend the Club Floor, and although the lounge isn't anything special, the breakfasts are perfectly fine. And, you get to pose with your card in the lift.

Reviews.Title: “not very quiet”
Reviews.Author: mulletman22
Reviews.Content: where to start? the guests walking down the halls at 2:30 this morning banging on all the doors? the way the room doors slam shut? staff cannot seem to provide the access code for Internet access in our room? thin walls? the only good point is only one night left... no way is this even comparable to disney!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on Concierge Floor"”
Reviews.Author: FitToLive
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Dec. 26 - Dec. 28 with 4 teenagers, our first time there. Prices for Concierge rooms were $514 first night and $494 second night - we had two rooms. The club lounge is a total joke and completely inadequate in relation to the cost of the rooms. Breakfast (we always try to catch a breakfast in the club lounge) consisted of some cold muffins, hard bagels, sticky oatmeal and some fruit. The lounge is very small, so not enough seating for everyone. One morning we arrived at 9:45 (breakfast is over at 10:00 ) and there was very little food remaining - we were told there would be no additiional serving. The rooms themselves were fine, nothing wonderful but clean. At this price I suppose I thought they would be a little upgraded; maybe they were but if so, I can't imagine what a regular room would be. Cocktail hour at night - poor quality wine and extremely limited selection of liquor for cocktails. What hors-doerves I saw were ...... well, I just can't remember because there really weren't any! Needless to say we went downstairs to the lobby and bought drinks before dinner. The good points - the staff at this hotel are very friendly, always smiling and saying 'hello". Their customer service is very good. The pool bar staff was very friendly, coming to stand and talk with us (granted they were not busy because it was cold when we were there!). I imagine they would be very busy in warm weather as the pool area is great - big slide, sandy beach, hot tubs, cabanas for rent, etc.; Going to Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure or City Walk is a easy walk just out the back of the hotel. Your room key card is also your "fast pass express" for almost all the rides/attractions so no standing in lines (the kids loved it). You can also charge to your room with this same card. All in all, great location, good staff, clean hotel. Just DON'T waste your money to get on the Concierge Floor. If you want to pay these kinds of rates and want a good pool area and not interested in easy access to Universal theme parks, go to the Hyatt Grand Cypress a few miles down the road.

Reviews.Title: “There has to be better hotels than this ...”
Reviews.Author: Msldublin
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late writing this ... We stayed here end of June early July. After spending 5 blissful nights at the Don Caesar in St Petersburg we arrived at 3 pm to find that our room would not be available for at least another 2 hours. We had booked a kids suite as we had a party of 2 adults and 2 teenagers as we felt the kids suite would be more spacious. On our first night we found it very difficult to sleep as there we people running up and down the corridor screaming at 1 in the morning. The following morning I went down to the reception and spoke to the girl who had checked us in the previous day and explained to her that we would not be able to tolerate that level of noise for a further 9 nights. She was extremely unhelpful and after persisting with her for an hour she eventually found another kids suite for us even though she said there was none available ... persistence pays off. The pool area was uninspiring. My teenagers only used it once in 10 days. We had lunch at the pool one day the food was OK but the flies were a huge problem. We ate dinner in 'The Kitchen' on a few occasions. The food was quite good but the service was quite mixed. The major selling points for this hotel is its proximity to the parks and the ability to fast pass, otherwise it doesn't have much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel - Great Hotel, Lovely surroundings & exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Jules-Nottm
Reviews.Content: We visted the Hard Rock Hotel in April 2009 and spent 2 weeks there; we had a great time and it certainly had the wow factor! The sweeping driveway, with palm trees and cool guitar fountain made us feel like we had definately chosen the right hotel, right from the start! Yes it is a little on the expensive side but its certainly true that you get what you pay for and this was money well spent! Check-in was quick and smooth, we were a little concerned about the reviews on here that the rooms near to the lift lobby meant a lot of noise at night .In our experience this was only really a concern at weekends when the hotel is busy; which is true of any hotel. Our room was on the 4th floor with views onto the garden at the rear of the hotel; the room was spacious and well equipped, the coffee machine and fridge were useful. The beds and pillows were comfy an the bathroom and towels of good quality. The bathroom is a bit of a tight squeeze in between the door and the w/c.The shower over the tub was good, plenty of hot water. There is a small hand basin in the bathroom and a larger vanity/sink area outside the bathroom which was handy when getting ready in the mornings. The mini bar is of course expensive and they add a 20% gratuity as well! I would suggest stocking up at a local store or at The Hard Rock Gift store or Emack & Bolios they have a range of snacks and drinks at a more reasonable price. Housekeeping was good, there were some days when our room wasnt made up till later in the day but it was always to a good standard. Had a slight issue with the hairdryer but this was sorted immediately by the friendly and attentive housekeeping manager who delivered a brand new one. He regularly checked with us that all was well when he saw us in the corridor and all requests were promptly dealt with. All public areas were tidy, smart and bright, the memorbilia and features are great and the music in the elevators was fun! There are several dining options, The Kitchen where we ate breakfast on a few mornings, this was of a good standard and varied buffet style dining, the breakfast pizza was a hit with my boyfriend! We also ate dinner there a few times and on some evenings they had Characters coming to the tables which was great for children and a fun touch for adults. Prices are of course what you would expect for a 5* hotel. The Palm, a popular American steak house will cost more, we had dinner on the evening of my birthday and had starter, steaks and a nice bottle of wine for $200, pricey but the food was delicous. My boyfriend loved the steak and it was literally melt in the mouth. They also serve food at the Beach Club bar; Burger and fries were a little expensive and the only downside is the automatically add 20% gratuity to all drinks and food. But the setting is lovely and staff friendly. The pool area/gardens are well maintained, beautifully landscaped and very relaxing, the pool isnt very deep but was okay just to take a quick dip and movies by the pool were fun. You can hire a Cabana but this was a little expensive and there were plenty of pool loungers and secluded spots even at busy times. We enjoyed drinks and cocktails at the Velvet Bar just off the lobby; they did special cocktails most evenings and they had an outside balcony area which was lovely to relax on after a busy day at the parks. The staff were friendly and fun, we fund ourselves popping in for drinks before heading our most evenings. The water taxi to CityWalk was great, the Captains were always friendly and there were a couple who would often do a funny little dance or share some local knowledge which added to the fun! It was great the snuggle up on the Water Taxi on the way back from an evening at Citywalk. They ran until 2am and you never had to wait too long at the dock at Citywalk. The garden walk to Universal Studios were lovely with ducks on the lake, took about 8 minutes to walk to Citywalk/Universal Studios, the area still felt safe and security was good even when walking back in the early hours of the morning. The Express Pass was also great when the parks were busy, we never had to wait in line for any of the attractions.The ability to charge all purchases to your room in the Universal resort and have them delivered to your room was great and saved having to carry purchases around. The only issue we had was the parking charge; $14 a day it seems to be a common thing in Orlando Hotels, we only had the car for 10 days and spent the remaining 4 days using the resort. Location is great in walking distance to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure/Citywalk, 20 minutes to Disney, 10 minutes to Seaworld. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, great at giving directions and suggestions. We were sad to leave and will definately be returning when we next visit Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Universal & a gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCPO-USN-2011
Reviews.Content: OK....First off.....I am not one of those "5 star" hotel people.......I normally only fork over that amount of money when I am visiting foriegn countries. But, even with the all-inclusive major hotel chains in the vicinity of Universal-----the Hard Rock cannot be beat. First and foremost is the Express Pass Key Card----that is included, no charge, if you stay in one of the Universal Orlando properties (there are 3 total). There were a total of 6 of us on this trip (myself, my wife, 20 y/o daughter, 11 y/o son, and twin 9 y/o girls.....the normal in-park price, for 2-park express pass is $70/each......so, the Express Pass paid for the room (in fact, the express pass exceeded the cost of the room----GOVT RATE). So, even if the hotel had problems (which, it didn't), the express pass would make up for it. No waiting at all, on any of the rides. Saw both parks----including several rides x2, x3, in about 7.5 hours.....and, the parks were packed. Now, onto the hotel. Typical Lowe's property.....stafff very friendly. Services for both guests with families, and guests without. Food is pricy (lunch for the 6 of us was $90...but, the best burger I have ever had). Velvet is a must, after a long day in the park. The pool is just perfect......heated to 80+ degrees, and a cool slide....TVs, music, sandy beach and just fun! The rooms are a little worn out from such heavy use (we had a kids suite).....but, I was still very satisfied. There are much less expensive properties, nearby. But, if you have the money, and want to be close to Universal (and City Walk), and have head-of-the-line, save up your money for Hard Rock. You will not be disappointed. We will return, yearly, for our Hard Rock Xmas Vacation.

Reviews.Title: “disasppointing”
Reviews.Author: suie1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hard rock and were disappointed this year. stayed there llast year and were pleased with it which is why we went back. we stayed on club level which is a step above wehre you have full access to the hotel and the club level lounge where they have drinks, food all day long. this was most disappointing this year with the menue they had. desert every night was cookies no variety; I like cookies but we stayed for an entire week and even when they did give ya something else it was overcooked; stale like it was left overs from ttwo days before!!!!!!. You pay extra to get the club level and on a whole it was disappointing. even the maid service was lacking. we had to call to get daily maid service

Reviews.Title: “A real treat.”
Reviews.Author: SteveBishop.
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days at the start of september. This was as you would expect from the Hard rock guys. Professional and helpfull service done with a smile at all times. Constant good music in the public areas and fast regular lifts to all floors. We found the location perfect and the water taxis a novel way of getting around. It is only a short drive to the attractions of Orlando so the position is perfect for the parks. You are near everything but far enough away to feel away from the madding crowd when you want to relax. We didn't eat in the restuarant but did have bar snacks in the Velvet Bar and they were good portions at a reasonable price. The girls that served the tables here were fantstic and as good as any we have seen in all are times in the States. They learnt our names and made sure we didn't want for anything. If you fancy a night cap before you retire to bed, then this is as good a place as any to come. The pool side service is worth a mention as well. Excellent service form the guys and girls waiting here. The hotel looks fantastic from the outside with nice grounds and walks. The pool area is large and there was plenty of room, although we were there off season so I can't speak for peak times. Our twin room was clean and spacious with enough storage space. We had a decent view over the water way and the river taxis. It was quiet as well which we were surprised about. We thought it may be a little loud at times but every night we slept well and didn't get disturbed once. We would recommend this hotel. It's friendly, professional, clean, well positioned, has cool rock and roll artifacts about the place and is in a good position. We will return here on our next trip to Florida for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay at Hard Rock Orlando”
Reviews.Author: TravelDudeMike
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hard Rock Orlando from Nov 1/09 to Nov 7/09 for about $180 per night with my parents. For me the main highlight was the large pool which was was heated to about 80 degrees. Only one of the two hot tubs was working and both were very small for the size of the resort. Luckily this was offseason, but if it had been busier it would have been difficult to use the hotubs since they only hold about 6 people each. The free water taxi at the back of the hotel takes you directly to Universal City Walk which was convenient. The pool grounds are beautiful with plenty of spots with both shade and sun. We ate at the restaraunt called the kitchen which was over priced with a very limited lunch menu. Lunch ordered from the pool beach club was good. Also food/drink service at the pool was excellent with friendly staff. I had a standard room with 2 beds facing the pool which was acceptable but not at the 4 star level ( I would say 3 star). The room and hallways appeared a worn out and are in need of some updates. Also the bathroom was very small and it was difficult to open and close the bathroom door since it was very close to the toilet and tub. Also the sink was outside of the bathroom which I do not like and it was only a single. The beds were firm and we were able to sleep well. The high speed internet which I paid for was extremely slow both with both wired and wireless connections. It was almost unusable so beware. Overall I enjoyed the stay at this hotel, but next time I visit Orlando I would try to find a hotel that is at the 4 star level in terms of the room and specifically a better bathroom. The outside of the hotel including pool grounds, lobby and oustide were beautiful and at the 4 star level. The hotel location is great with only a 10 minute drive to international drive where there are many restaurants and gift shops. Disney World is only a 20 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great time - better than Disney”
Reviews.Author: RachelMO440
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at Disney twice and Universal 4 times. Although going to Disney is a must at least once in your life, once you've done Disney, Universal is in many ways better. If you stay at one of the onsite hotels, your room key is a fast pass on all of the ride lines. You get to skip the crowds on every ride. Also, unlike Disney, there are no buses to catch. At Universal, you only have a short water taxi ride to the parks or a short walk through beautiful gardens. All of the hotels at Universal also have sand beaches at the pools -- so we do not miss going to the beach. Furthermore, all of the onsite hotels have kids areas in their restaurants where the kids can eat and be entertained and the adults can have a quiet dinner alone. This is free except for paying for the kid's meals. The Kitchen restaurant at the Hard Rock has a kid's area with tvs, video games, toys, and they usually have an entertainer on the weekend for the kids. They also put up, on certain nights, "dive-in" movies for the kids at the pool. At the pool, they put up a large movie screen with a kid's movie playing at night. The kids love to swim and watch the movie. We have stayed at all three hotels at Universal and they all are great. We have also stayed at Wilderness Lodge and Saratoga Springs at Disney. I enjoyed my hotel experience at Univseral a lot better than at those hotels at Disney. You can also use any of the pools/restaurants at any of the onsite Universal hotels if you stay onsite at Universal. So, we have stayed at the Hard Rock and then gone over to the Royal Pacific for the day to use their kiddie waterpark ship at the pool that sprays out water. Finally, if you buy your tickets to the parks online at the official Universal webiste, you pay the price for one day for unlimited 7 day, 2 park passes with park hopper. This was so much cheaper than disney and you can come and go to the parks whenever you want for 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock in November”
Reviews.Author: EggrollEggrolls
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from our 5 night Hard Rock vacation. The first two days we encountered many problems: game room took money for broken games, fan in room was broken, no reasonable place to eat at the hotel, no small store where you could purchase small items or soda, dogs barking, and what pushed me to my limit was the two nights when the people in the room next door woke my entire family up from 2:30 - 4:30 am. I was very dissappointed in my vacation at that point and wanted to leave this hotel as fast as I could. However, after our second sleepless night, I went to the front desk and spoke with a WONDERFUL girl named Tina. I expressed my frustrations and she moved my family to the Club Level on the 7th floor. From that point on I experienced a totally different vacation. It was everything that I had hoped for, We had a nice room and access to the "club" where there was unlimited beverages, they had a wonderful free continental breakfast, free (2 hour) happy hour with hordevours, and free snacks and drinks throughout the day. There was even a computer and a big screen tv in the club to use. It was heaven and took so much of the frustration of having to go to CityWalk every time you wanted something to eat or drink. You have to use your keycard to get to the 7th floor, so I felt safe letting my kids leave the room and head down to the club by themselves. There were lots of other kids up there and they made wonderful friends. If you are staying at the Hard Rock, the club level is the only way to go. Although I think it costs about $80 more than the regular rooms, it is worth it. You save a fortune everyday on breakfast, beer/win, snack and soda, not to mention the convenience of having everything at your firgertips only a few steps down the hall. I could not have been happier at the end of my trip. The pool is beautiful and the staff at the hotel is very friendly. Perfect proximitely to the parks and we loved the fast passes. TINA, thank you for making our vacation great!

Reviews.Title: “15 Years Old & Living Large Just Like A Rock Star”
Reviews.Author: cmoorer1
Reviews.Content: I admit that my Dad is excessive sometimes when we travel. He usuually writes the reviews but the Hard Rock is mine. This was our eighth year at the Hard Rock's Graceland Suite during Halloween Horror Nights. Out of all the hotels the family has stayed at this is my favorite. It has a great vibe. Everybody that works there is super kool and for a 15 year old and his friend it's closer to living like a rock star than being a Jonas Brother. The second bedroom where we stay is great but the shower in the master bathroom is awesome. It has a fire place and a dozen shower heads. My friend said the suite's pianao was perfectly tuned. The view out of the long wall of windows is the pool, City Walk, Universal & Islands. For me it was better than seeing the Taj Mahal from Amarvillas balcony. The pool scene rocks with under water speakers, great DJ and we liked watching the game in the pool cabana. Hard rock has the best hamburgers in the world, the french fries are killers and there even made us a root beer float. City Walk is kool and my parents felt it was so safe that they let us walk around by ourselves until midnight. We can't wait until were 21 so we can get into the clubs. Hard Rock for sure rocks. Tell your Dad to forget about Disney. Stay at the Graceland Suite and be a rock star. It's the best big suite in the WORLD!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Royal Pacific”
Reviews.Author: newwave2
Reviews.Content: Our room was dirty. Towels had stains on them. Sheets had stains on them. The blankets were the most horrible things ever. They were so thin as almost to be non-existant. They had squares woven in to them that you could feel through the sheets. We stayed at Disney's Beach Club and Busche Garden's Embassy Suites. Both had luxurious quilts. The sheets were not fitted to the mattress. Each night they came off the bed. The room was not stocked with caffinated coffee. Each day I needed to ask housekeeping for some. For some reason, each day the excess I had left over was removed. The buffet breakfast I had at the Kitchen was a pale comparison to the buffet breakfast I ate at the Royal Pacific restaurant. The staff at the Kitchen was rude. The music in the Hard Rock lobby was overwhelming. The paths around the pool were overgrown and populated with weeds. I was extremely disappointed with my stay and will never return or recommend this incredibly overpriced disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: kevinp63
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another great holiday, we stayed at here last year for the Universal Horror nights and came back this year. The place is great for a base, easy access to Universal parks and the I4 freeway to everywhere else. The staff are very freindly and helpful, the rooms a large and well equipt. If I come back next year I will definatley be staying here. The only reason I have not given it 5 stars, is the cleaners need to use there duster a bit better, other that that a very clean and well run hotle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: UKMarkB
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, superb location for Universal parks, with a hip and fun feel. OK it's not cheap but it is a buzzing, good quality hotel with friendly, helpful staff and it's right next door to Universal. We stayed for 8 nights in July with two teenage kids and they absolutely loved it. Check-in was a welcome breeze, after a long flight and hassles with AvIs. Our car was parked for us, our room was ready (not always a given) and bags taken care of. Room was a decent size with flatscreen TV, big comfy beds, nice bathroom and free coffee. Pool is great for lounging, with a "beach" and slide at one end. Plenty of waiters for drinks and snacks and constant music. Drinks and food weren't cheap ($5 beer) but we knew that beforehand. Pool bar was best for snacks and drinks - quick service and decent menu. Best thing is the location. Two minute walk to Universal parks and Citywalk. Use your room key for Express pass on all rides (crucial !) If you don't want to walk thre's even a free water taxi for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Rockin Time at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: lmcclain
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was well worth the money. It was a treat to have a 5 minute walk to Universal. Having the room key to act as a fast pass was an added bonus. I would not attempt the parks without Fast Pass access. We stayed on the 8th floor which was the "Club Level" It was nice to have a lounge where you can get a light breakfast, lunch, and dinner. There were also snacks available during the day. The room was adequate. It was equipped well and clean. There was a good view. The mini bar was way overpriced (but they are at most places) The pool was huge and warm. They did have games and activities for smaller children. There is an added 18% added to your bill at the pool. The service at the pool was great. They had a nice selection of junk food available. The food and service in the restaurants were excellent. We definitely would return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Pool area is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_FlDonna77
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel at Universal is awesome and the pool area is out of this world. It has a water slide, an outdoor movie screen, and much more! My toddlers loved it and there was so much activity that we stayed out swimming until almost midnight!! I would highly recommend this hotel to families with small children!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: misskaos
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property. Loved the memorabilia! Everyone on the staff were incredibly nice. I bugged the poor concierge to death (not on purpose) and every time she was gracious and most helpful. It is just a short walk or boat ride to City Walk, Unviversal Studios, & Islands of Adventure. We found this very conveniant. Our room keys also doubled as express passes for the majority of rides and shows at Universal and Islands and that was a HUGE plus with us. We got to spend time enjoying the parks instead of standing in line endlessly. I'll definately stay there again.....This place ROCKS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Stuffy Noses" starring at the Hard Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flipflops41
Reviews.Content: The room we were assigned to was on the 5th floor and down a few long corridors. We felt like we walked a mile to get to our room, with only one main elevator station. The room decor was okay and the beds were not bad, but the dust or allergen level in the room was too much. It seemed as though the room was very stuffy and not good air flow. Would have liked to have an air purifier, but in their defense, I did not ask for one since we only stayed one night. The Kitchen restaurant had good service, but the food was not that great for the price, tasty but overpriced. My daughter, 7 yrs old, enjoyed the pool and the slide. The pool area is very nice and they have beverage service while you sit and lounge. We got wet at Islands of Adventure and the convenient laundry rooms allowed me to dry our clothes, so that was a good feature. All in all though, we will not stay there again. We have been to Universal several times and have enjoyed the Royal Pacific Hotel very much, so we'll be sticking with them from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but not without problems.”
Reviews.Author: Mamaluvstravel
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before with no problems. This time we had trouble from check in to check out and beyond. Rooms weren't ready, then they reeked of smoke, keys didn't work, dogs barked ALL night (even after 3 phone calls), charged the wrong amount and had to make multiple calls to get it fixed. The kids love the pool and the convenience to the parks is unbeatable! The magicians at dinner at the Kitchen were fun.

Reviews.Title: “CHIC ROCKER HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: Antara33
Reviews.Content: The rooms were chic and divine, the bed outrageously comfortable. I loved have a CD player in the room. We upgraded to the level with complimentary breakfast and evening cocktails and appetizers -- excellent! Hanging out by the pool which had underwater music piped in and a sandy beach entrance was fab - have a few cocktails, lounge, swim, vibe with music & sunshine - sweet memories. The other AWESOME benefit was the free boatrides to and from Citywalk and the Universal parks. Super romantic and to be rid of the hassles of parking and long walks to the lots made it all extremely special for us. Rockers of all ages will love this place. Oh, and we also took in a concert (again via boat) at the Hard Rock Arena and saw Crosby Stills Nash. Everything was right at our fingertips --- niiiice.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Heaven”
Reviews.Author: MairiL3
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The music pounding in the lobby was a great atmosphere. Yet when you go into your room it is complete silence with amazingly big bedds (: Definately a must visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great FUN!”
Reviews.Author: JULIEGOLDA
Reviews.Content: We only had the pleasure of staying on this property for 2 nights...wow! It exceeded our expectations by far. Pros- *great room with great view of pool on 6th floor & adjoining room with our friends. *very comfy beds/pillows and awesome decor. *LOVED, loved the pool areas!!!! kids loved the sand, water slides and underwater music. Movie at night was also a plus. *VERY GOOD wait staff by the pool....also wonderful drinks! *every employee was so nice and friendly to us and the kids. *was so nice to use the express pass with our room key. *walking distance to EVERYTHING!!! Cons- *leaving...boo!

Reviews.Title: “You Need Some Determination but get there in the end”
Reviews.Author: dizzylinzy
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 5 nights at the Hard Rock - myself any my teenage son. We have stayed before but this time upgraded to the Club Level. First room allocated no good - one king bed!!! Second Room twin beds - miles from anywhere and with car park view!! Not good enough Hard Rock - third room - pool and theme park view - twin beds - but with bathroom fitted for handicapped guests!! Still it would have to do. As for the Club Level - not sure it worth the extra they charge - rooms no better and Club Lounge like staff canteen. Although the complimentary breakfast is good. Agree with previous reviews - Hard Rock is looking a little tired and could do with updating. The best thing of course is the location and the use of room keys to express rides although at this time of year not really necessary. Had major problem with room account they would insist on charging for the room nightly even though this had been paid in advance through a Voucher. I must have had to tell Front Desk every day about this. I am not convinced I won't be charged for this yet. However the staff were very friendly and approachable - their systems obviously at fault. We would go again but maybe stay at Portofino.

Reviews.Title: “big advantages”
Reviews.Author: shell13
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel rooms spacious and clean. Didnâ€™t think walking down the corridor it looked like a 5 star hotel as it looked very basic. The pool and services were nice. There were 2 lifeguards on the pool, which has a slide and beach area. Would definatly stay again as use of the express pass makes it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want”
Reviews.Author: hawks21
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel and location for people who just want to relax or be on the go. My partner and I managed both during our two week visit. The entire trip was fantastic from start to finish, with nothing to complain about. Yes it is a little pricey, but you know that when you book to stay here and shouldn't complain about it after you arrive. All staff members in every area of the hotel were great and couldn't have done enough to make our stay more enjoyable. If you want to relax in style this is the hotel for you, we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place and close to the parks!”
Reviews.Author: Dachduco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our 13, 11, and 5 year old sons the beginning of September. The staff at the hotel and the restaurants were extremely nice and helpful. The room was just an average hotel room, nothing special, and the beds were a little on the hard side - but this is our only issue. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a pool room view from a garden room view for no extra charge. We noticed absolutely no noise from the pool and were able to fall asleep. The pool side service of drinks and food was excellent. The restaurant staff were very nice - even replacing my 5 year old's food when he accidentally dropped his plate. The memorabillia was really cool and the live music poolside was awesome. But the best part of staying here was using our room keys to go to the head of every ride line in Universal & Islands of Adventure. Not that the lines were that long during most of our stay, but on Labor day they were. The beautiful walkway from the hotel to the parks was very clean and scenic. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: alexxray
Reviews.Content: First time at Hard Rock but would definatley stay again. Room service was excellent on first night as we were too tired to change and go out and served with such elegance! The pool area of an evening/night was buzzing with people swimming and hanging out by the pool... could have been in the Caribbean!!! Staff were so helpful and friendly and the gym was worth the extra few dollars a day if you like to train. Universal and the hotel benefits speak for themselves with the fast pass and water taxi and the added benefit of visiting the portofino hotel... little venice, and royal pacific where you can eat and shop and still charge to your room. Ate at Mammas in Portofino and had a great night of food and entertainment. If you want to buy soft drinks buy from the hard rock shop in the lobby its so much cheaper than the ice cream parlour downstairs and we also found that the parlour sold tubs of cereal and cartons of milk which we decided to buy everynight b4 bedtime as breakfast was getting expensive in the buffet room at $72.71 for 4 every morning The only downfall which isnt the hotel, is having the bother of tax and gradtuity everytime you spend, why oh why do they not add on the tax in the us? My other niggle is, i find it annoying that you have to pay to park and the valet parking is such a waste of money as the carpark is so close to the hotel for self parking but is still $15 a day plus tax! After saying that it was such a great place, this wouldnt put me off going again we had the best weeks stay there

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Fitzy2
Reviews.Content: This is a good 4 star hotel right in Universal park. It does what it says on the box. Big hotel, nice staff, the velvet bar is savage, the rooms are reasonable and clean, comfy beds, and of course universal is pretty good. One thing - we went to the Counting Crows at the Hard Rock Live during our vacation and they were pretty bad. They did this ridiculous thing of playing intermittently during the gig, and we left after three hours as we were still listening to the support acts. Otherwise, great hol!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for fun in the sun!”
Reviews.Author: nifty16
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great 5-night stay at the Hard Rock Hotel at Universal. The location is fantastic - we orginally checked in at the Royal Pacific, but swtiched to the Hard Rock because it's even closer to the parks. It was a five-minute walk from our room to the entrance to Universal Studios - so close that our 9 and 11-year-olds preferred to walk rather than take the water taxi! The California-mission style of the hotel is gorgeous, especially when sitting at the pool. The lobby is very big and comfortable, with plenty of chairs and sofas, and has a very 'fancy' feel withouth being stuffy. We spent about an hour one night during a lightning storm just hanging out in the lobby and enjoying the atmosphere. Our daughters loved the rock theme, and there were a lot of fun activities and music around the pool. The hotel is much more kid-friendly than you might expect from the Hard Rock chain. While the rooms are just a bit bigger than a typical hotel room, they were nice and clean and more than adequate for a family of four. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We don't usually stay at 4 or 5-star hotels, so it's difficult to compare, but the Hard Rock Hotel was probably the nicest place we've stayed at. Given the proximity to the Universal parks, being able to use your room key for ride express lines, and the overall hotel experience, the Hard Rock is definitely a great choice for a trip to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: mbgandco
Reviews.Content: The reason to stay at the Hard Rock is the proximity to Universal and the fact that the room key is an express pass at the rides allowing you to skip the queues. Rooms:- We had 3 rooms on the Club level. One suite was a very good size but the smallest bathroom I have seen in a good hotel. A Holiday Inn Express has bigger bathrooms. No bath, just a shower. The Club level has the advantage of a Club lounge where continental breakfast is available and snacks at othr times. This is welcome but the room is small with plastic furniture and the breakfast is geared to children. This is children's hotel really so do not expect a fancy club lounge as in a normal 5 star hotel. Amenities The pool area is the other star of the hotel. Very large with a small water slide and plenty of shaded areas. Restaurants The Palm is an upscale NY steak house which is good and certainly better than anything in City Walk The Kitchen has a good buffet breakfast The Pool Bar is good Other Do not bother with Valet Parking, the self park is very close and normally you have to wait longer for Valet than the walk to self parking

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun! Great for kids and adults!”
Reviews.Author: Soccermom8911
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was a spectacular visit for my family! We last visited in 2007, and I am fairly new to this TripAdvisor review site so im jumping on the bandwagon now! It was nice to get away from all the Disney shenanigans and go to this fun hotspot. My kids loved the pool--loud music, daily activities, what more could a little kid ask for? The lobby is filled with rock paraphernalia, surely keeping the kids busy along with us parents reliving the good ole' rock and roll days! There is restaurants and bars scattered along this monstrous hotel keeping my family entertained every single night! The staff was very friendly and helpful, I couldnt ask for more! We were there for my daughters birthday, we informed the staff and when we arrived in our room there were cookies and a personalized card for her!! Great hospitality I say. I really really recommend this hotel for all families and would most definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: tatesnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for two nights prior to going on a cruise, and I figured I would show my wife Universal since she has never been. We got to the hotel, and check in was a breeze because it was almost midnight by the time we got there. We were soo tired from traveling all day that we opted to valet the car for $22 a day instead of walk back to the parking lot. We got our keys and got to our room (garden view) and it was just ok, there was nothing special about the room at all to warrant the $350 a night price (except of course its location). I guess we expected a more modern, newer room then what we had. The bathroom was clean, but seemed a bit dated. This was really our only dissapointment. However, being as tired as we were, we went right to bed. We got up the next morning and enjoyed a great breakfast in the buffet downstairs, and then off to the parks we went. Nothing better then staying right on the resort. We had a choice of either a water taxi, bicycle carriage, or a short 5 minute walk. We opted to walk over to the parks, and it is a nice scenic walk. We were able to buy our passes at the hotel, which saved us about 20 minute of waiting on line at the parks. We bought the 1 day pass for 2 parks, and we were able to finish both parks in one day (No Kids with us). Also, our hotel key served as an express pass wich allowed us to skip all the lines at every ride, this is what really allowed us to finish both parks in one day. We didn't have to wait on any lines. We had dinner at the Hard Rock in the park that night, and walked around City Walk for a while, before calling it the night and turning in. The next morning, we checked out via our television set in the room, and off we were to our cruise out of Port Canaveral. I should mention we did have a hard time getting them to bring the car back for us, it took them about 25 minutes or so. Overall the location is top noth if you want to spend the day at Universal or Islands of Adventure of both, the hotel was clean, and the pool was nice and was open late. My only stickling point was the dated room.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here!”
Reviews.Author: LisaHBoston
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we visit Universal Studios. Really we just love it. The Kitchen is a bit pricey for breakfast, but when isn't a hotel pricey for breakfast? Plus, don't eat too much before hitting the coasters. ugh. We LOVE the pool and poolside bar. The game room is fun. The bars inside are great too and who can beat the Palm Restaurant?? So great! Rooms are average, but very nice. It is the closest to the parks so you can't beat it for location.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Clean, great pool. I always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: chihuahua_lover23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and will continue to do so! Very comfortable. Pros: - Clean! - Large room, comfy beds - PERFECT location - Fabulous pool area with slide Cons: - a little noisy. The family next to us was crazy! They would play CD's so loud and yell at the kids all night. Oh well =) Hasn't happened before. You can walk to Universal, City Walk, and Islands of Adventure all within 5-7 minutes. Amazing pool area. If you want a poolside snack, I suggest ordering a kids meal off the menu. It's big enough and only $5.00. Great little bar inside the hotel with a balcony. Good shop with some trendy things (L.a.m.b., Edun, ect...) I tried the room service late one night and it was a huge amount of food and they got my special requests right. =) Great service. It's fun to go down to CityWalk at night as you can just walk (or stumble) back safely. There is a kareoke place with a stage and back-up singers and everything. It was really fun after a few drinks. Also Bob Marley's is nice and of course Margaritaville. There is also a Starbucks. Wait for a bargain then book right away! (FL residents get really great deals...)

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Great location, Friendly staff, Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: mcbrad
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando Florida most years with my family for the theme parks, this has got to be the best hotel. Close to the parks, you get a free express pass with your room card, there is a fun atmostphere and the staff are so friendly and helpful! definately worth the price you pay i would recommend to anyone going for a fun family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock, Rocks Hard!!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeAdvisor
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip to Universal Orlando/Buena Vista for 4th of July weekend. I believe we checked into Hard Rock on the 5th, As we were at the Orlando Marriott World Center Resort July 3rd & 4th (Also did review for World Center) anyway, I found the hard rock to be awesome, the music dÃ©cor was rockin, haha. The lobby has a museum type feel to it. Bad [--] ice cream shop on site. Could see fire works from pool. It is literally a 1 min walk down a privet path to City Walk/Parks. Recommended Food: -Hard Rock CafÃ© -NASCAR CafÃ© -Wimpyâ€™s Hamburgers (Located In IOA - Popeye Theme) -Mythos Restaurant (Located In IOA - Full Service - Amazing Building) This Hotel is more for Families with teens & Young Adults, Deff not for Grandma & Gramps.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra few dollars and stay in the Club Level”
Reviews.Author: BostonCin
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a seven night stay and were quite pleased. Yeah, there's a few things that could have been better, but all in all, a great experience. Our biggest positive experience was staying on the 7th floor and having access to the Club. We traveled with three children, two of whom are teenagers, and found it totally worth our money. We all had breakfast each morning (a huge selection of a continental breakfast). Every day, all day the club was open for sodas and waters (a huge savings for us). We grabbed a few waters each morning before going out to the parks. From noontime on there were granola bars and small bags of salty snacks. The evening hors douvres were the best...very heary appetizers and a nice seleciton of beer and wine for two hours. Late night dessert was good too. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the wonderrful staff in the Club Level lounge....they go out of their way to please. Totally a money saver if you have kids who like to eat!! Our biggest complaint was housekeeping. We had to get demanding an yell a little bit to get them to come at a decent time. The first two nights housekeeping didn't get there til 7pm. We were waiting for towels to take a second shower, and had to go get them ourselves...very frustrating. The other complaint was the price of the drinks. Mixed drinks at the pool START AT $11...just crazy. I do have to say that management was fantastic when approched with a problem, though. We had the unfortuate situation of being next door to a group of young men in a band, and when they came in at 2:30 am, and decided to talk and play music until 4:45 security was great, and acted immediately the two times I called them. And when we let hotel mgmt know how unsatisfied we were with housekeeping, we were given complimentary breakfast tickets to breakfast in the kitchen (Fantastic restaraunt). Also, we did feel that $9.95/day for internet access was steep (although it is free from the lobby) Don't hesitate to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for a 5* Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Lola21London_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 13 yr old daughter as a trendy place for her to experience. I found the reception staff not very welcoming, certainly not compared to other hotels I have stayed in in USA. Our room was ok but nothing special, not very 5* but not bad either. The main problems I had with it were it seemed "agadoo-ish" (think cheap holiday in Spain with stupid pool games and a bit club 18-30) The pool was very crowded and they had "singers" which I have to say were absolutely terrible. I'm all for loud music when it's good but when it sounds like a cat being strangled I'd rather pass!! We also had problems with our room which was noisy for other reasons, dogs in nearby rooms barking, "funny" people knocking on our door for a "joke" @ 1am etc. All in all I found it awful. That said when I complained to the tour operator and asked to move the hotel manager was very accommodating and offered us a room change but by that time we'd had eneough. We moved to the Portofino which was fantasic and much much better, we had a room upgrade for our inconvenience (they are both part of the Lowes group) and a lovely stay there. Top food, lovely room and generally a relaxed feel after a day at the parks. Potofino is in a different league to the hard rock and so say both of us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not very 'Hard Rock' but loved it nevertheless!”
Reviews.Author: DMC589
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel when visiting Universal Studios. A bit more 'Soft Rock' than 'Hard Rock' but a very nice hotel indeed. The hotel was very large and very plush (to a commoner like me anyway), the rooms were massive and very well equipped. Didn't see much of the hotel's bars and restaurants but loved the ice cream parlour downstairs! Made our trip to Universal Studios much easier and more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our holiday !!!”
Reviews.Author: DidsburyFamily
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a couple of nights here during our 2 week vacation in Orlando (we had a villa for the rest of the time). Family managed to get us a deal on 'florida residents' so we got the deal for next to nothing. We got included fast passes for the duration of our trip - which were better than the normal fast passes you purchase in the parks as these hotel ones are unlimited. The rooms were nice, thought there would have been a bit more to give it that extra touch - but seeing as how we were not in them much, they served their purpose! Dinner with the children can be a restless affair - but 'The Kitchen' kept them all amused, the staff were great, the service was amazing and the children had fun making their own pizzas. The food is expensive, but it was one of the nicest meals we had whilst in Orlando. SCOOTER... what can I say, our children are still talking about you !!! (the childrens entertainer at the pool in the evening) What a fun fella, who really got everyone in a great mood - the children want to go back just for him !!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFloridian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock on July 30th. It was awesome! We were only there for one night to go to Universal and Hard Rock Cafe. After check-in, it was a five minute walk to the dinner. Much easier than the 30 minute walk through CityWalk. After dinner, the girls swam in the coolest pool that was open until midnight. The next day, we left for the park and the hotel housed our luggage until our return late that evening. The best part was the fast passes for Universal, you get one for each person in the room. You had the luxury of bypassing all the 60 minute lines. As a frugal Floridian, this is well worth the splurge if you're going to Universal. My only complain is if you don't have pets, request to stay off the first floor. Our room had a pet smell and dogs frequently mark their territory in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: bluekarma
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel.It is very hip and fun. They checked us in early they also gave my son a bag stuffed with candy for his birthday!we loved the cd that came with the room too.We loved the rock memorabilia around the hotel.The rooms are very modern & comfortable.The pool area was really great for the kids.Lot's of activities, video games by the pool was the kids faviorte.The kids loved the ice cream, which they my special for our birthday celebration.The hotel can be a little loud, but we didnt mind.It is also pricey but worth the extra money.(universal is next door & the universal express axcess is included with your room).You will pay for parking everyday .This is a great hotel for couples or familys with older kids.We will defintly go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, updated property. If visiting Universal Studios WELL worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: MrMajestyk
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We have a large family, so we had two adjoining rooms. We arrived early, and though our rooms weren't ready we were issued our keys so we could utilize the Express Pass feature at the adjacent Universal Theme Parks. The ability to use your room key to cut to the front of nearly every attraction/show is outstanding. The fact this is included in the price of the room more than justifies the price difference between this and other Orlando area lodging. As our rooms became available the hotel called our cell phone to let us know which was a nice touch. The rooms are fresh and outfitted with trendy but comfortable furniture, Plasma TVs, and iPod compatible alarm clocks. The only negative was that our room was a 'Las Vegas mega hotel like' hike from the lobby/elevator.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: tourist_or_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights earlier this month with my husband and teenage daughter. This was our first experience of Orlando and the Hard Rock was a good start. I booked a garden view room but actually had a pool view from the forth floor. The room was a good size and eveything was clean and in working order. The down side of this location was the long walk from the lobby. There was no noise from the rather over air-conditioned corridors and the staff were friendly without being over attentive. The hotel is in an excellent location for access to Universal and only a short walk way. There are also free water taxis which are good for a quick getaway when the rain starts. The hotel room key also gives front of line access to the rides at both Universal parks. The pool area was busy with family groups when we were there. The pool itself is very shallow and the underwater sound system isn't worth all the publicity. If you are looking for a rock star experience the pool probably isn't the place to find it. I don't think you should have to pay to park at a hotel of this standard, but you do, and it costs $15/day for self parking. The bellperson will look after your bags while you park the car. We had dinner one night at The Kitchen which was a little over priced but the food was of a reasonably good standard and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for location...”
Reviews.Author: realityaddict
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here after a concert at Hard Rock Live. The hotel is a very short walk from Citywalk and the Universal Parks - the location can't be beat. However, for the price you pay the rooms are pretty average. We stayed in a king on the fifth floor with a connecting door, though which we could clearly hear our neighbors - not something you'd expect for a $300/night. The pool area was nice and the grounds are beautiful, but they do seem to nickel and dime you - $15/day for self parking and $5 for a soda and chips.

Reviews.Title: “Take a loan out , it will cost you”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot4444
Reviews.Content: My kids loved it, it was beautiful, but the prices were just ridiculous , my husband ordered a crown and a beer and it was 20 some dollars, my son got a slushie it was like $14.00, they add 18% gratuity to everything , whether you get good or bad service. We rented a cabana the last day, with this rental you are supposed to recieve a fruit basket, we were their forty-five minutes when my husband had to go to the front desk to get a waiter, we had to go to the bar at least 2 more times to place and order , but we still had to pay 18% gratuity. After we returned home , told hotel management about how unfair prices were and how bad our service was the day we rented the cabana, he said he was sorry and they would review their prices. That's it . Really a great , classy hotel, but $300.00 a night for just 2 beds and a bathroom ,, is way to much in this economy, even though we can afford it , it was a one time thing for us, felt like we were burning money. Going to St. Pete, in 2 weeks, Hard Rock is owned by Lowe's hotels, made sure we aren't staying at Lowe's hotel that is there.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColbyDean
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the hard rock in orlando right on univeral studio property it was absoulutely wonderful. The staff were so accomodating anything at anytime food was great. The best was no wait in any line at the parks being you were staying there. We will stay there again when we vacation in florida. Great hotel nice people anything you could ever ask for. Hard rock is awesom not enough great things can be said. Cool pool outside with entertainment everynight. Three restaurants on site grt food. Go for it you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: romoKildare_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. The location was fabulous and we had no complaints about anything. The staff were very helpful and when called for problem with the safe responded very quickly. We stayed on the 3rd level (reception level) and loved this. We didn't need to use elevators at all. As other reviewers have said, the express pass can not be over emphasised. I thought this would be like the disney fastpass system, but it is so much better. We sailed up to the top of each queue. If we return to Orlando, which I hope we do, we will definitely stay at the Hard Rock Hotel. My only downside would be the fitness room, which is very small, and had some equipment not working.l

Reviews.Title: “Not 100% satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Famlef
Reviews.Content: What others discribed about the location and the hotel itself is mostly right. The only extra remark that I would give is that breakfast as forseen (if you take it) is nothing special. No cheese, no ham. Only sweet American stuff which I didn't like as an European. I can not call this a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth money”
Reviews.Author: chazrc
Reviews.Content: The bed was very hard and uncomfortable, the food mediocre, and the pool not nearly as big as pictured on the website. $525.00 for one night . That included the room, lunch by the pool, and coffee in the room the next morning. Did not include dinner, parking fees, and various other costs. We wont stay there again. It was very noisy in the hallways late at night with kids running up and down, and the pool water had very bad smell. Thanks,

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome”
Reviews.Author: WhenAreWeThere!
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 7th Floor Club Level during Christmas/New Year Holiday. With teenage sons this is the only hotel in Orlando to stay - great pool, close to parks, STAFF amazing and instantly sons made some cool friends. They and the parents just love thje HRH - especially the Front of Line Passes for both parks. The only downside about our 4 day stay was the on-going construction work on the refurbished Club Room. This was appauling project management not to have completed before the festive season. Having to cram into a ground floor meeting room with people spilling out into the corridor. NO PRIOR NOTIFICATION WAS GIVEN ABOUT THIS WORK and NO REAL APOLOGY. The new Club Room looked cool (brief look as construction workers recovered the entire room with plastic after it failed an inspection - further delaying opening), however, cant wait to return and use it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience outweighs the high price”
Reviews.Author: loveisbliss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March with my friend. Both of us really enjoyed the property and especially the pool. We had a full week of 85 degrees and just loved laying around such a beautiful pool. The staff were always most helpful - from front desk, concierge, and restaurant staff. The room was adaquate. Not amazing, but I knew that when I booked it. I was really here for the convenience of location and the use of the front of the line pass. However, I can say that in March this pass was not even necessary. I just came back from another trip to Universal over July 4th weekend and I really wish I had stayed on site then and got that priviledge! Breakfast in the Kitchen was probably the best that I have ever had! We ate there twice and didn't mind paying the $20. My biggest gripe was that we rented a car for one day and because I had parked it in their lot for two hours, I was charged the daily lot fee of $22. My rental on the car for the day was only $45! And one note regarding the rental - on site property will only rent hybred cars and that was a real trip to learn how to drive! Thankfully they go out and give you a lesson before you leave with the vehicle! Next year I am returning to Orlando with my family and instead of paying a lower rate to stay off property like I just did, I would absolutely return to one of the Universal hotels like I had in March. The location and the express pass is certainly well worth the extra dollars. Hope that this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mouse10Norwich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days in June. We had a room on the 6th Floor. Staff are very friendly, we had a problem with the in room safe and someone came and fixed it within 10 minutes of calling them. Rooms are comfortable and quite spacious. We had no trouble with noise from other guests as has been reported. Food and drink quite expensive but there is a Golden Corall 5 minutes away which we used quite a bit. Pool is a bit shallow, but i am over 6 feet and could swim around in most areas. Car park is a rip off, $15 a day so budget for this. The parks are within a 10 minute stroll through some lovely gardens, although it was 95 degrees each day which made walking difficult! They were late cleaning the rooms some days, it was 7.30pm one day, which was a pain as after a day in the parks you just want to relax and get your feet up. However the cleaning staff were all friendly and did a very good job. There is a laundry room where my wife spent a happy afternoon and reported it was good value. Probably the highlight of her stay! There is free WIFI in the lobby area, but a charge if you want to use it in your room. I would definately stay here again if I was to return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not completely impressed but the LOCATION is THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: bdostal
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we have been to some REALLY great hotels in the past, AND some terrible ones. This one was AVERAGE....except for the location. If you are wanting to be within a 5 minute walk (or free boat ride or "gratuity only " rickshaw ride) away from Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure, and City Walk, then this is the place to be. It is in the middle of it all. But given the price of about $200/night?? I was a little disappointed. The room was pretty clean, but had this sticky spot on the carpet, right in the middle of the floor that I seemed to hit EVERY time I walked through the room...gross! Who knows what it was that was SO sticky it could stop you in your tracks? The decor was kinda nice, room kinda small, view of the parking lot with a patch of grass and trees, okay. The pool rocked...zero grade entry...live music...fun for the kids with the waterslide...never heard the underwater music, though. We stayed for 3 nights...one of the bathroom rugs disappeared on day two...the other on day three...it bothered me to have to stand on bare ceramic tile in the bathroom so I called down and asked for our bathroom rugs to be replaced. They sent bathmats. I asked for the two original comfy white rugs that we originally had...they DID find some and brought them promptly. The remote was missing, too, BIG deal for my husband...they brought one within half an hour...but then we couldn't get the MAJOR networks?? WARNING!!! IF YOU HAVE CHILDREN MAKE SURE TO SET PARENTAL LOCKS... HBO and all kinds of evening shows are available with the push of a button!! BTW...breakfast buffet is AMAZING!!! at the Kitchen Rest. on the 1st floor! ANYTHING you would want for breakfast, good service, etc. but we had VOUCHERS for free breakfast every morning...don't know the actual price. Also...we checked in on Thurs. night....end of the month..HUGE concert in the LOBBY...it was WARRANT the eighties band that sings "Cherry Pie". Loud, chaotic, forced to valet park...not the best time to arrive with a 4 and 6 yr. old! PLUS it costs $15 to self park (per night) or $22 for valet...COMPLETE RIP OFF!! So, to sum things up...we were there on a FREE all inclusive trip through my husbands company with our 4 and 6 yr. old. The location is INCREDIBLE...but the rest...just adequate. I would have come away feeling disappointed if I had spent the regular price of $200/night for a room that we spent VERY little time in, and was just mediocre. Hope this helps, and if you like the way I review, see my summary of Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. We just came back home today from there! Happy Traveling!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the Fast Pass alone”
Reviews.Author: saffstar
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is beautiful, spacious and packed with memorabilia. There's also a nice little gift shop selling Hard Rock clothing and gifts as well as some other clothing brands (at suprisingly reasonable prices). The shop also sells essential items such as soft drinks, bottle openers and painkillers. Our room was fine, nothing much to write home about but it was a decent size and immaculate. The flat screen tv was a nice touch (having HBO was even better!) and the Keurig coffee was very nice. Some reviews have mentioned a noise problem at the hotel, we had no problems at all with this; we stayed on the 5th floor overlooking the pool and 95% of the time, while we were in the room, we could have been the only people in the hotel it was so quiet. The pool area was fabulous. On week days it was quiet with no queues for the slide but it was packed on Saturday afternoon. As some other reviews have pointed out, you can't really swim in the pool as it's only 4ft 6ins at it's deepest point, but then it's a 'fun' area, not a fitness one. There is an adults only spa pool (as well as one for all ages) unfortunately, we found the water just a little too hot to stay in for more than a couple of minutes! Loved the slide, the volleyball court and the 'beach'. The underwater sound system worked brilliantly - sometimes you could actually hear the music better underwater than over. We missed the dive-in movies but did manage to catch some live music around the pool, which was very pleasant and not too loud or overbearing. Drinks from the beach club were fairly pricey when compared with UK prices, at $21.95 for two beers, but this seemed to be fairly average around Orlando and included an 18% gratuity. The service from the bar staff was excellent - there's nothing quite like lying in the pool on a baking hot day and having a friendly face delivering you ice cold drinks at regular intervals! We travelled as a group of adults - I know that some 'adults only' parties have complained about loud and out of control children at the hotel; maybe we were just lucky but we didn't notice this at all. There were lots of children around the pool at the weekend and they made normal levels of 'kid noise' but I really don't see children playing as a problem. The hotel grounds were my favourite aspect of the whole place. Lush, perfectly maintained and teeming with wildlife (lizards, squirrels, butterflies and birds) the five minute walk to the parks was an absolute pleasure. When wandering the gardens, it's so peaceful that it's very easy to forget that you're so close to thousands of tourists. There is a free water taxi from the hotel to City Walk. These run about every 20 minutes and are a very pleasant way to travel athough it's probably quicker for most people to walk instead. All hotel guests can use their room keys to pay for food, drink and shopping in the parks and at City Walk - this is great as it means you don't have to carry cash or credit cards around with you. More importantly, your room key also acts as a free, unlimited fast pass into all the rides and shows throughout your stay - this undoubtedly saved us hours of queueing in sizzling hot temperatures and meant we were able to pack so much more into our days. It's almost worth staying at a resort hotel just for this! I can't comment on the hotel restaurants as we didn't use them (too much choice elsewhere!). The only real downside was that we didn't have a car. When we'd been to Orlando previously, we had only had a car for part of our stay but didn't have any problems as we were at an I-Drive hotel with easy access to the I-Ride trolley and free hotel shuttles to all the parks. As Universal is a fair distance away from I-Drive, we ended up paying quite a lot for taxis (the heat made it almost unbearable to walk most of the time). Although we didn't go to Disney, if we'd wanted to we obvoiusly wouldn't have had the advantage of the free Disney shuttles operated by many of the non-Universal hotels. Although Hard Rock charges $16 a day for parking, I'd say it's worth paying for the convenience of being able to travel where and when you please. Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “MUST READ!!! IF GOING TO UNIVERSAL & ISLANDS OF ADVEN.”
Reviews.Author: Mady35
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend just recently came back from orlando.. We stayed at the onsite hotel. Hard rock hotel, it was incredible, not to mention the keys to the room allowed us to by pass all the lines at both parks!!... we thought we weren't gonna be able to ride all the rides; being because we did both park in one day!.. boy were we wrong!. We arrvie at the park by 9:00 rode all the rides and saw the shows we wanted, finish by 4:30!!!!!!!! (But do keep in mind it was just the two of us, may vary for a family with kids.........) the hotel was very nice & clean and reasonable price for the restaurants. they offered transportation to and back to the parks so i never used my car excpet for arrving and leaving....the following day we did Disney Quest!! I personally didnt like it, we spend $80 for the 2 of us!. it allowed you to leave and enter the building for that day. my boyfriend is 23 he loved it ,i guess its because he's a kid at heart :). i personally think they over price it way too much!!, but there are many games!!! but not what i expected. ... hope this helps!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable 15 night stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyVisitor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Hard rock for 15 nights in June 2009. It is an excellent hotel that I would recommend. The following are the good and the bad points we encountered GOOD Location - This hotel is a few hundred yards from the original Universal studios attraction which can be easily walked to, has a complimentary boat to every 20 minutes and has some guys on bikes who will drive you around for a tip Very nice hotel, very well equipped, no real complaints about facilities, a large pretty (shallow) pool very suitable for children. Believe it or not this hotel is very suitable for children! Staff are very helpful, friendly and professional If you stay at a universal hotel your room card gets you to the front of the line at all the theme park rides. This is invaluable. Please note entry to the parks is not normally inclulded in the room price BAD Many of the rooms are adjoining by a flimsy door that does little to keep the sounds out from your neighbours rooms. One night I could hear a woman having a very pleasant stay. Another night a lot of children appeared to be having a squaling party. Another night I actually had to phone security and complain when a guest decided to practice his guitar playing very loudly at 2am waking up both my wife and I. I complained the next day to the management who somehow ensured it did not happen again. The pool - Very pretty but is not much more than 3 feet deep anywhere, great for young children but virtually useless for anyone above 5 feet tall. We normally stay at the royal pacific, and very slightly prefer the RP, but I was really impressed with the Hard Rock and would recommend it. I have also stayed in many other local hotels, including Disney's Port Orleans and motel 6's Quality Inn plaza etc. You should expect the likes of RP and Hard Rock to be better than these cheaper hotels, and you would not be dissapointed. Very impressed by all the staff, they were some of the friendliest and most helpful I have ever met

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Fast Passes made the stay well worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: missersue
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay with our annual pass and got a great rate. We made our reservations the night before arriving and we were worried that when we got there our rooms wouldn't be ready. They promised us if our rooms weren't ready they would hold our bags so we could go ahead and go to the parks and they would inform us when our rooms were available. Luckily we didn't have to use this service, we arrived at 12:30 pm and they were all ready for us. We were in a party of 13 with three rooms and they made sure that we had two rooms connecting and our third room was right across the hall. The staff went above and beyond our expectations, pampering us at every turn. In the late afternoon there was a typical Florida thunderstorm and when we went back to the hotel from the parks there was someone waiting at the entrance to give us towels to dry off. They have restaraunts onsite, as well as several at City Walk. The kids ordered pizza from room service which arrived quickly and was delicious. There are paths that lead directly to the entrance of Universal and it only takes about 5 minutes to walk and they also have rickshaw drivers to pick you up and drop you off and all you need to pay them is a reasonable tip. They also have free water taxis that take you directly to City Walk that run about every 10 to 15 minuttes. By far the most wonderful thing about our rooms were the Fast Pass priviliges you get with your room keys. This alone was worth the extra money we paid for the hotel room. When we priced them at the park out of curiousity we found that having that privilige makes the room very reasonable. Not only can you use them at both parks, they are unlimited, unlike the ones you purchase at the parks which can only be used to ride the rides once and are only good for one day. We had many jealous looks from people standing in the long lines while they watched us bypass them all. The longest line we stood in was 20 minutes and that was for the front seat of a roller coaster, the typical wait was at the most 10 minutes and we didn't have to many waits that long. You also have the luxury of shopping while on site and just showing your room key to the clerk to have your packages sent directly to the hotel. We have stayed in many hotels in Orlando going to the various theme parks and this was by far the best stay we have ever had. The combination of the Hard Rock Hotel, Universal Theme Parks and City Walk is one you just can't beat. At the end of our stay we asked for a late check out and they let us stay until 12:30 and once we left the room they took our bags and stored them for us and we were able to go back to the park and continue to use our Fast Passes and at the end of the day we had a quick dip in the pool and then called for our bags. The staff quickly helped us load up and still treated us like royalty. When we go back again this is the only place we will stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock ?? More like School House Rock”
Reviews.Author: Abby A
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times, always on business, just because its convenient and familiar- but each time its more like a summer camp and this trip is even worse than before....We are here now, its 6pm and the lobby is full of screaming kids running around and their lazy parents doing nothing about it. The pool is a C.F. from sunup to midnight.....this is NOT for young couples, or anyone who doesn't want to be around kids of all ages....they run up and down the halls at all hours.. The Hotel itself is great, the food is excellent and the staff are mostly on top of things....rooms are nice, clean and well equipped. The location is perfect if you are going to visit Universal City Walk, there are many great places to eat and the boats that take you back and forth run every 10-15 minutes.... The water pressure in the rooms is THE BEST.......and Housekeeping is doing a great job... But, back to the kids......it's not their fauilt they have such bad manners,. but don't expect the parents to change while on "vacation".....any time I've gottten on or off an elevator, some 13-16 yr old boy is shoving his way past me-or some 3 year old in underfoot.....and NOBODY cares...there is no adults only area at the pool so you may want to visit the neighboring Portofino which is MUCH nicer for relaxation and has some great places to eat too It''s not a very hip crowd either......very midwestern, dads with Mullets, tank tops and bad tatttoos, overweight moms with bratty kids and weary expressions....you get the picture....it's a shame too as this could be such a great hotel for the right crowd..... oh...and $16 a night to SELF PARK, no other option other than Valet which is more

Reviews.Title: “Family Suite should be called Family SWEET! Unbelievable stay...we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Cantrell
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel Orlando at Universal Studios is probably one of my families favorite hotels in the state of Florida. We've stayed in nearly every category room with the exception of the Graceland Suite, but our last visit was the best ever. We were able to secure one of their infamous "Family Suites" which is hands down one of the best kid friendly hotel rooms we've ever stayed in. The entire "bedroom" that is attached to the room is for the KIDS. There is even a separate entrance to the bathroom from the kids room & a kids sized sink! When you add this great room with one of the best pools in Orlando (12,000 sq ft with underwater music & a water slide...does it get much better?) You get one of the best hotels in Orlando. If you are staying at Universal...this is the BEST hotel on property....much much better than Portofino Bay in my opinion. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good atmosphere - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wh1stler
Reviews.Content: Overall very positive stay. Any time you were in the lobby area or bar areas day or night the atmosphere was very lively. Everyone was very friendly including the overnight concierge who checked us in upon arrival. Hotel has a beautiful pool and 2 hot tubs including 1 that is adult only. The bar/food area by the pool was fairly standard but did allow us to bring in our own alcohol in plastic cups to sit by the pool. Food was decent as well. Theme parks are within walking distance of the hotel (Universal Studios). Very big plus. Only downside was the weather the week I stayed. The pool/hot tub area was closed multiple times over the week and did not re open if the weather did clear. Also, the internet connection was basically unusable - for a business traveler and for the cost - it was a waste of money. Overall very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, fun property...Look forward to returning!”
Reviews.Author: ARKevin
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive before checking-in because of previous reviews regarding cleanliness and noise levels. I am happy to say that neither concern proved to be an issue. The Hard Rock Hotel is a beautiful property and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. I purchased a package through Universal Studios website that included theme park tickets and a reduced room rate. I had a garden view room that really didn't offer much of a view because it was obstructed by trees but that was fine as we did not stay here to look out the window. The pool is awsome and offers many shaded areas and yes you *can* hear music under water.
