We had lunch by the pool two times during our stay...The menu selection consists of sandwiches and salads which are delicious...prices are around $12 dollars for sandwiches which include salads, fruit or fries...an 18% gratuity is automatically added to the bill. The pool wait staff are very friendly and attentive...breakfast at The Kitchen is great but pricey...$16.95 for an all you can eat buffet. The Express Pass feature is FANTASTIC! Simply show your room key at any attraction in the parks and you bypass the regular lines...this feature alone is worth the price of staying on property. One other point....the beds are very firm...I found them to be comfortable but it is a point worth mentioning. Also, self parking is $15 dollars a day payable directly to the hotel when you check-in. (I hated that but what are you gonna do?) Would I go back? Yes indeed. Last year we stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian resort and the Hard Rock measures up nicely and even exceeds Disney's level of service. Yes I said it...I love Disney but they could learn a thing or two about service and friendliness from the staff at the Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun! Convenient to the Parks”
Reviews.Author: StarfishandSeashells
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the Universal property. It's in a beautiful location which, due to the landscaping, makes it feel secluded. Upon arrival, the bell hops are hopping and friendly. Valet is $22 per night and self-parking is $15. The hotel sits on a hill, and the parking lots are at the bottom on either side of the hotel. This means self-parking will require you to take a huge flight of stairs. So unload baggage before parking or have the bell hops drive down in an extended golf cart to assist if you want to tip. There is no elevator to the parking lot. Check in on a Monday afternoon was quick and friendly. We arrived around 2 and check in was not until 4. The girl said she would put a "rush" on our room and call us if we wanted to go to the pool. We did that and recieved a call at 3. Our room was very nice. LG flat screen TV, CD player, and iPod dock. Modern look with framed black and whites of musicians. We had poolview on the 6th floor which was great. The beds were very comfy with good pillows and down comforters. There was a table with two chairs and a comfortable chair and ottoman. There was also a coffee bar and mini fridge, but I believe it was locked. The coffee maker was the one cup Keurig. Internet service was $9.95 per day. The bathroom was nice because it had a sink and counter top outside the bathroom as well as a regular wall mount sink inside the bathroom. Both sinks had mirrors. And the one in the bathroom also had a small glass shelf mounted above it. The shower had great pressure. The tile floors were big, green tiles, not your normal hotel tile. There were spa type bath products. I couldn't find shampoo and conditioner anywhere, so called housekeeping. They came immediately with a small bag full. Once I entered the shower, I found it on a small corner shelf. We ordered room service one morning, which was fast and good. The breakfast buffet is $16.95 per adult and $10.95 for children. We did not try it. There were several restuarants in the hotel, and one was out by the pool. The pool was large with a water slide. There was a kiddie pool, a hot tub, an adult only hot tub, and several areas with water spraying for small children to play. The towel hut was on the way down to the pool, so grab one as you go. There were plenty of lounge chairs, some in shady areas and many in full sun. Some were even in white sand. Music was playing, but not too loud to make a cell phone call. The music was also piped underwater. There was poolside entertainment throughout the day for the kids. The first night they put out an inflatable screen and showed The Karate Kid. The second night there was a DJ who did fun games and interactions with the kids. He gave them mini inflatable guitars and did a girls vs boys rock out. Then he pulled out large inflatable guitars and called up moms and dads. There was also a hair wrap/gift shop cabana in the pool area as well. One great feature was that the pool stayed open until midnight. And although we had poolview, we could not hear the pool noise from our room. In the pool area there was a gate which leads to trails, beautifully landscaped wide sidewalks, taking you directly to Universal's main gate, City Walk, and Islands of Adventure. There was also a water taxi and pedicab available. The water taxi was free and the pedicab drivers worked strictly by tips. There were benches along the canal throughout the trails. And there was a butterfly garden near the water taxi area. Being able to walk/ride to the parks and come back and forth to the room and pool during the day was so much better than staying off-property. Definitely worth the extra money. And with teenage boys, it was great for them to be able to come and go all day on their own. Having a Fast Pass (room key) for the parks was probably the best part of all. The room key also allows you to charge to your room and send packages from the parks back to the hotel. Check out was 11, but the granted us 12:30 when I called to inquire about late check out. The room key continues to work as a Fast Pass and continues to grant access to the pool and self-parking lot throughout the day after check out.

Reviews.Title: “So-So.... Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: pbobonis
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my teenage daughter, my 22 year old daughter, my husband and I. I stayed, because my 15 year old wanted to stay here. She loved it, I liked it, but it's too boisterous for my taste, too many people running around. I loved all the Rock Memorabilia. It's too expensive for the small rooms, and they even charge for the parking, the use of the gym. The best part for us was being able to use to room key for the parks, and not having to do the long lines. Would I stay here again. No... I would probably purchase the Express Pass better. My daughters enjoyed the pool, I did not use it, since we have a pool at home, I really don't go into public pools at all.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Day's Inn”
Reviews.Author: Wine_and_Foody
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference at the Orlando Convention Center. I arrived to loud pounding music in the lobby where a party was taking place, which is OK if you're invited to the party, but not so much fun when you can't hear the receptionist at check in. The rooms are pretty ordinary, with small unexciting bathrooms. I call it a Glorified Day's Inn because I would equate the quality of the rooms with a Day's Inn, while the lobby and bar are essentially a Hard Rock Cafe with the usual rock star paraphernalia. I did not get a chance to try out the pool or other leisure areas, so if you are here on vacation, you may have a different take on the hotel. One of the biggest problems I had with the hotel was that the wireless in the room was so slow that I could not send large documents over the internet, and the hard-wired ethernet in my room did not work at all. The one redeeming feature of the hotel was the Palm Restaurant and bar (the bartender Tracy is great). I generally dislike staying in Orlando for business (and am unlikely to visit for pleasure), but even given that there are other hotels that I would prefer in Orlando, such as the JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing, amazing”
Reviews.Author: monroe8
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on may 5th 2009 for 7 nights on our honeymoon, never been to orlando before, the hotel is just amazing,the drive up to it is the start of it, lovely entrance, and there are bell boys to open your taxi door and take your luggage, our room had 2x king size beds and they were really comfortable, the room was lovely and modern, the bathroom had double vanity units, and was huge, they had a tea/coffee machine in your room, and a mini bar, flat screen tv as well, we were very impressed with the room, the hotel is beautiful and the pool is unbelievable, really big with a slide going into it,. it has a side with sand so its like a beach, they also have a life guard on all day, the pool area was beautiful and they had a beach bar and the waitresses came round were you sat and brought you your drinks or food, the food from the beach bar was great we ate there loads of times and they give so much food its hard to eat ! the kitchen restaurant breakfast are to die for anything you want they have, couldnt rave enough about this hotel, and the best thing about it is , you walk out the side gate and there is a water taxi that takes you over to universal studios and city walk, it runs all day up untill2am its really good and its free, we couldnt believe it was so close yo universal, literally 5 mins walk through lovely gardens and paths where you pass the odd squirrell ! its so close in islands of adventure we got soaked on one of the water rides and we went back to the hotel to get changed it was so handy , plus is universal and islands of adventure we showed our room key and we got to the top of the queues which was brillant and a free bonus to us! def wouldnt hesitate to go back to this hotel its unbeliavble, i couldnt fauly one thing about it ! th staff were great, we walked to get the iride to bring us to international drive, we walked i would say 10 mins and the iride just stopped at the bottom , its good because you pay a daily pass for a few dollars and you can hop of and on, then we got a taxi back from int drive and it was only like $5 .

Reviews.Title: “Big Loud and Flash”
Reviews.Author: loopyloo22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in May. Best thing was the Fast pass access to the Universal Parks but by day 4 we were all flagging as we had covered every single ride and attraction at least once ( and many a lot more). Due to the weather we ended up in hotel for couple of evenings and felt there wasnt really anywhere just to sit and spend time with the children as they were not alowed in the bar ( but perhaps its not designed for that sort of thing). Overall though would not hesitate to go back

Reviews.Title: “The best 3-star hotel you will ever stay in.”
Reviews.Author: Floops56
Reviews.Content: My wife had booked us to stay there for a week as we were going to view a shuttle launch. We were both looking forward to our stay and so wanted the hotel to be something special. The good things about the hotel are very good indeed. Firstly the location. Second to none. The room keys doubled as express passes in both Universal and Islands. This saved so much time in the ques. But what not a lot of people are aware of is they also get priority seating at most of the restraunts in City walk during the evenings. This again gives you more time to enjoy the place. We only found Bubba Gumps did not take part in this.The Gardens and the walk down to the city walk was wonderful. Just one thing, it is next to water and the noises you can hear being made by the creatures in the undergrowth after dark are not the squirrels. So no flip floops at night, or better yet take the water taxi. We also had no problems with the cleaniness of the room. Also the beds were supremly comfortable. That said it leds me on to my first area of criticism. 2 double beds is not what i would call 5 star treatment. We did enquire if rooms were available with bigger sizes only to be told that this was standard and we would have to pay for any upgrade.The room itself while being very stylish was let down by a number of things. No dvd player in the room, the electrical cables behind the appliances were a mess. Not Sure if I would let small children roam the floor. Any other 5 star we stayed at these would nrmally be wired in ( the cables, not the children.) The plumbing was terrible and very noisy. Every shower taken, toilet flushed or sinked filled, not only the rooms either side of us, but also above us, we would hear it. I am a light sleeper, however my wife is not and she was woken several time each and every night by this noise. My wife also informed me that one morning the sink filed with a dark brown liquid from the plug hole only to drain away again almost instantly. I never witnessed this, so I wonder if it happened regularly. The layout of the bathrooms is not to clever also. For some reason a dividing wall is at an odd angle. This just complicates the ergonomics of the available space. Trust me it sounds petty but every time i turned to reach for the toilet roll just reminded of the short comings. Also no walk in shower instead an over the bath type? Other things that just drop this place is having to rent the in-room fridge $15 a day. No complimentary car parking, again $15 daily. Plastic cups for the coffee in the room, not very polished. And the hotel claims to be trying to be green and the still use disposable cups? No bathrobes or slippers in the rooms, again what should be a given for a 5 star. The worst and possibly the smallest hotel room safe ever. But the clincer for me was the staff. Most just appeared to not bother. At the pool in 97 degree heat we waited for some service. The girl walk past our spot 3 times before I had to go the bar. We even tried calling her over, no joy. Most seemed to be having to good a time with each other to worry about the guests. I know thats not fair on all the staff, some were very good and were very attentive to or needs, but the bad one more than compensated for the good ones. I know it sounds bad, but this hotel just let itself down. It has great potential if only the managment and staff would allow it to meet it, it truly would be something special. That said I think you will have to go very far indeed to find a better 3 star hotel anywhere in the world. Then again you still pay the 5 star hard rock price.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Aliog
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night to take advantage of the Express Pass at IOA. We were upgraded for free to a pool view room which was a good start, as was the fact that we were able to check into our room at 9am before going onto IOA. The grounds are stunning - you can forget that the rest of Orlando (not the most charming of cities) exists. As it turned out IOA wasn't all that crowded the day we visited - the longest queues without the Express Pass were only about 20 mins, but it was still nice to queue jump and we rode all the big rides several times. The thing that I absolutely loved about the hotel though was the pool with the outdoor music - just my taste. It wasn't at all busy so was able to relax in my own private area near the spa while the music played. CityWalk was quite entertaining. We were there on May 5th so there was a big thing going on at the Salsa restaurant - a bit lively for us so we settled on a burger & ribs at the sports bar. My only criticism is that they charge you $15 a night to park there. If you're paying that much for a room, the least they could do is throw the parking in for free. I wish we could have a stayed for one more night. If I ever come back to Orlando I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dangeorge1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Orlando for a few nights over the Easter break. It was our second stay here and we were as pleased as we were the first time! The hotel was very busy but we still received fabulous service and the facilities could cope with the full capacity in the hotel. The room was on the 3rd floor just up the corridor from the gift shop which we were a little concerned about at first but it wasn't noisy and was fine. The room was large, spotless and beautiful decor, we had really good room service and the porters and valet staff were excellent even though the hotal was full. We put our son in Camp Little Rock for 2 hrs one night ($15/hr pricey but worth it) and he loved it! While he was in there we had a meal in "The Kitchen" it was fabulous and I had the best dessert ever. The pool area is amazing with a sandy beach, slide and loads to do. If you have yound children or teenagers they will not want to leave - we had to drag our 6 yr old to the theme parks as he wanted to stay and swim! Overall - yes the hotel is pricey (and you have to pay $15 per day to park you car which I don't agree with) but apart from that you get what you pay for and the standard is excellent. Best hotel we've stayed in Orlando by a mile - Love it, love it, love it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What elso to write...”
Reviews.Author: martinmatousek
Reviews.Content: Another great review about Hard Rock Orlando, this place is really hard to beat. Has everything, great theme, amazing pool, incredible location ( for theme park lovers ), helpfull efficient staff and big rooms. Can only recommended ! But be carefull...everything in Hard Rock is pricey and staying here does not come cheap, but ...who cares, we need to save the economy, so...lets' spend your money and have great time! It's worth it! ( even I will pay back my credit card another two months .-))) )

Reviews.Title: “man i expected more!”
Reviews.Author: clydester
Reviews.Content: when you walk in to the lobby the reception area wasn't to long of a wait. the room was ok not great or wow, maybe this is where they put the people paying the floridians rate. the bed(Queens) had torn sheets and was as comfortable as sleeping on a sack of hay layed over a rock,the pillows where so soft you had to put a another rock undernieth it so you wouldn't sink down. onward to the facilaties, its pretty neat looking at all of the memorabielia . food was VERY good at the palms and the service was a perfect 10! but if you want good food go for a little drive to international drive and there is a bunch of places to eat and not to far from the hotel. we decided to stay untill the morning late check out was granted and we slep in a little, packed and went the eat at the kitchen. the "cook" making omlettes was RUDE,IN A BAD MOOD,OR JUST DIDNT CARE. we asked what he had to make an ommlette he said he had "everything" he just pointed to a half made "display" of onoins,peppers and tomatoes. nothing else, we didnt know what kind of meats he had,yes we asked..the response was a very cold NO,,asked about another type no etc... you get the drift. well needless to say no omlette for me . on to the pool area. which was nice sun and shade, we ordered 2 adult drinks and 2 sodas plus an order of nachos $71.00 !!! $20.00 for one adult drink!!!! i came... i saw. i wont go back lesson learned. there are nicer hotels on universal property this one is off my list.

Reviews.Title: “Rock and Roll !!!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle12Uk
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant. Stayed here for two weeks in April. Seasoned traveller to Florida and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Have nothing to moan or whinge about..very busy as it was easter school holidays. Service excellent and I want to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Over the years, service, staff and cleanliness has gone down.”
Reviews.Author: afeeoo
Reviews.Content: Dear future customers of Hard Rock Hotel, Arrival On upon our arrival we checked in and pulled our own luggages to the room, there was no one outside to greet us. Our first room given to us was the 1st floor off of the entry way to the pool and resturant called Kitchen. My husband and I noticed a mildew smell mixed with cigerettes, we knew right away we could not stay in this room for the 7 day stay. We made our way back up to the the front desk and asked for another room and question why such an odor. He admitted that the main floor was recently cleaned since they no longer allow smoking in the rooms. I found it very rude not to inform parents with children before placing us there. Why would I want to subject my family to this when we are not smokers? Service Our room was cleaned once out of our 7 day stay. We had to call the front desk to ask for towels and for someone to come clean. The towels showed up but not the housekeeper to clean. At the pool we were told we can not bring our own snacks into the pool area and they asked to take our bag away. NO where in the hotel it states that we can not bring snacks of our own in and we did notice plenty of other snackers. My son has asthma and severe food allergies. We carry his special snacks and asthma medications in the bag. I carry my bag for the sake of an emergency, my sons emergency and this young waitress wanted to take my bag and store it for me until I leave the pool area. I informed her very quickly as to why we have this bag and she still continued on with the rules. The rules varied from person to person. The waitress looked young and immature desperate for tips. Overall The Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando is run by teens/young immature adults. Horrible management equals horrilbe stay. If you want to hear the people next door get up and shower in the morning, loud noise throughout the night, hard bed to sleep on, a dirty and dusty room, to call for clean towels every day, and pay close to $300 a night for this service, this is the hotel for you. LOL! PS I would have gotten a better customer service at a local motel.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean, pricy”
Reviews.Content: my wife and i went to the hard hard rock for four nights. we went just to get away for a few days from phila. i am not a music fan, but my wife knows every number sung or played by anybody. anyway, the hotel is very nice and the music was not as bad as i thought it would be. on arrival we were upgraded to club level after having booked a pool view room. the total room cost was $363.00 including tax, per night. the room was extra clean with a king bed, pull out sofa and two chairs, as well as a large bathroom, room safe, and all the extras that go with the club level booking. these extras are very nice and while not necessary, do make your stay much more enjoyable. while we did not pay the club level rate, it is probably worth what it would cost. the staff at this hotel is outstanding. housekeeping did a great job. any questions were answered by everyone and everybody was super friendly. the pool area is large, plenty of towels are available, and the area is clean. the pool is shallow and the days we were there it was jambed with kids. (that,s what this place is all about) the problem is not the kids. it is the parents that don't supervise the kids. this isn't the fault of the hotel or the park. parents are what they are. some great, some good, some fair, and some have no clue. anyway, the pool is a lively place. the pool bar is a fun place and the tenders do a great job. the restaurants at the hotel are ok. the hotel bar is fine. the drinks at all the bars are overpriced (as most hotel drinks are) baileys on the rocks is &1700 at the pool bar a 18% gratuity is added, (no problem) but at the hotel this is not done. i tip more than 18%most of the time but i don"t understand why this is on some bills and not on others. the boat taxi to the parks run often and are free. the parks are what they are. citiwalk is the wildwood n.j boardwalk downsized. all in all this is a fun place to stay. a bit overpriced, but the friendly staff make up for this. disney is down the road and is probably better. however, if one has been to disney it is worth a shot to try universal and the hard rock.

Reviews.Title: “Teens and tweens”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaAugusta
Reviews.Content: Many fun pool activities for teens and tweens. Be prepared to have lots of fun and blow lots of cash!

Reviews.Title: “nice room without a view and great service at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: JohnT.tn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip where I spent a few nights at the Hard Rock. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. The view out of the window was the back of a service tent and the pool music could be heard in the room until it closed around midnight. The air conditioning did not work well, and I couldnt get the temperature down to a comfortable level - but I did not bring it up or give the staff a chance to fix it. The conceirge was very helpful, and took as much time as was necessary with us. I never felt rushed by staff. All in all I would stay there again. The location is great, you can walk to Universal walk which has several bars and places to eat. of note the business center is only open certain days of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the RESORT FEES”
Reviews.Author: AnnieOrlandoFL
Reviews.Content: Just an FYI to anyone considering staying here the resort fee that the hotel is charging is $30!! And if you have a car it's $30 per car! We live locally but decided to spend the weekend at the park so overnighted here and were not told until check out about these fees. (They ended up dropping the charges but be aware they don't mention any of it when you book the room rate.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...............”
Reviews.Author: YellowMeteor
Reviews.Content: Lovely setting and grounds. Large themed pool is only about 3ft deep at it's deepest, which makes it VERY frustrating - beautiful warm pool too shallow to swim in. Not as much shade as others I have visited (unless you pay extra for a cabana). No fridge to keep my coke tins cool. Would stay again using a package (which included express pass for Universal and park entrance),but not otherwise. Room felt a little crowded with 4 people (when compared to other hotels with the 4of us in). We were surprised to be charged for parking, when I didn't see that mentioned on the web site.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel, great stay, great place!”
Reviews.Author: WVClairenmaddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel March 14-while a bit pricey I would say it's first class, comfortable, clean and has a lovely pool area. We loved the perk of the express pass so we could bypass the long lines at Universal. I would definitely return to this hotel. The room was spacious with a grand view of the pool. The water taxi makes it convenient to get to Universal, it's also a very quick walk. If I were to return I would recommend doing a complete package with tix included. This was a last minute decision to stay here, we had tix to the Blue Man Group and wanted to be nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break at the Hard Rock Hotel - (Club level room)”
Reviews.Author: RazorB
Reviews.Content: Great spring break trip with the family (Boys 12 & 14) to Universal and the Hard Rock Hotel (Club level) on one of Universals AAA packages. The hard rock hotel was great although we did experience the thin walls folks talked about in here previously. I am not sure if they were just drunk and talking loud late into the night, or it was after hours and everyone else was just quiet. Luckily that group checked out the next a.m. so the next 4 days were fairly good, although you can hear everything out in the hall. Luckily we were towards the end of one of the wings so did not have too much traffic outside our door. We were not given a pool view room even though requested at early booking (probably due to our package price). We we were not in the room that much so not a big deal, but would have been nice. Room was average for a supposed 4 or 5 star hotel as advertised. It was ok for the 4 of us, but nothing elaborate, or anything that makes you go WOW. Pool was beautiful though and with the parks behind it was a great view from the elevator bay on club level, so those high rooms (floors 6&7) with hotel and park views should be great. Next time I will not book the club level ( this did not seem up to the same standards at Disney), as my kids did not take advantage and we ended up eating out more than planned. The breakfast was basically a Hampton inn style with no hot food. The evening appetizers were just a couple of basic things (chicken wings, egg rolls, etc) that was not all that appetizing to be honest. Free wine and beer were ok, but kids did not want to go in there to eat, so was a waste of $$$. We never used the fitness center and internet service is not included on the club level, other than one pc that is in use most of the time in the lounge. Book a high floor swimming pool view room instead and take a cooler. Use the package savings on meals and drinks at the pool. Hotel food and drinks were fairly expensive and every restaurant and bar added an 18% tip automatically, but the atmosphere was great and my kids had a blast at the pool. They had live bands and DJ's and showed Movies or Concerts (Springsteen) on DVD at night which the kids could watch from the heated pool, beachside chairs, or from the pool bar restaurant. We ended up spending most of our time at the pool when not at the parks or Citiwalk. Overall I would probably not pay that much to stay there again, but as everyone else says, the express lines you get access to with your room key makes it worth it. Over a Spring break or holiday I would say it's the only way to go. The express passes they sell in the park are only good for 1 express ride per attraction where the room keys are as many times as you want. My boys rode the log ride and roller coasters all day at Islands of Adventure and that would not have been possible any other way with the crowds. We waited less than 5 minutes at the rides at Islands of Adventure and maybe 10 minutes at the most at Universal Studio's park. Most of the time you just walk right on. I would say the Hard Rock is a great safe place for the teenage family to stay and go to the theme parks, but once was enough for us. I doubt we go back as we just didn't feel it was quite as good as Disney. The staff at the hotel were nice, but there is a difference in the attitude and value at the parks. My wife thought it was much more noticeable than my boys and I, but after being at both places we all liked Disney better from a theme park perspective, maybe they can put in a Hard Rock Hotel over there Two last notes-- I did not think the music was overwhelming as some have written. The lobby and pool bar are rocking all day, but it was not as bad as some have made it out to be. I enjoyed the music at the pool, it kept your toes tapping ;) The other thing was the theme park hours and restaurants at the parks. They seemed to cut the hours back and several restaurants were not opened which was a bit of a bummer. I guess they did that to cut costs with this economy, but the spring break crowd looked pretty good to me with waiting lines at the restaurants that were open. Would have been nice if they would have reduced the cost of the tickets in proportion to the hours and restaurant availability. They also did not have early park entry available as advertised for hotel guests, although with the express pass was not a big deal. Just additional reasons to head back to Disney i guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break with extended family - would go back.”
Reviews.Author: 10kin
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (tween and teen) as well as grandparents spent Spring Break at the HRH on club level (7th floor). The rooms were large enough for 4 to crash comfortably and the club lounge was definitely worth it. As for club level, the food was good and it was nice having a place for all of us to hang to play cards or watch a ballgame. Lounge staff were always very helpful. Pool activities (dj, games, scavenger hunt, hula hoop contests) kept the kids busy along with the water slide. Though the hotel was near capacity, there were always seats near the pool and poolside service was excellent. Biggest plus was location. It is literally a five minute walk to the parks, which made packing snacks and bottles of water unneccessary. You can also take the water taxi or a pedicab back and forth. Between both parks, City Walk and Hard Rock (the Kitchen is a good casual onsite restaurant), we had no need for a car the entire time we were there. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Huskerfans
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and had a great pool. Also very close to City Walk and all Universal attactions. The band at Margritaville was so good we went back three nights to listen to them. My only complaint was we arrived at 2:00am because of plane troubles and no one was in the lobby. We had to use the house phone for to get someone to check us in.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: polarspeech
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Hard Rock. We had a no view room that got upgraded to a garden view on check-in. We stay here because we prefer the Universal Theme Parks. A stay at the Hard Rock gets you unlimited fast passes to all the rides in both Universal parks and the ablity to use the card for all purchases at the Universal parks. Universal will deliver your purchases to the hotel too. It's a very short walk from the hotel to Universal/Islands of Adventure. It's great if you want to take a quick break or need to get out of soaked clothes from the water rides! Restaurants are great here. There is a starbucks and icecream shoppe available downstairs. It is a wonderfully designed hotel. Shop at the Hard Rock Shop and there is the Velvet Bar. The downside to this hotel is the extra charges. Internet, fitness center, business center. You can get free internet access from the lobby though. Beds are not uncomfortable but not great. Maid service is just the bare minimum. The concierge and staff make it easy to book a ride to other theme parks. There are freebies you get to the parks and to CityWalk when you book here. Check back in frequently with reservations. I got my room cost cut over 100/night as the rates had dropped since m y first booking. They honor the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: disjunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock hotel for 3 nights in October. We checked in early in the morning and were delighted they had a room ready for us already. Bell Services escorted us to the room with our luggage, which was on the 7th floor (club level). The room was large and clean, with a fantastic view of the pool and Islands of adventure in the background. The TV had a large selection of channels, and pay per view options as well. We were located very near the club lounge which was handy for grabbing a quick drink or snack. We enjoyed breakfast and evening appetisers in the lounge, which had a decent selection of food but got very crowded at peak times. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants but ordered room service one night which was very nice. The location of the Hard Rock just can't be beat, a quick 5 minute walk and you're literally at the entrance to the studios, and the free express pass with the room key is worth it's weight in gold.

Reviews.Title: “Compared to disney resorts? Way better!”
Reviews.Author: htsec
Reviews.Content: May be the Disney deluxe resorts are better, but there price is much more expensive. It's really a classy hotel, much better then the poor All Star Movies, Music, etc. Anyway, there is a great rock feeling (you receive a CD to listen in your room), the rooms are beautiful, the pool is great (yes, there is music underwater) and The Kitchen's breakfast is pretty good too. It's only a 4 minute walk to Universal entrance. Or you can take the boat or a 3 weel bike. But there is noise, because of the teenagers arriving late night from Citiwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kthomas531
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel with a great atmosphere. However, for the price it's not the best 5 star hotel I've ever stayed. The rooms were fairly large (which was great since we had our 2 kids with us), but I was disappointed that the shower/tub area was not separate from the toilet area. I know this is being picky but I am a bathroom fanatic!! The food at the hotel is really pricey, but I guess this is what you'd expect from the "Hard Rock." This by no means in anyway would deter me from staying here again. It's absolutely in a FABULOUS location, and the fast pass to the Universal Parks is worth the stay alone. I think they've done a great job with the pool area and water slide. This is perfect after a long day at the park and the kids are still running on high octane. Another good thing about the pool area is that it doesn't close until late. Our kids absolutely loved it!! Again, not the best hotel for the money; but it is nice, and we'd stay again. If you like getting off the property, I'd recommend the IHOP right around the corner from the hotel. The entire bill for a family of 4 is what one breakfast cost you at the Hard Rock. Of course if you don't mind spending the money; the breakfast is good at the Hard Rock. And lastly, my biggest annoyance.... after paying SO-O-O-O much money to stay there, we had to pay $18/day for parking as well as wireless internet to the room. NOT TO COOL!! If you go, you'll enjoy... just know digging in the pocket never ends.....

Reviews.Title: “Number 1 Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FriskyDingo5
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Hotels I have ever been to. The atmosphere of the hotel is perfect if you're looking for to hangout and always have something to do, this is the place. From Hanging by the pool or if your smart enough to upgrade to Club 7 their will never be a dull moment. I would suggest upgrading to Club 7, you will be able to wake up and have a great breakfast. The staff in the Hotel is rocking. I must say the Concierge department is one of the best and most Knowledge I have ever met. Keep rocking, your doing it right.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok Overated”
Reviews.Author: spot36
Reviews.Content: The rooms were noisy, you could hear the other people walking up and down the hallway, opening and closing doors all night long. There was a gap under the door on both of the rooms we had, bad experience! We stayed there previously in 2000, had a good stay but the motel has went down hill since, wont stay there again. Motel management never responded to my complaint, besides that(no sleep), management, the breakfast no good, everything else is great! Will not stay there again. oh ya don't book on hotels.com they really screwed up our last trip to Florida as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Theme Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m0rrissey
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many great hotels around the country, don't bother with the negative reviews; for a theme park hotel, this is about as good as it gets. Exquisitely maintained, beautiful gardens and grounds, great pool area and perfectly located adjacent to Universal Studios and IOA. Rooms are spacious, very nicely decorated with very comfortable beds/sheets/pillows. Staff is young but friendly. Overall vibe is anti-Disney which is quite refreshing. I've stayed here when it first opened and it seems better now. Expensive, yes, but well worth it if you are looking for comfort, some luxury and convenience near the Universal parks. About the only downside is the food at the Kitchen restaurant, which is just average (but great for Orlando). Stick with the simple stuff and order sparingly as the portions are huge. In short, I would much rather stay here than at any of the premium Disney resorts.

Reviews.Title: “compared to Disney resorts?”
Reviews.Author: floridadisneyman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Jan 2nd and 3rd. If you have stayed at Disney Deluxe resorts dont even bother staying here. The hotel is not worth the money per night and the staff is not trained properly. It was great being close to the parks but compared to Disney there is no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Fun! Hassle Free! Almost Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: kjlicht
Reviews.Content: Stayed 12/29/08 - 12/31/08. Club Level ! Traveled with young children - with 5 in the room total, it was tight but doable. Concierge staff were fabulous, entertained the kids, movies by the pool, The Kitchen Restaurant - Awesome food & staff. Express Pass to avoid the lines at the parks - major draw and worth every penny! Enjoyed the continental breakfast, snacks, drinks, lite dinner, drinks in the Club Level. Check-In was slow, room not ready upon check in. Staff were friendly. Gift shop sells exclusive limited ed. t-shirts of classic rockers starting at $70 each. Recession? Poor Economy? Let me tell you, it was packed, the hotel and the parks - and even the cabanas were rented out. We had a blast - great pool, also BeachClub Restaurant is excellent too. Our request for "early" housekeeping service was not granted. Rooms were cleaned in late afternoon (like between 3-5pm) ...during my little kids naps. They give tours of the hotel and all its "displays". Overall it is still a family favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Bonus front of the line everytime!”
Reviews.Author: lynz001
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay had a great time. We arrived and were lucky the room was ready at 12:00pm. Poolview only because when we booked nothing else available. Pool view not needed. We were only in the room to sleep and change as we were out and about the rest of the time. Had the best sleep at this hotel as the heating system was very quiet which means a lot to a light sleeper. Room was nice with 2 Queens and outside sink. The best part is the fron of the line to all the rides which was worth every penny. The buffet breakfast was also great with 1/2 price for 12 and under. The pool area very nice but expensive drinks. Nice place to stay. Also nice to go back to the parks at night.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL STAFF IN ORLANDO!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYYankeeGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for the first time. We've always stayed on Disney Property at the Boardwalk or Contemporary. We've always had an ok time, but as of late felt like the staff was just going through the motions. Well... they'll never see us again over there!! The Hard Rock hotel is a blast! Besides the fact that you get to skip the lines at the parks and hear cool music everywhere you go in the hotel (including under the water in the pool!!). You're also surrounded by a bunch of awesome music memorabilla and taken care of by a staff that actually seems to enjoy their jobs! Everyone treats you like you're a guest staying at their house! "The kitchen" restaurant in the hotel is great and has amazing meatloaf and callamari! We also had a blast just hanging around and talking to the staff!! The bellhops are awesome and are really down to earth, they treated us like family! The bell captain nick even went as far as to help us plan out our trip to maximize the time we spent there! Kudos Hard Rock!!! Maybe Disney should start letting their staff grow mohawks and have piercings, then maybe they'd enjoy their jobs a little more!

Reviews.Title: “No complaint!”
Reviews.Author: thewoods25
Reviews.Content: I left my original hotel due to lack of customer service and called the Hard Rock Hotel directly seeking a 1 night stay on Dec 28. The reservation specialist was very helpful and understanding and she gave me specific details as to what was available in such short notice. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are nicely decorated. With the quality service I received the price was worth it. I've learned my lesson -- I will never sacrifice service for price anymore. My family enjoyed our 1 night stay at Hard Rock more than the 6 other nights at another resort.

Reviews.Title: “deluxe accomodations”
Reviews.Author: twji
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights before Thanksgiving with my two teenagers. Very elegant hotel!. The lobby, rooms,grounds,pool and location were impeccable. The location within Universal Studios was a huge benefit both location-wise(a short walk thru beautiful gardens along a river or a short water-taxi ride) and because we didn't wait in any lines at the park. Even though it was close to the parks you couldn't see or here them from the hotel. We visited the other on-site hotels and agreed this was the best. None of the on-site hotels seemed particularly suited to families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caitlinsdad35
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 5 nights of our 2 week vacation at the Hard Rock hotel, and this place is awesome!! The convenience of being able to fast pass everything with your room key is worth the price.(Take note Disney!) Lovely sized rooms, and a brilliant location. Would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: danaFlorida
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney but stayed here because we thought it was dog friendly. We have a dog who doesn't bark or bother anyone. We brought him to the hotel's outdoor cafe and they told us he had to be put back in our room. He wasn't allowed anywhere but the room and in a small outdoor area where he could relieve himself. This hotel was basically a glorified kennel if you have nowhere to leave your dog. If I had known that they weren't pet friendly, I would have sought out a different property to stay. We were disappointed that he had to be left in the room during our entire trip. The hotel is beautiful for those who are not interested in bringing their pet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Times at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock on Thanksgiving week 2008. We arrived on Monday afternoon and stayed until Friday, the day after Thanksgiving. We had a wonderful time here. Last year at the same time, we stayed at the Royal Pacific Hotel, another Universal Loew's Property, which we also enjoyed. My husband wanted to try the Hard Rock and my friend had stayed here in the spring and had a great time with her hubby and six-year old daughter. The room was very comfortable; we stayed on the 5th floor in a Garden View room with two double beds for myself and hubby and our 12-year old son. We booked our stay through Southwest Air. We were pleased with our fast passes; it is a bit of a challenge though to have to go to the park to collect our "Stay four/Play Four" free passes to Universal and Islands of Adventure for the week with Guest Services. The agent we got insisted that we owed a balance and even called our credit card company; after continuously reminding him that we paid everything in full already, he finally apologized (after a 15 minute wait) and said he had been "confused' - eesh - hardly the VIP experience! At Royal Pacific last year, we received nice pouches that we could carry our park passes and Fast Passes in; when I inquired at the desk at Hard Rock, the agent recomended we purchase the same at the gift store...NOT! The above is the only bad complaints I can come up with after staying there for four nights and five days. We ate at The Kitchen the first night and loved it; I had awesome potato and leek soup and crab cakes. We loved the pool and grounds and the convenience of walking to the parks and the Fast Passes and two free park passes. Last year while staying at Royal Pacific, we rented a car, but after being charged $15/day to park at the hotel, we decided to book round trip shuttle service from Orlando Int'l Airport to the Hard Rock through Mears Transportation Service instead. For a mere $28/person roundtrip, this was the way to go. They picked us up immediately upon arrival and delivered us to our hotel after one stop at Royal Pacific. It was a bit more crowded on the return trip to the airport the day after Thanksgiving, but the driver was five minutes early and we arrived in plenty of time for our flight back to CT! We also made use of the free shuttle service from Hard Rock to Sea World on Thanksgiving Day! Book this service 24 hours in advance through the hotel and it is easy and FREE! All in all, a great service. We had a full size travel/coach bus, and it was more than over 1/2 empty. Wonderful and convenient and free! Loved the Hard Rock's pool and water slide as well as the garden walkway; on the last day we went lizard hunting before leaving for our flight and discovered a gorgeous butterfly garden complete with orange trees behind our hotel - beautiful! The staff was very friendly. Tip: if you fly Southwest Airlines and want to get your boarding pass, just let the Concierge know at least one day ahead of time and provide your travel confirmation number, flight number and times, number of people traveling, and the Hard Rock Staff will make sure that you are in the front of the line for boarding! We didn't think of this last year at Royal Pacific Hotel and wound up being scattered all over the plane (party of 3!); this year we all wound up in Boarding Group A with our pick of where to sit (all together!) All in all, a most restful and enjoyable trip to Orlando. Wish they had more frequent concerts as we would have loved to enjoy one while we were there!

Reviews.Title: “greeeeeat”
Reviews.Author: richard71071
Reviews.Content: great hotel great location great food great staff i stayed for 3 weeks never got bored

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: tddn
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times kids love it, closest hotel to parks. No complaints would recommend to anyone. A side note this hotel does not belong to the Loews First program any longer although they do not advise you of this at all.

Reviews.Title: “All ROund Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobMo
Reviews.Content: A great all round hotel. Very friendly staff, great communal areas, good location, lovely rooms, all very clean, nice bar and nice restaurants. What more is there to stay? I'll be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ajnoone
Reviews.Content: This is a must visit hotel, great location, atmosphere, food . I could go on!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is Nice”
Reviews.Author: DuracellTampa
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two-day stay at the Hard Rock in Orlando, and it was a great stay. My wife and I enjoyed the hotel and staff and the location is great. Definitely recomend staying here, I want to try the other Loews hotels to see if they're as good as Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Rock On!”
Reviews.Author: Carribeanmom0307
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay. Easy walking to the parks or boat access. Giant pool with music played underwater. Helpful staff. Milk & Cookies at night if you are a Lowes member. Big rooms. Lovely scenery. Family friendly. Traveled with 2 teenagers

Reviews.Title: “Really is Rock 'n' Roll”
Reviews.Author: gzill47
Reviews.Content: I spent two days here on a business trip. Great hotel, thought not sure if I'd pay the price if I was footing the bill. Having said that I'm sure it's standard for this type of place. What I liked best is the music. They'd didn't just pay it lip service. They're always playing good music, hip music not just "oldies but goldies" of classic rock. It's like one of those great rock radio stations that are eclectic. There were some other at this meeting, probably in their 50's, complaining about hearing rock music all the time! Not for them I think.... best part, no muzak on the elevator! Rock 'n' Roll baby... (although I can't help think of the Nirvana RS cover w/ Cobain's t-shirt about corporate magazines sucking... I'd say that's kinda true about this place...) corporate rock = not very rock 'n' roll. But that aside, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still at the top of its game”
Reviews.Author: Charmingtoff
Reviews.Content: Ever since my children last visted the Hard Rock Hotel in 2006 they have wanted to return. I appeased them and so we returned. This time i treated ourselves to a "garden room". The hotel rooms have clearly had a make over since our last visit with new soft furnishings and plasma TVs. Our room was on the ground floor but the hotel was fully booked and so we could not move up a few floors. The staff were very helpful though and tried to appease me. The room as it turned out was just fine. The "Kitchen" breakfast remains quite one of the best breakfasts i and my children have enjoyed around the world. The children always enjoy the ice cream parlour which fills the spot well into the evening. The staff remain as helpful as ever and of course the fast track tickets/room keys remain invaluable for the Universal Parks. The hotel now has a Hertz concession which made dropping my hire car off much easier particularly as we arrived direct from London via Miami at 3am. One new tip i can pass on is the ease with which one can dine at one of the other 2 hotels at Universal. The sushi bar at the pacific hotel next door was superb. The children are already asking when we plan to return to the Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Haven”
Reviews.Author: Miopyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October and in the main it was a really good experience. The staff were very attentive and always seemed pleased to help. We had a double garden room which was much bigger than a standard US bedroom and the furnishing was quite modern and good quality. We ate in the Kitchen twice, once for breakfast which was OK but nothing to shout about and once for dinner where the food was OK but the service was poor. To be fair the waiter admitted he was having a bad night and gave us free deserts so he just about saved the day (and his tip). The pool area was fantastic and we rented a cabana for a day which was very relaxing. Food from the pool bar was not brilliant but the service was really good. Being close to the Universal parks was the main reason for staying here and of course the front of line passes and although the parks were never too busy this was a real bonus. Walk on pretty much anything you want when you want which meant we never wasted any time in queues. The only down side which cost them a 5 blob score was valet parking. Several times they were overwhelmed with customers and we ended up waiting for more that 10 minutes for someone just to take our ticket. Other than that we had a great stay and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: dublinlad25
Reviews.Content: Jus back from a trip to Miami and went for three days to Orlando to go to Universal. To stay at the hard rock was definately the best decision. It is a bit dearer than to stay on international driver but well worth it. You definately feel like a VIP walking into the hotel. The check in was very quick and the staff was brilliant and very experienced (know what I am talking about, work in a hotel myself) The rooms are nice and big and have everything u need and much more. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The pool area is very big with even a sand beach. The proximity to Universal is perfect and they have complimentary water taxis. Otherwise just walk through there park which is immaculately kept. Staying in the hotel gives you a Xpress Pass for all the rides in the parks which is definately a bonus as you can skip all the queues. City Walk has plenty of bars and restaurants and a Cinema. The velvet bar serves great cocktails. Definately a place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nessie1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to be in the heart of Universal,and thats exactly where it is.The hotel is fun and lively with something always going on and i found the staff to be nice and very helpful. We arrived on the 28th and stayed for 5 nights, the hotel room was clean and tidy and the decor was of good standard. The only bad thing about our room was the pool view was obstructed by trees so we could not really see the pool. The pool itself was nice but only 1 metre deep. The water taxis that take you to the parks were good and regular, but the hotel is only a 5 min walk away. We went to the horror night on halloween and there is just one word to discribe it "BRILLIANT" they had got the scare factor right and everyone there had a great time. i would suggest getting a fast pass if you go as we walked straight into the 8 different scare houses while others queued for up to 2 hours per house. The Rocky horror tribute and Bill and Ted show were excellent. As for the parks we had great fun and as you stay in Universal your room key acts as a fast pass. There's also a place there called City walk with bars ,night clubs and restaurants. We went into the Irish bar, the Karaoke bar and a night club but for me Margherita bar and restarant was the best , a lively place with great food and a live band. Your park tickets get you in these places free. Overall a great safe place for anyone to stay. I.Nisbett Essex Uk

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: M1chy8
Reviews.Content: We've just spent 8 days at the Hard Rock for our honeymoon and it was great, a few minutes walk to Universal is perfect and the staff were great. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to Club 7 and if we stayed again would definitely pay extra for this. You get complimentary breakfast and supper in the evening. The hotel is loud and fun but not in your face. The memorabilia around is good fun to look at and the pool side cafe does a gorgeous half-pounder. We couldn't fault the Hard Rock, well done guys!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: toothfairytampa
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was inexperienced very young (teenagers) and could not tell you anything w/ any certainity or help you. For some reason my room key would not let me charge and I went to front desk to fix this. The teenage girls at the front desk could not help me and would not get a manager "he's not around right now I don't know where he is." This was never fixed the 3 days I stayed. The room was beaten up badly scratches all over the furniture and very small and not at all fancy. We are talking motel 6 quality for the $259 a night room. The tv had lines going across it all blurry impossible to watch. None of this was ever fixed even though we complained. Also the noise in the hotel was terrible you could hear every kid running down the hall, people talking in the halls, the cleaning ladies Yelling!! to each other all morning 9:00 till 4:30 pm room to room and they took for ever doing this disturbing you. I will never stay here again way overpriced only for name. Hot tub only luke warm bath water temperature. The gaylord palms much less $ much nicer hotel! Try it instead. We thought the hard rock would be very romantic but was very very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: Chevy1
Reviews.Content: When I asked my son what he wanted to do for his 18th birthday, he said he wanted to go to Universal's Halloween Horror Nights. As a surprise, I made reservations at the Hard Rock for 10/3 - 10/5. He was thrilled. Our room was ready when we checked in and the front desk gave my son a b-day bag at check-in with some goodies. Thanks! He loved the pop-rocks. A balloon bouquet was suppose to be in the room so I went to check with Shannon at the concierge desk. By the time I got back to the room, the balloons had arrived -- with candy! Room 6082 was clean and bonus - at the end of the hall so it was 1) quiet and 2) had two windows instead of one. Only issue with the room, the phones didn't work when we got there but Harold arrived in about 30 mins. to repair. Sat. a.m. we ate at the Kitchen buffet breakfast which is everything you could want to eat and reasonably priced. Sat. was spent around the pool - my favorite way to relax. The pool and slide were not crowded this time of year but the water was a little chilly...for me. The kids, the other one is 13, stayed busy shooting pool and playing ping pong. Sat. night was HHN. We've never been before but we had a lot of fun and plan to go back next year. Sun a.m. was spent at IOA and then we had lunch at the Kitchen. We shared the BBQ pizza, a Philly cheese steak and BBQ ribs. Yum. After a couple more hours hanging around the pool, it was time to head back to Tampa. All in all, we agreed it was one of our best trips, albeit short, and wanted to go back ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: kez77
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at the hard rock, Very central to everything a family with a teenager needs. Breakfast in the kitchen was awesome. Staff are freindly, very helpful. Room was clean, maid service was excellent. Didnt have any faults i care to mention, had an awesome time, it is pricey but worth every penny. Have a strawberry slush at the poolside they are to die for. Would go back in a flash. Ace time

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: marioeliz
Reviews.Content: Walking into the hotel made you feel like someone important. Went up to the front desk to check in at 2pm and they were very friendly, the room wasn't quite ready but they took my number and not even an hour went by before they called me to tell me my room was ready, and no request was to big or to small. Got to the room and it was very clean and modern. Beds were nice and comfortable. Flat screen and iHome were really nice touches. The rooms are nothing over the top but we were barely in the room. Whatever we asked for they brought it up to the room in no time. Bathroom was very clean with all the toiletries in tow. Room service was fast and easy, and the food was pretty good, but not to expensive. Ate at the kitchen for breakfast and I have to admit that the breakfast served at buffet is the most amzing breakfast I had ever eaten with all the orange juice you can drink. The price is about $20/person a little on the expensive side but we ate our money's worth. The pool area was amazing and relaxing. The pool is not very deep but it serves it's purpose and the water slide made all of us feel like kids again! Very short walk to Universal and was very convienent since we were going to Halloween Horror Nights. We also went to Islands of Adventure during the day and used the room keys as express passes which is one of the real values and benefits of staying on-site. We all said that staying at the Hard Rock hotel will be our new tradition during horror nights! I would definetly stay there again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Judy31
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for families. My 13 yr old son and I just returned from a 5 night/6 day trip. As it was just the two of us I had decided not to book a car and it was the best idea, as the shuttle bus (Mears) was easily accessible, friendly encounters from the service desk to the drivers. Upon arrival at the Hard Rock, smiles everywhere, fast service, no waiting lines to check in and extremely helpful service at the front desk, to booking shuttle buses to and fro SeaWorld/Busch Gardens, restaurant information, maps, etc. The easy accessibliltiy to walk to Universal/Islands of Adventure/City Walk was a plus factor. They keep the grounds in and around the hotel property in perfect condition. The pool bar/restaurant has a diverse menu for all, service was extremely friendly and prices reasonable. Always pool games going on for all, and they try to get all involved. Great place to hang out after a long day out at the parks, as the pool stays open till late in the evening. I wanted a stress free vacation so this was absolutely perfect! Each day we visited a park, by early afternoon we headed to the pool to relax and we either ate by the pool or took a walk over to City Walk to find a place. Only complaint would be that the bathrooms are very small(we were on the 5th floor which has the most standard rooms) and do need to be updated, happy it was only 2 of us in the room. Do recommend asking for a room close to the elevators. Overall, we were highly satisfied with our vacation and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beats Disney for Service”
Reviews.Author: JoanneT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite for 5 days in August. Service was excellent at this hotel, from the moment that we arrived. We were greated promptly by valet parking and our car and cases were taken straight away. Yes - you are charged extra to even park but this is well advertised on the hotel's website. We were checked in straight away and our cases arrived in our room 5 minutes later. The family suite was superb and my children aged 14 and 10 benefitted in having their own room. We dined in the Kitchen every morning for breakfast, which was an excellent buffet - I have read people moaning about the $16 dollar per head price, half price for children - this is a 5 star hotel - what do you expect. We also dined in the Kitchen one evening, which served a great filet mignon with excellent service. Having front of line assess was brilliant and meant that we could manage the parks in a morning with the afternoon free to relax. Also the quick water taxi service to Citywalk was brilliant in the evenings with plents of restaurant choices. My children think this is the best hotel they have been to in Orlando and can't wait to return. For the last part of our holiday we stayed in the Animal Kingdom Lodge - Hard Rock beats it hands down for quality of rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_best_of_life
Reviews.Content: Great corridors, ask for rooms closer to elevators, ice machine. The pool unfortunatelly is not deep enough. LIKED: Nice room, nice tv, nice music all around, nice boat transportation to Citywalk, the Freepass at Universal DISLIKED: Few options of restaurants on property, Paid self parking, paid wi-fi. For the price of the hotel should not be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WillowBlackpool
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Hard Rock last month, my third time at the hotel and we were really looking forward to it. Reception which in the past has been a hassle was very smooth. The hotel was empty but there were no upgrades on offer despite us having stayed there before. We had an issue with bogus calls from someone claiming to be an employee of the Hard Rock wanting to re confirm credit card details. The duty manager advised this had never happended before and not to worry, but worry you do, someone knew my name not just poicked a random room number. I requested security check this out but they did not seem interested and I heard nothing back from them despite them saying all Hard Rock management would be updated. Interest in guests, not impressed. I also had an argument with a receptionist over car parking charges, I dont agree with these add on charges but paid for four full days, I was told that when I left on the last day that was it, after an argument with a rude Julio they agreed to let me use the car park. You just dont need these issues when on vacation. I dont think we will return despite liking the hotel. I just cannot get over how little the staff thought about us.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a few nights.”
Reviews.Author: sueandbaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock at the end of August - for one night - primarily to get the fast passes included on the room key - and because my teenage son is a music freak! We arrived on the day that Tropical Storm Fay did - so unfortunately the pool was closed (though we took advantage of the late check out the following day and the kids spent a couple of hours in it). The service was generally good, although we had some confusion about what was included in the hotel cost by way of breakfast - and it cost us more than we thought, and we had a concierge that gave us a bum steer about the water taxis.... but apart from that it was fine. The room was clean and of an adequate size for 4 of us and we were upgraded to a pool view when we arrived which was nice. The kids loved the 'coolness' of the place and all the rock memorabilia - in fact we topped that off by eating at the worlds largest Hard Rock Cafe whilst we were there. For my part I think more than a couple of nights would have done my head in - but it was a great nights stay and met all our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good for staying with children”
Reviews.Author: ksor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in the end of September. Our flight was delayed, so we arrived at 2am at night, and asked for a room close so we didn't have to walk so far. Got a room as far away as possible, had to walk 3 looong corridors with our suitcases. The room was nice, great with the sink between the bathroom and bedroom. Two big beds. Very nice poolarea, (but the water was very shallow), and loved the hotel interior. A nice short walk to Universal / Islands of Adventure / City Walk, or you can take the boat. I was travelling with my son, and he loved the hotel. It was quite expensive, but ok for 3 days in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey for what you get, and VERY noisy.”
Reviews.Author: tortugas2x
Reviews.Content: Was at the hotel this past weekend for a Halloween Horror Nights media event. Lucky for us, first night was comped, second night was half off. I can't imagine paying $300+ per night to stay here! What we liked: the service. Every employee we interacted with was super polite and seemed to go out of their way to be helpful. Pool area was gorgeous. Rooms had nice decor. Fun freebie CD with checkin. Easy proximity to City Walk. Adorable squirrels everywhere on the property. Loved them! Nice little cafe and starbucks on-site for reasonably priced grab and go snacks. Cool rock memorabilia and decor everywhere. What we didn't like: THE NOISE. It was inescapable!! The rooms were not soundproofed at all! I could hear the neighbor's music, toilets, in the hall, etc etc etc. The music everywhere was overwhelming at times. Yea it was great in the afternoon and evenings, but when I was reading the paper at the pool in the morning, Ozzie's Crazy Train was a bit off-putting. Also, the little towels in the room barely covered my whole body. At that price point, most hotels will give you giant bath sheets and robes. And don't even get me started about the fee to park. Ridiculous!! Self-parking was $15, valet was $25. And if you access the mini-bar, be prepared for a 22% service charge. So... it was a nice stay, but had I been spending my own money, I would have been sorely disappointed. I would only stay again if I got a helluva deal. But if you've got money to burn and are a music fanatic, you'll most likely love it.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: CC7Bern
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Hard Rock from Sept. 5-7. We had booked a garden view room. As we were travelling from Europe we had 4 suitases with us. The woman at the reception desk didn't call a bell boy or offer us any help whatsoever upon check in, ignoring the luggage and showing us with her finger the way to the elevators. We struggled to get to our room. First thing I noticed was the musty smell. Wanted to open the windows to let some fresh air in and ....the window wouldn't open, because it isn't really a window. More like a glass panel. I considered calling reception and ask if they could switch us to another room, but it was pretty late and we were tired from our drive from Miami. Besides, we were only staying there 2 nights and our main purpose was to visit the parks, not staying in. The room was ok, but the whole decor was a little tired. The bathroom was quite small for US standars. We booked the room with breakfast buffet included for practical reasons, and it was pretty good if you don't take into consideration the dirty water they call coffee, or the fact that there was no cheese platter. Actually, the only thing with cheese they had on the buffet turned out to be a kind of pastry, another sweet treat. 2 days before leaving home, I received an e-mail informing me the pool would be unavailable for the duration of our stay since they'd be doing work on it and the surrounding bar. One of the main attractions for me to book at the Hard Rock was the sound system in the pool.... They did offer free shuttle to the other two hotels in the park to visit their pools, but if you are tired from your day in the parks and want to just chill for 30 min, you don't feel like taking a bus and drive to another hotel. Same story upon check out, we had to carry our own suitcases (I had gone to check out 15 minutes earlier having left the luggage in the room). Neither somebody helped us when my husband was loading the suitcases and bags into the trunk of our car, even though there were 3 bell boys standing there, chatting. We were dissapointed with the customer service at this hotel and we'll definitely stay in one of the other 2 hotels next time we visit the parks. Maybe the story would have been different had we stayed at the Club Level rooms.

Reviews.Title: “always have fun at the hard rock”
Reviews.Author: calkid
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in July, with two 19 year old boys, so of course we booked the room with breakfast buffet, which was great. We have stayed at the hard rock 3 other times over the years and although there has not been much updating going on, the hotel is still in good shape and rooms are comfortable. You stay at this hotel to have a good time and so do others. Because of that, there will be loud folks in the halls/outside but all in all, the bother is of short duration and happens at many other hotels as well. The pool area is still one of the best in Orlando and I was able to access free internet pool-side. The staff are very helpful and hard working. An exhibit of Princess Diana's dresses was onsite when we stayed and we were given free passes when we checked in. The exhibit was magical and gave a glimpse into this woman's life. Location and speed-passes are a plus but all in all, the music, the fun and the spirit, is why we stay at the hard rock. Thanks again for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: minniemoo
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed in the Royal Pacific Resort, we thought that it would be a nice change to try the Hard Rock. This was not a wise choice on my part. I cant say that there was anything I liked about this hotel. I know that the clue is in the name but when you cant escape the noise anywhere in the hotel except the bedrooms it becomes very annoying. Unlike the Royal Pacific, where at least you can have a quick service breakfast in peaceful comfortable surroundings, at the Hard Rock there is nowhere to go except the noisy ice cream parlour. We all hated this. If this wasnt bad enough, when we got to our pool view room, all we had a view of were the trees, a drainpipe and a spot of blue in the distance. The bathroom had not been cleaned properly either. There was hair and paper on the floor and the grouting on some of the tiles was black. Added to this the furniture was chipped heavily. The corridors were full of linen carts, day and night and there were several occasions where trash was left outside rooms and was still there next morning. Even the carpet was frayed and lifting in our corridor. We were disappointed with the pool too. It was no deeper than 3'6", so we couldnt swim. There is no way I would call this hotel luxury and for wouldnt dream of ever staying here again. We stayed in 3 hotels during our stay in Orlando and this was the only one that let us down. I would never ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: youngerthan50
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at the Hard Rock Hotel in August and it truly was an amazing holiday. We have 5 children- all teenagers and after visiting Disney in 2000 when the chidren were small we decided to stay on site at Universal to take advantage of the express pass system. THe hotel is stunning as you arrive through the main entrance and the valets were exceptionally helpful at all times as quite often they had to order us taxis as there were 7 of us. Nothing was too much trouble. We had two interconnecting rooms which were beautifully cleaned and well stocked and we had no problems with the maid service whatsoever. The only negative point on the rooms was that we were right at end of the corridor and it was quite a walk from the lifts which were not that centrally located. The pool was great, if a little shallow & the entertainment was great both day & night. The children loved going for late night swims whilst the music played. Every time we went to the pool we were able to get sunbeds both in the shade & sun which is in quite contrast to European holidays. The two weekends we were there we stayed at the pool during the day to avoid the busy parks & did find the pool busier than in the week but not a problem at all. We ate a lot at the Kitchen which was great & at least 4 times the characters Shrek, Scooby Doo & Homer Simpson came to most tables whilst dining. This was great for families with younger children but mine liked it too. The concierge were very helpful and advised us about restaurants & when to visit certain parks outside of Universal. There was lots of interesting memorabilia in the hotel & whilst we were there Princess Dian'a dresses were on display. The location of the hotel was outstanding with just a 5 minute walk to the 2 universal theme parks & Citywalk & the express queue system was just brilliant. To sum up, our teenagers loved this hotel and its closeness to Universal. There was no hassle & if they wanted to they could go to the park themselves with their room keys while we relaxed at the pool. This meant some days we relaxed at the pool & others we went to the parks so it was not as tiring as spending all day every day at the parks standing in queues. it really was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jabawokee
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the hotel, my first impressions were good having been checked in by super friendly staff. The rooms are a good size, although the bath was very small, infact my shower tray at home is bigger! The pool was excellent and the kitchen restaurant was fantastic often providing free character meals in the evening which you would ordinarily have to pay for in the parks. The breakfast was especially good in the kitchen. The fast pass that automatically comes wth your room key proved invaluable at the parks allowing the whole family to by- pass queues that were sometimes 45 mins long. My only dissapointment with the hotel was the noise of drunken guests returning in the early hours of the morning to their rooms presumably from City Walk. As a result of reporting the noise the following day, I was transfered to another room, unfortunately the noise was even worse in this room. On the whole I would recommend this hotel, however take ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: breretons
Reviews.Content: On the whole we enjoyed our week's stay, but one or two hiccups along the way... Room was not ready on check-in, although this seemed a regular thing. Housekeeping standards were very average and our room went uncleaned one day. However saying that, the pool area is great fun, if a little crowded at times, and the fact that you are 5 mins walk to Studios and Islands was priceless! And don't forget the fast-pass advantage is magic when you are faced with 70-80 minute queues!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great theme, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: LiloDayton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock for 2 nights. The first night was only a little noisy. The second night we had loud drunks in the hallway from 2-3:30 am. I called the desk and security finally came but said they saw nothing. Upon check out I reminded them of this but was offered no compensation at all. It is a pretty hotel and very cool if you or your kids are into rock music, but be prepared for noise while your trying to sleep. Emack & Bolios ice cream parlor and snack place is VERY overpriced!! We got 2 bagels with butter and the bill was over $7.00! No drinks in that price. The pool is very nice. They boast a very big water slide. The water slide is very long, but not very high.
