We stayed here strictly because they wanted to go to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure/Wet & Wild. This hotel is a great choice if you have teenage kids and want to go to the parks. Universal is within walking distance and the hotel will provide free shuttle service to the 2 other hotels on the Universal property. The Pros: The location is great and the kids really loved the cool "rock and roll" feel of the hotel. I was impressed that eery single employee was super friendly and went out of their way to be so. The service was top notch so they must be doing something right as far as training their employees. While the kids went to the park my husband and I stayed by the pool most days, and the pool is outstanding. They have a sandy beach pool which was heaven, and there were plenty of friendly servers who provided efficient service with drinks and food. The Palm restaurant is on premises and we dined there 2 nights. The food is outstanding by New York standards (we eat at The Palm in NYC all the time). In fact, the food throughout the hotel is excellent. We had breakfast every morning at The Kitchen and lunch by the pool every day and it never disappointed. We also got a ride one night to the Bice Restaurant at the Portofino Hotel on night and the food and service there was excellent as well. Yes, we all gained a few pounds on this vacation but it was worth it! The kids used their room keys for "express" access at the park to get to the front of the lines and they loved it. The Cons: I am Loews First Gold member and I have stayed at many Loews properties and although there are many positives about this hotel, I was disappointed with the quality, and the feel of the room furnishings. The bed felt cheap and hard, and the linens were rough and felt like sheets from a Days Inn. There were obvious stains on the carpet and they politely advise you that the sheets will only be changed every 3 days. I felt that the housekeeper did a less than adequate job cleaning the bathroom and room. In summary, if you are visting Universal and want a place to stay with the kids I would definitely recommend this hotel. The kids will love it. However, for the parents, do not expect a "luxury" experience. For the moms, there is no spa on the premises. There is a Manadara Spa at one of the other hotels (the Polynesian?) but it was too far to walk and I didn't want to take the shuttle. All in all, nice but not really a Loews experience.

Reviews.Title: “great perks”
Reviews.Author: BristolToothfairy
Reviews.Content: Great perks with this hotel and if your a fan of universal like we are you'll love it!!!! its a stone throw away from islands of adventure and universal! the hotel itself is great such a wondeful friendly atmosphere! the rooms aren't fantastic but are clean and spacious with mod cons like flat screen tele's etc. The hotel has a brilliant pool but it is small for the size of the hotel. Concierge are fantastic and recommended some awsome restaurants including moonfish in Dr Phillips wich is just to die for and only around $10 in a taxi away! I would def go back! but maybe stay club but not sure what extra's you get for your money?!

Reviews.Title: “the Hard Rock.....Rocks !!!”
Reviews.Author: rockstar32
Reviews.Content: from the minute we stepped out of the taxi we were made to feel welcome, the check in was quick and easy, the room was fab...and the room key is worth its weight in gold for getting on all the rides in universal straight away....the kids were made to feel really welcome and the staff couldnt do enough for us.....the location was ideal and couldnt fault anything, we ate in the beach club which was a little pricey but the food was great...although we ate out at other places around the resort just for variety...cant wait to go back..cant think of any cons....have been spoilt now and wouldnt want to stay in any other place in Orlando when we go back !! go see for yourself !!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and great hotel staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: brigette621
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days at the Hard Rock Hotel. We stayed at the Portofino in August and wanted something different this time. We had reserved the Royal Pacific but I inadvertantly did not tell them I needed a pet room. We were quickly rebooked at the Hard Rock and from the moment we got there we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was awesome! My DH and I were really nervous about staying at the Hard Rock. We had my mom with us and I had this idea that the Hard Rock would be full of crazy drunk singles and have loud screaming music 24/7. I could not have been more wrong. Everyone was sooo nice. I have to tell you though. The Hard Rock does let employees express "be themselves". So we saw mohawks, piercings and tatoos but it was more in a comical cool way and in no way offensive or a turn off. We had our kids 16, 10, 8 with us and they loved the place. My 8 year old cried when we were leaving. We had an issue with someone complaining about my shih tzu barking while we were at the park and the staff was awesome in every way. I have absolutely no complaints about the hotel other than the food at the Kitchen was overpriced for the quality but ....remember you are eating at a hotel. The pool was incredible. My mom was 100% impressed with this hotel and she is truly a spoiled diva LOL. She likes nothing but the best. I guess if it were just DH and I looking for a romantic laid back trip I may choose the Portofino because it is a beautiful hotel. But...the hotel staff was nothing like the Hard Rock. We are already planning our next stay at Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “I'm just not sure”
Reviews.Author: kirstenoel
Reviews.Content: On my third visit to Florida I spent a week at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge (which was absolutely fantastic) and then a week at the Hard Rock. At first, I saw the Hotel and was amazed. As we pulled up in the taxi I was so excited by the huge, amazing looking hotel, with all the flashy cars outside and the extravagant reception. The staff were friendly, opening the taxi doors and taking our bags to check in for us. We went to check out the hotel and the swimming pool area looked absolutely amazing and I couldn't wait to hop in! When I eventually got in the pool I didn't like the fact that it was mainly full of posers, who would stand around in the pool up to their waists, sipping on cocktails and bottles of beer. I also didn't like the fact that the pool floor was covered in sand from the man made beach. The room's weren't that impressive either. It was nice to have a 32" LCD TV, but that's about it. The bathroom was quite small and non de-script, the bedding was plain and boring, the view was a white wall of the hotel and a tree top and none of the rooms have balconies. coming from England and staying somewhere as hot as this, you want to enjoy your holiday and stand on your balcony looking at the nice view - but you won't find this at the Hard Rock. On our first night at the Hard Rock we couldn't sleep. The room next door was playing really loud music and they were all drinking in their rooms and running up and down the corridors until the early hours. My Dad went outside to complain, where there was already a member of staff so obviously someone else had complained first. The hotel definitely needs some sound-proofing work done to it. We got up early the next morning and headed off to Universal studios. It's a lovely short walk with nice scenery and the queues weren't too bad for getting our tickets. One good thing about staying at a Universal Hotel is the free transport and the fact you can queue jump the rides with your hotel passes. In previous years we had stayed at Disney for the full 2 weeks and found traveling to the Universal parks expensive and time consuming. I would like to say that the hotel staff were friendly, but most of them weren't, in fact I found some of them to be quite rude and stuck up. Overall I wasn't impressed with this hotel at all; the rooms were nothing special, the pool wasn't relaxing, the food was quite bland (except for the expensive restaurants - their food was delicious!) and the rooms don't even have balconies!! I much referred my stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge (in fact I much preferred my stay in previous years at Disney's All star Resorts). At the Animal Kingdom, the gym was free to use and internet connection was fairly cheap. At this hotel the gym and internet was expensive. Beware: you even have to pay 18% service charge for a bottle of coke at the bar. You pay the barman an extra 18% to open a bottle of coke! It's outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: PGA2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. I would stay there again. I found the SELF parking fee to be annoying. I was surprised. If you don't tell them you drove in they won't charge you. I think it was $15 per night. Room was nice and comfortable. I was in and out quickly. I can't speak to the pools or Universal Studios. We did enjoy the Palm Steakhouse in the lobby. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Mooms77
Reviews.Content: Fab place to stay for 20-30 somethings, loved the decor, staff friendly and helpful especially the bar staff!

Reviews.Title: “Run-Down Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: KathyBiggs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 7 years old. Stayed there first in December 2001, then again December 2004. Great experience, no complaints THEN. Just came home after 5 days there...January 2008. This hotel is "RUN-DOWN". Outside of the hotel has rust stains running down the building, we booked a pool cabana as we have done on our past stays... the canvas was covered with mildew - YUCK - carpet in the hallways is dirty and needs to be replaced...nothing sparkled... just overall... needs a serious "facelift". Very disappointed. The only thing this hotel has going for it right now is it's location to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirepudding21
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas and into the New Year. Our rooms were large, well equipped (32" LCD TV, iPod docking station, stereo, DVD player and two phones) and extremley clean. The turn down service was prompt, efficient and a pleasant surprise. All the staff were very polite and most helpful. The poolside cabanas are wonderful, these include TV, phone, fridge (with soda), fruit bowl, ceiling fan , table, chairs and plenty of towels, poolside food and drinks were quick very nice, also the room service was very quick and the meals were delicious and well presented. We cannot praise the valet guys highly enough, they were quick, friendly and always with a smile and a great attitude. The Hertz desk came up with a GT-H Mustang in less than 24 hours. The free Universal park tickets provided by Hard Rock and transport was either via a very short boat ride or a pleasent five minute walk through the grounds. There are cheaper places to stay but non better. Well worth every penny. We are already planning our next stay at Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sdahl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, too bad the weather was cold. Unable to use the pool due to weather. Great service, you pay for it. The best part was the express pass for Universal and Island of Adventures. They could use fridges and microwaves in the rooms. You could have a fridge brought in for $15 a day. The parking recently went up as well. Happy hour 5-7 in the Velvet Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Chill Baby Chill”
Reviews.Author: JohnBoland
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock is cool, classy, down to Earth, fun, trendy, and most amazing hotel I have ever stayed. I am a 40 year old who worked in 5 star hotels in UK when youger so I know when hotel staff do it right and boy..did they. After valet parking the car the first guy we meet is the head doorman/porter Buck, I have 3 kids and he made em feel right at home Buck is good relaxed guy. After check in we were booked on club level 7 which is worth the money if you have kids, as drinks and snacks for them free all day and night (saved us a fortune) also the buffet breakfast and dinner included was adequte for us, ( not to mention the free beer etc between 5 and 7pm) I have seen a few reviews saying the food is expensive but we didnt think so, the Kitchen was as cheap as any average cafe/restaurant but let me tell you the food was superior. Pool was great with the water slide and it being shallow all round was a bonus for us just to keep dipping in for a cool off. The memorabilia around the place is amazing youll take loads of pics if your like us.The location is spot on for IOA an USF we even took the free boat transport just for the hell of it even though it is only a 5 - 10 min walk right to front of the parks. Drinks didnt seem too expensive and again the service is excellent in all bars. Snacks around the pool in evening are also well priced. Rooms not over big but nice and again very clean, and well presented. Overall the Hard Rock for a family like mine with 3 boys 12, 10,9 is high quality coolness that is real value for money. We are definatley going back again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Rocks”
Reviews.Author: MissyGalway
Reviews.Content: This is a fab hotel check in,concierge and restaurant staff were great and very helpful. We had a standard room and it was more deluxe than standard. Large room with big bathroom, fresh and funky decor and spotless and if it was'nt Orlando you would never leave the bed. Can't swim either of us but we still enjoyed the pool lovely set up lots of chairs and so clean. Right in the complex of Universal Studios it was very convient. The only drawback was getting to Disneyland, but the hotel will organise a shuttle bus service for you so its fine. Would highly recommend it for lots of reasons enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Rock On! Loved It! Will Be Back!!”
Reviews.Author: JennWhit
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! We're in our early 30's and were looking for a great place to stay close to Universal and downtown. We researched several options and decided to splurge on the Hard Rock and were not disappointed. We stayed Dec. 3-8 in a king club level room. Yes, it was pricey, but worth every penny. The room was modern and classy, and having access to the club room all day was great. We like to eat several small meals a day, so the continental breakfast, evening appetizers & drinks and bedtime sweets were all just what we needed to make our stay nice and relaxed as opposed to a constant search for something low priced and good to eat. We also usually spend a small fortune paying for sodas and waters in vending machines when in hotels, so access to unlmited sodas and water all day was a big bonus for us. The hotel staff was FANTASTIC. Everyone was friendly, accomodating and helpful, from the club room concierge right down to the valets. Room service was prompt, and the food wonderful. The proximity to the Universal Parks and Citywalk really made the Hard Rock a total fit for us. We could walk out of our room and be through the front gates in 5-10 minutes depending on just how fast we were walking. We could pop back over to the hotel at anytime without feeling like we were giving up a lot of time in the parks. Water taxis run until 2am as well, so if your feet are aching by the end of the day like mine, you needn't walk home. We can't really tell you much about the restaurants in the hotel. We dined out quite a bit. We did have appetizers in Velvet which were great. The portions are huge, so watch out! What really surprised me was that the drink prices we're ridiculous. I've paid a lot more for drinks at bars in major cities. One restaurant to check out is Bice at the Portofino. The have a mushroom ravioli that is to die for! Basically, we had a great stay. The parks and the hotel were empty all week, so we had the place to ourselves and really enjoyed it. I'm sure the summer crowds make a big difference in the experience, but we felt like we got our money's worth and more!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish and fun.”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeRedDot
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel during a driving holiday around Florida for a delayed honeymoon and I really have no complaints. On arrival, there were no self parking spaces available so we were offered valet at the same price. It was Thanksgiving weekend when we arrived and the place was heaving. There was even a mini concert going on in the lobby when we arrived. Check in was polite and efficient. Everything about the hotel is huge. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a garden view and was big with 2 double beds, armchair, table and chair, several sets of drawers, huge plasma TV, CD player, wardrobes, a vanity area and a bathroom. The decor was stylish and modern and everything you see is referenced with quotes from rock songs from the menus to the pillows. We mentioned we were on honeymoon when we checked in and we found a mini botte of champagne and strawberries when we came back to the room on the second day. We ate in The Kitchen several times for dinner and breakfast and always found the food to be good. There is a more formal restaurant and a cosy looking bar there but we didn't get a chance to check out either. Didn't get a chance to use the pool area either but it looked great, with sun beds, cabanas, spa pools and a beach bar. This hotel seems to have most amenities you could wish for. It is within 5 mins walk of Universal Studios and our room keys acted as Express Passes which meant we could walk to the front of almost any queue. Overall it was a good location for us as we only had 3 nights in Orlando and wanted to be able to do a couple of parks plus have somewhere to drink in the evening and City Walk on the complex allowed us to do just that.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning~Beautiful~Great Service~”
Reviews.Author: joenan88
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property after 5 nights at the polynesian on Disney property for 2 nights. I wish we stayed here for all 7 nights! This resort made the Polynesian look like a Super 8 motel. It was Beautiful! We paid for a deluxe room and it was huge, clean and filled with awesome ammenities. I loved the one cup coffee maker and the fully stocked mini bar..which is extra. We found the staff to be more then helpful and the themed hotel to be fun and educational for our kiddies 10, 7 and 6. I grew up in the 80's and loved Run DMC, they were from the town next to my hometown in NY and when I stepped into the elevator with my two little one's I heard "ROCK BOX" one of my favorite songs. I made my kids go up and down the elevator until the song ended. It was a lot of fun! I loved the distance to the Universal parks and the express pass feature was the cherry on the cake! The clientele were upscale and very friendly. I wouldn't think twice about staying here again! Do not listen to any negative reviews..they usually come from people who can not really afford this property and therefore pick the resort apart. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great? It depends what you are looking for.”
Reviews.Author: Prodance
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the phenomenal reviews this hotel has. I would just like to put this hotel in the proper perspective for those of you that travel a lot like we do. First of all the positives - - The employees are great, they are the hotels #1 asset. -The Kitchen buffet breakfast is very very good - we paid 17.00 a person and were happy to do so for the convenience, food and most mornings great service. - The Palms - one of the very best restaurants in Orlando. - the atmosphere - if you are a rock fan - need I say more? The decor, the big screen rock concerts in the lounge, live rock concert in the lobby(added charge), the constant music, etc. - Almost Everything is very clean - rooms, grounds, pool area, restaurants, , only place was the outside bar/restaurant. The menus were dirty, tables dirty, service slow and not too good - only there once. The needed better or more employees there. - Walking to the park, front of the line access. The negatives - - The rooms are very average, although the queen beds are a plus. The club rooms are exactly the same as the standard rooms- they should be better. Some of the "garden view" rooms are an embarrassment to Loews. If you look out your window and see a dirty roof top and a parking lot - refuse to stay there. The feeling is of a highway side flea bag hotel. - Very limited facilities. There is 1 warped cheap pingpong table and 1 billiard table that you have to pay for. If you have teenage boys like we do, this is a problem. - The pool is large by only park hotel standards, it is also very shallow. There is a slide that is small and slow - good for little kids. So, for preteens and up - a little boring. - Don't believe that the hotel is green and cares about the earth. For example- They throw away all the plastic card keys. When I asked the clerk about that, she said they can't recycle cards because it would take too long - they have hundreds to thousands in one day. I then watched her bend them and throw them in the garbage. I have seen many hotels put the same cards through a machine and in seconds they have reprogramed them. What their problem is, I don't know. Think about what this is doing to our landfills and oceans. Some hotels are willing to put their signs in the bathroom about not washing towels to save energy - why? because it saves money. But the real issues behind the scenes are ignored. - Star Services - ? what is this? The only time I deal with any bad employees was when dealing with star services. It sounds like this is where you get the best treatment, best employees. On check out - we dealt with them and felt like we were again in a fleabag motel. So although during our stay we were happy, at checkin and checkout, we were left with a bad taste in our mouths. Would we recommend it ? I don't know, you decide. Next time we will buy front of the line access and stay at one of the great hotels with great facilities outside of the park.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Alkaz
Reviews.Content: We had booked one night only as a treat as part of our honeymoon but we were so impressed on checkin we booked another night. Checkin staff were very friendly and we were allocated a room on the third floor. We were surprised we got a room straight away as we arrived at 13:00. We liked the boat ride from the hotel to city walk. Enjoyed lunch at Nascar cafe which has just been refurbished. We really enjoyed the added feature that you can use the express line with our room keys. We had breakfast both mornings in The kitchen as this was included with the room rate , breakfast was impressive good selection at the buffet. On our final night we had dinner at The Kitchen abit dearer than usual prices around Orlando but well worth it and the best steak I have ever had. Recommend the ice cream parlour as it was out of this world. Hope to return on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie03
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Hard Rock Hotel. This hotel is well worth a visit!! The garden view room on the 4th floor was clean and all fixtures were well maintained. Housekeeping were very good especially the HK manager (Tom B) who very friendly and made us welcome. The food in the restuarant (The Kitchen) was excellent and good value for money. Also, the atmosphere and STAFF in the Velvet Lounge was very good. The pool area was well maintained and the water was warm enough to enjoy a swim after 7.00pm. I have no doubt that we will go back to this holel and have no reservation about recommending a stay at the Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service but amazing food!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewfieScotian
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Hard Rock and thought I would share some of my experiences with you, in hopes that it will help anyone planning on staying there in the future. Had a Garden View room; having previously stayed at PBH, I was hoping that the rooms would be on par with the size of the rooms at that hotel. Unfortunately, the room was smaller than expected and the bathroom TINY!! I was not impressed with the furnishings or decor of the room. Looked shabby and the furniture looked worn. Definitely over priced! We obtained the room using points but will never pay the price to stay there. When it came time to crawl under the covers, you can imagine my surprise when I turned back the sheets, only to find black shoe prints on the sheets!! I really don't think they had changed the sheets from the last person b/c fresh sheets should not have these markings. Called the front desk, requesting housekeeping to come up and change the sheets. ONE HOUR later, and four requests later, someone showed up. I thought it was terrible that I had to call 4 times to get someone to address the problem. Not good service Hard Rock! We lost one piece of luggage en route and was told that our bag would be dropped off at the baggage hold area of the Hard Rock, once it arrived, Fine; informed the guys in the baggage dept and they made note of this. I did a daily check with them and, no baggage. On the third day, I checked once again and they told me, to my face, that no bags had arrived. Imagine my confusion when I checked the phone messages in the room and was told that my bag was dropped off earlier that day!! Called the desk again and told them that my bag was suppose to be there. Fortunately, I spoke with someone who was alert enough to remember that the bag was dropped off and waiting for me. I told him that the guys who are responsible for watching over our bags told me that it didn't arrive?? So, moral of the story: don't totally trust that your bags are really being watched b/c my bag was sitting there for hours and they had no clue that it was there. Thank God no one got to it before me! Now, to the positives: the grounds... amazing! The pool... to die for! The Kitchen.... THE best food i've ever had in my life and the staff, wonderful!!! Out of everyone at the hotel, the food and beverage staff are the best! You have to eat at the Kitchen b/c you might never experience the likes of it again. We had breakfast and it was out of this world. The sushi is the best i've ever tasted and the wings, well let's just say, nothing else may ever compare. I can't help but gush about this place - it makes the hotel worth going to. The staff are just wonderful and so friendly and helpful. In the future, I may not stay at this hotel (unless I can use points) but I will always keep coming back to the Kitchen and it's great food. Keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “Rock the EXPRESS lines!!”
Reviews.Author: totalimage446b
Reviews.Content: The hotel name speaks for itself! The valets and bellhops treated us like royalty, they even gave our little guy a ride to the room on the luggage cart. The rooms were nicely decorated, and the beds were comfy. We had two adjoining rooms, and rollaways in each, we still had room to move around. The bathrooms were nice, and the extra sink was helpful with our large group. There was no micro or fridge, but the coffee machine was an asset. We ate at the kitchen resturant downstairs, (I would save my money for citywalk next time). The pool was great, the kids enjoyed the slide, there was always a lifegaurd on duty, and they played movies two nights a week on a big screen over the pool. The best part of staying at the Hardrock was that your room key gets you in all express lines at the parks. We never waited! It made for a relaxing enjoyable day at Universal without crowded grumpy lines. I think that made the the hotel worth its cost.

Reviews.Title: “Another brill stay”
Reviews.Author: AndreaandAndy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock (for the 4th year in a row) from 21st October for 4 nights. Staff are great : especially the Valet Guys who are just so friendly. Room 3095 is the one that we have had 3 out of the 4 stays. Handy for the shop and you don't need to get in the lift. Food at the Beach Club was great...starters were enough for a meal! Last day met Vince Neil from Motley Crew who was playing the Velvet Sessions that night. Can't imagine ending our holiday in Florida anywhere else...possibly the coolest hotel in the world? We think so.

Reviews.Title: “Love all Serve all !”
Reviews.Author: finnsaunders
Reviews.Content: This is the motto of the Hard Rock Hotel and it is evident everywhere in how the staff treat every age group. My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from 23rd to 30th Oct and we both loved our stay there. The staff were all so pleasant and attentive. The Halloween Horror night at Universal was fantastic and we would then come back to the Velvet Bar for a few drinks. The cocktails were superb. A grey goose and lemonade was $10 as were most of the cocktails. Some guys arrived in from the park with their faces painted and big hats with flashing lights on and the bar staff didn't look at them twice, just got on with getting them a beer. So cool to have staff like that who don't judge at all. This was the same night Vince Neill (Motley Crue) was sitting at the bar and being really nice to anyone who approached him. Not for me, I like my rock a bit heavier...Rammstein anyone ? Our room was bigger than most hotel rooms and spotlessly clean, nice widescreen TV, CD player with a disc made up for us of mixed rock tunes which was a nice touch. The bed was very comfortable and nice toiletries replenished every day. We didnt eat in the hotel at all but ate several times in City Walk restaurants. A bus driver told us the best ribs were in the Nascar Cafe and he wasn't wrong. They were gorgeous and we were able to people watch as we ate. The hotel air-con was set too cold for me in the lobby, bar and corridors, baltic would be the word..but I was able to keep the room air con off. The week-end brought big numbers of american teenagers with hormone overload ensuing and no sign of any parents. The pool was a pain with all this flirting, ie playfighting, screaming, splashing etc but thankfully they all left on Sunday and the hotel was nice and quiet again... We would recommend this hotel and will stay here the next time we're in Orlando, we have been well and truly spoilt ! Loved it !

Reviews.Title: “rockin”
Reviews.Author: gray-mcd08
Reviews.Content: What can i say, amazing very spacious rooms, with everything you need in them Pool open till 11pm most nights was a real treat, for kids and us! (the pool bar also serves great cocktails.) All the staff from valet parking, reception, concierge, pool bar were excellent. If you go you have to eat in the Palm restaurant, off the main lobby, it was truly wonderfull, 4 people, three courses of 5* food including wine and drinks for $250 (Â£125). The velvet bar off the main lobby is very good for late night drinks, althought kids are not allowed in the bar, they are allowed on the balcony overlooking the pool, which has great outdoor sofas. You can't beat the location of this hotel, a 5 minute walk to universal studios and islands of adventure, combined with your room key for fast pass access to all rides was a major saving, no long queues. Again only 5 min walk, or courtesy water taxi gets you too citywalk, opposite universal/island with an abundance of great bars/restuarants, Recomendations to eat - Buby gump shrimp co - great Foret Gump themed restaurant with really good food Nascar - for sports fans, TV screens everywhere all running american sports constantly. Hard rock cafe - Food wasn't the greatest, just ok, but the surroundings are great, take your camera. NBA sports - Good food, worth a try. All in all you can't beat the Hard Rock Hotel, for luxury, style & quality. I will be going back with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay - club level this time”
Reviews.Author: lassie
Reviews.Content: We booked club level this break and it was a good choice as there was plenty to eat for breakfast but to be honest the kitchen is better for breakfast. Club gives you a good deal if there are more than 2 of you in a room. cookies were good at night. Hotel service was good and the pool snack bar was pretty reasonable for food (huge portions and not expensive). Did not use any of the other fod outlets this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Waited Years to Get Back”
Reviews.Author: formerhillbilly
Reviews.Content: You folks at TripAdvisor have steered me right several times over a few years and a few countries, and so I was curious to see what you had to say about what might just be my favorite hotel so far on the planet. I've spent the past hour reading reviews of the Hard Rock, and it's nice to know I'm not entirely crazy. The place IS great.. Yep, it's expensive. I'm surprised that so many people would even think of spending two weeks in Orlando, period (there's other stuff in the rest of the country, and it's less expensive, less sweaty and more educational). Orlando is a diversion and little more. But if you're going to Orlando, by all means stay at the Hard Rock for at least a couple of nights and enjoy all it has to offer. Don't plan to actually "swim" in the shallow pool; do plan to hear lots of tasty "classic rock" and even the occasional Ramones or Hives song (bless you, anonymous Hard Rock programmers). The slide is fun; get wet and laugh about your back hair, and then order a cocktail. Don't waste your money on the underwhelming Palm Steak House, which is an extension of an overrated and overpriced franchise here in New York. "Kitchen" is the better option, but it's also expensive. BUT WAIT: You are at a really nice hotel that's a world away from your real life. The incredible 3D Spiderman ride is a 10-minute walk away, and you won't have to wait in line to ride it yet again (me: 19 times so far). So pay the money and have fun. Just don't waste it at Palm, and think about bringing bagels and cereal to save some breakfast cash. My husband and I have enjoyed two 3-night stays at the HR, and we're looking forward to going back there two days from now. First stay (we were an extended-family party of 15), it was merely excellent and trouble-free. The second time there was a bit of confusion since we came a couple of days later than the rest of the family, and they sort of gave our room away. That sucked for about 2 minutes, then they offered us an entire hospitality suite -- the place where the richer and more famous throw their parties -- for no extra money. So we had a full (non-stocked, until we went to the liquor store) bar and kitchen, surround-sound stereo with actual speakers, a few couches and a poker table that sat twelve people. It was much bigger, and nicer, than our apartment. Our nephews still think we're special because of that room; a minor hotel mistake turned into a major family triumph. Those folks really know what they're doing. This time around we are surprising my sister and her family, who are there upon our recommendation. I spoke to the front desk tonight, asking them not to spoil the suprise, and they were more than accomodating. That's what made me start reading, and now writing, this blog. SO, here's the deal: Rooms are somewhat shockingly nice. Staff really is beyond reproach (at least so far). One can walk easily to a bunch of fun rides, pick his favorites, and ride them over and over again without waiting in line. They're gay friendly, hillbilly friendly and pet friendly, and they're very good at diverting the attentions of the children who made you show up there in the first place. For the childless with some extra cash and an affinity for amusement parks, this is THE place to go. Your beloved will love you even more after a short escape here. If you hate children, or puppies, or rock and roll, or fun in general, this is probably not the place for you. For the rest of us it's top-notch. PS i can't recommend the Spiderman ride enough. The ability to ride it over and over again with impunity before retiring to a nice bed is what makes life worth living ... at least this week.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: jomo0602
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my partner Maureen and her two girls aged 17 and 20.We all had our own room keycard which also doubles as a Universal express card.This is definitely the way to do Universal.The hotel itself is quite wonderful.The room was spacious even for the four of us.The pool was tremendous.First time I have been in a pool with underwater music.We walked over to the Portofino Bay hotel across the road for dinner which was delicious.The room cost Â£175 for the night but it was well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: beachbumn
Reviews.Content: We love this place and plan on making this an annual getaway. Excellent service, and beautiful. The convenience alone is worth it- fast passes to the park rides and no door fees to the bars with your room key. I don't even remember the view from the room b/c we were either at the parks, walking around the hotel looking at their collections of rock history, or at the pool. If you love music, this place is for you. You even hear music in the elevators and even under water at the pool. We also enjoyed the adults only jacuzzi. And if you can swing it, I highly reccomend the room service, it can be very romantic, great presentation, service, good food, and strong attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great time as always!”
Reviews.Author: sydney626
Reviews.Content: I just love entering the lobby of the Hard Rock. The music experience is everywhere. Immediately puts me in a great mood. Reservations and check in went smoothly. After a few minutes in the room, wine and nuts arrived, compliments of the Loew's membership. And that pretty much set the tone. Had a great time. Great food at The Kitchen, as always. Love the pool area, though the music wasn't working the day I was at the pool. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “My Honest Opinion of Hard Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: SAZ1975
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand some of the reviews on here. This hotel is fantastic. Here's what I honestly think... - Price. Yes it's expensive. We paid just over Â£100 per night for a garden view room and spent a lot while we were there. Drinks, food, etc are not cheap but the quality is good so we didn't mind. 18% tip is automatically added. Some people have complained about that, we found it convenient. Only thing that really ticked us off was the charge to park your car! - Staff. Whoever called them rude or unfriendly must have really caused a stir and wound them up because during the 2 times we've stayed in the past, all of the staff have been wonderful, especially the lovely guys at the Beach Club. - Noise/Music - It's Hard Rock. Get a grip! Surely when you book to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel you expect an atmosphere and some noise. We loved it! - Room Quality - No issues. Nice and clean, great ipod docking station and flat screen TV. Really modern feel. We had great views of the gardens. Only complaint was the trek to the room. It's a bit like a maze. Overall this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. We're going back in September for the 3rd time in a row and can't wait. Far better than Disney's Deluxe resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackieBCoventry_UK
Reviews.Content: The start of the holiday didn't get off to a good start. Our flight from England was delayed by 10 hours and by the time we got to the Hard Rock Hotel they had no rooms left (not sure why as this holiday was booked 15 months ago). Complimentary room for the night at Portofino and checked in to the Hard Rock a day later - they have refunded one night back to our travel agency (waiting to get this passed onto us, will probably take some time though). Anyway, booked into the Hard Rock for 2 weeks and the hotel was great, especially good for families. An 18% service charge is added to drinks and food at the beach bar, but the service was excellent. Didn't need to carry cash, just used our room key and charged it. Not having to queue for any rides at the Universal parks is a definite bonus. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, although a little expensive, was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Expensive, & Worth it”
Reviews.Author: jes0926
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tops.... The perk of being able to get in front of a long line at the park is practically worth every penny. I just wish that beyond the hotel being a really cool and awesome place to stay with a family and be close to the park that the prices were a tad bit lower. It is a high price to pay to stay here. We only stayed two nights and it ate up most of our budget. You cannot drink here or you will go broke. You need also to find a place to eat more reasonably. The high price you pay to stay at this hotel is worth it for the theme park perks,,,the efficient staff and gorgeouse atmosphere,,, but eat somewhere else and drink somewhere else and save yourself a buck.

Reviews.Title: “Our fourth time at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hale_Liverpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights of our vacation. This is the fourth time we've stayed - we all love the hotel. we had two newly renovated adjoining rooms but the downside was that they overlooked the back of the Hard Rock Hotel sign. (The bellboy actually said these have the worst view in the hotel!) The best thing about staying here is the front line access in the parks - you just can't beat this. Even Disney with their Magic Hours doesn't work this well at making you feel special walking to the front of the line again and again and again.... Had breakfast in the Kitchen which is really nice and Emack and Bolios does good starbucks coffee and fab ice creams. I wish you didn't have to pay for the gym though because with two teenage daughters and my self using it each morning it runs expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Rocking Hotel/ Coulter family Alloa Scotland”
Reviews.Author: Moira07
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 year son and I have just returned from a fortnights stay at the HRH.15/07/07-29/07/07 Overall this hotel delivers what it promises. Check-in was fine ( stated I had joined as a leows member a fortnight previous and was given a choice of gift, but no upgrade) Room was fine but carpets/ furniture a little marked bed comfy and bathroom good size with vanity area.Housekeeping also was sometimes a little touch and go IE had to request coffee/ sugar but no real problems. The room also had a mini bar which we did use a couple of times but decided paying 3 dollars for a can of coke was not on so we went on to I DRIVE and bought them there. The hotel has music playing throught the hotel ( except the corridors) and this was fine. Had a couple of Cocktails at The Velvet Bar. Pool was great with good slide , beach area and Pool towels and if you wish Cabanas to hire. We ate ot the Kitchen a couple of times once for Breakfast and once for Dinner. Both excellent. Staff were very friendly and atttentive. Also ate at the Palm Restaurant( special occasion) but can not say this was one of our best meals on holiday as we had ordered quite an expensive bottle of wine(130.00 dollars) which the server had difficulty opening. She then got her duty manager to take over who in turn came back with the bottle open ( we did not see this happening) Refused this bottle as cork could have entered but this should not have been presented back to us . Meal also was mediocre. As in previous reviews the hotel is expensive but you prepare for this. Front of line access at the 2 parks is without a doubt a Major Plus. Paying to self park is a major gripe and rightly so. Leows should address this especially if like us you are there for a fortnight. Only one other complaint HRH is pet friendly and I knew this before I booked.During my research into the HRH I was under the impression all pets and their owners were allocated rooms on the 1ST floor ( we were on the 3RD) On returning one afternoon dog barking was heard coming from the next room. I suffer from Asthma/ Allergy to Dogs , cats, and other animals and was horrified as I had informed my Travel Agent of this condition and they were to request Non Smoking/ Pet Free Room.I proceded to inform reception but first of all I spoke to conciarge who states this is correct it should only be 1st floor for pets. and possibly this person had smuggled them into the hotel. NOT SO.This couple and their TWO DOGS had been allocated a room next to ours. Reception said we could move rooms -US THAT HAD BOOKED A FORTNIGHTS STAY AT A PRICE!!! .Couple with dogs were there for 2 nights. Declined offer but informed reception that many people could have severe reaction to Dogs as I have if in close proximity. Overall apart from the Dog situaltion the HRH and its Sister Hotels which we also visited and ate there are faboulous. Would definetly stay stay there again. HAPPY TIPPING !!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel but expenisve for Florida”
Reviews.Author: u05sdw
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I aboslutely loved this hotel. We are a young couple (25 and 27) and our pre-requisite for a hotel in Orlando was a fun environment which was not entirely child focused. The hotel certainly provided this but equally, I believe it would be perfect for families. It is exceptional for Orlando in that it can provide a great holiday for singles and families alike.- I know that the disney hotels are all about the kids! We met loads of parents who were chilling out at the bar while their kids were within sight, watching the evening movie in the pool. The hotel offers a very high calabre of service and the general experience warrants its 5 star reputation. However, this standard is coupled with a chilled out and casual environment, resulting in guests being entirely relaxed. I think this hotel encompasses everything Orlando is about and delivers it with on a 5 star plate- it is fun, lively and chilled out yet luxurious. Staff were all wonderful and extrememly friendly, food and cocktails were superbe and music at pool was great. I just don't think you could be in a bad mood at this hotel as its so fun (without being cheesy)!!! We wondered across to Portofino- it also looked wonderful but I believe Portofino caters for an entirely different spec. It is very peaceful and relaxed and there is a lot less going on than in Hard Rock. If you are looking for a more tranquil ambiance, I would recommend Portofino over Hard Rock. We are also Scottish and wanted to feel like we were in America. Hard Rock is a represenation of the US culture unlike Portofino, which has the Italian novlety. Only bad point is that after 2 weeks in the hotel and an extras tab of $4000, we were charged $200 for a 2 hour late check-out. I thought that was bad customer service given the circumstances and length of our stay. That unfortunately left a bitter taste in my mouth but without this individual situation, our expericence would have been entirely positive. The hotel is a little greedy- its very expensive for food and drink (compared to the other hotels and rest of Orlando) and everything certainly adds up! I would hate to think how much it would cost to keep a whole family fed and watered therel! If you're willing to accept that it will be an overall expensive experience, I would absolutely definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Raves for the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMom17
Reviews.Content: Having had an awful experience at Royal Pacific last summer we were a little nervous about another Loew's Universal Hotel! Not to worry, however, there was all the difference in the world. We booked our Club Floor room throught AAA and received two free seven-day tickets to the Universal and Islands of Adventure parks, since we stayed at least four nights. At $409. per night the price is definitely steep but when you factor in a real four star property, the free Park tickets, access to Club 7, and a three minute walk to immediate entry to all the Park attractions, it doesn't seem so bad. With temps near 100 every day the room key express entry feature was worth it's weight in gold. We took one day and rented a poolside cabana to cool off from the heat and decided it was a great buy. The cabana we chose was a new one with no TV (we chose this to keep the grandchildren in the pool) and a price of $50. for the day. With a large ceiling fan, a dining table and four chairs, and two chaise lounges it made for a very comfortable break, especially with poolside lunch and drinks service. The quality of the food from room service, Club 7, and the Pool were high quality and reasonably priced for a resort. Our room was decorated in a quirky and fun style, spotlessly clean, with turn down service and fresh towels every night. The extra perks on the Club Floor are a special treat...a welcoming tray of homemade cookies and ice cold milk at check-in, little favors for the kids every night at turn down (much nicer than chocolates), and free water and sodas, continental breakfast with pastries and fresh fruit, canapes and crudite at cocktail hour, as well as complimentary beer and wine. Of course, I can't forget the fresh cookies, cheesecake, and pastries at bedtime! We were extremely lucky to get a room overlooking the pool and the parks and that put the icing on the cake for a very successful vacation in a top notch hotel with excellent service and superb amenities. We would recommend this property for anyone but, naturally, the kids are particularly taken with the fun in this sun!

Reviews.Title: “Trust my opinion”
Reviews.Author: iluvrocko
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hard Rock and have traveled quite extensively, so I can tell you that this resort gets 3 1/2 to 4 stars, out of 5. Check-in was a breeze; the staff is extremely friendly; the rooms were beautiful - I reserved an upgraded larger room that slept 6, even though there were only 3 of us, but we really appreciated the room to spread out. The resort was very clean, the pool was nice, with a great waterslide. Plenty of seating and lounge chairs, plus private cabanas. You have the option of taking a water taxi to the parks and City Walk area, but you have to wait sometimes up to 20minutes for the water taxi, or you can take the walking path from the resort. It's about a 6 minute stroll. The HUGE advantage of staying on-site Universal is the Express Pass. My family and I enjoyed the 2 parks in their entirety and repeated our favorite rides, even though we left the park each day around 12n or 1p to return to the pool for 3-4 hours. My only issues - our toiletries in the bathroom weren't replenished, and the maid service is a bit slow to get around. BUT the maid service issue is an ongoing problem in all of Orlando. And when we called the "star service" desk at the hotel, they brought oodles of toiletries to us immediately. They also forgot to replenish our coffee supply one day, but again when I called, it was taken care of, and with a sincere apology. I found the food and drink at the restaurant and pool bar a bit pricey, but that's to be expected at a resort of this caliber, plus the fact that you're at a vacation resort. I've have stayed on-site Disney on past Orlando visits, and I can't say that Disney does the on-site experience any better than Hard Rock. You can feel confident in booking the Hard Rock and having a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Teenage Birthday Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: alion76
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room for my son's 13th birthday for him and 4 friends and myself (5 person maximum per room). The room was not ready for early check-in in the morning but they gave us express passes to use at the theme park and called me on my cell before noon to let me know the room was ready. The rooms are small but nicely decorated in the hard rock theme. The staff were very nice and even surprised my son with a huge tin with candies, a free in-room movie and popcorn since they found out it was his birthday... I was very impressed. When you stay at a Universal property you are able to use any of the other 2 hotels pools which was great since by 5PM the Hard Rock pool was closed for the night becuase some kid used the bathroom in the pool! GRRR, other than that, great experience - quite expensive for Orlando area, but worth it for location and amenities and staff. The Kitchen is the restaurant there and the food wasn't great - other than that, fun trip and we got a late check-out of 1PM! Teens love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: jl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 children (ages 14-11) stayed at the Hard Rock over Memorial Day weekend of 2007. We stayed for 4 nights in a Club Level Room, and got the stay 4/get 2 free passes rate. The propery is awesome, the location is great, and my kids loved the room. The only problem we had was checking in - it was 8:00 P.M. and we were told our room wasn't ready....we had booked the trip about 6 months prior, so I was a bit concerned. We ended up with what appeared to be a jr. suite, so the 15 minute wait was worth it. It was a very spacious room, and my kids were very excited. The pool does get very crowded in the early afternoon, so we did the parks early in the morning for a few hours and then went back at night. Club level is great - continental breakfast and cocktails and appetizers from 5-7 at night. The restaurants on propery are pricey, but what isn't pricey in Orlando! We would definitely stay at this hotel again! The staff is excellent and extremely accomodating, and you can ALWAYS find someone to ask if you have a question. The only downfall is that they charge you to park there, even if you're staying there, which I find a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is very cool !”
Reviews.Author: delra22
Reviews.Content: Well, before I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Universal, I read several reviews about it online. So, I feel compelled to write my own! My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel. Our kids - 12 and 14 yrs old loved the pool ! It had a water slide that kept everyone happy - young and old. The drinks at the pool were a little pricey - $12 for a strawberry margarita but they were good. We ate breakfast the first day at the "Kitchen". The buffet ran us about $80 - a little more than I usually spend on breakfast. There was quite a varity though (omlette bar, pancakes,sausage, bacon etc) The second day we found out that you could buy bagels, cereal, fruit etc at the market place (lower floor - next to the ice cream parlor). Most of our meals were eaten at City Walk which had a good varity of restaurants. We stayed in a gardenview room which was adequate. The beds are very comfy ! Overall, I would stay here again - the service was great, the staff polite, rooms clean and you can't beat staying right in the parks. The express pass that you receive with the room moves you to the front of every line at the parks. We waited no more than 5 minutes while others had to wait 60 min. The music that is played throughout the hotel rocks !! We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: We have been here several times before and this was our best stay ever. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute drive from the hotel and once off the highway, signs direct you to the hotel very well. Gated entrance and we drove up to the front in a convertible and the family felt great. One change is that they now charge for self-parking so w/ a light $ upgrade you can valet park. We were VERY early for check in and we got hung up at the front desk as they couldn't get us a room. People at the desk couldn't have been nicer during the proces and then upgraded us to the 7th floor whcih was like an upgrade from coach to first class. A major change ! 7th floor provided breakfast w/ fresh fruit etc., snacks during the day, free drinks at happy hour and nice young people focused on the customer. We loved it. Pool was clean as always, entertainment w/ music or movies every night, room was clean, bathroom updated and just a great experience. Walk to Universal was as always easy and w/ the hotel pass going to the head of line for the rides is such a great treat and a major advantage over Disney's fast pass. Ate at Emerils 1 night (great) and NBA City on NBA Draft Night ( a terrific experience) Loews hotels sent a survey when we left and it was followed up w/ a personal email from the hotel manager as they were concerned at our initial wait at the front desk. Nothing to woryy about as when we return we plan on absolutely staying here again, not sure we could get the kids anywhere else after such a positive stay. Many thanks to all the employees that made our experience special.

Reviews.Title: “great fun!”
Reviews.Author: theboogs
Reviews.Content: I researched alot of properties before picking the Hard Rock to stay at. We stayed in a deluxe room and it was comfortable and the maids cleaned outstanding! This is a great place for families (we brought 2 sons -ages 15 and 18) music blares constantly, which we loved, there is lots of music memorability all over. You use your room key to bypass the regular lines at Universal and Island of Adventure, which is worth the pricey room in itself! All the restaurants onsite are great. One thing I should mention, though. When we checked in, on a Thursday night at 7 pm, there was a live band playing in the huge lobby area(The Knack - very cool) so it was extremely loud to try to talk to the front desk people. We had to yell. But the staff walks around singing and dancing and everyone was so happy! It was a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: klms1423
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando. I guess the second time was definetly better for us. Our first trip wasn't great but we decided to give them another try. It was much better. Housekeeping was not good the first time we went, but was prompt and did a great job this time. We had a great time going to events at the pool. Concierge was always helpful and our check-in couldn't have went smoother. I am very happy we gave them another chance. The only things I would complain about is the 12 dollars a day they charge you to park in there lot. I think at the price you pay to stay there you should be able to park for free. Also I wouldn't reccommend eating breakfast at the Kitchen. It is not worth the price. The food was ok, but was way overpriced. Overall things were good and we had an excellent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jkbrown19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock July 1 - 3 and had a great time. This hotel is the closest on-site property to Universal Studios. You can either use the complimentary boat to get to the parks or you can walk to Universal. The boat ride is cool for the kids but it is closer to Universal if you walk. There is a sidewalk that takes you literally to the front gates. When you take the boat it drops you off near CityWalk. As far as the room goes it was nice. I would compare it to a Nice Hilton property. The room alone is not worth the $200 plus dollars a night that it will cost you but what is worth its weight in gold is the Express Pass that lets you skip the regular lines. The pool area is awesome as it has a fantastic slide for the kids. We opted for the valet parking as it is 18 dollars a night compared to 12 dollars for self parking. It was nice to pull up to the hotel and have the bell service guys take your luggage and park your car. This is first class service. If you are like me and were debating whether to stay at the Hard Rock vs Royal Pacific because of some reviews that I read about the Royal Pacific being an older hotel, I would not worry about that. I did not visit the Royal Pacific hotel, but we did not spend much time in our rooms at all. I could have saved about 50 dollars a night had I stayed at the Royal Pacific. All in all I was very impressed with the Hard Rock. The only complaint that I have is that the beds in the room were very hard and uncomfortable. I don't know if anyone else had this problem but I was not impressed with the beds. I thought that a hotel that was charging 200 plus dollars a night would have an exceptional bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time..I love Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: CHOCOLIT30
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the HardRock Hotel in Orlando. We had such a good time. I couldn't believe how friendly the people that worked there was. Everyone including all the workers greated us with a smile at all times. Everyone seamed to love their jobs and it showed. Even one of the bartenders said it was a great company to work for. I stayed on the 7th floor which you needed your room key to get to that floor. There was a club room with drinks and snacks, tv and chairs where you can sit and relax. I like that a lot. We stayed in room 7124 which had the perfect center view of the pool. The room was very nice and modern, with a flat screen tv, ipod doc, dvd player, play station, computer with keyboard. The decor was so hip. But who even needed any of that when you could go out to the beautiful pool where they had it set up like a beach, I thought I was on an island somewhere. They had the music going. The activities was fun. I even won the hoola hoop contest for adults. But the best was taking the water taxi to Universal, Island of Adventure and City Walk. You could even walk it is 5 mins to everything. I loved the fast pass that made it all worth the money. You don't have to wait in the long lines just show your room key and you go through another way. The first thing you should do is buy the neckalace that holds the fast pass for $5 it is worth it...just put it around your neck and you don't have to worry about digging for the key and it also makes a great souvinour. I also liked the fact that you can use the facilities at the other two hotels. One day we went to one and the other day we went to the other and stayed at the pool and ate. I am so glad I picked hard rock because I like the music going they even had speakers under water. The water wasn't deep at all though. The slide was the best. I can go on and on. I loved this vacation and I am a picky traveler. We ate at the Bob Marley restaurant. The food was excellent. The only thing I didn't like which had nothing to do with hardrock, is that after 9:00 pm you couldn't take the kids out to dinner because all of the restaurants turn into night clubs and they wouldn't let us in unless you are 21 and over which sucked because we wanted to stay at the parks until closing and then get dinner but we were stopped at the door. I thought this was suppose to be a kid friendly place. We didn't eat at any of the restaurant on site because we bought the meal deal at the park where you can eat at participatating restaurants. It is limited on what you can eat but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Freddie6
Reviews.Content: After spending 9 nights in a sub-standard timeshare we finished up our trip with one night at the Hard Rock in Orlando. What a pleasure. The accomodations were clean and nicely decorated. The pool was fantastic. The kids loved the slide and the underwater sound system. Not to mention the games and activities organized by pool staff. I was able to get a late checkout and spent the whole day by the pool before we had to leave for an 8pm flight. We did not do Universal or Islands of Adventure but if you stay at this hotel you get to go to the front of the lines at all attractions. I would definitly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “hard rock rocks”
Reviews.Author: matnkel
Reviews.Content: spent a week here in june, loved the location close to international drive and you could walk to universal and city walk .. the pool was great to relax by and the amount of restaurants at the hotel and near by was great if your not driving (unlike the week we had just spent at disney were we would of been lost without a car) and best of all the fast pass system when you are in the universal studios or island of adventures you have access to the hotel guest only lines and we didnt wait for anything bearing in mind some of the lines were 90 mins long! it was cool being able to pass people in line and then have another go while they were still waiting! If you like the Hard Rock franchise you will love the hotel with it being set up simmilar to the cafes with memorabillia and music piped everywhere including the pool! another great place we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: amusementparkfan
Reviews.Content: What a great place for Kids. Mine are 6,7, and 9. We loved the pool. They had something going on every night we were there. DJ and hool hoop contest on Thursday, Dive in Movie on Friday. Very close to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure - 3 to 5 minute walk. Beautiful grounds. Great Staff!! Only complaint is that it is a pet friendly hotel. We had a great room on the first floor - did not have to wait for elevators or climb stairs. Only problem was that the first floor is where they put all the dogs. We had barking dogs on both sides of us all week long. We complained and got free drink tickets, but wish they could have found us another room on the first floor away from dogs. Best part of the trip, the express pass. Worth every dime. We rode spiderman 3 times while people in regular line were still waiting to ride once. AWESOME

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eightiesgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Hard Rock hotel in Orlando. I traveled with my husband and three boys 10, 7, 6. This was our first trip to Universal Orlando as we are usually loyal Disney World guests. We originally booked our stay at the Portofino, but at the last minute changed to the Hardrock as rooms (with Florida resident discount) became available. Boy am I ever glad we changed resorts. Although the Portofino is beautiful in every way and everything seems to be first class all the way it did seem to be a bit stuffy for a family with three young, active boys. The Hard Rock fit our bill to the tee. We loved the huge lagoon style pool. My kids enjoyed the waterslide. I liked the poolside restaurant service. The wait staff was VERY attentive. We never had a problem getting a beach chair. Plenty of towels were offered at the pool area. The staff had organized games for the kids in the pool area as well as nightly movies. My kids LOVED watching the movie from the pool. The rooms were very roomy. We did have to get a roll away bed for my son. Once we folded it up and put it against the wall; it was like it wasn't there at all. The bathroom is large and had a place for all our toiletrees. They had an honor bar which we didn't open. They had a nice coffee pot that we used every morning (we brought our own coffee from home although they do supply decaf and regular coffee in the room.) We liked the ipod docking station and the flat panel TV. The beds are queen in a double room which is a nice plus. We ate in "The Kitchen" restarant three times. Twice for breakfast and once for dinner. All three meals were good. We had the breakfast buffets both mornings. It's a bit pricey at $16.00 per adult ($8.00 for children) but it included beverages...and the food was good. I recommend the asian chicken salad for lunch or dinner. It's a huge salad...big enough to share..for sure. Definitely try the ice cream parlor downstairs. The prices are reasonable and it's the best ice cream we've had in a long time. We liked the short walk from the hotel to the parks and City walk. We took the boat once and enjoyed the ride. With wait times and all it's quicker to walk. The Hard Rock is the shortest distance to the parks than the other three resorts. It took 5 minutes to walk to the entrance of Universal Studios and 10 minutes or so to walk to the entrance of IOA. We liked that we had the ability to charge everything back to the room and took advantage of the package delivery service. Anything you buy will be sent back to the resort ready for pick up the following morning. The best perk of all...by staying at any of the three Universal Orlando Resort properties you and everyone staying in your room gets the Express pass. Basically you can go to the front of every line. For shows such as "Twister" not only do you go to the front of the line, you also get let into the building before everyone else! It's a real VIP treatment. Because of the Express Pass we were able to tour both parks in one day. We literally walked onto every ride with NO wait. I can't imagine tour Universal without this pass. The regular lines were VERY long. I can't say enough about how wonderful this hotel is. If you are looking for an outstanding compliment to your Universal vacation sstay at this hotel. If you want a Disney Resort comparison?? I'd compare it to the Beach Club. The Hard Rock at Universal Orlando gets an A+++!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hooked on Hard Rock!!!”
Reviews.Author: morningdew4
Reviews.Content: My family & I have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando 4 times, and have been extremely impressed each time. Hard Rock is onsite at Universal Orlando, so you are only a 5 min. walk from the theme park & citywalk, or a 5 min. ride on the water taxi or resort shuttle bus. You feel as if you're at home in this hotel, and are free to be yourself, relax and have a good time. The atmosphere in the hotel and attitude of the staff is so great that it has to be experienced first-hand! We've stayed on the club level (7th floor) every time, and would highly recommend staying there because of the ameneties that are included (free breakfast, snacks, desserts, liquor (5-7pm) and all-day free soda & water). Hard Rock Hotel is a must for any family vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is lovely, but encountered a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Diayanne
Reviews.Content: My BF and I stayed at the Hard Rock on May 3 & 4. I was in town for an event and my room was paid for by a third party. We checked in around 7:30pm and had no wait. The check in was quick and we were directed to the elevator bank. First problem we encountered was that we got on the elevator with other people and everyone started selecting their floors. My room was 1114, so we are looking for 11th floor, but 7 is the top. We take the elevator back down to the lobby and ask them where we go? NOTE: lobby is actually the third floor. Our room was on the first floor. It is a little confusing when you get off the elevator on one because the sign points to the gym, pool, water taxi etc. After wandering around a bit, we finally found the room. It was a nice room, beds were great and the television got lots of channels. Ate dinner the first night at "The Kitchen". Food was good, but expensive. Rest of stay was pretty uneventful until after we checked out. Because my room was paid by a third party, we had given them a card to place the $100. hold for incidentals. We charged our parking and dinner which came to $104. The hotel placed two additional charges to cover the additional $4.00, one charge for $6.00 and a charge for $407.!!!! I was charged $513. for a free room! It took three days to get it straightened out, even though the hotel admitted they made a mistake. That really took a bite out of our vacation fund.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: AmesFL
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Orlando as a family as the drive is reasonable from South Florida and we got a deal on the entire week pass for Universal's parks, Universal Studios & Islands of Adventure. We spent our first night at a LaQuinta and then after seeing people at the parks entering with express passes (and the lines for some rides on a Saturday were heinous) we looked into the express passes. Forget it - $40 per person per day. (That's on top of the park admission) Then we learned that if you stay at one of the 3 Universal Resorts you get express access as your room key is also an express pass! The nicest part of the perk was that the first thing we did when we got up on Sunday was went to the Hard Rock for "Pre Check In" where, even though you don't get into the room right away you get the coveted express pass! We didn't expect them to have our room ready right away but they called my cell phone within an hour to tell me that our room was ready for us. The staff were terrific. We were there for the parks so we were not in a hurry to return to the room. The rooms by the way are LOVELY and I travel significantly for work and have come to be very discerning about where I stay. The bedding was supreme. The pool area is great (although there are tons of little kids) and there are activities all day long. We got a very decent rate as we are FL residents - but the express passes alone, which would have been $240 for the three of us, made it worth every penny. You do have to pay to park at the resort but you would have to pay anyway at the parks. The walk to the parks from the Hard Rock is a beautiful landscaped path that in 5 minutes has you at the Universal Studios entrance or Citywalk. You can also take a(free) shuttle or the water taxi but its so close the walk is perfect unless you have kids that would like the boat ride. We didn't go to the restaurants or the clubs but would have enjoyed them as the place has great atmosphere. I would return in a heartbeat. Great Fun.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star hotel??? Please!”
Reviews.Author: shinez
Reviews.Content: The Hard rock was a far cry from Disney- starile, messy, unfriendly and ... Well, we stayed on the "club level" for reasons of quiet, food, and pampering, but, I must say, this "club level" was soooo underwhelming. The club room was so tiny, the food/snack choices very limiting- the trash was overflowing at every trashcan filled with half chewed food and the like- the seating were these desk chair things, a bar (that had 3 stools) and one table- it looked like this was a total overlook and they just coverted 2 rooms in to their version of a club. Pathetic. Housekeeping was terrible- we left on 3 days around 9 a.m. and returned to the room at 4- do you think that our room was made up?? No way! I complained to Housekeeping, and told them that we would be out the following day during the same hours, and low and behold, we returned every day to an unmadeup room- Come on!! We thought that we would have gotten service since our room was next to the housekeeping room, and the housekeeping cart was planted next to our door the whole time we were there, but no go. The whole hotel was very bare minimal, sterile and cold feeling. Okay, I am used to good hotel service, and this was definately no Ritz Carlton, no Four Seasons, not even a Best western! If you don't mind kids running amuck up and down the halls, trash bins over flowing, bad housekeeping, and not a quiet place to sit in a lawn chair without being overrun by kids screaming and throwing sand, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Rocking Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JWilson213
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from April 26 - 30 2007. Check-In was fast, room was clean, Pool was great, We will be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: Purpledesk
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we felt like nothing was too much trouble for any member of the Hard Rock staff. We arrived at around 11.00 am, not expecting our room to be ready but hoping to go straight into the parks for some fun. There was no line at check in; Rachel the receptionist was extremely helpful and arranged for our laptops to be stored in the strong room while the rest of our bags were checked in with the bell desk. We were given our room keys (the all important requisite for the Express line in the parks!) and told we would be phoned once the room was ready. 5 minutes later we were walking through the wonderful grounds to the parks. 15 minutes later my husband and daughter were riding the Hulk coaster! Hotel called while we were riding Jurassic Park so I called them back and they immediately confirmed our room number and said they looked forward to seeing us upon our return from the park. Room was great. We'd booked a deluxe room (2 queen beds and a sofa bed) and there was PLENTY of room for the four of us (two adults, daughter 13 and son 6). Pull out sofa bed was very comfortable, according to my son! Tasteful colours, ipod docking station, flat screen tv, cd player/radio (we got a complimentary cd at check in), cordless phone, coffee maker. View from the room was overlooking the front entrance and gardens but weren't disturbed by noise from cars coming or going at all. There was some noise from the corridor, but no worse than many other hotels. Bathroom was small, but perfectly adequate and spotless. Additional washbasin and dressing area just outside the bathroom made it easy for everyone to get ready on time. Ice machine on our floor was not working and within 5 minutes of reporting it, someone appeared at our door with a bucket of ice. When we walked past the machine on the way to the elevator approx 45 minutes later, the machine was working fine. Bell hop who brought our luggage up suggested we might like more towels as there were four of us in the room - he said he would arrange this and sure enough 15 minutes later a pile of fresh towels were delivered. Every time we walked through reception throughout our stay if Rachel was there she greeted us by name and stopped for a chat. Dinner in The Kitchen (complete with Scooby Doo!) was great - they mixed a special virgin cocktail/smoothie for my daughter - and the memorabilia around the place is great fun to investigate. The Velvet Lounge was a ideal for an evening cocktail to wind down at the end of the day. Kids loved the ice cream parlour too. Pool side has a great vibe, but the pool is definitely for kids, very shallow. Service in the poolside bar was slow. Biggs the bell hop/valet guy was fantastic! Yes there is music playing in all the public areas and elevators but this is the Hard Rock Hotel, what do you expect!! We loved it. We had just spent a week prior to this at Disney, but Universal and the Hard Rock beat it hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: tomsak
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay during the last week of April. Family of 4 (girls 11 and 13). Mixed feelings about the Hard Rock. It is a first class hotel in most respects. Check in, check out, concierge, bell hop, etc. all up to standards. Requested a high floor, quiet and this was superbly granted with a room on the 6th floor at the far end of 2 hallways from the single elevator bank (don't worry, these are the fastest elevators I have ever seen in a hotel of any size). The room had windows on 2 sides because of the end unit whch gave it nice views and extra quiet sharing only one wall. It was very clean and nicely appointed. Nothing to complain about. 2 queen size beds, not fulls like the Marriott does in the same price/class hotel. It was a longer walk back and forth from the elevators but worth it. Grounds are well kept; however, the general pool area gets a bit ratty looking by day's end, especially since many people apparently don't feel any need t o pick up after themselves. You see this everywhere today but more so here. I believe it is a product of the rock n' roll atmosphere here. The hotel can get somewhat "rowdy" in terms of noise in the hallways but perhaps to be expected at a Hard Rock.
