Pros: short walk or boat ride to the parks and City Walk, express pass for the attractions cannot be beat, nice fitness room, many activities for kids and live entertainment at the pool on Sat. night as well. You can also use the facilities at the Portofina Hotel if you wish, Cons: $3 for a grande Starbucks in the Marketplace and self-serve to boot. Breaks a record for me by far. All restaurants very expensive, pay for Internet $10/day, pool side specialty drinks start at $11, shallow pool depth (my kid's complaint) but good slide, difficult self-parking esp, for $12/day, and as noted above, the general pool area becomes a bit of a mess by late aftenoon with not much effort to clean it up. By the way, Universal parks are fun but there is no way that they compare to the quality standards set by Disney. This is my experience here as well as Universal Hollywood vs. Disneyland. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenny66
Reviews.Content: The whole family enjoyed are stay here at Hard Rock. We stayed in the Kids suite. Great for kids. We loved the pool. Great service. After a busy day at the park we would come back and spend the remainder of the evening at the pool. We had dinner, drinks and the kids swam. Hotel has lots of music, its the Hard Rock. Loved all the music that was playing, loved the set up of this hotel. I don't think the room were noisy i did hear children running up and down the hall but that's on the parents, so it's not a complaint on the hotel. I'm a very heavy sleeper and i need quite and darkness to get to sleep and i had very restful sleep. I would stay here again and again and i love that it is on grounds of Universal. When they say on grounds they mean on grounds. You can walk to Universal studios/Islands of Adventures of City Walk, or take a very short water taxi ride or a very fun ricshaw ride. Loved the food, loved everything. Meet Hulk Hogan he was staying at the hotel. Check-in and check-out was painless no lines at hotel and no lines for rides. With hotel key express line at park. This was better then Disney and the last four vacations were at Disney so the next 3 will be at Universal. Fun for all!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with hotel service”
Reviews.Author: John73
Reviews.Content: My family ,friends and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights from April 2 to 4/07 and we had a few problems with this hotel.First of all,the check in service is extrremely slow as we had to wait from 130pm to 4pm to get into our rooms.Now i know that check in time is at 4pm but we waited around the hotel lobby as the lady at the check in told us that our rooms would be ready in 30 mins which they werent until 4pm exactly.We kept on checking back every 20 mins but we were put off each time.The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms were clean and comfortable.The location is good. for going to the Universal parks but we paid a high price for the regular rooms,approx $350 per night plus tax.This brings me to this other issue of the express passes as you are able to bypass the regular lines in supposedly no time at all because you are staying on site.There were times when the express line was a 50 min wait as compared to the regular lineups of 90 mins.I dont think that it is worth it paying the high price to stay at this hotel just because of the wait in line for the rides.etc.You are better off staying at another hotel in the International drive area that saves you money and gives you perks like free breakfast and free parking unlike to $12 charge to park your vehilce on site to this HardRock hotel per day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is disappointing the second time around”
Reviews.Author: cressydoodles
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel and it will probably be our last. Maid service was poor (I had to pilfer supplies from the maid's cart myself), bulky decorative pillows on bed were a pain (each bed had a huge 4 foot cylinder pillow which were nuisances to put somewhere at night) and the rock memoribilia novelty of the hotel has worn off. Also it was very difficult to find a parking spot in the 2 hotel parking lots, especially when the hotel had a wedding or party. It was very frustrating since they charge about $15 a day. Lastly they wouldn't honor my Loews Hotel Rewards card because I booked thru Universal. However, we will definitely stay at another hotel on the property next time since the "free" Express Pass that is a guest privelege is downright necessary. I wouldn't go to Universal without the room key to show and get ahead of the line - we waited 10 minutes for the Spiderman ride instead of 2 hours! I was impressed that the check in was quick and the ticket desk in the lobby could process my Univ. ticket voucher, so I didn't have to deal with it at the park.

Reviews.Title: “Rock On”
Reviews.Author: vacationbug
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hard Rock on two occasions. Loved it the first time, came back for a second! The decor is so different, so fun. Everything music related. And beautiful lobby, so pleasing to just sit in and look around. We loved the pool area, relaxing with a drink after wandering the parks all morning. We stayed on the Club level. Not sure if it was worth the extra $, but we did enjoy it. The location of the hotel can't be beat, and the express pass at the parks makes it all worthwhile. Without the express pass (which is your room key), I don't think the parks would have been nearly as enjoyable. We never had to wait on a line more than 5 minutes - fantastic perk for staying at this hotel. But we just loved the whole ambience of the hotel, my kids (16 and 14) really enjoyed it also. Two wonderful stays. Such a fun, energetic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: disnyfan83
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here during our Spring break. We had two sixteen year old girls with us, so we booked a "Kid's Suite." This consited of a VERY lage entry way with a massive walk in closet and wet bar (consisting of the mini bar, coffee maker, glasses, etc.). The bathroom was broken into two rooms - one large room with a big glass shower and two sinks, and a smaller room with a tub/shower combo, a small sink and the toilet. The main bedroom was enormous - with a king size bed sitting area, large dresser, ipod docking alarm clock and big flatscreen TV. The "kid's room" was thru two double doors off of the main bedroom. It consisted of two single beds, a cute round table with cube chairs, a plastic shelving component, a dresser and flat sceen TV. Everyone LOVED it!!!! The linens and pillows were fantastic. The only problem we had was that the room smelled very smokey (I have a very high sensitivity to smells.) We talked to the concierge about it, and while we were at the parks, they came in with an air purifier. It helped a bit. Of course, the BEST thing about this hotel is walking onto EVERY RIDE WITH NO WAIT!!! You really felt like a rock and roller in this place!!! This is one sexy hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LisaDee_Virginia
Reviews.Content: We had a great family vacation at the Hard Rock Hotel April 2nd through 7th. We were in a Club level room on the 7th floor with a view of Universal Studios. The room was very clean and nicely appointed. Prior reviews have complained about noise but we didn't experience a problem. We were far away from the elevators, just a couple rooms from the end of the hallway. On the Club floor you have access to the "Club 7" lounge which had complimentary continental breakfast (bagels, donuts, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, coffee, juice), evening drinks and hors d'ouevres from 5pm to 7pm and an evening sweet snack (cookies, brownies, and ice cream were selections while we were there.) Additionally, sodas, bottled water and coffee were available all day. The pool area was lovely but when arriving in the afternoons we were never able to get a lounge chair. They were all occupied or 'reserved' with towels. We were there over spring break so perhaps it's better at slower times of the year. The pool itself is very shallow with a zero-entry edge and a great waterslide for adults and kids alike. The water was very warm, almost like bathwater. As others have mentioned, the location of the hotel can't be beat if you are planning to visit the Universal parks. It's about a 10-minute stroll (through gorgeous landscaping) to Universal Studios and another 5 minutes more to Islands of Adventure. There is also a free water taxi and pedicycles. Having access to the express lanes at the parks was wonderful....we rarely waited more than 10 minutes (during Spring Break!) We enjoyed meals at The Kitchen restaurant. Thy had a "kids buffet" and a play/TV area off to the side for kids to hang out while their parents finish their meals. They had character dinners two nights. Our favorite meal was at Mama Della's at the Portofino Bay hotel (also a short stroll from Hard Rock.) We had wonderful food and service. Dinner at Tchoup Chop was fine but not as good as Mama Della's. We used the "Camp Lil' Rock" kids club one night. They had a great room for the kids with art supplies, computers, a large TV, video games, etc. My kids were the only ones there that night. They would have enjoyed it more if there were other kids to play with. It's very pricey at $12/hour per kid plus $12/dinner so we probably wouldn't use them again. Overall we had a great time and we will definitely return to the Hard Rock the next time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Quieter, Nicer and Just as Hip as Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: YazBeanSaysMeow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on business in February 2007, booking the cheapest possible room. I anticipated a loud, funky, run-of-the-mill hotel and was pleasantly surprised to uncover a hip, fairly quiet property with good service. The rooms were modern yet comfortable, with colorful decor and musical theme throughout. The only complaint I have about the rooms was the tight squeeze from chair to wall at the business desk. Given that this was a Hard Rock property, I expected a lot of noise and loud guests. Happily, this did not prove true, even though the hotel was fully booked (albeit with many convention attendees). Service was top-notch (and this comes from someone who enjoys staying at Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons properties). The front desk, gift shop and concierge staff were excellent in responding to both routine and unusual requests. I ate at two restaurants onsite -- The Palm (an old standard and always good) and The Kitchen (this one was fine -- nothing outstanding but solid food and drink). Although I typically prefer more "traditional" hotels, I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing - You should read this”
Reviews.Author: Foxhunt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock May 2006 and I am shocked at the positive reviews I read here. Did we stay at the same place? Hopefully they have changed a few things in a year, BUT they accept pets, which is great, but our room smelled so badly like cat pee. When I called to be moved, 7 hours later they sent someone to "clean" the carpet. Anyone knows you can't clean cat pee out of a carpet. Since we were busy from the moment we arrived with2 other families and multiple children, it wasn't until the next day I asked to be moved. They told me I would be downgraded in the room class without any compensation. A $300/night hotel room that smells like cat?? That said, how about the rude wait staff at the restaurant next to the pool (we waited 60 minutes for our food at 8 pm when the restaurant was 1/3 full - no apologies). We ended up eating there 4 times for the convenience and only once was a waiter pleasant as opposed to condescending. The skinny, tatooed and pierced girls serving drinks at the pool also had a such a sunny attitude that they had to add a tip to our $17 tab! We purchased the meal plan for the kids which was horrendous. We were supposed to feed our 3 kids chicken fingers and french fries for 5 days? The park food at Universal is bad enough. Not only is the Hard Rock very expensive, I suppose paying for all the cool paraphenalia on the walls, but the food and drinks were outrageous, even for vacation prices. Our friend paid $14 after a tip for one "rail" margarita. Frozen drinks by the pool are upwards of $10. All 3 families that we were with felt gouged. The one nice thing we all remember is the poolside entertainment for the kids. The comedian was great. Also the proximity to Universal cannot be beat. We also bought tickets to the "private party" concert. It happened to be Boston. Once again, very deceiving. It was purely for single locals, serious meat market. They sold us on emails saying "free cocktails and hors'dourves for the first hour, the band in a private setting." It was a singles bar, filled with people looking to hook-up from the Orlando area. Not a fun place for 3 couples, and the lines for the "free cocktails" took 20 minutes. FYI management: I wrote a lengthy commentary (when asked by the hotel) when we returned. The response promised that changes were afoot. Guests, beware.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaCNNJ
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hard Rock!!! We stayed for 5 nights 3/28-4/2. Our first 3 days/nights were great as I pulled my children (12 &9) from school 3 days early. The Hard Rock was busy but not crowded the early part of the trip. The last 2 nights were crowded but it was what I expected as it was spring break. Okay - my family normally spends 4 or 5 days in Manhattan over Easter break. When I first got to the Hard Rock in Orlando I was blown away on how wonderful the staff was. I honestly thought it was a fluke on my first day. But the staff really is accomodating and friendly. We could not open a piece of luggage and about 4 bellhops helped out until it was opened. They were funny and cheerful and I knew they really enjoyed their jobs. The coffee pot was missing in our room and one was brought ASAP. They also brought me tea bags. One day the newspaper was missing and within 5 minutes we had another. The Hard Rock is so close to Universal. The walk is beautiful and easy. The best part is using your room key for the Express line at the parks. Some times the lines on the bigger rides stated 60 minutes but we were on in under 10. Over all I would say just go and have a great time. There are so many resturants to choose from. Don't let one so so meal or a little laughter in the hallways turn you negative. This is a great family resort that is beautiful and fun at the same time. We are back only 5 nights and planning our next trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun environment and close to the parks...”
Reviews.Author: Mandirae
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando in Feb for 3 nights. First time stay at this Loews Property( we are Loews Blue members). Have stayed at the Portofino Hotel twice in the past. Love the convenience and the major bonus of the express lines in both the Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure when you stay at one of their properties. We really enjoyed our stay. The room was contemporary and decorated very nicely. Comfortable bed, flat screen TV. Two sinks-one in the bathroom-very nice. Advised that the rooms were recently updated. Loved the fun environment with music playing everywhere you go. Nice lobby with plenty of "hang out" space. Loved "The Kitchen" restaurant for casual dinner and buffet breakfast. Hotel has a nice ice cream palor which has incredible ice cream flavors!! There is a small take out/snack area, which was nice for a quick, lower cost breakfast. We unfortunately did not have time to swim in the pool-and was a bit cold when we were there, but very nice. We sat by the pool for some sun and read. Very relaxing after a full day in the parks. Loved that we could walk to both parks. The only complaint would be the walls seem to be a bit thin. Could hear our neighbor too easily. Would definately stay here again and try to make more use of the facilities. Go and have fun. Also loved Choup Chop restaurant(Emeril's) at their Royal Pacific Hotel. Be sure to make reservations before you go-very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: JJPCheers
Reviews.Content: We live only about 1 1/2 hours from Orlando and visit often. We now have stayed in all 3 Loew's resorts in Orlando. We like Portofino Bay the most, but that's another review. I'll start with the good things about our stay. My self, hubby and 10 year old son stayed for two nights. We had a waterview room on the sixth floor. The room was plenty big with two queen beds, new carpet, a table with two chairs, a flat screen TV, Honorbar and coffee maker. Two sinks (one in bathroom and one outside) was a nice to touch to get everyone ready on time. Had drinks at the Velvet Bar and was very satisfied with the service. Pool area was very clean. Now for the not so good. Ladies bring your own shampoo and conditioner. The hotel toiletries were awful. They do supply a hairdryer (not the crappy kind attached to the wall) We dined at "The Kitchen" for dinner and it was not very good. Pizza was not cooked all the way and steak was way over cooked. Service at the restaurant was not good either. After being at the park and going on many rides we decided to take a break and go to the room for a little while. We arrived at the room at 3pm and it still was not clean and no fresh towels. Called for service and they said someone would be right up. Left and came back at 5pm and still no service. Called again and they said the same thing as last time. Finally at 5:50pm someone came to clean the room and bring fresh towels, this was however too late for us to take showers due to dinner reservations. The biggest reason to stay here is to get in front of all the lines at the both theme parks. All the rides were a 45 minute wait for the regular line and for hotel guests with the express pass we always waited less that 5 minutes. If you are not going to the Universal theme parks stay at another hotel. There are lots of other great 4 and 5 star hotels in Orlando both in Lake Buena Vista area and International Drive, but if you are going to the parks then one of the three Loewe's hotels is the way to go to avoid long waits for rides. If you are going to the parks we ate at Finnegan's in Universal Studios and Mythos at Islands of Adventure and were really happy with both choices. Great food, atmosphere and service. (both are full service restaurants)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TweetyConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, good service, would recommend to anyone. Food was very good. Pool was wonderful, good access to Universal Park.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: JustFair
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed are stay here at Hard Rock. We loved the set up for the Kids suite. Great for kids. We loved the pool. Great service. After a busy day at the park we would come back and spend the remainder of the evening at the pool. We had dinner, drinks and the kids swam. My only complaint was the noisy rooms. We heard everyone up and down the halls all night. They vacuumed every morning at 6:00 a.m. I am a very heavy sleeper and I could not sleep all night. For the price I paid, I would not stay there again. I had read previous reviews about the same complaint. So they are valid complaints. I liked the Hard Rock because it was only a 5 minute walk to the parks. The other on site hotels are further. We are going to try the suites at the Portofino this year. Great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't get 'Star Service'”
Reviews.Author: AnnGHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first visit to the Hard Rock Hotel. The Hard Rock did not provide the great service that we have received at during previous stays at Universal's Portofino Hotel or similar Disney resorts (Yacht Club, Beach Club). We arrived well past check-in time, but a room was not ready. It took three requests to get the toilet fixed (water ran all night). Tried to get a dinner reservation at one of the Universal restaurants and was transferred from the hotel to the restaurant to City Place to Universal Studios where the operator told me to call the hotel again. I spoke to three different hotel staff members who gave me three different answers about reservations. The room itself was nice and clean. The location is great and the Universal Express feature is a great plus. The next time we return to Universal, we will probably go back to the Portofino.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: wishbone958
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hard Rock for 1 week in February, and it was excellent. All the rooms have been redone recently, they were roomy enough for a family of 5 and the beds were great. We had a room away from the elevators, and there was no problem with noise, even though the hotel was packed. The pool area is excellent, even with the chilly weather the kids were able to swim comfortably in the heated pool and absolutely loved the water slide. The pool bar has great drinks and good food, they automatically add in an 18% gratuity charge to everything, but their service stands up to that amount. The food in the Kitchen is very good also, and they have great icecream at Emack and Bolio's. Although the Hard Rock is a little pricey, it is worth the price, especially when you factor in the room key express passes for the park. We loved the Hard Rock and are already planning our trip for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good but pricy”
Reviews.Author: doghouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights after a 4 night stay at a disney property. We have stayed here before and it was just as good, a great hotel for teenagers. The room had been renovated and was very clean. We had an excellent view of the pool and across to the roller coasters. It is only a 5 minute walk to the parks - not worth waiting for the waterbus. The weather was cool but the pool and hot tub were so warm we were still able to make use of them. The staff here really make an effort, everyone was really friendly and helpful. The snack bar at pool level has a great value breakfast - $4.99 for a bagel, juice and fruit. Housekeeping was a bit hit and miss - some days we did not get replacement toiletries, but I am sure if we asked they would have had them sent up. Maintenance we great, we had a problem charging our uk phone and after a couple of attempts they provided a transformer that did the job!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: bellaherna
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on 4 different occasions. Excellent beds, great rooms. Excellant location to the Universal parks since you can Walk there!!!!!!! Bit pricey but worth it in my opinion since this gives you a Fast Pass to get in the shorter lines at the parks. We love this place and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hard rock Hotel, Universal orlando”
Reviews.Author: DiverBruce
Reviews.Content: After 3 trips to Disney in 18 months, we found our home at Hard Rock Hotel. It's about the same price as staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. For some, who don't care if the adults have fun too, Disney is great. I have a child, but still like to live, Hard Rock and universal cater to both. I found Disney to be lame and lacking adrenaline of any kind. We came to Universal and found they do care about the young ones also. After 6 years (age 10) my daughter now goes on everything and is an adrenaline junky like her parents. Even at 4 she had plenty to keep her interested. What I like about universal most is they understand parents need fun too and are paying the bills. (Try finding alcohol at any Disney park) I have read many of the posts here, and can honestly say I haven't experienced any of the bad service problems reported. Cumulatively we have spent about 58 days at Universal without more than minor complaints.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights at HR”
Reviews.Author: seejanerun
Reviews.Content: We followed 5 nights at Disney's BWV with 3 nights at the HR. We arrived at 11 am and one of our two rooms was ready immediately. However, we all received room keys so we could hit the parks right away and have express-line access. Those keys are worth their weight in gold! We never waited more than 5 minutes for a ride and it was over the weekend when it was quite a bit busier than mid-week. The hotel itself is beautiful. The lobby is beautiful with lots of room to hang out comfortably. The music paraphenalia was interesting. Dining options include the Kitchen which was great. They have several "home-style" selections that were delicious, and while I thought the cost would have been more, it was quite reasonable. Emack and Bolios served up great coffe, ice-cream and quick breakfast selections, although nothing hot. The rooms were recently renovated so they were in great shape. The beds are very comfortable. My only disappointment was there is no option for a king bed in a standard room. Two queen beds made the room feel very cramped, and there were only 2 of us in there. Also, no balconies, which was a drag. The pool and grounds are spectacular. Very lush, well groomed and manicured. We were travelling with our 18 and 20 year old sons, so we thought the HR would be a good selection because of the music theme. While we all enjoyed it, it grew old for me quickly after developing a headache. I couldn't find an escape from the noise! I'm not sure I'd return for that reason, but otherwise, the hotel is great. Very clean, comfortable and no problems other than the noise level. Even that perhaps wouldn't have been a problem if I didn't have a headache!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is Great!”
Reviews.Author: j9999
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at all three Loews Universal Properties several times and the Hard Rock is my favorite. The staff is excellent.. .all seem to be in a great mood. The theme of the hotel is fun. The beds comfy. The kitchen has great eats! The front of the line access at the parks is reason enough to stay. We went to disney this time but stil stayed at Universal. Let me tell you... waiting in line really stinks!! We had a deluxe room and it was much larger than a standard room. Had a large closet area and a pull out sofa. We were only 4 but you could have slept 6. Room service was fast and yummy. Housekeeping was fine. Pool was gorgeous and service there great. The hard rock is not stuffy and you sort of forget you are in Orlando (except for all of the kids running around!) My only gripe...18 bucks a day to valet park. (it is 12 if you park yourself which is still a lot)

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt -Now would never stay anywhere else! ”
Reviews.Author: gr8hounds
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is wonderful! The rooms tastefully decorated with great facilities and amenities, the Kitchen Bar and the Velvet Bar offer a easy casual atmosphere, with a touch of elegance (Tracey in the Kitchen Bar was absolutely excellent and a total credit the the hotel!). The theming is excellent - everything form drumstick barriers at security to a wake up call from the Red Hot Chili Peppers (amongst others) - everything about the hotel was extremely tasteful and well done. Only one gripe - usage of the health club costs $8 a day. All round, this hotel comes highly recommended, funds permitting I would never want to stay anywhere else in Orlando now that I have been spoilt!

Reviews.Title: “Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Boxerfan2
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Hard Rock Resort Orlando two times. One trip we stayed for 4 nights and the most recent trip for 5 nights. Both times were great. Standard garden rooms were, large, up to date, and extremely clean with daily cleaning service. Ambiance is fantastic; lobby area is nice with plenty of chairs and couches to relax on. Coffee shop/Juice bar in the lower level. The Pool and slide were to die for. The kids played in the pool and went down the slide several hundred times. Well at least twenty five times. Huge white sand beach along side of pool, available rental cabanas, volley ball nets and bar with poolside service not to mention a pool table and ping pong table. Oh yeah, did I mention the band stage for scheduled concerts. I would stay here again in a heart beat. Now the down side, the first night stay was by the elevator and ice maker which ended up being very noisy. I was hearing ice hit the metal ice buckets until 2:00 am. I requested a new room for the following night. We were told to pack our stuff up and while at Universal they would move our luggage to a new room. When we returned back that night, no new room, and manager didnâ€™t know anything about it. Took approximately one hour to get our new room. They supplied us with 4 complementary breakfast buffet tickets to the restaurant The Kitchen on the lower level of the hotel which I must say was well worth the inconvenience.. One more thing, check in and out lines are slow as molasses and if you park a car, they tack on a $10 dollar a day parking fee. Donâ€™t let the down side stop you from staying here. This place rocks and everyone should try it at least once. I plan on visiting this place for a third time in the near future. Let the good times roll.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock has improved!!!”
Reviews.Author: vickier
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from December 21st-23rd. All of the rooms have now been renovated and it shows! The beds were new and all of the bedding as well. The room was bright and very clean. There was a nice flat screen television in the room as well. Check in is never very quick at this hotel, but the person who checked us in was friendly and knowledgeable. I requested a room in a quiet section of the hotel and we were put in room 5115 and it was pretty quiet. We were at the end of one of the hallways and away from the elevators. When you stay here, you get front of the line access at the Universal Parks and that is a huge bonus, especially at busy times. The one thing I really dislike about the Universal Resorts is the 12.00 a day parking charge. 12.00 to park your car in an open parking lot is ridiculous. We are annual passholders and get free parking at the Universal parks, so having to pay for parking at the hotel is ridiculous. Other than the parking fee, our visit was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - A 4 star in Ireland”
Reviews.Author: Katy00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for 11 nights over the Halloween period Oct-Nov. 2 adults and 2 children ages 6 & 13. We did have some issues with the check in staff (and they do need to adjust their attitudes) but it wasn't entirely their fault. Our travel agency was supposed to give them a voucher stating our stay had been fuly paid, they had not done this so the staff wanted us to pay again!!!!! 3,000euro....after getting off a 10 hour flight from Dublin I told them where they could shove their room. we eventually got it sorted. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby and grounds are immaculate. The food by the pool is of good quality and the restaurants have something to suit most tastes. I Drive is a bit of a walk away and the trolleys can be awkward as you have to take two. We didnt hire a car. Apart from check in staff the service by the pool and the vallet guys was excellent. There was one day when our beds weren't made. Both our kids loved the stay here, theres an ice cream parlour, music playing constantly and a water slide in an amazing pool. The walk to the parks is lovely and very relaxing, the water taxis go every few minutes or you can get a bike ride. It's only 5 minutes. We went at a great time of year, the parks were busy but not packed. We had no waiting because your hotel key gets you in the express qeue and the weather was like an Irish summer. We went to the Magic Kingdom for one night for Mickeys not so scary spooktacular and it was the best night we had there, amazing fireworks. IOA is really not that big but it has some excellent rides. We're lucky that our 6 year old is a thrill seeker and had no fear so got on everything she was allowed on. Busch Gardens is well worth a visit also. We weren't impressed with Wet n Wild, the European water parks are 10 times better. Maybe Disneys are good. In all the Hotel is really expensive but if you're looking for cleanliness, comfort, fun and a little luxury along with the added benefit of express qeueing (worth its weight in gold) then its worth it. For us, it was a holiday of a life time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - a revelation!”
Reviews.Author: Boxermad
Reviews.Content: I was really taken aback by this hotel - was expecting something a bit in-your-face and a bit OTT - instead, it was a lovely design set in fabulous grounds, didn't feel like we were part of the theme parks at all. Quite Mediterranean in style from the outside, modern and clean lines inside. We went out of season so hotel was quiet, we checked in at lunchtime. Rooms have been renovated and were excellent - spacious, well equipped. Downside is the gap between doors and carpet so you do hear people very clearly in the corridor. Take ear plugs! We ate at The Kitchen a few times - recommended - and drinks in the Velvet Lounge also very good. Staff were friendly and helpful - we got a late checkout till 3pm on the last day without any argument - but it was quiet anyway. Would go back here for sure, thought it was good value apart from the ridiculous $12 for parking our car each day!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It;s not all that, its the location your paying for!”
Reviews.Author: Tarzan8675309
Reviews.Content: Hotel grounds and lobby are nice, there is no in hotel entertainment at night, if you want that, then just go to the citywalk, with all the people paying only 50.00 a night!! we stayed in a ground floor room, with nothing to see but trees, room was worth 100.00 not 250.00, its location to the rest of universal is it's major plus, compared with other hard rocks, hollywood florida for example the rooms here are quite inferior. very overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...almost”
Reviews.Author: samat2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel from 15 November - 20 November, and I can honestly say it was the best hotel I have stayed in, in my entire life. Check in was almost instant - none of the problems which I have read on here. We were given a room on the 4th floor, and considering it was the cheapest room you can buy, it was massive - pleanty of space for the two of us, two large double beds and a very spacious bathroom, with an extra sink. It had been recently rennovated and included a large flatscreen TV (American news rules!) The room was exceptionally clean, and was serviced every day with fresh towels, and Hard Rock Hotel soap (which we 'stole' a few of). No complaints with the room whatsoever. The staff were extremely friendly - much friendlier than UK staff - always smiling, and wishing you a nice day, and very knowledgable of the area when we asked where the nearest shops, restaurants and Walmart were. I didn't use the pool, so I can't really comment on that, though I did see ducks swimming in it in the morning - apparantly not a rare site. They came right up to us too - how sweet! The room keys were like Willy Wonka's golden tickets - show them in the parks and you're whisked to the front of the line - on the Hulk ride, we literally walked straight into the seat of the rollercoaster - literally didn't stop walking until we were sat. The longest we waited in across both parks was 10 minutes on Men in Black - but this was only because it had broken down! These cards are worth the price of the room alone. Perfect in every way - almost. There was only one slight hiccup which could have been a lot more problematic than it actually was...basically you can use your keycard to buy products in the park (and have them sent straight to your room so you don't have to carry them round the park) - to do this, they charge your card $300 to do this (just in case you do a runner I guess). We declined this service, but they still charged us. If we didn't have the money we would have gone overdrawn and could have been pretty nasty. We noticed this on our bill and questionned it. They admitted it was an error and apologised for it. This is the only fault of the entire trip, but it wasn't enough to give it any less than five stars for excellent. Top marks for the Hard Rock Hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Legal-123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel as overflow accomodations from a conference attended in Orlando. We found the sound 'intrusion' to be detrimental to sleeping --- one aspect was the noise in the hallways each night from people talking and walking around in the hallways (not enough insulation to prevent sounding like they were in the room with you carrying on loud conversations). Another aspect was a concert held in the Lobby, the sound of which carried up at least through the 8th floor (as if you were sitting in the next room) well into the night. Just not what we were needing.

Reviews.Title: “I was worried!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyofFloridafans
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hard Rock for 3 nights for my son's 11th birthday while we were travelling around Florida - and then I read some reviews ! This was $313 a night so not cheap and I worried that the bad reviews of which I thought there were quite a few would spoil our stay. I need not have worried from the minute we entered to the minute we left we were treated really well by every member of staff we came across and made good friends with some. We loved it here and we used our keys for fast pass access in Universal which was great. Our room was immaculate and we had the best time. I would not hesitate to return. Don't worry about the negatives I think some people were born to complain!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place, and I Love the Short Lines”
Reviews.Author: Scot in America
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in November and were very, very happy with the place. It's definitely a "cool" hotel, with great decor, music, and rock memorabilia. The Kitchen restaurant is a good place and surprisingly reasonably placed for a resort restaurant. The very best feature of the hotel is the fact that your room key allows you to skip lines at the theme parks. This feature is not offered at Disney hotels, and it really makes the Hard Rock, Portofino, and Royal Pacific Resort stand head and shoulders above the Disney hotels. We've stayed at both the Hard Rock and Portofino, and we liked both a lot, for different reasons. Portofino is more picturesque and charming, as it seeks to re-create the village of the same name on the Italian Riviera. Hard Rock is "cooler" and more kids-oriented, and it is very close (5 minute walk, max) to the theme parks and CityWalk Orlando, with its fun restaurants and vibrant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Why do most people complain?”
Reviews.Author: Ctcope
Reviews.Content: First off, let me tell you that I am a frequent user of Tripadvisor. Anytime we are traveling to a new destination I will check the reviews. I have found that you need to read the reviews carefully and filter out the ridiculous complaints. Unfortunately, most people like to complain about everything. If the vast majority of the reviews are negative, we will avoid that particular hotel. The Hard Rock was excellent. Some of the prior reviews talked of dated carpet and bedding, which could be true in some cases here but it wasn't like the place was a dump. The carpet in our room had some wear and tear showing, but it wasn't awful. While we were there, they were beginning to shut down wings of the hotel for new carpet, painting, etc., so this shouldn't be an issue once the renovations are complete. Prior reviews also talked about the hotel being so expensive. We chose to book a club level room which came with 4 park tickets for 5 nights. The cost was $330 per night but that also included the breakfast and evening appetizers, beer and wine. The upgrade cost about $90 per day, so the true cost of the room was around $240 per night. One of the other reviews mentioned that they would stay at the DoubleTree instead. I checked out the cost and it was around $200 per night with 2 free tickets. You would then have to take a shuttle to the parks and lose the front of the line access you get staying on site. Other reviews have mentioned it, but this feature alone is the greatest reason to stay on site. Unbelievable! We rode the Mummy 5 times in a row, sitting in the front row, and never had to wait more than 3 minutes. So I'm not sure what people are thinking when they say it is expensive to stay. I guess if you can find a motel for $70 per night, buy 4 unlimited 2 park passes averaging $25 per day, pay $12 for parking, a family of 4 would pay around $180 per day and save $60 over the Hard Rock or $30 or so over the Royal Pacific. It doesn't make sense to me. We stayed on site and walked to all the parks, came back in the middle of the day and went to the pool, then walked back to the parks later in the day. More Positives: Check In: I asked for an upgrade and got one. Check in took a little while, but I can't believe some of the reviews when they said it took 45 minutes. The people at the desk were great and I was more than willing to stand there for 15 minutes to be upgraded to the family suite, for free. Music: other reviews complained about the music in the lobby and elevators as too loud. We loved it, when you got on the elevator at 8:00 in the morning and had rock songs on your ride down, you were pumped up for the day. Proximity to Parks: easy 5 minute walk to the front gate of Universal, 10 minutes to Islands of Adventure. Here's the negatives: Club room- not bad, but not worth the $90 per day to upgrade. The breakfast was really the only deal to be had. We may have covered our $90 extra with breakfast, appetizers, and drinks on some of the days, but not all. Pool Cabanas- the club room allowed us to get poolside cabanas for 1/2 price. I found that we only used them a couple hours a day and many days we would get there and a storm would roll through and close the pool. Take your chances and try to grab a chair instead of spending the $60-$120 to get a cabana. Pool- It was a little shallow but my 11 and 9 year olds thought the underwater music was great. The adults have to go towards one corner where the water was around 4 feet deep to actually swim, otherwise you could just sit on the bottom with your head out of the water. Food/Drinks- expensive but expected at resorts. It's not like the Hard Rock charges any more than any other resort in the country. We checked out the 2 other hotels while we were there as well. The Portofino was beautiful, but it is pretty far away from the parks. You would have to use the shuttle boats to get to the parks if you have kids or if you have been in the parks all day and don't feel like walking another mile to get back. The Royal Pacific is closer to the Island of Adventure, about the same distance as the walk from the Hard Rock to the Universal gate. We are going back in January and are staying at the Royal Pacific. We are going for the least expensive room and it includes 2 adult passes for $209 per night, (not sure why some people will still say this is expensive). We found that the view from the room means very little to us. We were out of the room by 8:30 in the morning, came back to change for the pool, then returned to change and go out to dinner. We didn't spend much time in the room so the view meant very little to us, not worth the extra $30 per day to get a water view. Being veterans of Disney, we really enjoyed the experience here. Our kids loved the Hard Rock and Universal. We don't go into vacations looking to find something wrong with the places we stay. These are upscale hotels with all the amenities you would want, great restaurants, and front of the line acces which can't be undervalued. I hoped this helped most of you, read the other reviews carefully and decide if the people complaining about waiting at check in, a stain on the carpet, noise from kids in the hall, music too loud, pool to shallow, drinks too expensive, etc, need to lighten up and enjoy their vacations. We had a great time and most of you will as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cheesecake2112
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in October. The checking in process was smooth and friendly, the staff were very cheerful, and the atmosphere was great. Our room key served as payment for meals, drinks etc in the Universal area. We didn't go to the theme parks, but apparently you can use them as a fast pass. We went to a concert at Hard Rock Live, which was a pleasant 5 minute walk away from the hotel - very convenient. The only thing I could complain about was the noise on the corridors - voices seemed to echo, and there always seems to be inconsiderate people around late at night when you are trying to sleep! The room was quite large and comfortable, and the bathroom was gorgeous! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It does Rock”
Reviews.Author: PeterGunn
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel. But, not the place to go if you're cheap. The lowest price room starts at 220.00 per night with a three night minimum if purchased on the internet. Add $12.00 a day for parking and about $25.00 in room taxes. For a family of 4, plan on spending about $500 to 700 a day with food and park activities. The entire hotel staff was very nice. That being said,the property is just beautiful. The pool area is wonderful. The water taxi to Universal is fun, or use the walking path. Your hotel express pass makes it easy to get on all your favorite rides quickly. The room was very clean and inviting. It was a pretty standard hotel room other than the big wide screen television. The beds and pillows were very comforatable. There is music playing everywhere, so if you like it quiet, watch out. We had a great time during our stay at the hotel. It is really a top shelf hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i love hard rock hotel”
Reviews.Author: ponyboy
Reviews.Content: me and my family stay here we love it rooms were beauiful the kids love the pool and the waterslide i love how you stay here you can bypass the lines at universal will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: Dufus30
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic 2 week stay at the Hard Rock Hotel and enjoyed every minute of our honeymoon! We booked through Virgin Holidays in the UK and our reps provided an excellent service in Florida. However, it must be said, that prior to departure their "Call Centre" service is truly unbelievably awful. Basically, Virgin Holidays' call centers seem to be based in India and, in our experience, your advisor will not understand what you are saying, and vice versa... They will NEVER email you, and when we received our tickets they had spelt my fiancee's name incorrectly on the flight tickets. Trying to sort this basic error out was a nightmare worthy of Kafka! I kid you not. It was a disaster and we had no confidence that our Honeymoon would even happen! Luckily, when we arrived at the Hard Rock (5pm ish) our room was ready, we had been upgraded to a Club Room, and check in was excellent. The entire stay was amazing. The pool at the hotel is very very good, the Velvet Bar was a fantastic cocktail bar with great friendly service, the Ice Cream bar was superb, and "The Kitchen" served a wonderful buffet breakfast. The housekeeping service was also excellent, and very friendly. The only 2 downsides were quite simple - the maid service can be late (ie 4 in the afternoon but that is cool really isn't it?), and the Beach "Pool" Bar service is very inept. Even though the hotel was not at peak time the Beach Club service was slow, disorganized, and lackluster. Like previous reviewers we must say that YES, the Hard Rock Hotel is more expensive than staying at home! Please do not stay there expecting a budget holiday.. But it is brilliant fun with great rooms, and amazing memorabilia everywhere you look - we will definitely be staying again some time.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time back a winner all-around”
Reviews.Author: memsh
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 recently completed a 6 night stay at HRH with visits to both Universal and Disney. Stayed here after a visit three years due to the proximity to Universal (easy walking distance) and a great experience with our four kids in 2003. This time was no different. Stayed in two of the newly renovated rooms on the sixth floor. The decor and updates were obvious. Rooms were clean as a pin and returned that way each day despite some very hard use by my kids. Service was top notch by everyone from valet to check-in to housekeeping and pool service. All seemed genuinely concerned about our satisfaction. The one defining moment was one morning my wife went down to the coffee shop on the first floor and they were out of chocolate sprinkled donuts which my daughter loves. The lady behind the counter proactively volunteered to take a plain donut, drizzle it with chocolate and sprinkles to complete the order. That is pro-active customer service! While the price may seem a little pricey, it is much better quality facility and service than some of those "on-property" Disney locations that have not been touched since the 70s. I recommend HRH in Orlando to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hard rock!”
Reviews.Author: islandbreezer
Reviews.Content: Booked our vacation through Universal Studios vacations at the Hard Rock. Took JetBlue direct out of Boston which was so easy. Rented a car at the airport through Avis and drove an easy 20 minutes to the Hard Rock Hotel. The entire hotel has been renovated and they have completed renovations on all floors except the first which they were working on. We asked for a smoke-free and pet-free room due to allergies/asthma and were more than pleased with the accomodations. Two queen beds and a rollway suited our family of four. The beds were so comfortable and the service throughout the hotel was excellent. There are now plasma tv's in each room.. The hotel staff is pleasant, helpful and appears to actually enjoy their jobs! If you don' like classic rock, dont stay here. It plays constantly(an excellent selection throughout our stay!) in the elevators, restaurants and pool. We loved it and so did the kids! The food at the hotel's restaurant "The Kitchen" was excellent as was the service. The room service was very good also but they do include a 20 percent gratuity. You also pay for parking your car. We cant wait to go back and will stay at the Hard Rock again!

Reviews.Title: “KIDLESS TRAVELERS BEWARE - Don't book club level”
Reviews.Author: sassytravelor
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently returned from a stay at the Hard Rock in Orlando the end of September. We travel every year for Halloween Horror Nights. My boyfriend has two young children and we play like teenages. However, I travel on business and I am used to the perks of staying on a concierge level floor. Upon arrival we upgraded to the club level expecting concierge floor sophistication. IF THIS IS WHAT YOU ARE LOOKING FOR, THINK AGAIN. The club lounge is constantly over run by children and families looking for free food and drinks. It is consistently out of supplies and does not provide the relaxing atmosphere one might expect when they pay over $100 a night to upgrade to a concierge level floor. I agree with the 8/28/06 review I read upon my return. If you are traveling with children and like the idea of taking advantage of the hotel's club level offerings and raping the other hotel guests of an opportunity to enjoy a nice atmosphere, then you should most definitely book the club level room. If you are looking for a place to have an adult, sophisticated environment, save your money. You will not find it here. The club level rooms should be described more accurately to the hotel guests by management as associated with a play lounge for the kids. That being said, we loved the hotel and had a wonderful stay. We just won't waste our money on the club level next time, unless we bring our kids.!

Reviews.Title: “Important!!Read the true Hard Rock Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: travelpro22
Reviews.Content: Before I start, I want everyone to know I have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel 4 different times and go to Universal several times a year. I have stayed at many properties around Universal and Disney, some very good and some that were horrible. Always remember a vacation or trip is what YOU make it, as a business traveler I experience "bumps" along the way almost every trip I make (30-40 trips a year). Having said this I will proceed, The Hard rock is a wonderful hotel full of energy and music. If you have teenagers, they will love the place, if you are bringing grandma and granpa, they will probably hate it. If you are looking to save money, stay somewhere else, IT IS Pricey. I hate when people complain at the price of cokes, food, parking, etc., when they book a room at $260 dollars a night. HELLO??? If you pay that much for a room, do you really think everything at the hotel is going to be cheap?? Also, people complain about the noise??? It is the Hard Rock Hotel, at a Theme Park with kids, kids, kids, did I mention kids?? This is not the Best Western on some deserted highway in Arizona. The Hard Rock is downtown at Party Central, this place does not go to bed until late, if you can't handle it, it is probably best you stay somewhere else. I will now address other issues that always seem to come up about the Hard Rock. 1-Checkin in-Do not expect to get into your room before 4:00 pm, it is probably NOT going to happen. Drop the bags and go to Citywalk or the parks. Everyone gets wound up when the room is not ready when they show up-Here is your warning, it is going to happen, now get over it. 2-Price-It is expensive to stay at the Hard Rock, the food and drinks are high and you will be charged for parking. There is bottled water in the room, if you drink it, they will charge you. Funny, no one ever mentions the tag on the bottle saying the price of the water and that they will charge you. Those tags that are on every bottle of water from all the hotels around the USA must just Magically disappear at the Hard Rock. 3-Noise-I once read a review where a woman complained about all the noise and that they were having a concert in the LOBBY of the Hard Rock Hotel....Hmmmm... ever heard of "Velvet Sessions" that happens every month at the hotel. That is part of the draw at the Hard Rock to see famous musicians around the hotel and in the restaurants. 4-Rooms-Yes the reviews are right, the rooms are getting a little shabby due to high traffic at the hotel. But, the hotel's rooms are currently being renovated and each new renovated room features flat screen TV's and docks for the IPODS.Nice.. 5-Pool-Very large pool with great slide and underwater speakers. Pool bar is great, drinks are high. To summarize----After reading this review, I'm guessing most are asking why stay at the Hard Rock??? The rooms are expensive, food and drinks are expensive, you have to pay to park, the rooms are showing age, it can be loud and there are kids running everywhere. Express Passes..........:)...:)...:)....:)LOL...LOL...LOL This is the key, the magic pass, the big Kahuna...the whip topping..OH Baby...OH Baby... Take a hour wait at a ride and do it in less than 2 minutes, walk right by all the poor suckers waiting in line to ride Spiderman, Hulk, Jurassic Park, Mummy, etc.,in 100 degree heat, all sweaty and grouchy with whiny kids complaining about waiting all day to ride a ride. You know,,, sometimes I almost feel guilty about jumping to the front of the line....NOT!!!!! Let's do the math, the express passes you buy in the park are around $35-$40 dollars a day per person and you get to ride each ride ONCE. So we have 5 people,, 5X$35.00=$175.00 plus the cost of the Holiday Inn across the street at $129.00 plus tax. Basically you are better off to stay at Universal's properties because the Room Key is you UNLIMITED express pass. This alone makes all 3 Universal Hotels worth their weight in GOLD.. I hope the review will shed some light on the Hard Rock Hotel..Remember, all Hotels have problems and most will try to make your stay as comfortable as they can, have a open mind and don't let little blunders ruin your trip. I hope you and your family enjoy Universal and Islands of Adventure as much as we do, if you liked this review, I also submitted a review on Universal Studios and tips around the park a month or so ago. Have Fun>>>>>>>>>Take it Easy>>>>Rock and Roll all Night>>>

Reviews.Title: “Worst two nights of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: caterinocr
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock Hotel is a NIGHTMARE and should be featured at the "Universals Halloween Horror nights" because it was HORRIBLE from the time we arrived until the time we left and even came back to haunt us a month later when I recieved my credit card bill. In July, my daughter and I arrived at 3pm anxious to get to "Islands of Adventure" on the first day of our vacation. It took 35 minutes of waiting in line to check in, we went through a maze of halls, elevators , stairs (and left a trail of bread crumbs to find our way out) to our room (which was no different than Motel 6 except the price was 260 dollars AND it was filthy ) ...as I change my clothes I notice dried food stuck to the table and more dried food and cereal crumbs on the floor. The base of the lamp had dried banana peels on it. My daughter gets chocolate squished between her toes from the garbage on the carpet. I check the bedding to see if it had been changed and I got lipstick all over my hand when I pulled back the bedspread. There dust all over the credenza and TV and I was petrified to look in the bathroom. I was LIVID... So now we spend 35 minutes waiting for houskeeping to come. an hour waitng around while they RE- CLEANED the room, then another hour waiting for management to come which, after three phone calls to the front desk inquiring to thier where-abouts, NEVER SHOWED UP!!!! Thats when we decided to leave for the park let it roll off our shoulders and have some fun. After all it was the first few hours of our vacation. When we returned late that PM management left a VOICE mail indicating they would discount the room 60 WHOLE dollars for us. We go to bed. 12:30 PM .......drip drip dripdripdrip, drip drip I try to ignore it. This is now Chinese water torture. I go looking for the source...water is dripping down a water shaft INSIDE the WALL behind a metal grate. 1AM and I call the front desk who sends down "maintenance" the guy gets to our room a half hour later and says he cant do anything about it , and I quote, "because all the water from the rooms upstairs drain down here from behind this grate" Now I am ready to KILL management...they give me a filthy room and then they knowingly sell a room for 260 dollars a night that no one could sleep in because of the constant dripping. 2:30 AM we are moved to a different room with ONE bed for both of us to sleep in and we are both so overtired and angry we barely slept ...we left at 8 am NEVER to return again. Management never did come speak to us or apologize in any way. Our following day at Universal was cancelled and ruined because we were both zombies. The following month there was a 6.00$ charge on my credit card for consuming a bottle of water at 2 AM while waitng to change rooms. Its a good thing we left the trail fo bread crumbs to our room when we arrived because they were still there when we left. Motel 6 I am so glad you're gonna leave the light on for us.

Reviews.Title: “Keep on rocking”
Reviews.Author: TimothyBecker
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days at the Hard Rock from 18th August. Had high expectations of the place and neither myself nor my 2 sons(12 and 10) were disappointed. My sons were delighted to receive their room keys which doubled up as charge cards in the hotel and all around the Universal Parks and Universal Walkway. I was delighted too as it meant that i didnt have to worry about cash as i walked around the 2 parks. The cards are also the all important fast track cards. This is a real life saver and means that in 3 days my sons and i went round the 2 parks 3 times. We did Land of Adventures in 5 hours and that included multiple rides on various attractions esp the Hulk roller coster which can take up to 45 mins to get on. Enough time to chicken out but not if you get on it within 10 minutes. Anyway the hotel was certainly impressive. The rooms were large and it was good to have 2 wash basins to use in the morning. The buffet breakfast is taken at the "Kitchen" and cannot be faulted. There is even a low level servery for children although the plastic plates are of the prison style! Didn't put my youngest of helping himself to the smily face potatoes. Breakfast set us up for the day and we did not savour lunch or dinner. There is an ice cream/smoothie parlour which is excellent. Something for child and adult alike. It is open late so a nice place to drop into on the way to bed. The pool area is clean and my eldest son was impressed that as advertised music was indeed to be heard beneath the waterline. A nice touch is on Sunday evening when the hotel holds a "swim in" cinema. Something of a novelty to enjoy sitting in a hot pool or jacuzzi and enjoy Toy Story 2 being projected outside. There is a vast amount of dining places to visit at Universal Walkway which is easily accessed from the hotel and again the hotel chargecard give you priority booking. After a hard day on the rides it certainly helps to get a table fast though sadly my children were usually too tired to go anywhere in the evenings. The rock music played around the public parts of the hotel is unobtrusive and is really quite pleasant even to a square like myself. Lots of rock and role artifacts which could be tacky but aren't. In truth the whole hotel had a real vibe to it. Having visited the film set style Portofino Italian resort i doubt if the other 2 hotels have as much soul as the Hard Rock. Returning to the hotel from Disneyland was a great relief and one felt rather superior staying at the Hard Rock rather than at one of the Disney hotels. Probably only one gripe. One had to pay $6 per day for the use of the gym. Essential to work off the breakfasts. Considering the class of hotel I thought that the food bill was very reasonable. One of the porters told me that the rooms are about to get a make over this month which will include large flat screen TV's in every room. The idea is to make the place even more like a rock stars abode. The Hard Rock Hotel certainly rocked me and my children's world. We shall not hesistate to hang by when next visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluepulsar
Reviews.Content: Stayed 25-29 August 2006 and this was our 2nd visit. Check in fast, efficient and friendly. Asked for room upgrade as I'm a Loews member and was upgraded to pool view room which was on the 6th floor. Chilled wine and large portion of nuts delivered too (Loews benefit). Room was attractive and large with a great vanity area with a big curvy backlit mirror. It was a little tired but refurb is coming soon and really the tiredness wasn't that noticeable. This hotel has a very strong rock music theming, yet manages to convey this theme with humour and real style. The music is played in all public areas all day and I really liked it. The public areas are smart, grand and tastefully done. The pool area is magnificent - a real tropical oasis. I did have two problems. The main one was banging, scraping and hammering coming from the room above me which was very intrusive on our last day. I complained to 'star service' who said they were renovating the room above me and the noise would stop between 7 and 8pm, however it did not stop until 10.15pm. Then, at 7.10 am I was awoken with the noise starting again. I complained again to star service, and said I felt a 50% concession on my last night's rate would be fair compensation. I expected them to bait me down or refuse this, but instead they called me back and said they had sorted this for me! I think that was impressive service and I was satisfied with this outcome. The other problem I had was a burger arriving medium rare from room service when I'd ordered it well done. They delivered another one (and fries) with sincere apologies and a basket of fruit by way of apology. They were totally forgiven! Like everyone says, the theme park express benefits are brilliant. The walk to the parks too is really pleasant with a meandering path by the canal with loads of interesting tropical plants, many of which are labelled. I wanted to give them an excellent rating, but because of the noise I couldn't. However I think this hotel combines style with a really good attitude and my advice is stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Club Level Perks”
Reviews.Author: DollyMae
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HRH from 8/16 to 8/23/06. Me, husband & three children ages, 15, 13 & 12. We stayed in a club level room. Everyday had breakfast in Club Lounge, saved time & money. Fresh Fruit, bagels, muffins, cereals, pastries, drinks. Snacks throughout day available. Dinner had three hot items & cut veggies, wine, beer & soft drinks. Late night desserts snacks & drinks, mini canolli, brownies, blondies, etc. You save so much money. We ate lunch out but for the most part the offerings in the lounge were fine for us. Everyday we would each get a bottle of water before heading out. In the parks you will pay between 1.69 & 2.50 per bottle. We would get more water when we stopped in during the day and again at night. We also saved money at the parks restaurants and shops by using our AAA card for a 10% discount. Even when we went to lunch outside of Wet N Wild the restaurants gave us the AAA discount. We arrived on 8/16 at about 12:00 and our room wasn't ready but they let us go up to the club lounge. Cold drinks and snacks. The consierge made a call and within 15 minutes we were able to go to our room. We made reservations for the 5 of us and there were only two queen beds in the room. We were told at check in that they only have 3 rooms that have the sleeper sofa and we would have to pay $25.00 per night for the cot. I complained that we booked the room for 5 and should have a room that sleeps 5. I contacted my travel agent at Liberty Travel and they contacted the hotel and made sure we did not have to pay the additional money. I would only go to Universal & IOA if I stayed on site or bought the express pass. We rarely if ever had to wait in lines. The most would be 10 minutes. Some rides would say the wait was 40 minutes, and we just showed our room key and you are shown a separate entrance and get to the front of the lines. This also worked for us at City Walk. We went to Margaritaville and there was a 45 minute wait for a table. I showed our room key and they said they would cut the time in half for us. We sat within 15 minutes. We had the tickets for Universal, IOA, Wet N Wild and Sea World. My favorite ride was Men in Black in Universal, my husband and son loved Spiderman at IOA. My girls' favorite ride was the Mummy. Shows were great. You also had preferred seating showing your room key. Loved Fear Factor which we saw the first day. Thankfully we saw it then since it closed after that until Halloween. Our rooms were always clean and ready for us when we returned around 4:00 for a break. Turn down service also was nice, getting clean towels, and little gifts for the kids at night. We usually just walked back and forth to the parks from the hotel. Less than 6 minute walk. We took the boat a couple times, since it was right there. If we had to wait we just walked instead. There was a free shuttle from the hotel to Wet N Wild 10 minute ride and to Seaworld about 20 minutes. We took a cab back from Wet N Wild since the return shuttle was later than we wanted. It cost just $6.00 for the 5 of us. One last thing. My husband loves Pink Floyd. Hard Rock Live had a group playing in concert Pink Floyd's albums. He loved taking our son to his first rock concert. It was really a treat for them both.

Reviews.Title: “recent stay”
Reviews.Author: drtwnbys
Reviews.Content: we just returned from the hard rock and had a nice time. The hotel could use a "freshing up" and I was told that all rooms will be remodeled starting this week!! So you may want to check and see how that will impact your stay. The hotel is conveniently located so you can easily walk to the parks and your room key is your express pass so no long waits in line, which is a major benefit. Don't expect stellar service though. The check in was long, our room wasn't to be ready until after 4pm, the maid service was sometime between 1:30 and 3pm, sometimes we got handtowels and wash clothes and bath mats etc, and sometimes we didn't. Prices for food and beverages are high here. A couple of pops and candy bars at the ice cream stand was over $20. Bar service, pool service and room service all carry mandatory 18% tips included. Service at the pool was poor with waiters walking past without asking if you wanted anything and even turning around and walking the other way when you were holding a menu! The Kitchen restaurant was about $50 for a light lunch for two adults and one child. And that was a dip, chili, and kids meal with cokes! And the waiter got the order wrong and denied it! Parking is additional (12 self park 18 valet) and the self lots fill up quickly by night time. This was our second stay at the hard rock we also stayed at the royal pacific. Not sure which hotel we prefer more. Won't be back for a few years anyway, so not sure it matter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: amtrak
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a vacation to Universal Studios in Orlando, Florida. We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel and I cannot tell you how we loved it. The people that work there no matter what they were doing were amazingly helpful. The day we checked in we had adjoining rooms and one of the rooms smelled of smoke and they not only gave me my money back for that room, they moved me to a better location and with no effort from us. They moved the luggage and everything while we were at the park. The easy access to the park was the best feature. We walked to Universal Studios, Islands of Adventures and City Walk in less than 5 minutes. We were able to bring a small cooler with bottled waters for my 4 boys and it was a great savings. The hotel also gives each person there own room key which is used in Universal to cut the line. We never waited more than 15 minutes for a ride even when the wait for the regular lines were 1 hours or more at times. We were amazed how quickly we were able to finish both parks. The hotel also has a shuttle that takes you to Sea World which was a great convenience not to drive after a long day at the park. The rooms were spotless and we ate at The Kitchen twice because the food was so good and never had to wait for a table. Another thing we liked about this hotel is that we decided to stay by the pool one whole day to relax and we rented a Cabana that had a TV and refrigerator, an overhead fan to stay cool plus a table with chairs to eat or just play games. The staff would walk around and hand out ice cold towels so that you could cool yourself off. The restaurant by the pool was also very good - we ended up eating lunch and dinner there as well. At night they even had a kiddy movie playing at the pool. Great hotel and will absolutely stay there next time we go back to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “OK but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Cofi
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers we had to wait a long time at the front desk to check-in, although there was only one person in the line before me. Later on in the stay, and after waiting in the line, I was told by an adviser that she could not change my travellers cheques for cash, and that I should see another adviser. This after waiting 10 mins in line! The room was nice with plenty of space for a family of four. We had a few problems - the toilet became blocked and this was sorted out immediately, but the door did not lock properly and this was not sorted to our satisfaction throughout our stay. We did not eat at any of the restaurants but took a quick and cheap breakfast each morning at the take away shop. This was very convenient. The pool was nice with a great slide for the youngsters, but the incessant loud rock music made it difficult for any one wanting to read!! The main advantage to staying at the Hard Rock is that you are able to use your room key as an express pass at every ride. We found this to be a major advantage - although you are of course paying towrads it in the hotel price. We would recommend this hotel, in particular to families with teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Sucks”
Reviews.Author: efrazi101
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hard Rock Aug1-5, the room they put me in (3095) was disgusting,. It had numerous spots on the carpet, rusted bathroom fixtures, spotted comforters, and a funky smell. I asked to be moved and that room was worst than the first. It took three tries to get a halfway decent room. Also my room was not cleaned until 4pm and it was never vacumed. When I complained I was offered free drinks and food by the pool but the problem was never corrected. At $279 a night I expected more from the Hard Rock. Next time I will just stay over night for the front of the line access and then move to a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard rock (heartbreak hotel)”
Reviews.Author: medievaltimes
Reviews.Content: i made reservations for the hard rock on february 6 of 06. i booked the club room at a rate of 359.00 plus tax a night. total being at check in 1,700.00. i also made reservations for the velvet sessions. now i drive up to the hard rock on the afternoon,2:00 pm ready to have a great vacation with my wife and three boys age 15,16,19,bags were pulled off vehicle,tipped 20.00,paid cash at front desk got park express cards,went up to the 7th floor club room and thats where everything started to fall apart. we were told 6 times that our room will be ready in a few minutes over a 2.5 hour period. finally got to room and there was no wine ,peanuts,local newspaper as promised.cleaned up a bit and headed to meet several friends at the universal globe,one of which happened to be my boss at work,we went through universal studios for several hours then headed to meet my reservation time at 7:30 at margaritaville on citywalk. food was great,drinks were fun, then when i went to charge the meal and drinks on my hotel card the server returned to my table to say(IN FRONT OF MY BOSS) your card is no good.i paid the hotel at check in 100.00 to have a charge so i wouldn't have to carry any cash at the park. he ran the card several times to no avail, contacted the hotel to see what needed to be done and hotel said that they will not honor the charge. so now i am so embarrased i don't know what to do. so finally i ended up leaving my drivers license and boss at the restaurant and me and the wife walked all the way back to the HARD ROCK HOTEL .i explained to the front desk what i had run into at the restaurant thinking that an apology and instant gratification was near. boy was i wrong . When we finally arrived, I called the night time management BRANDON to be exact, now it seemed to be a blame game,for some reason he tried to keep blaming the restaurant saying that maybe their computer is not operational, to which my reply was that a landline was used to see what the mistake was.Brandon would not call the restaurant to see what happened. We decided to check out and find a new hotel but were told that they would only give us $200.00 and mail us the the other $1500.00 .Now after 2 hours of total insanity and disbelief he left the front counter and sent a supervisor under him to deal with the situation. Finally at 10:30 pm i got my money back and my family left the HARD ROCK HOTEL to try and salvage the vacation,it's amazing how just one person can destroy and deminish dreams and excitement. At 2:00 am i finally checked in at the DISNEYS shades of green hotel,they seemed to love to honor one and all of my request.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, OK”
Reviews.Author: Cognac62
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the comments. Don't expect the Ritz. Only the Ritz prices. First off, this is the closest to the parks. I prefer Universal over Disney. They are doable and walkable. Clean. Bathrooms. Mucho food choices. And that express pass is worth gold. You get squat for staying on Disney properties. As for Hard Rock, my experience is very similar to others. Despite booking and prepaying nearly six months in advance for a club room, they couldn't find us in the computer. Took nearly half an hour for them to find our reservation. We weren't offered any compensation for the aggravation. Not even a bottled water. We were starving for lunch at the time. Not overly friendly staff. Once up in the room, it is standard fare. Nothing spectacular. Don't expect to be awed. I won't pay extra for club floor again. The food is standard holiday inn continental fare. What was horrible was fighting the other animals for food. People can be extremely inconsiderate. Nothing like waiting behind some cow in the coffee line who insists on filling and fixing five cups of coffee at a time. And best that ye get to milk and cookie time early because the hordes will snatch up a dozen cookies at a time, leaving none on the plates. Upsetting for my nine year old to see adults acting like this was the apocalypse and grabbing everything edible in site. And forget ice cream night. People were struggling to scrape that frozen mess out of the tub for ten-fifteen minutes at a time. I walked out on that fiasco. In summation, I would stay there again but not on the club floor. Would rather eat a real breakfast at The Kitchen which you can do for the difference in room price. If they ever do away with the express pass for hotel guests, won't be worth staying there at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has been the best hotel we have stayed. We have stayed at other 5 star hotels, but this one is awsome! The quality of the staff is outstanding. Just the fact that my son got sick at midnite on a Friday night and the front desk was able to provide me with imediate info. on how to have a doctor come to our hotel room to check my son was very important. The hotel is a little expensive, but it is worth the price. I will defintely stay again at the hard rock hotel. We also stayed at the Coronado at Disney, but found the rooms were showing some wear and tear and it was expensive for what it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: clidec
