Reviews.Content: Arrival- friday, very easy check-in, valet parked $18a day vs $12 selfpark, bells unloaded and was in room in 15-20min.....had dinner in kitchen restaurant at 8 very nice and had magician for kids....7 min walk (or we could have taken shuttleboat )to citywalk to have some drinks to see band at marquaritaville SAT- early star for me..went to Emacks for starbucks/ choc milk and muffins for family. had reserved cabana for sat/sun(strongly reccomend if poss for you )$ 120 per day, 8-10pm ,about 12x12, tv ,ceiling fan for excellent breeze, table /6 chairs and 3 loungers, free sodas in refrig...awesome service...overlooked great pool slide for kids ...room was nice, cool and quiet(some normal kid noise but we expect it as we have been there /done that with our kids8/10)we went to parks in evenings and had great times, READ reviews and were somewhat worried but, you make your vacation not the hotel...i feel we are "cool parents that keep the kids happy on vacations and believe me we enjoy it too" and that is what it takes to have a successful trip....................tks HR, not cheap but very worth it and our style ....have fun everyone it is up to you chris any questions?

Reviews.Title: “Too pricey, but nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel had alot of memorabilia which was very tasteful. The lobby was beautiful, but the checkin was very long. You had to pay for self parking, while valet was 18 bucks a day. If you don't need a rental car skip it. The pool was great for kids- at a safe 3 1/2 ft deep. The benefits are a great family atmosphere, express pass to all the attractions. You can either walk, or take a short ferry to Universal. My daughter absolutely loved the hotel, and to me, that's what counts the most. There are hotels nearby that might cost half as much, with a free shuttle to the theme parks. Like another reviewer said " Not for the cheap"

Reviews.Title: “Rock on at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: BlackpoolWillow
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Hard Rock to end our Florida vacation. Once you get in the place and get a room the place is fantastic. I just found the wholw registration system rather laborious, 90 minutes for our room after arriving at 16:00hrs. Anyway after that it was all systems go, a great hotel, some enthusiastic people down the corridoors late on but thats all part of the vibrant Hard Rock experience. Great pool area, plenty of activities and the express pass to Universal rides meant we covered both parks in one day and did not miss a ride, in fact we went on most twice. Our second stay at the Hard Rock and it wont be the last. Excellent would have been the mark if they just improve the arrival process.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Everyone, Except Cheapos”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Good restaurants. Great proximity to the parks. One of the best hotel pools I have seen. Rooms are clean and nice, but not large. Lay out of hotel is a bit confusing and if your room is at the wrong end from the elevators it can be a long walk, but other than that, no complaints. Was it expensive? Yes. As most things in Orlando are. If you don't want to spend money, don't go on vacation. Reading the reviews, it amazes me that some people bother to go on vacation and then spend the whole time angry about the cost. The Hard Rock is less expensive than most Disney resorts, but offers a better locations in relation to the parks than Disney does. Food and drinks cost more than they probably do at your local pub, but they are not out of line. We liked the Hard Rock for dinner and "The Kitchen" inside the resort for brunch. Hated the Italian joint in the City Walk area (forgot the name, sorry- wish I could forget the terrible service). Stayed 4 nights at Disney Polynesian then Hard Rock. Highly recommend using the Mears transport service. Cost was about $50 (w/ tip). Service was great. Guy waiting for us with a sign outside our hotel. Also used them to get us back to the airport. I preferred the Disney parks to Universal. Not much to do for my younger kids. The older ones preferred Universal. I don't recommend the park if your kids are under 10. I spent most afternoons at the pool with the little ones and they loved it.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: PaFrequenttraveler
Reviews.Content: After our lousy and expensive resort stay at the Contemporary this place was worth every bit of the money. It was cheaper than the Contemporary at Disney. Book early so you get the cheaper rate. I had 2 teenage boys. The room was big, clean and had a cd player which they loved to play their music. The pool was great. They had a DJ and everyone in the pool was dancing to the music. We drank coffee at Starbucks, ate dinner at the restaurant in Hard Rock and enjoyed ourselves. We stayed at the RC in universal before and this was far better for the teens. If you didn't want to wait for the boat you could walk to the parks. The no line no wait was the best. We have been to Orlando every year and this was the best year staying at Hard Rock. Next time we come we will skip staying at Disney, stay here and drive.

Reviews.Title: “Has so much potential”
Reviews.Author: MantenoTraveler
Reviews.Content: First I would like to state I have been here the last three years so something draws me there. We stayed several nights to relax before a very hectic six days when we moved to the Disney properties. This place is great, could be heaven, but definitely has many cons. The pool - wonderful, the walk to the parks and City Walk - wonderful, the Express passes - wonderful. Rooms are so-so. I was told they were going to renovate some this year, but not so far. Carpet is getting pretty bad. Our room did not have one of the nice bedspreads this time. Chairs were filthy. And check in is what turns me off the most. They tell you they will have you in by 4:00. I kept calling with no room. They assign you a room in the morning. Someone coming in at 11:00pm may have a room ready, but you may wait. CRAZY. I finally went back at 4 and was given a room. THEN I could not get in. They send up security who gets us in. Then at 5:30 we get a call on our cell that our room is ready. Low and behold they had given us the wrong room. Thank GOD or we would have waited until 5:30. We did not pay the upgrade for a pool room, but got one again this year. It is nuts as most are overgrown with trees so you have no view. I would not waste the money for the upgrade. My kids love the ice cream shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: airman1937
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock Hotel Club Level June 18th -22nd me, wife and eleven year old son. Arrived at 11:30am on Sunday morning, check in was within five minutes, very smooth very polite. Of course room was not ready but they gave us our rooms keys so we could go to the park and use the express pass or go up to the club room. They said they would call us on our cell phone when the room as ready, but we got back around 4pm and had not heard from the Hard Rock. We went to the front desk and the desk clerk went up and checked on the room for us and we were in our room within five minutes. The room was not huge but more than adequate, clean and very comfortable. Twin queen beds (a little hard for our taste) Separate sink and vanity Bathroom had another sink with a toilet and combo bathtub-shower Safe, coffee maker, cd player, clock radio, robes and wet bar. Room was clean and well appointed, with photos of Elvis and the Beatles. Club room was a little small and got crowded at times, it had two TVâ€™s and you could check out cdâ€™s for your room or movies to watch in the club room. The hosts were all very nice and most helpful with any request and were available from7am until 11pm at night. They printed our boarding passes and gave us tons of tips about the rides at Universal and Islandâ€™s of Adventure. Breakfast was from 7am-10pm consisted of coffee, hot tea, hot chocolate, coke, diet coke, sprite, bottled water, apple juice, fresh OJ, donuts, bagels, nice upscale breads ,cereal, fresh fruit, yogurt, and cream cheese, butter, jelly, ect. During the day the sodas and water were available so were chips, popcorn and pretzels. The water sometimes was not ice cold but there were cups and ice so really not an issue for us. Happy hour was from 5pm-7pm and consisted of one or two hot hor'deurves fresh vegetables with dips. Beer consisted of Corona, Bud, Bud Light, Heineken, Miller Lite and Red and White Wine. From 7pm on until 11pm they had the drinks available along with fresh baked cookies and other sweets. Pool was very nice, not super large but we enjoyed it. They have a beach area (sand was clean), water slide and of course music playing above and below water. They had activities through day for the kids and showed a movie at night. Overall we had a very wonderful time it is worth staying at one of the parks on site hotels for the express pass. The walk was about five minutes or the water taxi came pretty often and they had bike taxis for tip only if in a hurry and to tired to walk. The express pass in our opinion is the only way to go never waited more than two to three minutes for the rides, some we got on right away; the show type rides maybe fifteen minute wait. We have stayed Royal Pacific before and it was nice too. We are in our forties and grew up and still listen to rock n roll and so does my eleven year old so we enjoyed the atmosphere and all of the memorabilia at the Hard Rock. As far as the club level we enjoyed the convenience of it and the staff was wonderful and we enjoyed hanging around during happy hour talking with other folks. If you have a several kids its money well spent just for breakfast and all the drinks during the day and evening, for us it was just a nice perk. We would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen the the bad reviews, they are crazy...the Hard Rock is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: chihuahua_star
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Central FL, and I would know that this is by far one of the nicest hotels in the area. I do get a FL resident discount, so this does have an effect on my outlook I am sure. Pros: - Immaculatley clean rooms. I felt comfortable enough to go barefoot and relax in bed. I am VERY picky, too. This place is very clean. (Unlike many tourist hotels in the area) - Very nice and modern features. There is a CD player in the room and they give you a mix CD to play. - Large bathroom and large tub. Large vanity area with all the necessities. - Wonderful lobby with several dining options and a club called Velvet which is nice. Velvet has a great balcony overlooking the pool. - You can walk to Citywalk and the Universal Theme parks. Very beautiful walk. - The Express pass to everyride, anytime, all day. I cannot stress this enough: THE EXPRESS PASS IS UNQUESTIONABLE - YOU MUST HAVE IT TO ENJOY THE PARKS THOROUGHLY! Would you rather wait 45 -90 mins at each ride in the sweltering heat, or just cruise on in as many times as you want? Staying at the Universal Hotels or purchasing the pass for $35/per person/per day is the only way to get them. I am telling you that you must have them! - The pool is just gorgeous! It is HUGE with a really fun slide. The great thing about the pool is there is always space to be alone if you are out for a restful sunbathing session. There are 2 hotubs and a huge bar. Sometimes a calypso band will play. Cons: - Theme park prices on the food and drinks. I just love this hotel! You get what you pay for. This is a very clean, gorgeous hotel that has great benefits. We won't stay anywhere else. I have never paid more than $199/night, just book in advance and check surrounding dates, it usually works out. Tips: Margaritaville has good drinks and is fun. Okay food. But you must go! Bob Marley's is a great place to have some drinks and dance. The inside is open to the sky! Hard Rock Cafe has the best fajitas ever. You can stay out as late as you want, since you can just walk back! And there are security gaurds all the time so don't worry =) And if someone in your party gets tired, they can just go back 1st and not drag you with them! I hope this helps to convince you to stay....you will have a great time here. Walking to the parks and the Express pass will totally make your vacation! Remember that many nearby hotels run a very limited schedule to and from the attractions. This is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: zambiasmith
Reviews.Content: We got stuck at this hotel because the Portofino Hotel was booked. It was fabulous. Everyone was friendly and accomodating. They had actual activities in the pool area for the children, they even offered a movie at night by the pool. The prices at the kitchen restaruant were not outrageous, they were nicely priced considering the area of Florida that we were staying. Unfortunately, I was there on business, so was not quick on the draw with the camera. I did however get a picture of the resident squirell on campus at the Hard Rock which I will post later, he was pretty cute. On my next business trip, I will most definitely stay at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay & Excellent Value! Fun Pool”
Reviews.Author: lichtfamily
Reviews.Content: Very Hip, Very Cool. Too cool for me and my small kids, but the pool was great, and the value you receive with Express Pass can't be beat! Loved the proximity to Universal Theme Parks, movies & music at the pool area. Rooms were small. We had 2 queens and also used a crib (2 adults, 1- 6yrs, 1 infant. No refrigerator only a stocked minibar. No microwave. Easy walk or shuttle boat ride to Universal theme parks. My son enjoyed seeing the Rock n Roll artifacts throughout the hotel. Elvis momentos abound. My son asked "Where's Bon Jovi"? ....I replied "On tour, They still need their guitars". The concierge Club level was not worth the extra money "small mini cans of soda for free and "ok" snacks 2-3 times a day...unless you are drinking alcohol / cocktails frequently.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY worth it for the EXPRESS Pass”
Reviews.Author: figgy33
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed here May 26 - 30. Upon entering, the main lobby is really COOL! My son (8yrs.) was amazed by the sun clock shining on the floor. Checking in was a short wait, about 8 mins. I booked this room 3 months before and requested a refrigerator (BTW! Refrigerator and microwaves are $15 extra EACH per night), not only was it not in the room yet, we had to wait over an hour for it, wait for it to get cool and then put our warm groceries in it. We purchased some drinks and lunch food 2 hours before, thinking the refrigerator would be ready.... But as far as staff service this is my only complaint. The hotel is ONLY pretty on the outside. Our room was small, with a "garden view" not much of a garden all I could see was a big tree... The tiles in the bathroom were cracked and I think I could see some spots of mildew. Hallways were small, dark, cramped and VERY generic. We heard children screaming up and down the hallways most of the night. The pool was OK, it's a lot smaller that it looks in the photos on the websites! My son had fun. They played the movie Batman by the pool, it was too dark to see... The bar service was Extremely slow we had one bottled beer and a margarita-- we were charged $23.00 In conclusion, I feel after we paid $1850.00 for 5 nights : I wasn't impressed with the hotel at all, but it was the closest hotel to the CityWalk and the 2 theme parks, and the express pass saved us at least 20 minutes of wait time in each line!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap, but worth every dime”
Reviews.Author: Vanegas
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you are on a budget!!!! Stay only if you like a nice slightly upscale place and don't mind paying for nice things. Just for fast passes to Universal and Islands of Adventure makes it worthwhile. The rooms are clean, restaurants have great food . The kids enjoy the pool and slide. Expect to wait for poolside service as this is the only bad thing in the hotel. Other than that its a great place to stay. Would stay here again and again and again.............

Reviews.Title: “Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to stay 2 nights for my daughter's 7th birthday. We only stayed one. I could NOT believe how small the rooms were and the shabby condition of the furniture and amenities. For the price, I thought it was a joke. Pool is overrated and not enough activities for adults or children. As a Tampa resident, I know that there are MANY other properties in Orlando where you can spend less and get more. The Hard Rock is resting on its laurels! : ) : )

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was PERFECT !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was amazing. We stayed from May 23-May 27 & had absolutely no complaints. We arrived at 11:00 AM & checked in with absolutely no problems, they took my cell ph# & called me back within 1 hour stating our room was ready!! All of our requests were met, we asked for a room away from the elevators & ice machines, this does mean you will have a long walk back to the elevators, but the up side is that you will not have any noise or disruptions at night time. We never heard our neighbors at night & our room was sooooooo clean & beautiful & HUGE !!!! It was a standard garden view room of the water taxi area & it was beautiful!!! I am a very picky person & could not find one flaw with the room or it's bathroom area, which is also very clean & amazing. The bathrooms have incredible towels & 2 bathrobes that are available for your use during your stay. You can also buy the bathrobes, but I do not know how much money they are. It rained one evening & when we headed back to the hotel, we were greeted with WARM towels to dry off with. This place is AMAZING !!! The Express passes are beyond words!! Even on May 27 (Saturday on Memorial Day Weekend), we got right on the rides, again & again & again. NO waits !!! It was my son (10 years old) & myself & we had the BEST time!! You can walk to Universal from the hotel & it is a beautiful walk, the trees, plants, & view are not to be missed. We also took the water taxi from the hotel & never waited more than 5 minutes for it to arrive. The Universal Studios Park & Islands of Adventure were both great & the parks were very clean. I have read on many posts that there is no healthy food at the parks, I disagree. My son & I just refilled our water bottles at the water fountains. They also sale fresh fruit cups throughout the parks & they have some incredible fresh sandwich places in both parks. The Confisco Grille & the Croissant Moon Bakery have fresh sandwiches, fresh fruit, & homemade potato salad. The NBA City restaurant has the best grilled salmon & veggies & their food is incredible. What a great vacation !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: Boders
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early May and really loved everything about the property (with the exception of paying to self-park your car, but we got over it). We were upgraded to the Concierge floor which was wonderful. There was soda and bottled water available at all times, free breakfast from 7 - 10am, and a free happy hour (beer, wine, and appetizers) from 5 - 7pm (all of which we took full advantage of). We received free gifts in our room every night, an 80's CD, luggage tags, a magnet, etc. Cute touch. Room was spacious. Nice king sized bed with plush linens, vanity area, robes to use during our stay, etc. Tons of seating around the pool. Although there were some kids, we didn't feel they ran the place which was a concern of ours (we are a married couple in our late 20's without kids). Easy walk to Universal property, close to some good golf courses, etc. Would definitely stay here again! Fun vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock nice, but yes, you will PAY!”
Reviews.Author: TravelChic214
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock many times...It is by far my 1st choice when in Orlando. I usually have stayed with my two children (girls-ages 9 &12) and on several occasions went with my Husband alone. Here is the deal with Hard Rock: It is PRICEY - if you want to weed out any "riff-raff", (believe me, there are lots on vacation in Orlando) that you will find at the cheaper hotels, this hotel accomplishes that. I have never pd. under $300/night at this hotel. Another reviewer complains he had to pay to park his car???What is that about? I am sorry in "upsacle", even moderately upscale, you have to pay EXTRA to park. That is a given. The tip thing; another given...Don't you tip people? FYI: 15-18% is customary with 20% being reserved for exceptional service. Yes, you should even tip on a cocktail bill...15-20% of the total bill. Secondly: It is LOUD. If you want a quiet time, this place may not be for you. There are lots of kids here. It is a family place. Kids are loud and they do run in the halls..sometimes late at night...sometimes early in the AM. You also have the 20-30's crowd that come in at 3 AM...They are often loud, too. Lastly: It is FUN. There is a great pool with a BIG water slide for the kids...THE KITCHEN which is a yummy restaurant, and they have room and pool side service as well. They also have treats for the family dog if you happen to be traveling with him/her. They have a lounge/bar for the adults which is very trendy and full of good looking, well dressed 20-30's somethings... The rooms have always been comfortable & clean, with little problems here and there that were always taken care of...ie: too few wash cloths, requested 2 beds - got one..(We were moved to a 2 bed room quickly)..OVERALL- Great location, fast pass for Universal, upscale FUN FAMILY/YOUNG PLACE. If you are looking for CHEAP or QUIET - go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel...mixed feelings?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel is always sold out in comparison to the Portofino Bay Hotel and Royal Pacific Resort (which typically have rooms available and sell out after the Hard Rock). Therefore, my family and I decided to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel for $169+tax at an Annual Passholder Rate/Florida Resident discount. We arrived at the hotel before 9AM and were advised that the room would be ready later in the day. The check-in was average and the lobby and entrance area was very nice. The pool was very pretty. We went to Universal and Islands of Adventure to take advantage of the Universal Express with our room keys. We returned within three hours to check on the status of our room and it was not ready. The manager then spoke to us and upgraded us to the Club level (conciege floor) which was the same as a standard room with the exception of the club lounge which was not worth the price when you look at how much guests pay for the service. We used the Portofino Bay Hotel pool which was less crowded and more of amusement to my family. Botoom line...we will continue to stay at Portofino Bay Hotel and Royal Pacific Resort, but not again at the Hard Rock Hotel. We left the hotel after our a/c broke and released very little cool air. Front desk manager was unhelpful and informed us of the sold out status, so no room change (even to a standard room on another level). We were not very happy, so we left for the Residence Inn by Marriot near Sea World and enjoyed a much better hotel with a bed that was a dream compared to the Hard Rock Hotel's slightly uncomfortable beds. Only stay if you are willing to spend the money on the Unviersal Express access...if you have a choice do stay at the Royal Pacific Resort or Portofino Bay Hotel before here!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Over Rated they Nickel & Dime you!!!”
Reviews.Author: eb556
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was just ok, pool was nice, but cold have been cleaner, But most of all they nickel and dime you for everything!!! Example: Wanted to have just 1 drink they automatically added 18% gratuity, then odered lunch for our family, a burger with fries and no drink was $11.50, with 18% gratutity added automatically. Then at check in which they don't tell you on the phone when you make your reservation. YOU have to pay to park in there hotel lot. Which is $12.00 per day to park the car yourself or valet parking for $17.00 per day, I could not beleive it, If I am paying for a room anywhere from $200-$300.00 PER NIGHT I FEEL I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO PAY TO PARK MY CAR!!!!!! WOULD NOT GO BACK , ROOMS WERE CLEAN BUT NOTHING GREAT. NOT PLUSH AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Hotel Is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MomIAm
Reviews.Content: My husband and two sons (ages 10 and 7) stayed at the HRH from April 19 to April 26. It was fantastic. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a small problem with our room rate but the reception staff solved the problem in a very professional and expeditious manner. Don't forget to ask for the inflatible guitars for your children, my sons loved them. We stayed in a garden view room on the 6th floor. The room was lovely and as nice as any 5 star hotel that we've stayed in although the mini bar area definetly needed more dusting. The bathroom was very clean. We received milk and cookies in a cute cardboard car on our first night. The cookies were amazing. There was a movie playing in the pool , the night we arrived. It was the Hulk. It was a lot of fun to watch the movie, swim and eat nachos and chicken fingers while hanging around the pool. We ate at the Kitchen twice, for dinner and breakfast. Both meals were great. My eldest son loved the kids dinner buffet. My youngest son loved the grilled cheese sandwich. The seafood chowder was fantastic.The blintzes were the best I have ever had. Service was always very friendly and helpful ( our youngest son is allergic to nuts and peanuts). We ordered room service once for my sons. The food came within 30 minutes. My sons loved their meals. My family loved Emack and Bolio's. I especially appreciated having a Starbucks in my hotel. How convenient. We ate at the Beach Club several times. The food was good but your food and drinks will come much faster if you go to the bar yourself to place your order. The hotel definitely needs to hire more staff in this area. My husband and I ate at the Palm twice. On both occasions the service and food were very good. The servings are very large. I loved the crab cakes and surf and turf. The steak was wonderful. We never had room for any dessert which looked huge. My sons visited Camp Lil Rock twice and loved it. They especially loved a staff person named Macho. Camp Lil Rock has a big screen tv, arts and crafts, games as well as 2 or 3 computer stations. It was very clean. My sons both said it was better than the kids club on the Disney Cruise ship. (Go figure)! The pool and surrounding beach area is beautiful but was often littered with empty plastic cups and straws. One day the garbage cans were overflowing. The slide was great. The pool water was warm and clean but on several occasions there were plastic cups floating around. Please note you can only bring inflatible balls into the pool. The lifegquards that we spoke to were all very nice. The cleanliness of the pool area was our only disappointment but nothing in life is perfect. If you are looking for a relaxing holiday while visiting Universal Orlando this is the place to stay. It was a beautiful 5 minute walk to Universal. We took a taxi bike on our first day. It was lots of fun. We took the water taxi 3 times after visiting Islands of Adventure. I think our longest wait was 10 minutes. The waiting area is covered. The water taxi drivers are hilarious. One gentleman told the boat riders jokes, another one sang Minnie the Moucher (?). We used our rooms keys all the time to get to the front of the line, bypassing long lines with waits ranging from 20 to 60 minutes. If you are visiting Universal I would highly recommend the HRH. It's a beautiful hotel with very friendly and accomadating staff. The room key is an amazing perk with or without a special room rate from the annual pass or the automobile association. The room key perk made our holiday especially relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel is ok.”
Reviews.Author: feather601
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 6 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel. Check in was fast, no problems. Girl gave us our keys and said to show them everywhere in Universal because they do "something", but shes not sure what...ok? Turns out they act as fast passes through the parks...Nice! Stayed on 6th floor and room was VERY far away from elevators even though elevators are centralized. Our room was suppose to be "garden view"...we had a really nice view of the roof overhang and a parking lot...not exactly what I pictured "garden view" to be. I really liked the separate vanity mirror and sink...Magnified mirror was nice too. Made it easy for three girls sharing a bathroom in the morning!. What I didnt enjoy was the little kids running around screaming at 6 a.m. and hanging around by themselves at Midnight. I actually had to open my door at 5:50 a.m. to ask what the heck was going on outside my room...sounded like someone was getting killed with all the screaming and banging going on...Turns out some little kid (no more than 7) was running around...parent just smiled and told me they were on vacation...NO KIDDING?!?! GUESS WHAT? So am I!! Breakfast buffet in the Kitchen was very expensive for what it was...something like $17/person. $3.50 for a bottle of soda downstairs. CRAZY! Pillows were very uncomfortable too. Maid service was ok...only gave 1 washcloth for 3 people...only get one roll of toilet paper, once you're done thats it, I guess...same goes for tissues. Had to call the lobby and they brought it up within the hour...long wait when you have to use the bathroom. Maid kept taking our bathmat and didnt replace it..called lobby and they told me they didnt have bathmats..(they had them, turns out he just didnt know what a bathmat was...once he figured it out, one was brought up to us). Should really think about moving those ping pong tables...they are RIGHT on the walkway...every time you walk by you get whacked by a flying ping pong ball. Pool looked nice...didnt get to use it...Pool closes at 11 and I witnessed employees yelling at people to get out of the pool at 11 p.m. on the dot!...GET OUT POOL CLOSED!! Never saw people scramble so fast in my life. Guess I'd be scared too if someone was yelling at me like that. One night it looked like they had a paint ball fight going on...paint (?) was EVERYWHERE on the sidewalks and stairs by the pool. Overall, I think the hotel is overpriced, after reading all the reviews and seeing the pictures, I thought it would be better. Dont really think this is the place to go if you want a nice quiet vacation. Its very loud mostly b/c of the thousands of little kids running around by themselves without a parent in sight.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Hard Rock, Orlando and have had a brilliant time on both occasions. We travelled with our 2 teenage children, now 17 and 13. The hotel decor and music is great, both for teenagers and those with musical tastes still in 60s and 70s rock! Undoubtedly one of the major advantages of staying at the Hard Rock is the room key which acts as a fast pass to all the rides in Universal. We stayed during Easter, but even so did not have to queue for more than a few minutes for any ride. This time we stayed on the Club Level, which is more expensive. However, it is worth it. Included is continental breakfast, fresh fruit, pastries, doughnuts, muffins, etc. Unlimited tea, coffee, lemonade, cold cans of sprite and coke, bottles of water, which you just go into the club room and help yourself to at any time from 7.30am - 11 pm. From 5pm-7pm there are hot snacks, e.g. spring rolls and dips, chicken, corn dogs,etc., cheese and biscuits, salad & dips, etc. Also during this time there is unlimited beer and wine served. From 8.30-9.30 there are desserts available, usually cookies and/or brownies. There have been comments on the site about problems with check -in. I have to say that we had no problems at all. Check in was quick and efficient, staff were pleasant and helpful. The first time we stayed at the Hard Rock our son was taken ill during the night. The staff could not have been more helpful. The Hard Rock would be our first choice if we visited again.

Reviews.Title: “superb location for universal attractions”
Reviews.Author: ChippenhamUkGooders
Reviews.Content: My family with two daughters 14 & 12 loved the hotel for its superb location within a short walk of both Universal Studios and IOA. The fast pass system by showing your room card was brilliant never queued for anything! Hotel was very smart, fab music all the time,service standards high. Only slight downside for us was sound proofing between rooms and the corridors was quite poor, noisy on occasions, and the pool for its size was so shallow arround 3 feet deep! Expensive for food and drink. Even bottled water in your room was 6 dollars! not complimentary. But we were careful what to buy in the hotel. Overall if you want a quality hotel in an ideal spot for the parks and city walk and only 15 minutes from disney we recommend Hard Rock to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Trish J
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great time at the Hard Rock and Universal Studios. PROS: * Great Location (easy walking distance to parks) * Beautiful Landscaping and Grounds * Conveinient Water Taxis (included with stay) * Universal Express Plus passes (speed passes for rides - a MUST HAVE!! We didn't wait longer than 15 minutes for any ride!) * Lobby area - fun, great for kids, lots of neat stuff * Pool - amazing for kids. Warm, easy "beach entry", sandy area, long water slide, shallow enough for safety, great lifeguards * Bell Boys and Valets - SUPER nice and helpful SO-SO * Room was billed as a "sleeps 5" - which means a bed was wheeled in and they initally tried to charge us for it, even though we booked it for 5. CONS: * Maid Service - slow. Our room was still being cleaned at almost 4PM and the maid was actually watching TV in our room * Layout - it's a very large hotel. Our room was at the end of one of the wings and the elevators are all in the middle of the hotel. We ended up using the stairs instead.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that the first thing I did was sign up to be a Loew's member. This doesn't cost and you receive extra amenities. We stayed from March 2-8, spring break, and had a wonderful time. We stayed on the club level and it was worth the money. We have three children, 17, 15, and 10. We were able to get one of the oversized deluxe rooms on club level (there are only a few) and we all slept very comfortable. By signing up to be a Lowe's member we received a free bottle of wine, nuts, a paper every morning and some other extras. The room was clean and never had a problem with the maid service. The breakfast every morning was fabulous-cereals, great donuts, pastries, fresh fruit, bagels, toast, juices, coffee etc. There was free sodas and water all day. At 5:00 it started happy hour. Always 2 hot appetizers, cheese and cracker tray, and a veg. and dip tray. Also, 3 kinds of wine and all kinds of bottle beer. At night there was always a dessert-either brownies, cookies, or ice cream sundaes. This saved us a lot of money. We found that the restaurant was ok, a little pricey. We loved all the music playing, but my family is really into rock music. The pool outside was great as was the slide. The express pass was absolutely wonderful! We never stood in line for a ride-had a great time. We really hated to leave. If you check the internet the Hard Rock runs a lot of specials and staying on club level was well worth it! Oh-the ice cream shop is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Get Away”
Reviews.Author: snowbunnyBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando, FL and every year that I go, I can't believe how fantastic the staff is, how great the food is, how clean the pool area is and how easy it is to get around. The staff are all very attentive, very informative and very approachable. They will go out of their way to say hello everytime you pass them. The food in the Kitchen is SO good. Especially the French Toast on the menu for breakfast! Also the Starbuck's place with the icecream is amazing... they have icecream cones with a Rice Krispy Treat all around the outside! SO GOOD!!! It's a great hotel, very convienant and nice. I will go again and again and would recommend it to everyone. Thanks Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly high guest service”
Reviews.Author: MNSusieQ
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the reviews I read here, I didn't expect much from the staff at the Hard Rock Hotel at Universal. I was surprised to find that we were treated very well by everyone. First of all, let me say that if you are wavering about staying at the hotel, it is worth it. The room key is like gold at both Universal parks. Using the Express lines at each ride or attraction made it possible to do both parks in one day, even during Spring Break week. We were able to do it all, then decide what was worth doing again and again. For my impatient 9 year old son, this feature made it worth the extra cost of the hotel. Also, the Hard Rock Hotel is the closest of the 3 hotels to the Universal parks. It was a quick 5 minute walk to the front gates of Universal Studios and the City Walk, and 10 minutes to Islands of Adventures. Being able to head back to the hotel midday for a break and a swim, then head back later for more rides, was wonderful. My 13 year old daughter enjoyed the movie night in the pool on Friday night after sundown. I don't know if that is a nightly occurence. We just went to sit in the hot tub that one night. Rooms were adequate. I liked having a separate sink area outside the bathroom, and another sink in the bathroom. We had two spots to brush our teeth and clean up. I used the coffee pot in the room, but was happy to find a Starbucks in the City Walk on the way to Islands of Adventure. The biggest surprise for us was the level of service we received from the hotel staff. My son became very ill after our first day there. The concierge gave us directions to a nearby walk-in clinic, and even mentioned there was accomodations to get us there if we needed a ride. Later on, the emergency services staff called to check up on our son and see if we needed anything. Also, when a toilet clogged in our room, a hotel maintenance worker came quickly to fix it. When our remote control seemed low on batteries, they were quick to bring a new one to our room. On our last day, with our son still really sick, we requested a later check-out than 11am. Not only did the guest services employee tell us we could check out late, but she even asked the manager if we could have even more time due to my son's condition. I didn't ask for that. She called back to let me know that we could take our time checking out. I don't know if it helps that I tend to assume people want to help me, and am pleasant with them. My husband tells me that is why people are nice to me. I think the key is to ask for what you want as nicely as possible, and to let them know why you want or need it. We never ate at the hotel, so I can't give an opinion on that. There was a young woman making rounds in the pool area asking if we wanted a drink. One irritation for me was how loud the music played in the pool area. I would have preferred quieter music around the pool. After being at the noisy parks, a little peace and quiet there would have been nice. Given that it's the Hard Rock Hotel, they blared music all around the pool. The towel service was nice. They had a group of employees directing games for younger kids, which seemed to be a hit. The sand beach by the pool was nice, but made for sandy pools and hot tubs. All in all, staying at the resort is pricier than staying close by, but the convenience to the parks and access to the Express lines made it worth it for our family. We would definitely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: TexasTandE
Reviews.Content: This was a great property and the staff is awesome. The front desk is terrible - and our check-in was a mess. Check-in is at 4pm, but our room wasn't ready until 5:30. Other guests told us of the same problem, and many waiting until 7 and 8 pm for their rooms to be ready. We had a family suite on the club level floor. The family suite is fabulous - if you go with kids it is a MUST! Our kids LOVED it and we loved the privacy and space. Breakfast was great - lots of pastries, coffee, fresh fruit, yogurt, bagles and cream cheese. The daytime snack consisted of a bowl of pretzels, but there are sodas and waters available all day. The afternoon happy hour was great with 2 hot munchies each evening and other things like cheese and crackers and veggies. The sweets at night were store bought cookies - usually oreos. Still recommend the floor for the super breakfast and happy hour. Plus, the staff in there is very helpful and friendly. The Kitchen restaurant is excellent. The pool and Beach Club restaurant are also wonderful. The water taxi leaves every few minutes to transport you to City Walk where you can either hang there or walk over to Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios. We went to the Luau at the Royal Pacific one night and that was the best part of our trip - our kids (ages 10 and 11) loved it. The Hard Rock Hotel is wonderful. Just be careful about check-in. It is apparently a common problem.

Reviews.Title: “The Hardrock is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: gaudifan
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13 year old son and I recently returned from a fantastic trip to the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando. This was a very pleasant surprise, as both my husband and I dreaded going to Orlando for vacation--my son had not managed to visit Orlando til this year. The hotel was lovely, our room was large, beautifully decorated, and clean. The bathroom had a separate sink area that made getting ready in the morning easy for all of us. We splurged for the club floor, where we could rent cds and dvds for the room, and where there is complimentary food through the day--that added to the stay! The concierges on the floor were also terrific--they got us restaurant reservations, confirmed our flight home, etc. The hotel pool, complete with underwater speakers, was great in the afternoon. There were lots of other "older" children there as well, so my son even made a few friends. The food at all of the restaurants on site was also good--and the service was great. The hotel is a quick walk to both Universal parks and Universal City Walk. We could easily visit a park in the morning, return to the pool in the afternoon and go back to the park in the evening. The highpoint however was that your hotel key allows you to go in the "fast line" at the Universal parks. With this we never had to wait more than 5 to 10 minutes for any ride. This alone makes it worthwhile to stay at the Hardrock. Everything about this hotel is terrific--don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, little on the pricey side”
Reviews.Author: Tubtruck
Reviews.Content: Excellent access to the themeparks, toilet blocked up on two occasions and repaired very quickly. Found the pool very shallow, never heared the underwater speakers that are triumphed in all the literature. Tendancy for room service trays to sit outside rooms until the following morning. Breakfast in the kitchen was very good quality with lots of choice and in my opinion well worth the 17 dollars per person. Only one small hot tub for a hotel of this size was not great. Would recommend this hotel to anyone like myself who wants the convenience of being very near to the parks and are willing to pay the premium that this entails.

Reviews.Title: “Dressed up Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Codeedo
Reviews.Content: We read many hotel reviews before Spring Break this year and finally decided to split our time between the Hyatt Grand Cypress and the Hard Rock Hotel. If you want true star treatment and fine hotel service, go to the Hyatt. The Hard Rock Hotel is nothing but an over-themed Holiday Inn. Rooms are small and unimpressive. "Garden-view" means over an air-conditioning duct; "pets allowed" means it sounds like a kennel walking down the hallway and the staff is completely apathetic (unlike the Hyatt where we were greeted by name from the maid to the valet just hours after arrival!). "Hard rock" describes their pillows so be sure to bring your own. Our car was always waiting after calling the valet at the Hyatt; at the Hard Rock be sure to call at least 1/2 hour before you need it. In addition, at both hotels we had adjoining rooms for our children. At the Hyatt we couldn't hear a peep from the other room--at the Hard Rock we could hear everything through the walls, so I guess that hints at the quality construction. We repeatedly read that the big draw about staying at the Hard Rock is the Express Pass. Here's something no one tells you--you can buy an Express Pass (check Universal's website) and stay at a more inexpensive yet comparable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for Music Lovers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel March 1 and 2. Rooms are beautiful but not huge. We were told there would be room in the small fridge for our drinks/snacks but the fridge was packed with their pricey items so we bought a cooler. My 12 and 13 year old sons loved the hotel and memorabilia. My son actually brought his guitar and was dying to play quietly in the huge lobby - hoping to get discovered I guess but he didn't in the end. The pool area is gorgeous. I was surprised at how many small children were in the hotel. I thought it would have more older kids/young adults there. As noted elsewhere on this site, the corridors were very noisy. There were tons of young children running up and down the corridors until real late at night - midnight??? We were on the fifth floor. My husband got on the elevator once and just as the doors were closing a couple of young kids reached in at the last minute and pressed the alarm bell! So beware for over-indulgent parents with more money than sense and bratty kids. We did not complain about this - but it does seem to be a problem. I had registered as a Lowes loyalty customer and had requested local newspaper and beer/nuts for our loyalty gift. It wasn't there but a quick call to the front desk brought it within an hour. We had no delays checking in (around 5:50 p.m. Friday night). The boat to Universal was very convenient and we used it every time. Most was a 10-minute wait but hey, it is beautiful out and we were on vacation. The front of the line access at Universal was very good. However, beware of the Mummy Ride!!! I hate scary rides and roller coasters and this ride looks pretty unscary from the outside - you can't tell it is a roller-coaster type of ride because it is all hidden inside the building -- but my 12 year old son and I got on it and we were terrified. We felt we barely escaped with our lives. We should have known when we were asked to lock up all our belongings in lockers before getting onto the ride. I lost my sunglasses and the face of my watch on this ride. We did not try the restaurants at Universal - chose to go off property so we could get the International Drive experience. Warning - try to avoid driving this at night - the traffic is crazy and there are too many pedestrians. As a result of eating off-property when we came back in at night the self-parking was full and we had to park in the valet parking. My husband was worried that our car would be towed so he called the front desk and they said it would "probably" be okay. It was okay - no ticket or anything. I would go back to a Hard Rock with my teens but would probably try a different location - Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Loveddddd it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was amazing. Although our hotel room was way smaller than we expected and out safe was broken when we arrived so they were in our room fixing it for 30 min. The fast pass for the Universal Studios were the best part of staying there. The pool was packed at times couldn't find a spot but the restaurants there were amazing. The 'fake beach' was great. The ferry to the parks was amazing always there when we were otherwise had to wait for 5-10 min. The people there were very nice. Loved the pictures and memorabillia throughout the hotel. Highly recommended, espically if you are going to the Universal parks, got first in line in a 3 hour line because of the fast pass. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Just excelent!”
Reviews.Author: RP-BIQ
Reviews.Content: Staying there for three nights. The only thing I can tell is the resort is well above the average. Ok, it is definively an expensive one, but it worth your money! The property is beautiful, very clean. Our room was big enough, tastefull decorated. Clear and cool colors, confortable accomodations. The breakfast is good, like the restaurant. Enjoy a diner on the terasse! The pool is huge, but unfortunately not deep enough as often in the US. The service was fine. Do not forget that you are litteraly within the park, witch is very conviniente. Consider a 10 minutes walk trip from your room to the entrance of the park. You can also enjoy a free boat shuttle. To sume up, go ahead. This hotel is a premium!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Hard Rock Resort-Orlando!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ttraniello
Reviews.Content: I love to stay at the Hard Rock Resort- Orlando! I have stayed there many times, as I am an annual pass holder for Universal Studios. I would recommend it to anyone!! I love the pool and the rooms are very clean and very beautiful!! It is very expensive but in this case... its worth every penny!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard luck hotel”
Reviews.Author: louis1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed several times at the Portofino at universal, we decided to try the hard rock for one week. we booked three rooms and paid Virgin directly, on arrival, we were given a smoking room having called from the UK requesting otherwise. day two, a check out bill under door, another hour sorting at reception. day three (after two nights of noise)both lounge bar AND Palms restaurant closed for private functions.Day 4 room cards cancelled as we were meant to have checked out! day 5 most lounge area closed private function, Hard rock cafe closed, private function, check out day, another bill for rooms under our door. Not what we expected for $600 per night, wont go again,they seem more keen on high rolling private functions than general guests. Staff polite, always "sorry" but..... sorry not good enough Loewes. Watch the 18% automatically being added to restaurant, bar bills if you do stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful onsite hotel, but we had a few problems...”
Reviews.Author: Dr Ali M.
Reviews.Content: I recently took my family of six (2 adults, 2 children and 2 infants) for our annual pilgrimage to Orlando, Florida. This year we stayed at Universalâ€™s Hard Rock HotelÂ® from 3-7 January 2006. We booked our four night stay in the middle of November 2005 in order to take advantage of the â€œFamily Free For Allâ€� offer. This limited time offer, which was available from November 2005 through February 2006, was a great deal as we got free Universal StudiosÂ® theme park tickets for two adults and two children and the two infants went free. We booked online and planned our vacation by visiting the Universal OrlandoÂ® Resort website at ----. The only condition attached to this deal was that you stay four or more nights at one of the Universal hotels so we chose the Hard Rock HotelÂ®. This deal also included free admission to Universalâ€™s CityWalk. Although the room rates at the Hard Rock HotelÂ® are significantly higher here than most Walt Disney World hotels and many of the hotels on International Drive, there are many advantages to staying onsite. The most notable advantage of staying onsite is the Universal Express ride access. Hotel Facilities: The Hard Rock HotelÂ® at Universal Orlando Resort is a AAA Four Diamond Award winner and is managed by Loews Hotels. This rating is equivalent to a British or European Four Star / Luxury hotel. The hotel offers an interesting mix of rock music themed entertainment and visually perfect surroundings. The architecture of this hotel is in the style of a California Mission and is reminiscent of The Eaglesâ€™ Hotel California album cover. The hotel features a number of rare rockâ€™n roll memorabilia throughout the public areas rumoured to be worth in excess of one million dollars. The hotel also boats a large heated swimming pool with a great water slide and underwater audio system. Other facilities included a fitness center, steam room, sauna, whirlpool, onsite Hard Rock merchandise store (very expensive), game room, shuffleboard, life-size chess/checkers, volleyball, supervised childrenâ€™s activity center, four restaurants and several lounges all of which were beautifully designed and immaculately maintained. Dining: We did not try all of Hard Rock Hotelâ€™s restaurants and lounges. The main reason was the high cost. The Kitchen was great but we did not manage to catch any legendary rock star cooking their favorite recipe for us. The Beach Club bar and restaurant were great! The waiting staff here were very patient, friendly, polite and helpful. Overall the food in the Beach Club was great but a little expensive. Nevertheless we dined there most nights. The Marketplace area was disappointing. The variety and quality of the food on offer was below par. All they had on offer for breakfast was muffins (three varieties only: blueberry, chocolate chip and bran), regular and decaffeinated Starbucks coffee and a few varieties donuts!!! However, staff members in the Marketplace were very friendly and polite. Hotel Location: The location of the hotel is perfect; it is right next to Universal Studios (5 minute walk) and Islands of Adventure (10 minute walk). The CityWalk entertainment Complex is only 5-7 minutes walk from the hotel. If you donâ€™t like walking or have mobility problems, complimentary on-site transportation is offered via water taxi or shuttle bus. The best perk of staying at this hotel is Universal Express ride access. You just show your room key card and bypass the regular lines at your favorite Universal Orlando rides and attractions. You do not need to purchase the Express Pass or get ride reservations. We did not wait in line for any of the attractions. Another perk is priority seating at select Universal Orlando restaurants although we did not use this Rooms: Our room was a standard garden view room (375 square feet) with two queen size beds. The room was on the ground floor and featured a color TV, stereo with CD player (you also get a free Hard Rock Hotel music CD to take home with you), 2 dual-line telephones, voicemail system, data port, internet access, coffee maker, safe, two sinks and a hairdryer. Our Experience: The Pros: Staying onsite is great â€“ a real bonus. I admit that the heated swimming pool at the hotel was fantastic. The pool is very clean and the kids loved the slide. The staff working in the Beach Club bar and restaurant were great! They were very friendly, polite and helpful. The Cons: I regret to report that we experienced quite a few problems during our four night stay. Although the room was spacious and comfortably accommodated all six of us, we felt that it was not cleaned very well. The carpets were really dirty. We had to keep asking for clean bath towels as the bath towels were stained and dirty. The poolside towels were cleaner than the bath towels!!! We had an infestation of ants in our room but the management were not very quick to deal with it. On our last night we had problems with noisy hotel guests who had just checked into the hotel. There was a huge national building convention in the new Convention Center. This convention started on Saturday 7 January 2006 but many of the attendees of this convention started checking into nearby hotels including the Hard Rock HotelÂ® the night before. Some of the convention attendees were not particularly well behaved and because of all the noise they were making and their drunken behavior we had to call security to deal with it. Unfortunately the hotel management and security did very little about this problem and we got no sleep at all on our last night at the hotel. This adversely affected our enjoyment of the last day of our stay. In summary, we may have saved over $400 by taking advantage of the â€œFamily Free For Allâ€� offer but we got a dirty, and ant infested room and noisy neighbors. My family loved Universal StudiosÂ® and Islands of Adventure and the Universal Express ride access was a real bonus. The hotel was visually very appealing but the level of service was unsatisfactory. I had hoped that $229 per night plus tax would guarantee a clean and quiet room â€“ no such luck! On my next trip I will try another Universal hotel or just stay in Walt Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for 14 nights with our two children (15rs and 12yrs). Late arrival after longhaul from U.K, arrived by coach so had to be dropped off at lower level to reception, which was inconvienient because we then had to make our own way with suitcases upstairs to lobby. Dissapointed with first contact with reception staff and ignored by bell boys. However when we reached our room over looking the pool all our annoyance was forgotten. Room very good size, very clean and top quality enviroment, plenty of wardrobe space, very comfy beds, large bathroom with seperate dressing area. All the room lacked was a fridge to keep drinks cold, and for us English visitors tea as well as coffee. The hotel also had coin operated laundry which is very useful when staying along time (this information i could'nt even find out on their own website). Pool area great but the $10 charge for a pool float a little ludicrous, fitness centre good at $8 a day including sauna. The restaurants were very expensive, not really suitable for younger kids but the poolside beachclub food and service excellent (tipping automatic on bill). Hotel keys as fast passes to the two parks were very useful as was the transport to the two universal parks. Handy hint if you don't drive then a 12 minute walk from the front of the hotel towards the Doubletree resort will give you access to the i-ride trolley. Overall the hotel with all its rock and roll memorabillia and constant playing music was fantastic and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good second time around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to HRH and yet again we had a fabulous time. We upgraded to the Club floor on arrival and if you are booking your visit in the U.K through an agent, I would advise you to do it this way as it works out a few hundred pounds cheaper. Everything was perfect- rooms were spotless (AND I'M FUSSY)staff friendly, food yummy- especially at the Palm - and we just had a great time. The complimentary beer and wine in the lounge of an evening really went down too well, as did the cookies at bedtime. This really is a great place to stay and as has been said so many times before, the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: Atlantis13
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a Kid's Suite (family of 5 w/ 3 children, aged 8, 6 & 2) Pros - Fun Facility. Location cannot be beat. The beautiful walk to Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure & City Walk is unsurpassed in Orlando (beats taking the monorail, etc. to get around Disney) All onsite Food & Beverage establishments were excellent! (we frequented them all, including room service) Bathroom in Kid's Suite is great with 3 sinks. The Express Pass used at the theme parks is also a great perk! The staff was always courteous & pleasant. Kids loved the pool...shallow enough that you don't have to worry about them as they can touch the ground. There is a pool table & game room on property. Water Taxi is also very nice. The entire City Walk "scene" is great! The Hard Rock Store has cool things too...Disagree that it is not family friendly...it is all about family. Just make sure that you enjoy music (they play all kinds). It is a fun place. Cons - As expected from previous posts...our room was not ready. We drove 2 days and arrived at 3:30pm (check-in at 4pm) and waited until 4:45 for our room. That part sucked...with 3 kids that needed to change clothes, diapers, etc. They compensated us with some drink coupons. I guess after "rushing" housekeeping, they did a poor job in preparing the suite. One child's bed had soiled sheets all over that appeared to have dried blood on them. We immediately asked for new ones. There were very visible dirty fingerprints all over the bathroom doors...personally cleaned them as it grossed me out. Although the furniture is cool, it is in desperate need of cleaning. As is the carpet...really stained. After paying $550+ per night, that really is unacceptable. However, this place is all about location and turnover...they are always busy & will get the clientele without having to fix every little thing. The beds also are not really that comfy...stark & cold. (bring your own pillows & blankets) I even expressed all of the above to the GM who apologized but never offered any compensation of any kind. However, having said that, the staff and awesome facility really made up for the few downfalls of the hotel. We would definitely return there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: First time staying @Hard Rock and it was a fantastic experience. Pros: Our room was ready at an earlier check-in. Being from the NYC metro area, the rooms are larger than your standard size room. Clean, Clean, Clean. Staff was friendly and helpful with park info. Location, Location, Location - you can literally walk to Universal Studios and CityWalk or take a ferry boat from the hotel. The pool area has enough lounge chairs and umbrellas for everyone and the pool bar has a happening scene. Cons: Pricey - over 200 bucks for their garden view room Dining - "The Palm" was such a disappointment - wine glasses dirty, steaks burnt and poor service. I highly recommend this hotel for young adults and couples. THIS IS NOT A FAMILY HOTEL! If you like music this is the place to stay, music is playing everywhere in the hotel at all times!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Universal for 6 days in January with children, age 13, 11,and 8. Got a great rate off Expedia for the Hard Rock by paying in advance. The hotel common areas and grounds have a luxurious, modern design -- worthy of a much more expensive venue. Staff was reliably friendly and helpful. Valet parking was $17 per night, versus $10 for self park. There was no reason to valet - the parking lots are not that remote to your room. The rooms were average size, nice, but nothing too fancy. We had two queen beds and a rollaway ($25/night)in the room without too much trouble. There is an $8 charge to use the Fitness Center. The maid service was not meticulous, but was adequate. The rest of the hotel is quite clean and well maintained. The large courtyard view from our room was nice. The hotel allows pets, who use the courtyard for their own purposes. The pool is nice for the kids, with hot tubs and a water slide. We ate at "The Kitchen" and found the food was pretty good, service spotty. The kids enjoyed characters Shrek and Scooby Do coming into the restaurant. Of course the snack bar and gift shop are ridiculously expensive, but there is a Walgreens within an easy 2 minute drive of the hotel. The water taxi to Universal is a nice service and works well, but this is the closest hotel to the parks, and the walk there is a short one (5-10 minutes) anyway. We waited until the last minute to purchase our Universal park tickets, and ended up getting 4 days admission free through the Universal internet site. The deals change from week to week, and we got lucky. The two Universal parks were ideal for our kids, we spent 4 days there and never made it to Disney at all. The hotel room key - express pass system works like a charm. Our oldest rode the Hulk roller coaster 10 times and usually "walked on" with no waiting. The room key supposedly works at the City Walk restaurant / shopping area - - although this was spotty and some merchants wanted your credit cards. The room key works just fine for charges in the parks, which is great in that you are not constantly juggling large bills. Punch a hole in your room keys and wear lanyards for the parks! Ate at Emerils in City Walk - dropped $180 for two people, but it was worth it, believe it or not. Also ate at Pastamore (average) and NBA City (good) and offsite at Thai Thani(good). We toured the Portofino Hotel, which was picturesque, but it is farther from the themeparks, if that is your destination. For a family with kids, we enjoyed the music and the higher energy of the Hard Rock. For your rental car - try digging hard on the Alamo website. We got a great rate, as did the rest of the big crowd at the Alamo counter at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dimed to death but still enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: girlcat
Reviews.Content: Though at every turn it seems there's some kind of charge waiting for you, we had a wonderful time here. The atomsphere was awesome - loved that there were so many clever music quotes everywhere. We had a beautiful pool view room. Beware of the poolside restaurant, though - terrible service and they automatically tack on their tip. We weren't too impressed by the hotel workers and the bath area could have been bigger, but the access to the parks and City Walk and front of the line access with your room key overwhelmingly made up for the shortcomings. Our kids loved it and we would definitely stay here again, just bring more money!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the HRH!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel Orlando is truely a unique, entertaining, and fun luxury hotel. WE stayed there last year, but did not stay on the concierge floor on the seventh floor (Club 7 is what they call it). This is a private, keyed-off floor from other guests, and you get some serious service and bonuses up there! You get the lounge access- free breakfast, snacks, drinks and appetizers, and desserts, magazines to read, CDs to check out of their own library, you get the security of a private keyed-off floor, and upgraded toiletries. To some people, these extras are unimportant and don't mean anything, but for my whole family it was great. Do yourself a favor, by booking a room on the concierge floor, and do a deluxe oom if you can (it's huge). Universal citywalk is great as well as the theme parks! We has a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock the New Year in!”
Reviews.Author: Lobby12345
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 30th December for 8 nights. Negatives - Very thin walls that can be a pain when you have noisy neighbours. Also very expensive whilst inside the hotel - ie. 1 ltr water was $6 (only 60 cents from Walmart). Positives - Excellent spacious room. Excellent music piped throughout the whole of the hotel including the pool area. Lovely pool area and plenty of sunbeds even though the hotel was full. Using the keycard as an express pass to get to the front of the queues was an absolute godsend as it meant that you could go to the parks at any time of the day and not have to worry about queuing. We paid for City Walks New Years Eve party which was abosolutely fantastic - we upgraded to a VIP pass for $40 extra and this included all your drinks and also segregated VIP areas in all the clubs and bars - well worth the money! Overall - As you can see the positives far outweigh the negatives. We were a bit worried before we went because of the few poor reviews, but apart from a couple of minor issues, we found the staff, hotel, room, pool and overall stay an absolutely fab one! Dont be put off by previous poor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but noisy neighbours”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let's get the bad stuff out of the way first - 5.30am being woken up by the family next door shouting and screaming. Either the insulation between rooms is really poor or we were just very unlucky! Hotel is also very expensive for food and drinks and didn't like having to pay for self parking $7 a day! But that said we still loved it, the rooms are gorgeously decorated and clean and location is fantastic. Pool was fab and never really busy. Its worth staying there just to be able to skip the normal queues in Universal, by just showing your room card, we walked straight on to most rides!

Reviews.Title: “A NEGATIVE ZERO!!”
Reviews.Author: Kittles
Reviews.Content: It all started when we were driving from The Grand Floridian Resort (which was great) to The Hard Rock Hotel. There was one night that they had a live concert band in the lobby. The hotel said nothing about it. Do you want to know how noisy it was? We were on the very top floor and & could still hear it up there all night long! Another night there was an unexpected fire alarm that went off. Here we are worried, but it turned out some punk teens pulled it. The beds were hard like a new car seat. They also had some pretty rude and selfish staff. Coming back from dinner one night we were surprised to find that our room key was not working for our door. We went down to the desk to get someone to take care of it. We had to literally scream to the front desk staff right in front of us because of the LOUD concert going on in the lobby. We had to sit out in the hall in front of our room for about an hour. It seemed like forever to get the door open. The hotel made up for it by giving us a free movie. That night we turned on the movie and it did not work. We ended up paying for it. The breakfast was okay but was kind of a tiny room. I could not wait to go. When we went to go for a swim, without any notice from the hotel at all, they had the pool area closed down for a photo shoot. We were highly dissapointed with our Hard Rock experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: fiona229
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock over christmas with a twelve year old and fourteen year old. We loved it. Staff were incredibly helpful. Room was ready when we arrived at 10 in the morning. Being able to get to the front of teh queues in Universal and Islands of Adventure was worth its weight in gold. Definitely worth upgrading to a club class room. Plenty of soft drinks all day. The breakfast is good and the evening snacks and drinks are excellent. superb if you are travelling with teenagers or older children. My children think it is the coolest hotel on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is hard to beat.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel with the rest of my family of 5 for 3 days. It was great, I'll start with the good points. First, the atmospere is great. The hotel is beautiful, and there is rock memoribelia everywhere. The music is also a good touch, not just the elevator music played everywhere else in the world, good rock. The pool was good, it has a water slide and 2 hot tubs. But it only ranges from 2-3.5 feet and the center is always crowded. The restaurants are great, some are a little expensive, but it's vacation, stuff's always expensive. There was a movie night where they projected Jurassic Park onto a large screen next to the pool. Not exactly a new movie, but a good one. The staff was very nice and we never even saw the maid, but the room was always perfectly clean. And finally the proximity to the parks and City Walk were great, Hard Rock is the closest on sight hotel. Okay, some of the bad things, there wern't many, but they were enough to cost the hotel a point. When we got there, the room was not ready. We had to wait for them to clean it or somthing. But instead of having to put our things back in our car, they held them behind the desk for us. This also gave s some time to tour the grounds of the hotel, so that inconvenience was a bit of a mixed blessing. The Gift Shop/Store is good, but expensive. They also didn't have one of the things my brother wanted, a Hard Rock poker set. They had display models all over, but none in stock. :( Magazines and snacks were also very expensive. Once we finally got to our room, it was okay. However, we got a Garden View on the 3rd floor. We didn;t so much over look the Garden as we did the front over hang for the cars, and the parking lot. But we never really spent much time staring out the window anyway. The boat shuttle service is over rated. It's slower than walking and we ended up waiting for it for a over half an hour once. City Walk is fun, but I don't recomend taking small children to a resteraunt with a band, they tend to turn the music up very loud. Other than that, it was great. The Express Pass with the room cards is a good touch, we rode several rides many times. But the express pass kind of kills the atmosphere that they set up in the line. You miss many of the videos that explain how the ride work, which can get confusing with interactive rides like "Men In Black: Alien Attack." There are also a few thing I recomend doing that we never did. Such as checking out the other hotels, using the gym, and using the Hotel Cards for priority seating in resteraunts. All in all the Hard Rock Hotel is a great hotel. I'd recomend it to anyone and plan on going back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Cool & Artistic”
Reviews.Author: CaptainAmerica
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights recently and was pleasantly impressed. The artistic vision here really works- the classic rock tunes playing everywhere (even underwater at the pool), the memorabelia collections, the rock star groomed staff- all adds up to a unique hotel experience. The pool is great, if a little shallow. The slide is alot of fun. One strong criticism is the arcade- alot of the games were broken, they charged $1.00 a game (?!?!) and the games were rigged to end early. A total rip off. The rooms themselves are entirely mediocre and showing their age- nothing special here and unjustifiable for $250 a night. The best thing about the Hard Rock is the pleasant 15 minute walk to Islands of Adventure and Universal and Universal Studios and the Express Pass which allows you to effectively cut in line. Just show your room key and you can save hours of sitting around in lines- the true bane of theme parks. I would recommend this hotel, barely, based largely on the Express Pass privleges and the artistic quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnathansTravel
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent;therefore, by nature I tend to be over critical of most places I stay. My family of four, two adults, two boys 10 and 14, stayed for one week. Stayed in a poolview room, 2 queen beds, small table w/two chairs, comfortable chair w/ottoman,1 bath w/sink, w/separate sink area outside of bath, drybar area w/inroom minibar. Room was clean, beds very comfortable, safe in closet,iron/ironing board in closet,stereo w/cd player,good size tv (plenty of stations w/hbo),good size dresser. I would say room was in good repair, bright, cheery, not what one would say elegant, but nice. Housekeeping was excellent as long as you get lost during the day. If you hang around and are in and out during the day, it seems to mess their system up somewhat. This hotel is really great for families w/8yo to teens. My kids thought it was the bomb. Music is playing everywhere. In the lobby, the elevator, the pool, the whole property just makes you feel like you are 21 again even if you aren't interested. I could have cared less and by the second day it grew on me. The location is the best of the onsite hotels. It has the shortest walk to the parks, less than 5 minutes. Has a short shuttle and water taxi if you don't want to walk. Has great concierge, valet's,front desk staff, etc. They were all very attentive. Though you do find yourself tipping a lot of people. However, I always felt they earned it, they were just that good. This hotel has a starbucks on site, ice cream shop, the "kitchen"(a casual restaurant), the "palm" (fancy), the "velvet bar" great indoor lobby bar hang out, and the beach club outdoor bar hang out. Much more. The pool is always 86 degrees heated, much of area around it is sand, outdoor sand volleyball court, pingpong tables, lots for kids to do at night to hang out. Huge waterslide during the day. Aside from all of that, the front of the line access you get at the rides at Universal parks by showing your room key is worth the stay alone. Take a lanyard so you can punch a hole in your key, put it around your neck, so you don't have to take it in and out of your pocket constantly. Great so kids don't lose theirs too. Also, you can set up adult room keys so you can charge all purchases in parks to your room back at hotel and have pictures and souvenirs delivered back to your room so you don't have to carry them around all day. All bonuses of staying on site. These are perks of staying at the Royal Pacific or Portofino as well. If we go again, I would not hesitate to stay again at the hard rock. The only thing I would do different is book a family suite which has a living room separate from the bed room to get more space. There is only a limited number of these, so you have to book them way in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location”
Reviews.Author: ginatexas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Orlando. I won the trip so hotel was comp'd. However, we did book an additional room which was paid. The location was excellent and we were able to walk to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventures, plus the City Walk. Not a lot of kids in this hotel (early Nov.) but it was kid friendly. We took our 3 yr old. The pool is great!! He actually enjoyed it more than most parks. They have a great ice cream shop that kids and adults love. The rooms were good sized and very comfortable with lots of down pillows. Service was excellent, except for the pool restaurant which was a little slow. "The Kitchen" restaurant was very pricey but we only had breakfast there, which was around $15 for a full buffet - kids 3 & under are free. The menu for dinner did look good though. The music at the hotel is loud but if you like rock & roll it won't bother you too much. The rooms were quiet however. The hotel is a bit more expensive than others but you can't beat the convenience to the Universal side of Orlando. You can take a boat ride (or walk) to 2 other Universal hotels and use their amenities or to the Citywalk for no additional charge.
