So in the end I think you end up spending the same on transportation plus hotel. Also, at both parks you just show your room key and you get to use the "no wait" lines. So... if you want good service and convenience, Hard Rock is a hit

Reviews.Title: “OK but would not return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August for 4 nights, it was totally worth staying at an on-site hotel because you have a fast pass. This saved us tons of time in the parks.We had a club level room which gave us continental breakfast in the morning, beer and snacks in the afternoon and cookies at night. The only problem with the room was the view of the dog walking park. Pretty disgusting to look out at dogs releiving themselves. Also the maid didn't clean our room until about 5pm and then turn down service was at 6 pm. A little early for turndown service. Everyone raves about the pool, I thought that while it was a great looking pool, the fact that it was only 2 or 3 feet deep made it uncomfortable to swim in, and it was very crowded. The slide was alot of fun. We had a good time overall but would not return and I would hesitate to recommend this place.I will try the Portifino Bay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock was wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just finished reading the review titled "Hard Luck at the Hard Rock Go Anywhere Else" and I felt compelled to respond. I stayed at the Hard Rock this summer with my boyfriend, mom, and brother, and we had a wonderful time. We also booked our two rooms months in advance, and upon arrival were told that the rooms we booked were not available, (due to overbooking). However....the hotel staff was very accomodating and upgraded my mom & brother to the "VIP" floor. My boyfriend and I wanted a smoking room and the "VIP" floor didn't have smoking available, so they found us another room we were very happy with. The staff also provided us with "VIP" keys so that we could access this floor to see my mom & brother or have a drink in the lounge up there anytime we wanted. We were very happy with the rooms we ended up getting. The pool only closed once during our stay due to inclement weather, and there were signs posted around the pool making us aware of the closure and they re-opened the pool within two hours or so. Anyway, we were informed why the pool was closed. Also, the staff working at the bar out by the pool area was friendly and attentive. Our hotel rooms were really nice and were cleaned at a reasonable time everyday by the housekeeping staff. Everytime we got back in the late afternoon our rooms were cleaned. We truly enjoyed our time at the Hard Rock. I will say that it was pricey, but I think that should be expected....anytime you vacation at Disney/Universal, you should expect to spend some money!! The food at the hotel was above average, drinks were very good, nice fitness center, beautiful sand beach around the pool, nice shops, and neat ice cream shop. The hotel is definitely decorated beautifully around the Hard Rock theme, and the music in the hallways and the elevator is a reminder that you are at a very fun place. I do understand and would be upset myself if I had some of the experiences listed in "Hard Luck at the Hard Rock Go Anywhere Else" but I just want to let people know that this is a beautiful hotel and although we found a few minor things wrong with it....overall we had a wonderful experience at this hotel and I would encourage anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “It Rocks”
Reviews.Author: kirotank
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 had a weeks vacation planned since last year for Hard Rock and Universal. This hotel is top notch. Friendly staff, great atmosphere, awesome pool. We had a deluxe room that was very spacious and comfortable. My only complaints were the view (for a duluxe you should have better views) which overlooked the dog walking area, and the parking ($15 a night for valet or $7 a night for self park) which should be included for the price. My father had the kids suite and it was like a small apartment but had a mediocre view as well. Club level is highly recommended and a suite if you can swing it. A warning to those planning on going to parks on the day of check out. Your express plus pass will probably not work. Had family members in which it worked for only half of them and heard some complaints at the front desk for the same problem. Very minor complaints compared to the great time you will have at this outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: grttimes
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Fourth time there. Needs a little better up keep. Pool was great. Fast pass on every ride if you stay there is worth a few extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Best place ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was the best hotel I have ever stayed in!! The staff was very friendly, and did eveything they could to make our stay more enjoyable! The scenery is gorgeous!! The food is graet and the pool is spectacular. The best thing would probably be the Express passes you get for staying there. The longest we had to wait in line for was 10 mins. It was great because of all the things on site!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock MOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock for our Honeymoon. To start â€“ we arrived at the hotel (lovely looking etc) â€“ lugged our bags into the lobby, whilst watching the porters just staring back at us, only helping families or old men with cars!. Got to the reception desk and was greeted by reception, the most rudest staff I have ever met. They barely greeted us, hardly cracked a smile. I mentioned it was our first day of our honeymoon and no reply!, then they just gave us a room key. I pryingly asked if the room had a king size bed rather than a twin and they said sharpishly no!, all kings are taken. Then I said â€˜does it have a nice viewâ€™, they replied â€“ its of the gardens, so I thought great!. Finally brushing off their attitude, I asked what we do with our bags and they looked at us and the bags and said: â€˜theres 2 bags and 2 of you!â€™ I was so upset and the room we got given was in the basement opposite the base of a tree. It was a dirty room and 2 small beds with a tiny bathroom, which I could barely turn in! I then went back up to reception to complain, funnily enough another couple who arrived the same time were about to complain â€“ seriously â€“ Iâ€™ve seen better rooms in a motel, not 5* standards.So then on the second visit to reception, they sniggered and then gave another room on the 4th floor slightly higher up the tree! â€“ same quality room. Once again they never offered us help with our bags and cheekily said to the porters thinking I didnâ€™t hear, that they were to open the door for us in our new room as we were incapable of doing so!!I was so upset and instantly called our holiday rep â€“ give the rep their dues as they confirmed after a minute call that they would take it further and call me back asap. 2 minutes later they had arranged an upgrade to club level. Fantastic news as we ended up with a lovely view over the pool and parks and complimentary breakfast. Just another quick point to round it up â€“ the next morning around 9am we were called by reception to come asap â€“ no warning what about. Worridly, we went down and was told we were being charged $3 for our call to the rep!!!! â€“ just to be really spiteful! I would never recommend the hotel and really wished we had chosen disneyâ€™s Floridian!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock is the Way to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip at Universal yesterday, 10/15/2005, after a six night stay. We had a great time. The service was excellent. We got to the hotel about 12:30pm and were able to get a room. Our room was over looking the pool. It was a beautiful view. We are just your average family, not a rock star or movie star. However, we were treated like one. We are members of Loew's First Club. I do recommend joining it. You get a few extra perks, a welcome basket and the newspaper, etc. But over all the staff we talked to at the front desk, Velvet Lounge, and support staff were extremely nice. I know that when we go back to Universal we will stay at the Hard Rock. The best part is the Express Pass that you get by staying at an on-site hotel. You get to by-pass the lines. We were able to breeze thru all the rides. The longest time was 20 minutes ( the Ripsaw Tide) Log ride. The only thing that was a pain was the fact that they didn't have enough staff maning all the stations, the Express pass stations, we had to work our way in some of the lines. I felt bad because of the looks people were giving us. I am the type of person who doesn't like to upset others, especially if they have been standing in a long line. I don't blame them for getting upset either. I just wish they understood the express pass program. The Hard Rock is the best. My kids loved the pool. We spent several afternoons down there. The staff even arranged to put our friends next door to us. They didn't arrive until the next night, but they were put in the connecting room. The staff did everything they could to make our stay the best. The Hard Rock is the Way to Stay!! Thanks Hard Rock staff for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: trichIreland
Reviews.Content: My husband and i deceided to treat ourselves on our 10th wedding anniversary and stay at the Hard Rock for our two week vacation. I was a little disappointed on the size of the room and the size of the bathroom, (my husband is 6ft5in) and taking a relaxing bubble bath was certainly not going to be on our list of things to do! We had continually problems with the toilet blocking and yes they would come and sort it, but it was happening everyday. Housekeeping kept the room serviced well apart from the bathroom, and always arrived early to do so. The only other thing i have a problem with is after paying 2,000 sterling to stay at the Hard Rock, we still had to pay everyday to park the car!! This was our 4th trip to Orlando and im sure it wasn't our last, but we won't be staying in the Hard Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “What service?”
Reviews.Author: bitirish
Reviews.Content: I didn't rate this hotel terrible, but I am not sure why. We checked in the Hard Rock on 10/12005 early in the morning.. knowing our room wouldn't be ready, but needing our room keys to get perks of fast pass. Room was gaurenteed to be done by 4... Didn't get into our room until after 6..only after I called 3x.. we are a family of 5.. with 3 children. Once I got into the room it smelled.. so bad that when the luggage was delivered the bell man even mentioned it... But the front desk said the hotel was full.. so we decided to try and stick it out... at this point I had a terrible headache and just wanted to lay down.. Around 1:30 our neighbors came home >>>> and partied loudly until after 6am.. I did report them and security came up.. that just agitated them so they banged on the wall... I asked to be moved the next day and please let us be in our room by 4... needless to say I had to call again (after being promised they would make us a priority and call.. NOT) They did move us.. to a room with a view of tree tops... Needless to say I was disappointed in the entire stay.. At the rate I was paying a bit of customer service and making nice would have smoothed it over.. but they didn't bother.. and neither will I the next time I visit Orlando.. I am sticking with Disney!!

Reviews.Title: “We had the best time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pool was fantastic! The room was clean and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and always smiling.

Reviews.Title: “september at the rock”
Reviews.Author: ismom
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean up to date, very nice. in reading a previous review someone had mentioned the distance from room to the elevators, wow they werent kidding. Very tough if you are carrying a little exhausted child back to the room. basically that is our only complaint. Had dinner with Scooby Do at the Kitchen rest. my daughter 6, loved it. Also had dinner there the night we arrived and the magician fasinated her. Great trip, loved the pool and the music. Our daughter danced in the elevator and halls as soon as we were alone. We would go back however a little expensive if you are not on an expense account

Reviews.Title: “Great time to be had by all”
Reviews.Author: qtpie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Universal during my husband's business trip. We took our children ages 10 & 7. The resort was very clean. Check in and out was timely, and the staff was cheerful and fun to talk with. The staff in the gift shops were equally kind and attentive. My children loved the pool and water slide. I loved the fact that our room key acts as the "express pass" at the Universal parks, allowing you to walk right onto the rides with a very minimal wait time. The other park patrons didn't look too happy when the express pass holders just zipped right by them in their own private lines. My only complaint of our entire stay was this: I arrived much later than my husband, I arrived after 10PM and I couldn't find any food to purchase and I was hungry after my long drive. This is really not a valid complaint, I wouldn't want to cook for anyone that late either. (ha-ha) We had a wonderful stay and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Still rockin' out”
Reviews.Author: madame_rouge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock, Universal for 3 days at the start of our recent vacation. It was our second visit to this great hotel and hopefully it won't be our last. Loews hotels always have great beds and this was no exception. We were upgraded upon check-in, which was lovely (I seriously recommend becoming a Loews First member). The Kitchen is a fun place to eat - although our server was a little 'off' but the food and atmosphere more than made up for her. We also indulged in the Ice Cream parlour - expensive but gooood : O ) Our room was large, very clean and a pleasure to be in. I had a really good rate on the Loews website - be sure to check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will go back”
Reviews.Author: colleenmarie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Hard Rock hotel. We travel a lot and good service is sometimes hard to find. The service at Hard Rock was EXCELLENT! Every person we dealt with there seemed outgoing and always treated us well. The resort (especially to pool), the food and people make it a place we can't wait to visit again. The room key/express pass in Universal was WONDERFUL. We breezed through both parks in one day! After reading my review to hubby he said to mention that the pool gets really crowded so you need to get a lounger early and since it is an upscale place you are paying a higher price for food and drinks. Well worth it, though!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the 1st time”
Reviews.Author: holtzt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Orlando 4 years ago when they 1st opened and it was great! Feathers comforters on the bed, with great throw pillows and the most beautiful glassware I have ever seen! The check in was fast, friendly, hip and cool. They could not do enough for you to make your stay memorable. 4 years later, check in was a disaster, room on the 3rd floor as requested was not ready at 4:00. Offer another room on the 5th floor, went up with our bags and house keeping was still in the room. Advised the front desk and they insisted that the room was ready....it was not. While we waited went to the pool bar for a drink, staff was friendly, but took a long time to wait on us, kind of felt ignored. When we got into our room, was disappointed to see the feather comforters had been replaced with scratchy stiff ones. Paper cups for coffee and no chenille lounge chair. The hotel is in quite "used" condition only after 4 years. Suggestions clean the carpets and night stands in room 5013 they are gross!! Next time in Orlando, I think I will visit Mickey Mouse

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, but only for the Discounted Price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, without over analyzing or going into great detail, we really enjoyed the stay here at the Hard Rock. Now that that is taken care of, let me go over some of the things I liked and disliked. Liked: More spacious rooms than the Royal Pacific Nice Music playing The pool definitely The close proximity to the Parks Fast passes Beautiful walk way to the Parks Dis-Likes: Dog Poop everywhere in the grassy areas (Wanted to play ball with kids, but just could not find any clean area) No extra amenities in the room, relevant to the price you pay. No Loews First Member line to check in Not much of a Garden in the â€œGarden Viewâ€� Just a little bit too much Partying on Weekend nights, if you know what I mean, for a family with kids. I hate to say it, but I will never stay here again unless they run specials like they did this past Labor Day weekend. It just is not worth the price when you can stay at the Royal Pacific for cheaper and still use the Hard Rock pool if you want. Letâ€™s face it; the main and possibly only reason to stay at any of these Hotels is the Fast Pass. It is unfortunate to say this but you could stay at much nicer Hotels for almost half the price, but you just canâ€™t beat the Fast Pass and I think these Loews Hotels know this.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Gordo282
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hard Rock over Labor Day Weekend - September 1 - 5, 2005. We have two adults and 3 children (ages 11, 8, and 5). We stayed on the 5th floor in the Deluxe Queen room. The room was 500 sq. ft. and was huge! It had two queen beds and a pull out sofa bed that was actually comfortable. They give you a cool music CD at check-in and you have a nice CD player in your room to listen to it (or the radio). The music playing around the hotel property is at a comfortable listening level and does not over power the mood. We are a military family and although this was slightly expensive we enjoyed our time to the fullest. The Kitchen (hotel restaraunt) has great food but is a bit pricey. We had great breakfasts there and dinner one night. The other nights we ate in the City Walk where prices are a bit less. Recommend the Italian restaraunt there. Your rooom key gets you Universal Express access to all the rides and attractions in both parks. Our longest waits were for the things like Earthquake, Twister and some of the other movie rides. Other than that, we were in and out of the Hulk twice in 30 minutes! Great time and makes it worth the money you spend. The pool at the hotel is great. Kids loved it - especially the huge water slide. The pool is 4' deep and has a few jacuzzis around it. It seems that there are pool activities each night - on Sunday night they had a DJ who did some fun stuff (family oriented) with the kids and adults. Really made it for a pleasant day. Expect to spend some money when you stay here but I believe it is worth the money spent to enjoy such a nice time. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “How did they manage 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ the Hard Rock from 9/1-9/3, At check in they did not have have any info that we were coming w/ a dog (which they do allow) even though I had booked on line stating this and then called to confirm this info. They room was on the first floor and it was a bit old and tattered, toilet and sink barely drained and the carpet was totally thread bare. My suggestion to them is if this is the pets allowed room have them tiled. If you like to sleep for more than 3 hours a night this place is not for you. The really drunk come stumbling in around 3 am and then the kids are up and running and screaming though the halls around 6 am, tried to complain to management, they did nothing. I have stayed at many fine hotels and this remined me of a really bad interstate motel. For the $ you spend on this place it is not worth it. oh- for the dog walk area perhaps they should supply bags for the thoughtless owners who do not pick up after their dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks”
Reviews.Author: glyndab
Reviews.Content: If you have teenagers with you - everything abou this hotel will make them happy. From the music under water in the pool, the proximity to the parks and the front of the line privledges - the teenagers with us loved this park. It was crowded when we checked in but the people at the desk were really nice. They accomodated us with adjoining rooms and were very pleasant about it. The rooms are not huge, but the beds are comfortable and they have all the stuff you need (shampoo, etc) and will provide more - they even provided us with a "snore free" pillow for some people traveling with us. The pool is great - nice waiters and waitresses who were great in bringing beverages when we needed them and the best thing about the hotel is the front of line privledges. Our longest wait was 10 minutes. We could walk right onto the Hulk with NO wait. It was great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 PM Check In Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at 11:30 am and was able to check in but they told us the room was not ready, they would put a rush on the room and hopefully get us in early. We gave a cell phone number for them to call us when the room was ready. We walked around at city walk ate some lunch came back around 3:00 pm but still had not had a phone call. Around 3:30 pm went to check on the status of the room. They were very rude and said check in is not til 4:00 pm. I argued that they said they would try and rush the room. They called to housekeeping which said they had not even started the room yet it could be another 20 minutes. 4:30 pm we approached the desk again because we had not had a phone call. The guy laughed and said the room is ready. I asked why we were not called he said he didn't know. We get into the room which is nice but we took off our shoes and the floor in different spots was wet. Not just damp, soaked. We went to the pool area to swim. Later got into what I guess I thought was a hot tub. But the water was actually cooler then the pool water. We stayed at Royal Pacific resort last year this was a much better hotel better pricing and same benefits with the express pass to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (wife, 13 year old son and myself) stayed here during Easter this year. Although full it never felt crowded and the attitude of the staff was great. Always willing to help when asked and approachable. My wife is harder to please than me but she loved the place and it will be the first option when we return to Orlando. I think it helped that she is an Elvis fan and to have her picture taken in front of the costume display in the lobby was a bonus. As has been said before, the real bonus, was the extras: Front of queue pass was worth the room rate alone. Peak season and we never queued for more than five minutes for a ride when the main line wait was showing 60 - 90 minutes. Parcel delivery service from the parks to the room meant you could buy when you saw something without having to carry around/pay for a locker A gentle 5 minute stroll through the gardens to the theme park meant you were right on the doorstep and didn't have to wait for the waterbus. The Hard Rock really does rock. p.s. for those commited smokers out there thinking the worst; there are enough dedicated smoking places within the parks and a great cigar bar on the upper level of Citywalk

Reviews.Title: “A really fun hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pearl*o*the*sea
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a beautiful large deluxe 2 queen room which was worth the extra money as we had 3 adults and a child who could sleep on the pull out sofa bed. This hotel was very upbeat and fun to stay at with the piped in music playing all the time. And NO, it wasn't too loud, just enjoyable backround music! Most of the staff are very young and eager to please but I found them very inexperienced as my check out bill had a few extra charges on it, so check your statement carefully! The large pool is really beautiful and of course staying so close to the parks is the big draw here and well worth the price. Meals at the hotel can be very pricey so we had most of ours at the Hard Rock Cafe and other venues at the parks. All in all, it was a great trip and I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “You Won't Feel Welcome”
Reviews.Author: BigMeatball
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, but it's run by people that would rather you not bother them. The 4pm check-in time is not observed, they just don't have the rooms ready. The cleaning service is disorganized and there is a charge for everything. For the $300 a room costs, you just expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Came up trumps”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel last October for 16 nights with she who must be obeyed, and have to say that we had a great time we paid extra to stay in a pool view room but was on the second floor so had a great view of the palm trees, but not much pool, however this did not matter much as the room was large enough with good facilities, but for this reason i have only given it a four rating The express access was worth its weight in gold even in october when the queues were not that bad, it still made a big difference in the way we planned our days (no panicing to get the best rides in, walk up and walk on.) We ate out at City Walk most nights, but spent many hours relaxing in the atmosphere of the Velvet Bar and would recommend the staff and drinks being a visitor to the states cannot comment on prices but for a Londoner abroad it was what i expected and not bad. Pool area was also under refurbishment, which we were not advised about prior to arriving and the pool bar was closed to walk up business, but who wanted to drag themselves away from the pool when staff were on hand to bring refreshments to me were i was vegging out. in conclusion we like the Hotel so much that were back again this October for another 2 weeks

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice Hotel, friendly staff and very nice gardens, and pool. The short walk to all the atractions was perfect for short afternoon breaks to beat the heat. I would stay here again for sure but using club levle would be a toss up. I wasn't impressed with what you recieved for the extra money. Had a great week. Mike , Toledo, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Manteno
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago and it was at the top of my list. I just felt it dropped some this trip. The rooms are great, but getting a little warn. The carpet was pretty stained and the bedspreads have seen better days. Not up to $300 a night room in my book. My biggest complaint was the pool. I would not recommend this pool area for small kids. They allow people to use regulation size footballs in the pool. I counted 8 at one time. I just do not think they should allow them in the pool. I got hit a couple of times which did not matter, but small children is a different story. They also had one guy who worked there that would run and throw the football across the pool. They also have strict rules for the slide. I tell my kids to follow them and then he goes down on a life vest standing up. Ugh...... The place has the potential to become my favorite hotel again, but needs a little work.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: chimpanzes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night but this gave us 2 days front of the queue passes for Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios. The room was lovely, very clean and lots of soft towels and a dressing gown. The queue for Spiderman ride was over 1 hour so the express passes were a god send. Going back again at Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock was great!”
Reviews.Author: mckinfam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four night stay utilizing Loew's Stay 4, Play Free package. I thought the rate was still high even though it included 2 free length of stay passes to the parks, but it's the height of the summer season and I guess to be expected. Was told a room upgrade as part of their Loew's First program was not available, and we were given a garden view room (a view of the lobby and parking lot). We received the Loew's First welcome gift (cookies and milk) immediately and the kids liked it. The rooms are very nice and included a sink outside the bathroom which is convenient for 4 people. Housekeeping was excellent. The hotel was very crowded, but there seemed to be enough lounge chairs at the pool when we needed them. I enjoyed the pool area and the music played throughout the public areas. We only had breakfast bagels and pastries at Emack & Bolio's and did not dine in the hotel's restaurants. My family still prefers Portofino Bay at Loew's Universal Hotels, but I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it (with a few minor exceptions)!!!”
Reviews.Author: mpstm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 2 children (daughter 13, son 11) to the Hard Rock, June 4th thru June 8th. Staying for 5 nights, ONSITE, felt more like being there for 2 weeks! The VERY close proximety to the parks, combined with the EXPRESS PASS made us feel like we were royality! In the 5 days that we were there, we felt like our time was a luxury, we never felt the need to rush!!! Waiting 10 minutes, or less, in line for the rides was amazing (without the Express Pass others were waiting an hour or more)! The hotel itself was beautiful! The room was very nice, and the maid service was exceptional! Only ate at the poolside resturant (1 night), but the wait staff and food were very good (the kids really enjoyed it because they got out of the pool to eat, and were able to get back in while my husband and I finished our food and had a few drinks)! The number of lifeguards at the pool was very impressive!!! We felt completely comfortable allowing our children to go to the pool a little ahead of us (even 30 + minutes a time or two)! The only "downside" to our stay was that one of the hottubs wasn't working (the other was very crowded), and our "garden view" room was a view of a bush (we were on the 1st floor, didn't really matter though, we weren't in the room much)!!! Not only will we stay at the Hard Rock again, but my husband and I are looking into going back again next year (just the 2 of us)!!!! Sherrie, Brunswick, GA

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip to the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hard Rock with our 2 children ages 14 and 10. We had one of the best vacations staying there. I agree with everyone that the room key being used as express passes is the best!!!! I don't think we waited longer than 15 minutes for any ride. With an impatient 10 year this was great. Ate one time at Universal Studios Monster Cafe and had a great pizza, would recommend. We were told to take the water taxi and did that for the first couple of days. On the 3rd day we decided to walk back to the hotel and it was no more than a 10 minute walk. We walked to the parks the rest of the trip. The hotel was great, we arrived at noon and had no wait for our room. Suggestion is to register as a Loews club member, you get a treat of your choice delivered to your room which is a nice treat and it is free. We stayed on the club level and if we return and I would not opt for this choice, a little over priced for what you get. Basically you get a continental breakfast(bagels and fruit) and there is evening snacks that are not worth the extra $$$. Even though I would not stay on the club level again, another benefit is soda and water available all day. I would stay on a regular floor and drive over to one of the local stores(5-10 minute drive) for snacks and liquor(Walgreens has a liquor store beside it, ask the help desk how to get there). At the hotel we only ate at the pool side resturant and all in all it was pretty good. We took everyones advice and did not eat at the Kitchen. We did talk to some other guests that had and their impression was the same as others, not worth the $$$. The pool side drinks were expensive, although good, so I would suggest getting something at the Walgreen and mixing your own. We did venture to Wet n Wild and were very dissapointed, long lines and overcrowded. There are alot of kids at the Hard Rock, which we loved since we had kids of our own. They have one night of a big screen movie you can watch in the pool. That was pretty cool. The last couple of years we have taken a cruise and gone to Cancun so had some concerns because we went to Orlando a few years ago and stayed at a Disney resort and left very dissapointed. This vacation was the best vacation we have had in the US. The kids rank it up there with the cruise we took last year. I would definitely recommend the Hard Rock and we plan on returning the future. I have never written a review but because of our wonderful trip and great memories felt it was something to share. We, along with the kids made some great friends and will remember a great trip for a long time to come. If you want more information feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting vision of 5 STAR”
Reviews.Author: beeclean
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Hard Rock. (children aged 15 and 10) This is an interesting property, and one which is difficult to review. My overall impression was positive, but there are some things that are a bit unusual for a high end hotel. POSITIVES: Room keys act as "express passes" to get you to the front of all lines! Clean rooms Overly helpful concierge service Well kept grounds Proximity to Universal attractions All expenses at Universal may be charged to your room NEGATIVES: No operable windows/sliding doors TOTALLY defeats the benefit of a pool room view and means you have few options for relaxing in room. Clothes wet from water rides have no place to dry. Pool is NOT for swimming. Average depth is less than 4 feet. Too few pool chairs/chaises. They get filled up early. Limited food options. Music can become annoying over time. OVERALL I would highly recommend the Hard Rock, or any other Universal property for the simple reason that the room key/express pass is invaluable. 60 minute + wait times become less than 10 minutes. You can ride your favorites over and over and get much more out of the parks. Ultimately, the reality is that you do not spend that much time in the room or at the property. Therefore, get the least expensive room you can, and enjoy Universal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks in Florida and the highlight was the stay at Hard Rock Hotel. The public rooms were spacious and a good place to relax the swimming pool was big and the slide kept the kids entertained for hours and the ability to walk to Universal Parks and City Limits was a major plus, being able to ESCAPE back to the hotel really made visiting the parks much less fraught. Only minor point was the rock music this was played in all the public rooms and to some could become a bit wearing after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but you need a car”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hard rock hotel is a very nice hotel. The staff is very nice, housekeeping was wonderful but the price to eat at the hotel is crazy. The food that is served in the Kitchen is really not worth it. The food cost too much and the food is not that good. The hotel charge $8 to go to the workout room and I paid alot of money to stay there and the workout room should be free. There is a charge for a large bottle of water the cost $6 and a regular size bottle of water $2.50, a can of soda $2.95. The best part of the trip is the exress passes, it bypass the rest of the people standing in line. the food inside parks are wonderful and alot cheaper than the hotel. Make sure to buy a soveiner cup and take to the park everytime because it cost only$1.49 for refills. Overall it was nice but I can not afford to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 days during Memorial day with my husband and 2 kids ages 8 and 10, and had a great time. The hotel was clean, and friendly. We had stayed at the Portofino around Christmas and was very impressed, but when we decided to come back for Memorial day, we heard that Hard Rock was more kid friendly so we chose it instead. From the mixed reviews, I did not know what to expect, but we had a great time. We stayed at the club level in both hotels, and they both had their advantages and disadvantages. The food choices in the Hard Rock are much better in the evening than the Portofino, however, breakfast is much better at at Portifino. Also, the club room is smaller at the hard rock, and you get people in barefeet, and pj's which was a turn off for me. However, the pool at Hard rock for the kids is much more enjoyable. I enjoyed both hotels and their ammenities and would recommend either one. Breakdown though if you are couple stay at Portofino if you are a family chose hard rock.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: lsjmhart
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a nine day stay at Hard Rock (June 10-18.) I read so many of the previous reviews before we went, I almost didn't know what to expect (some people had some pretty negative things to say.) I'm thrilled to write this review as we were extremely pleased with our entire stay at HRH. The POSITIVES: -Club Level definitely worth the extra money (quick, light breakfast each morning-- beer/wine and hor dourves from 5:00-7:00--desserts every evening--soda and bottled water all day long) -Friendly staff (every single employee we came into contact with said hello and asked how we were doing) -Pool (perfect for my seven year old and the baby pool was great for my twenty month old) -Rooms (clean and comfortable--we upgraded our second day there to a bigger room w/ king bed and pull out sofa, two TVs, separate dining room, etc. FABULOUS!) -Short walk to Universal, Islands of Adventure, and CityWalk (Express pass at the parks was enough to make you feel like royalty) -Music, music, music!!!! The NEGATIVES: -poor lighting in the bathrooms -remote controls did not work well unless you were 2 feet from the TV (we noticed it in our first room and with both TVs in our upgraded room) What else can I say? The positives DEFINITELY outweigh the negatives. Yes, some of the food/drink prices were high at the restaurants on site, but what can you expect anywhere in Orlando?? (And believe me we went to many restaurants throughout the area that week.) You can't expect to travel to a tourist area like that and find a $3.00 cheeseburger! This vacation was all we dreamed about and MORE! We can't wait to go back. Thank you, HRH, for a fantastic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: plaurel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Hard Rock Hotel Club level the first week of June. We were given our room key to enjoy some drinks on the 7th floor lounge while we waited for our room to be ready. I was called on my cell when our room was ready. The room was spacious & clean. The cleaning people were very nice and creative. They arranged a gator (the boys won at the park) and had him posed on the bed with a blow-up guitar. Club level free sodas, water, coffee, breakfast, delicious appetizers, beer, wine(5-7),cookies & milk (evenings) was awesome. It is worth the extra $$. The pool was very nice and clean. My teen loved the slide. The hot tub was always packed, the other was closed. The pleasant walk to the parks with all the nice plants was great. All the rock memorabilia was cool. I especially liked Elton John's super high heel shoe display. We also enjoyed the rock music playing everywhere, even under water. I highly recommend this hotel (unless you like peace and quiet).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hard Rock for a quick Mothers Day weekend trip and were delighted. The front desk service was fabulous and check in at the Lowe's First counter was a snap. Beware that self parking is $7 per day and valet parking is $14/ day. Unconscionable in my opinion, but I look at it as my fee for the express pass feature on the room key. The room was spacious, clean and tastefully decorated. Only criticism of the room is that the pillows are too soft (down) but extras were quickly delivered and hypo-allergenic replacements are available. When we first arrived at the hotel we were concerned because we had small children and the atmosphere seemed more adult, but there's plenty of families at the hotel and our concerns turned out to be unfounded. The pool area is fabulous, with underwater music piped in, a waterslide and volleyball area and great margaritas. However, despite its expansive size, the pool is very shallow throughout. Great for kids, but it made swimming difficult for adults. Mother's Day Brunch at the Kitchen was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: hongihika
Reviews.Content: A beautfiul hotel to stay in. Service was great. I hadn't pre-booked, the desk was helpful and told me to call reservations to see if I could get a cheaper rate. Parking is cheap $7 a day. A walk through the garden connects you to Universal Studio's and City walk or you could catch a shuttle. The restaurant was pricey but good food. Seems like a great place to take kids. Pool was awesome. Enjoyed the buffet breakfast, lots of choices to eat. From cooked to continental. Only downer I had a 2 inch cockroach walking around the room. However, the hotel was quick to deal with it and very apologetic. Didn't milk it because this is Florida and you get bugs in this climate. I would stay there again. I liked the rock music theme.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: MPI57
Reviews.Content: My husband, two sons (ages 11 and 9), and I stayed at the Hard Rock recently, from May 19th through May 23rd. I was a little apprehensive because of some of the reviews I had read here concerning service and room conditions, but I must say just about everything was great. Our room, which was in the garden-view category, was clean and spacious. As a matter of fact, we had a lot more room at the Hard Rock than we had when we stayed at Disney Wilderness Lodge a few years ago. The front desk was courteous. The pool was great. While the prices at the on-site eating establishments were on the high side, they were not out of line for what one expects to pay at a resort. I did not feel like we were being gouged. However, there were a couple of negatives. On one day, we returned to the hotel around 3:00 p.m. after several hours at Universal and our room still had not been cleaned. Given that May is not exactly the busiest time in Orlando, I found this a bit difficult to understand. Also, on the Saturday we were there, it appeared that a number of the cabanas by the pool had been rented to host local kids' birthday parties. The pool was quite crowded and every single beach chair was either claimed or occupied. Every other day at the pool was fine. The best reason to stay at the Hard Rock, though, is to get the express privileges at Universal. We saved several hours of "waiting in line" time and got to ride all rides we wanted, some more than once.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: HensleyKodak
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a great pool, nice rooms, good location, and easy parking. However, the front desk can put a damper on your stay from the moment you check in. I had read reviews prior to booking a room here and read that some folks had had problems getting their rooms billed appropriately. I had the same trouble. I wanted to leave the room charges on the card with which I had booked the room, but I did not physically have the card when I checked in. It was with my wife who was meeting me there. So I had to give them another card to use until my wife arrived. When she arrived, I was assured that the charges would be taken from my card and put onto hers. Of course, this didn't happen. It took several calls and emails to get it done after we returned and got our statement from our credit card company. This put a damper on our stay and really left a bad taste for us. Also, we had charges on our bill when we checked out that were not correct. If you stay here, make sure you check your bill before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the nice beds?”
Reviews.Author: rymorse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Halloween weekend for HHN. The hotel was wonderful, service was good at the front desk, room was large and comfterable. I had stayed in this hotel not long after 9/11, and i was a little shocked to see the differeenc in the bedding for the same floor, same garden view room catagory. Last time the room had numerous pillows on each bed, a down feather comfter, and a mini fridge in every room. This time however the beds had standard lumpy hotel pilows, and the regular hotel bedding. What happened? Also they now charge for the minifeidge in the room. Bedding asside, I would like to compelment the hotel on its security. THeir was a group of people having a rather large pary at 3am in the room down form ours, i called the frotn deks..and they inforemd me it would be taken care of, it was rather fast. They kicked the poeple out of the hotel! ;) The pool is great, maidservice is top notch, and the food is extremely good for a buffet brekfast. Allthough id wait for a sale price on the room its a little pricy for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nites with a group from work. Non stop party. I had the Rolling Stones suite and it was very nice to come back to the Hotel at 3am and order room service and contiue partying. Pool is great .Location close to City Walk and the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: dan1van
Reviews.Content: "Does what it says on the tin". The hotel is good, very good if you're going to Universal Studios because you get an express pass to beat the queues. Everything clinically clean and fine, though if youre coming with a girlfriend etc. forget it, not at all romantic or characterful. But for everyone else, fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: meagan11
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Hard Rock from 16-22 April 2005. We went with two other family's, so there was a total of ten kids in tow. Let me tell you, staying on site is soooooo worth the extra money you pay in order to avoid the ride lines at Universal and Islands of Adventure! The longest we ever waited was ten minutes....we rode the Mummy three times in a row without a wait! Tha hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The kids loved the pool, and throughout the day they had kids activities there which the younger ones enjoyed. We even felt safe enough to allow the older kids to go off on their own at the park (with a two-way radio)...when the adults had enough...or when the kids wanted to go back to the pool...we just met them there...it was great! We walked to City Walk every night for dinner...really didn't have to wait that long for tables, considering there was 16 of us! Ate one night at Emeril's (without kids)...VERY expensive...food was good, but I don't think it was worth the money. I would recommend staying at the Hard Rock to anyone...and if you plan on spending a lot of time at Universal or IOA...you can't beat staying on site...after all...you wait a long time for vacations like these...make it as enjoyable as you can...it's worth the extra $$.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hard Rock Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GirlPenguin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel April 27 & 28th after spending a few days over at the Grand Floridian at Disney. We arrived around noon and checked into our room. We had requested a king sized bed but they did not have one in our category (Garden view) so they upgraded us to a Deluxe room, which was larger. Our room was not ready and we were told would not be available until 4 p.m., so we ate lunch at the Kitchen and went over to the park and then came back. The walk to the parks is very nice - quite short, and beautifully landscaped. It was very convienient. When we got to our room, our bags were brought to us pretty quickly. We had a cruddy view - the roof of the building - but since we had gotten upgraded we couldn't exactly complain. The room's bed was the nicest hotel bed I've ever slept on! And the pillows were MUCH nicer than the usual hotel pillows. The room was good sized and had a couch to sit on. The best features of staying at the Hard Rock: 1. Express Passes for the rides...without a doubt worth the price of staying on site! My husband commented that it spoiled us on any other amusement parks we will ever visit in the future. We literally walked right on several rides without breaking stride. 2. Closeness to the parks and City Walk: A very quick and easy walk, and they even have a water taxi if you want to bother waiting for it. We tried it once but it took 20 minutes and we could have walked there 3 times over in that amount of time. 3. FANTASTIC pool area. White sand beaches, two hot tubs, a great slide, and just overal nice. We rented floaties ($10 apeice for the whole day) and spent the whole afternoon at the pool one day. It was so relaxing! The pool resturant and bar was really expensive - $8 for a tiny margaretia was a bit over the top - but it was convienient. The only complaint I have about the Hard Rock was that the resturant service at The Kitchen was hideous. We ate there for dinner and we waited 20 minutes for the server to bring us a desert menu after we requested one. It was soooo slow! Plus they seated us outside in what felt like the middle of the sidewalk with people constantly walking right around us and staring at us. The other complaint is that we wanted a fridge but it was an additional $15 a night to rent one. At the prices we paid for the room I think a fridge should be included for no additional charge. Overall, we really liked the Hard Rock and would like to return again some day. Both hubbie and I liked it better than the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hard Rock Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lanikai
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent three days at the Hard Rock Hotel in February 2005 and had a wonderful time! We split our stay with the Animal Kingdom Hotel in Walt Disney World, which is a fabulously themed hotel and was perfect for our Walt Disney World stay. The Hard Rock, however, was an excellent value and a beautiful property. It also felt a lot more "adult". As music buffs, we appreciated the music theming throughout the hotel (even the pool has underwater speakers). Also, it's a very short walk to the parks, so we were able to return to the hotel for mid-day breaks. We've stayed at the Royal Pacific, and the Hard Rock is the better of both properties, for sure. We're returning to Orlando next winter, and we're staying at the Hard Rock again. If you do go, make sure to go to Emeril's Tchoup Tchoup Restaurant at the Royal Pacific Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money for FOTL”
Reviews.Author: mcefao
Reviews.Content: First off I have to say it was worth the money to stay on-site for the FOTL privilege. Made our vacation - no rush - walk on for all rides - just a great benefit!!! Stayed in a garden view room Wednesday to Saturday. Had room 5129 which was very far from the elevators and ice machine. Room had two queen beds with white covers - a dresser with 6 draws, a large closet, a decent size TV, bathroom with vanity area outside area with toliet and tub/shower. Attached hairdryer in bathroom. Also had a table with two chairs and a chair with foot rest with it's own light. Room overlooked the water taxi area. Very quiet - never heard any noises outside the room. Could be because it was almost at end of corridor. Was able to get into room when we checked in about 12:30 which was great. Pool area was nice but got very crowded even though Wed, Thurs the hotel was not booked. Had one very hot hot tub and one that was just right - though filled with small children probably because the weather was cool after 5pm. Slide was pretty good - great for the kids - I went on it once and was surprised it wasn't bad. Hotel is very convenient to City Walk - short water taxi ride or quick walk. Never waited more than 10 minutes for water taxi. Buffet breakfast in The Kitchen expensive but not bad. Had just about everything. Had dinner one night there - excellent steak - melt in your mouth and very good taste. Pasta dish was just ok. Very good waiters both times. Quick and efficient and on top of filling water/juice glasses. Good bagels/donuts/muffins in deli on first floor - convenient for a quick breakfast. Had chicken fingers twice from beach pool bar - actually received them before the drinks one time. Daugther loved them. Thought the $8.00 frozen strawberry margaritta was terrible. Had one in a nice plastic cup at RPH also and both had a strange taste I didn't care for. As mentioned before be careful because the beach club at the HRH does add 15% gratuity. Would stay again though would probably go with the less expensive Royal Pacific or if I could get a deal would love to stay at the Portofino - looked nice when we did a walk around one evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Has Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from April 14-18. Some quick conclusions: If you are going to visit the Universal theme parks for more than a day then it is worth it to stay at one of their 3 hotels: the Hard Rock, The Royal Pacific or the Portofino because each is only a 10 minute walk to the parks via a paved path and also guests receive the Express Pass which allows you to get on most of the rides with only a 5-10 minute wait versus a 50 minute wait. We also ate at Emeril's and Emeril's Tchoup Chop restaurants and highly recommend both of them. The Kitchen at the Hard Rock was great for the breakfast buffet but otherwise the service was horrible and the food for lunch and dinner was mediocre and not worth the price. Between the 3 hotels, I would recommend the Hard Rock or the Royal Pacific. The Portofino may have nicer rooms but it feels very deserted, almost like a ghost town compared to the energetic vibe at the Hard Rock. The Royal Pacific is very nice from what I saw. Has the most beautiful lobby and grounds, also has the Emeril's Tchoup restaurant and the cheapest rates of the 3 hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: sunveggie7
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent two nights at The Hard Rock and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We shared a deluxe queen room and were quite pleased with the size of the room as well as the comfort of the beds which included white duvet covers...always a huge step up from yucky hotel bedspreads. The staff was laid back but still professional and seemed to genuinely care that you were having a good time. We were also pleasantly surprised to be able to check right into our room at 1:45 in the afternoon. The pool was very nice as were the cocktails/food there albeit a little pricey ($88 for 4 drinks, nachos and a turkey sandwich). The convienience to the park is a huge plus, it is great to get to a hotel and never have to get back into a car until you leave for the return to the airport! Dinner at The Palm was delicious as always and we enjoyed the atmosphere of the club at The Hard Rock although the name escapes me. If you have a rainy day and are tired of the parks, I suggest going over to The Portofino Spa which we found upscale and very quiet...sometimes hard to find at spa! I have stayed at The Portofino before and was expecting The Hard Rock to be a step down but it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock a Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: kvandewa
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a night at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando and loved it (so did our 4 year old). From the point we checked in, to the point when we checked out we felt we were treated like we really were welcome and appreciated. Being able to use our room key for an express pass made it even better. This hotel is definitely worth the nearly $300 per night we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time at the Hard Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: kandm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock April 8-11 and everything about it was fantastic. We arrived at 11:00 am, knowing that we wouldn't be able to check in until 4. However, we were instantly given our room keys-allowing us to go to the parks as well as being able to have charging privleges-the entire process took about 5 minutes. They asked for our cell number to call us when the room was ready and we checked our luggage at the luggage services desk. This too, was quick and efficient. We were called before 3 and told our room was all set. Definately sign up for Lowes club prior to going.This enabled us to upgrade to the club floor for only $50/night and it was DEFINATELY worth it. We took FULL advantage of the beer and wine from 5-7, as well as the breakfast in the morning. Throw in the water and sodas and it is a no brainer that you get your money's worth. All of the staff were friendly and were eager to talk to us. The turn down service as a result of being a Lowes member was great as was being able to get a late check out. We received our bill under our door the morning we were leaving and it was accurate so we were able to just sign it and drop it in the box in the lobby making checkout a breeze. The front of the line privelege at the parks that you get with your room key will definately leave you saying that you would never go back to the park without it! Two thumbs up for the HARD ROCK

Reviews.Title: “Benefits Outweigh the Inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: CaptainJackBart
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Universal Studios and/or IOA - there's no substitute for having the Express Pass you get when staying at an on-site hotel. You can easily do in one day what it would otherwise take two or even three days to do if you had to wait the posted wait times for each ride. There are no limitations on how many times you can use it or how often... so I would recommend VERY highly that you stay on-site. We chose the "middle-of-the-road" hotel, and stayed at the Hard Rock. The Hard Rock Hotel itself was great - There were three of us (2 adults, 1 seven year old) and we stayed in a king room which also had a fold out couch and plenty of room for everyone. Check-in was smooth, everyone was very friendly. We checked in first thing in the morning and they took a cell phone number and called us at the park when our room was ready. Housekeeping was great, and the only miniscule inconvenience we experienced with our room (a missing TV remote) was taken care of within 2 minutes. The pool is probably the best part of the actual Hotel, especially if you have kids who like to swim. It's shallow enough (deepest part is 4'8" I think) so that you don't have to worry much about smaller kids who might not be strong swimmers, and the water slide is enough to keep most kids happy for hours on end. We didn't eat there, but the prices at the Beach Club seemed really reasonable for a place of this caliber. There is a down side to the place, and I think most people have mentioned them here before. * They do have a knack for nickle-and-diming you to death once they have you there. * $7 a day for parking ($14 for valet) gets tacked on immediately upon check-in, which seems a bit much for a $300/night hotel. * The minibar police have a tendency to ignore the "Privace Please" signs that you hang on the door, barging in at 9:00 (our room was on the 1st floor, maybe higher floors got to sleep later) whether you want them or not. * Food prices are pretty absurd, particularly at the carry-out place on the pool level. (Emack and Bolio's I think it's called - $26 for 3 bagels and juice.) But if you go on vacation expecting to spend money for conveniences and such, it's not enough to make it a bad experience. It's just that when you pay nearly $300 a night for a hotel, it's a bit chintzy of them to wring every cent out of guests while they're there. Ultimately, I'd probably try one of the other Hotels on-site next time. Not because I'd expect them to be any different, but simply because they look nice and there was no "we HAVE to come back here" feeling about the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights @the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando. I read a lot of reviews on both Universal Studios and the Hard Rock Hotel; our experience this past week has EXCEEDED our expectations! The staff was AWESOME. We stayed on the concierge/club level and we wouldn't recommend doing it any other way. It was well worth the "extra" $$$. We had access to all the bottled water, coke, diet coke, sprite, coffee that we wanted. It didn't hurt that there was happy hour from 5-7 every night with different appetizers. Your choice of Heineken/Bud/Bud lite and then wine. The kids really enjoyed the dessert hour every night too! Rice krispy treats, cookies, oreos, etc. Turn down service was offered every night....I would recommend applying for a Loews card--no charge, easy to do online. Then with your acct#, book your room. We received a bottle of wine/nuts/daily paper. Too many good things to list. Hopefully somebody finds this info. helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 in Disguise”
Reviews.Author: auburn8
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando. If location were the only consideration this would be a 5 * hotel. The hotel is a few hundred yards from the attractions or a short Water Taxi ride. That and the Express Pass for the rides were the only redeeming qualities of this hotel. Our problems started with check-in. We were a couple of hours early but we were allowed to check in and were promised a call on our cell phone when the room was ready (the official check-in time is 4:00). We went to the Islands of Adventure and by 5:00 we still had not received a call. We stopped back by the front desk and were told the room had been ready for a while and the girl just laughed when we asked about not receiving a phone call. Also, as a result of ineptitude at the front desk my credit card was rejected at a restaurant the next night because the check-in person had "accidently" charged about $20,000 in room charges to the card. It took two days to get it resolved and they never even appologized for the error except to say it was a typo. The room is not worth the nearly $300 charge. It is small with a small bathroom that you have to squeeze next to the toilet to get the door opened. The toiletries are sub-par and the decor is nothing to write home about. The maid service, however, was excellent. The grounds are nice, though not Disney quality. The pool was very nice and the kids enjoyed the slide tremendously. The restaurants are very expensive with only so-so food. As another reviewer said, go to the grocery store before you get there and bring a cooler to put drinks in. We walked over to the Portifino Bay Hotel and were able to look at a room there. For similar room rates it looks like the Portifino would be a much nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- A Few Words of Caution & a Tip”
Reviews.Author: Mominator
Reviews.Content: Stayed Week of March 6. 2005. We found the hotel to be very clean -- carpets were fine. I think some of the past reviewers interpreted the subtle shading as dirt. We even saw them shampooing the carpets while we were there. The staff was very friendly, professional, and helpful-- top notch. Our room was truly one of the nicest we have stayed in -- and we have been in a lot of hotels. Everything was clean, new, amenities were great. Here's your tip -- We had a Loew's First Card (free if I remember correctly) and the upgrade to concierge level was $50 instead of $100 per night. Just make sure you tell them you are a member; they won't offer unless you ask. You will get a newspaper every day and some other free stuff, too. There are even better benefits, like free room upgrade, the more you stay at Loew's hotels. I think there's information on the website... Here's my beef(s) 1. The hotel is sorely lacking in sundries -- magazines, toiletries, sunscreen -- the things travellers need. The only items available were in the back of the Hard Rock merchandise store. A tiny little section, with things like individually wrapped aspirins. And you will not find a good store anywhere else on the entire Universal properties -- I looked. 2. We have stayed concierge in many hotels and it has always been a quiet, quality experience. Not at the Hard Rock... There were more people in that small lounge than in the lobby! People sleeping, unsupervised kids in pajamas running through tipping plates of food on the carpet ... the whole gamut. I got the feeling that some of these people had crammed 20 into their room and were using the lounge as overflow. Most times we could not find a seat & wouldn't have wanted to anyway. The food was just OK... I think it was because it was such a free-for-all that the hotel decided to put out the "bad stuff" or the "unwieldy stuff" to cut down on the gluttony. Many times it was as if a swarm of locusts had descended. The worst was the night that someone had set up their child's birthday party in the concierge lounge. They had balloons, party favors, and the food was... evening cookies from the lounge! They took big plates of them for their party, leaving store bought Oreos for the rest of the guests. I guess concierge is still better than buying food at the hotel ($13.00 for two cokes and a bag of chips), but it sure wasn't the treat that I am used to. Note to HRH: Consider having a family level and also an age 15+ level of concierge service. Or limit the age that can say on the concierge level, and the number of guests per room. Note to self: Ask driver to stop at a grocery store before checking in. The extra transportation costs will be dwarfed by the savings in bringing your own sundries and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: natsfan62
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel...beautiful. Amenities are great. Nice features is the express to be put at the beginning of the lines in the Universal parks. The maid service was outstanding and our room was as beautiful as when we first walked in. The only problem I have is the staff. Not too friendly and when asked questions about the hotel and some gave conflicting answers and were not sure where to send you for answers. Training really needs to be done for the staff. The reservations on line were very confusing and your really need to make sure you read EVERYTHING because the pricing is very misleading. Great hotel but for the price, I expected the staff to be more accommodating of their guest.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: theKiwi
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando. Maybe that was the problem. The check-in was smooth. A pre-requisite to working here must be that you have to look like a rock star. The staff all were OK, and had personality, but this sometimes overshadowed that they had a job to do. I waited at the luggage services desk while 3 staff members chatted amongst themselves 5 feet away. The room was OK. The desk and walls had chipped paint in some places, and aside from some black-and-white pictures on the walls, there was no indication that this was a rock-themed hotel. The corridors and rooms were generally bland. In my opinion, in any themed hotel, wherever you are standing in the hotel you shouls know what the theme of the hotel was. The bathroom was very small, but some musical note or instument themed tiles or shower curtain would have been a 100% improvement. give the rooms personality. Also, some music themes carpetting in the corridors and hallways would have been fantastic. The rooms themselved were barely better than a motel 6. Nevertheless, the location could not be beat. just steps from the citywalk and universal studio's, and even if you don't want to do the short walk, the water taxi is right there. Your room key allows you to skip the lines, and you can charge anything, absolutely anything in either park and any restaurant to your room. even at the little hot-dog stands!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected But Still Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a few nights. I had higher expectations after staying at the Portofino Bay at Universal for the Hard Rock Hotel. Dont get me wrong...this is a very nice hotel but the only thing that dissappointed me were the rooms. I just expected a little more out of them. The ammenaties are unbeatable here. If you are planning on going to the parks, spend the extra money and stay on-site. It pays for itself. You get virtually no wait ride access with the express pass. When you go to the park all you need to carry is your room key. It is your express pass, and you can use it for purchases at the parks and it charges it to your room. Parking at Universal is $9 per day. Staying on-site allows you to be taken by water taxi to the parks and that is the ticket after a long day of walking at the parks. A piece of advice...get AAA if you are planning on staying on-site. The $40 dollars will pay for itself when you receive discounts on your room and 10% off everything you buy at the parks. The AAA discount and the Annual pass holder discounts are the same. I saved $170 dollars over 2 nights with AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, I can't stress enough the value of the express passes that staying on site affords you- especially when you have antsy teenage kids with you :) We stayed at the HRH for 6 nights from Feb 21st until Feb 27, and to be honest, the hotel itself was one of the highlights of our trip. We went with our 13-year old son, who for the most part, preferred staying by the pool- trying to catch lizards and using the amazing waterslide (by the way, it's fun for us adults too)....instead of going to the parks. The amazing part is that since you're so close, you can have some down time in the morning just to relax by the pool and get in some Florida sun- no rush to get to the parks early because they are in such proximity to the hotel- just a 5 min. walk or water taxi- in addition, with the express passes, we were able to do the Mummy Ride 3 times in a row in the time it took most families to ride once- TRULY INCREDIBLE- and worth the money if possible. This certainly isn't a cheap place by any means, but for us, it was the Disney trip of a lifetime, and worth all the extra amenities for sure!!! The service was also amazing!! Staff was Always willing to go the extra mile. While we were there, we enjoyed one of the velvet sessions where they have a rockband from the past come in and perform- as many of us 80's buffs remember well- the Romantics performed for us. The HRH did an amazing job transforming the hotel lobby from the luxury of a 5 star hotel to a hip rock-star party-like atmosphere. It was also great for our son because as we sipped on Martinis and beer, he was close by at the pool and always in close reach, which was such peace of mind for us. The whole experience was amazing, and I hope that we are able to return very soon!!!! The final thing worth mentioning is the MUSIC!! After all, this is the hard rock- I heard songs the whole week that I haven;t heard in years... In my opinion, the constant music is perhaps the most under-appreciated aspect of this hotel- it really adds a flare that makes you never want to go back to ultra-snooty places like the Grand Floridian- after all, this is a Florida vacation, and especially with kids, the whole point is to HAVE FUN, and the HRH succeeds this measure beyond all expectations :)

Reviews.Title: “Move over Disney!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are visiting the HRH in April to celebrate our Anniversay - we honeymooned there as well. This will be our 5th visit (well mine anyway!) When we were there for our honeymoon and they bumped us up to a King Suite for the week! Big thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay maybe I am a jaded, well-traveled New Yorker, but I expected alot more from HRH. I expected something more plush/ deluxe resort oriented. I went with two teenagers and I admit they loved the pool (even i went on the water slide a couple of times) but they were un impressed with the accomodations. I have been to several other Loews Hotels (the one in Miami is terrific) and I thought HRH was going to be more like them. Yes the carpet was a little raggedy but the walls and hallways were clean. Also it was worth staying on the property to have the Universal Express access! It is better that using the one that the park offers because you never have to come back with your ticket you have access right away! We loved IOA much more that Universal Studios (The Mummy ride is fantastic) The restaurants on site were okay but not alot of diversity in the menus. $3.00 for a 16 oz bottle of Sprite! If I ever go again I think that I would upgrade to Club level and if I had been told about the Club level upgrade I would have done it! I would go again but my expectation level would be lowered! I will probably stay at the Royal Pacific...it looked like a better hotel! Don't believe the hype!

Reviews.Title: “Had fun at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: shpedly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, and had a great time. Hotel was beautful, rooms were nice. Loved the pool, though it was always crowded. Rented a cabana for three days. Got great treatment and service at the cabana. Had cabana 1 which was close to the bathrooms, and the bar, as well as the pool. Loved that you always had lounge, as well as tv and fridge. Am posting some pics from the hotel. Front of the line with room key is the best thing, and well worth it. The convenience of the walk to the parks and citywalk was phenomenal, about 5 minutes to universal and citywalk, 10 to islands of adventure. This was the short cut through the pool area by the slide. Many rides had over 60-70 minute waits, and we waited no more than 5 minutes if we didn't actually go in and walk on the ride.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: counselormom
Reviews.Content: I paid for two nights recently at the Hard Rock Hotel. Two rooms each night, on the club/concierge level. I had problems from the minute I checked in. Unfriendly front desk clerk, non-smoking rooms full of smoke (even the valet noticed the smell) and an unhelpful concierge. The trip was very stressful because of this hotel's staff. Upon checking in, the front desk clerk attempted to re-charge me for the first nights' stay in each room that I had already paid for previously (and had documentation showing it). The clerk argued with me for over 5 minutes, then finally relented. When I got to my two club level rooms, one clearly smelled of smoke, even though a sign listed they were "especially prepared" as non-smoking rooms. The valet noticed it and said he'd send up an ionizer to help. The ionizer never showed up the first night. Because the rooms were adjoining, by the next morning they both smelled like smoke. I called the front desk and they said they'd send up an ionizer while we were at the parks. When I returned later that afternoon, no ionizer and still a bad smell. I called again, and this time the concierge said she'd personally put one in my room, or they could transfer me to another set of ajoining rooms that were smoking (?!!) After complaining for a few moments, the concierge offered my party free breakfast the next morning because of our troubles-not a big deal since I was already paying for the club level's free breakfast and snacks every day as part of my room price. The ionizer was delivered finally and the rooms smelled better for our last night. Upon leaving I went to the concierge to pick up my rental car-as I had been told to do-(one of the other Universal hotels has a rental car company in the hotel), and the concierge couldn't find my rental reservation. He just simply told me he couldn't help me and told me to go find the valet!!! I have stayed in MANY 4 or 5 star hotels and never have had a concierge tell me he could not help me, then refuse to help. I ended up speaking to the valet, who personally took me over to the other hotel where the rental car company was located, and that hotel's manager and concierge helped me from then on. The Portofino's staff was VERY nice and helpful and if I ever go to Universal again I will certainly stay with them. The Hard Rock's location is nice in that it is in walking distance of both Universal parks, but the value for your money is not worth it. Even at the club level the rooms were very small and offered few amenities. Next time we will go back to Disney for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 9th trip to Orlando and our first at HR. We have previously stayed on site at Disney (Wilderness Lodge) bit gloomy but good service and also at the Portofino Bay at Universal (bit rambling). We have also stayed on I Drive at the Wyndham (rooms poor service good). But can't praise HR enough. I travelled with my son (14) and my mother 65+! and both rated it as the best. The staff couldn't do enough (they practically sweep the floor in front of you). The food in the Kitchen was good and very efficient service. We went at Christmas and the decorations were fab. Of course the best perk for my son is the front of line access to the rides (although he wimped out on The Mummy) I had to do it by myself (how scared was I). We were so impressed we have booked to go back this October for 1 week (even though the flight from the UK is a killer) we would rather do HR than anywhere else. Rock On Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God...YES!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
