Our first indication of this was the fact that our room was no where near ready when we arrived at the appointed check-in time. It was only after numerous phone calls to the front desk that we finally were able to check in at 5:30 p.m. By that time, my wife was nearly dead from heat stroke, as we had decided to go to the park since we could not get into our room. I, myself, was tired because the Hard Rock has no adequate facilities for moving your luggage from the parking area to your room. Guests must either endure the conga line of traffic to the front portico or hike up a mountain of stairs from the parking area. I chose the stairs, and it was after my long march up the stairs that the doorman greeted me with, â€œDude, that luggage looks heavy.â€� He was nice enough to open the door, but the thought of helping with my luggage did not enter his pierced and studded head. The room itself was nicely appointed with a good view of the garden. I was surprised by the comfortable bed, pillows, and quiet surroundings. Since most of the guests like to party, it is good to know that the Hard Rock has thick walls. After a hard and sweaty day at the park, we decided to hit the famous Hard Rock pool. It is huge and well-designed. Unfortunately, it is usually swarming with kids and sometimes there are â€œaccidents.â€� As we approached the pool, we noticed there was no one swimming. The lifeguard informed us that they had to over-chlorinate the pool. When asked why, she said that a small child had emptied its bowels into the pool. YUCK!!!! Apparently, this is not uncommon at the Hard Rock pool. As we were waiting, another guest asked what was going on, and when we told her, she replied, â€œOh, great! No again!â€� It seems that the same thing happened the day before. So if you were looking to the Hard Rock as an adultâ€™s playground, think again. Dining: The Hard Rock has several semi-decent restaurants, but they are far too popular for their own good. The wait is extensive and the prices are high. We chose to return to the Portofino across the street for their excellent hand-made pizza. Checkout is early at the Hard Rock, and even though the room wasnâ€™t ready for us, they still insisted on early checkout. So once again, I marched down the long line of stairs happy to be leaving the Hard Rock. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fun, fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is nice but not as nice as the other two on Universal property. They make you think the rooms are real big, but they are just normal unless you get a delux room. Those look real nice, but they are $50 more per night, and at $289.00 plus tax per night it's hard to go any higher. The front desk staff was OKAY, but the maid manager fro our floor was wonderful. He got us a frig ($15 per day) and a rollaway bed ($20 per day) for free. He didn't even want us to tip him, but we made him let us. Our room smelled real bad (like Cat Pee or Mildew) Finally by day 4, I couldn't take the smell any more so they told us that the room had a pipe with a water leak and sprayed something to cover it up. They should not have put us in there in the 1st place. We did not even get an appolagy from any one.The hall carpets are dirty and our furniture and comfortor in our room was stained (Found a roach in my bed on morning 2) The pool is wonderful and not to cold, but I never saw anyone cleaning it during our stay (even w/ babies in Dypers in it) ......Ecoli!!!! The Kids loved the slide and we did not have a problem finding chairs and they also do things to make kids happy and they have life guards which is nice. The pool staff was just ok, not overly nice. The Food was great at the Pantry, but service just so so, way over priced $75 for breakfast Buffet and $65 for lunch sandwiches for a family of 5. ($20 for 4 ice cream cones) Pool food and drink service was terrible and over priced as well. ($12 for nachos) The over all vacation was a great and We would not do Universal any other way. The resorts are close and no waiting in the lines. City walk is fun to, but the resturants do not honor your room key for prefered seating like the hotel says, and then when you ask the hotel they ignore it. Islands of Adventure is the the best park we have ever gone to, we loved it. Yes we would do it again, but we would stay at Portafina. We stayed there last time and loved it. It is truely a 5 star hotel. Hard Rock Could be, but they need to work on some things.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked my vacation thru Universalorlando everything went A OK! The hotel was gorgeous, room was very clean, and spacious, employees were friendly and helpful. Definately would recommend to my friends, and would certainly do the whole trip again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Pleasant Staff, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day, 3 night stay at the Hard Rock. From the beginning we had a wonderful experience. The staff is extremely friendly (as were everyone in the hotel and both theme parks!) Our room was super clean, which is a huge importance for me! THe bathroom was a great size with a full shower and sink. There was also another area with a sink and mirrorm which was great for two people needing to get ready at the same time. Full mini-bar that was reasonalby priced for almost all of the items. Comfortable beds and pillows as well. The pool was just wonderful as well as the Beach Bar. You can take a quick ferry ride to the parks or a short five minute walk. The Hard Rock is the closet to the parks out of the three hotels. I forgot a personal item, and when I called the front desk they showed up at our door with a bag full of what I needed. What service!!! Last, but not least, I got home and realized I had misplaced my wallet! I called the hotel to see if I had left it there and luckily I had. They had put it in a safe and were going to ship it to me at no charge. We will back next year for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Closer
Reviews.Content: Just got home - perfect hotel for adults & kids - quick easy walk to parks & citywalk - keep your starbucks cup for free refills for entire trip (also gotta have the ice cream GREAT) - pool & service great - step to front of hotel and ask an employee for a quick ride to anywhere close - no problem - water taxi quick & easy to city walk - Universal & Islands just show your room key and no waiting in lines - great spot ! "Take it Easy" you'll hear from the staff......

Reviews.Title: “Stay here or stay at home!!! Our 'family' loves it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ahhhh, the Hard Rock Hotel Orlando..... That's what I think when I hear those words. My family and friends stayed here in July and August 2003 and are returning in June of this year AGAIN (3rd time). I can't even think of a better place for a family of 4 to stay than the Hard Rock. It's the closest to the Islands of Adventure and Universal Studios parks, all within walking distance unless you take the boat which the kids loved. We bought a week's pass (2 park/5 day pass on-line because it's cheaper and less hassle than standing in line) and just went over for a few hours in the mornings and retreated to the hotel after lunch for a swim and some activities. We thought the hotel was the BEST EVER and the kids are STILL talking about it. Now, when we stay somewhere else, the kids want the Hard Rock. No wonder! They have the sand beach, a great water slide that even the adults enjoyed, movies at the pool twice/week (in case of rain it's in the lobby area with lots of bean bags etc.), lots of poolside activities, vollyball, etc. We loved the music around the property and ate at the hotel almost every day or night. The food was not cheap but it was really good and lots of it. And actually is wasn't that EXpensive either. The kids pool is about a foot deep and has little fountains in it. When my son was two we couldn't get him out of it. It's the BEST! You can actually sit by the pool in the sun or shade at any time during the day, watch the kids play, or take them to the child care facility for a small fee. They have lots of activities and the kids love it. They even feed them in the evenings. Some of the rooms have a view of the parks fireworks which we enjoyed. You can get a great rate through AAA so it's worth joining AAA if you are not already a member. You can get rates under $200/night for two queen beds, etc. We loved our rooms--they couldn't have been any cleaner. Also, they have a Starbucks and an ice cream parlor. Now that can be expensive if you have a sweet tooth. ha ha All in all I say the Hard Rock Hotel is my very favorite. We also own a timeshare through RCI and choose this place 3 to 1 over ANY of the timeshares we have visited. Enjoy this place! We always do and can't wait to go back. See you there.....

Reviews.Title: “Great way to see Universal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the HRH because it was one of the hotels on-site at Universal. Most of our friends and family had stayed at portofino in the past so we were experimenting on the basis of reviews here and elsewhere. We had a great time, although admittedly our stay of a couple of days was spent mostly out of the hotel at the attractions. The stay was also improved by a complimentary upgrade because the first room offered wasn't what we had reserved. The room-key is great for letting you skip the queues at the attractions and for paying in shops and restaurants. A couple of days is about the longest we could have stayed - once you've done the rides to death and once even the Hulk has lost some of its oomph, you really need to get 'off campus' to other restaurants and shops. But while we were there, it was a fun place, piped music, donuts and CDs, live band performances in the lobby, biggest arcade games room I've seen in a hotel, great memorabilia and decent restaurants. If we were to go with kids to Universal, we might well consider staying there again. Self-parking is handy, the staff were very helpful and cheery and the rooms were cleaned and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “No Thanks.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Monday evening with reservations, but the hotel had no record or information about our arrival. We waited for at least 45 minutes until they just gave us a room, and said they would figure it out in the morning. The front desk staff person was blase and uninterested in doing anything to help us, and moved very slowly. The room was very nice, the hotel is quiet upstairs, and we stayed 4 nights with no problems. The one thing that is the "DEAL BREAKER" is that we called the front desk, requested a 5 AM wake-up call for the next morning for our early flight out of town. Nobody called us and we woke up too late to make the plane!!!! We got silent stares as we told the desk staff on the way out!! Unbelieveable!!! If you like the Loew's properties, I recommend the Portofino across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely Universal”
Reviews.Author: TripsIM
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip with NJTravel. We visited the Hard Rock Jan. 1-4, 2004. We went during the holiday season. We had a standard room. Staying at one of the Universal properties is the only way to see Uiversal Studios. NO waiting at all and we could walk to everything. The hotel was nice, but a little nosey, because they have music piped in everywhere. The pool is fabulous. The food prices are NOT outrageous either. Our travel agent gave us the details ahead of time, so we knew what to do.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a flight/hotel package with Expedia on a non-holiday weekend in January arriving late Friday and leaving early Tuesday. The kids (11 and 13) had a couple days off from school for teacher training. We arranged over the internet for a car to meet us at the airport and bring us back to the airport several days later for $80 roundtrip. The car will make a stop on the way to the hotel if you want to buy milk, cereal, snacks, etc (so you aren't tempted to buy stuff in the room fridge). I think the car service is cheaper for a family of four than the Mears shuttle and about the same as a taxi. Of course a trip to Orlando is for the kids. My wife and I weren't expecting great things. We were worried about too many kids, too much noise, small rooms and poor service. Expecially since we were arriving late (we'll get the last room in the hotel?). But our 3rd floor room was quiet (at the end of the hall away from elevators made for long walks but a quiet room), clean and roomy. The roll-a-way was provided soon after we checked in. The weather was great, we swam all three days, played volleyball, had fun in the water slide, and watched our kids play basketball in the pool for a long time. Universal Theme Park and Islands of Adventure were great and the express pass means you never wait in line. The Bob Marley restaurant at City Walk had great spicy Jamaican food. Prices at the pool restaurant at the hotel were reasonable, and there's a market/store in the hotel where you can buy pastries, cereal, etc. You can walk by the canal to Portofino or the theme parks, or take the (free) water taxi. We were lucky to visit when the hotel and parks weren't crowded. And we had great weather. But it's a cool place. I even opened my eyes a few times on the Hulk. Orlando may be virtual, sort of like being in the matrix, but it was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A TOUCH OF CLASS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok i would first like to say that i am an average guy with average expectations and also i have a family, and pride myself on my honesty, and have been to a lot of very good hotels and some not so good, but with hand on my heart the two previous reviews before this one are total and i really do mean total garbage. I stayed at this hotel not so long ago and it was immaculate ,expensive but immaculate the rooms were not only clean and tidy they were luxury with the most comfortable bed i have ever come accross in a hotel, everything in the hotel was absolutely fantastic ,the pool was the best i have ever been in so classy and relaxing ,not deep but as i just said relaxing and classy which pretty much summed up the whole hotel, as for the staff most were spanish american , now where ever you go in america you are expected to tip , to think other wise is to say the least very nieve , and the staff in the hotel did expect a tip BUT YOU SHOW ME AN AMERICAN THAT DOSENT, now the staff were not rude they were just ... how shall i put this ..JUST AMERICANS its their culture , i mean you have to bare one thing in mind this is probably one of orlandos top hotels and if the staff were not up to scratch they would be out of a job but they are up to scratch believe me. Now the location of this hotel is brilliant its a stones throw away from city walk " a out of this world place" which has islands of adventure and universal studios in its grounds . When we whent to this hotel it was at the begining of september and my little boy who is eleven had just two other children round about his own age to play with while we were there ,but that was to be expected because the kids were back to school by that time , and besides he had so much fun with myself and my wife visiting all the theme parks he dident care ,but the point i am trying to make is that to suggest the hard rock hotel is over run with screaming kids is a joke , the atmosphere to this hotel is relaxed and modern .Now i will just rap up this review by simply saying this hotel is not cheap, america is not cheap , i saved up for three years to afford this holiday for my family for that one off luxury experience and it was well worth it , and if you can afford this hotel and america in genral go for it you wont regret it , but on the other hand you really are trying to do the whole thing on a budget and are reluctant to tip . Forget it there are plenty of places in this world alot cheaper than orlando YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!!

Reviews.Title: “I have had better service in 3rd world countries”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was the worse hotel stay I have ever had. Room was unclean. Staff was slow and rude. Was charged for vallet parking when I did not use it. There was mold growing on the pool chairs. Waited forever for room service and bar service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: absolutely fabulous, the best hotel in the world! food is fantastic, friendly and affiant staff I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not for people without kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hard Rock during off season in mid September. There are 2 reasons why we choose the Hard Rock, the perk to jump to the front of lines at Universal with your room key and because someone recommended it to us. It turmed out Universal was not crowded in Sept even on a weekend. Lines were short and after a week at Disney, a 20 min wait did not seem long. Maybe during peak season you do need your key for the lines. Someone with small kids did recommend the hotel to us. This is NOT a place for people without kids. There are kids running up and down the halls at all times of the day. We upgraded to the concierge level which was a little better but still lots of noisy kids and it cost us almost $100 a day more! (They also did not have any rooms available with a king bed in the regular part of the hotel). The people who worked at the concierge lounge were very young and only seemed to be interested in talking to each other about when their shift ended rather then helping any guests. They did not clean any of the tables in the lounge until someone complained. The coffee shop was also closed for renovation and the only choice to eat was at the bar by the very crowded pool. The food was very overpriced and not good. This is a fun place for families but there are much better places to stay for the money if you don't have kids.

Reviews.Title: “coolest hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: had a great time here with my husband daughter and sister. The food was great and the staff very friendly .we only stayed for 2 nights and were sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just found this site so I am a little late in posting ... My husband and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for a week while on vacation in August we just loved it, it is without a doubt one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in ,very clean , lovely decor throughout the hotel and in the rooms they were just beautiful and spacious , we loved the 5 minute scenic little boat ride out back of the hotel to City Walk which is at the front entrance of Universal Studios it was non stop fun the whole time we were there so many things to see and do , great restraunts and entertainment at night at City Walk, and if you show your room key at both Universal Studios and Universal's Islands of Adventure for most rides and attractions you can skip the regular lines with UNIVERSAL EXPRESSSM ride access all day , every day it was like we were VIP's . We look forward to our next trip there ! Amber in Las Vegas , NV

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Pool ! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Love this Hard Rock Hotel. The place is very clean,relaxing&fun. The service is great from the time you check in to the pool staff to the wait staff at the " Kitchen " restaurant. The is awsome. The dive in movies are a great way to enjoy an evening athe the H. R. Beach Club/ pool. Stayed here about 9 or 10 times , great time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i think that the Hrad Rock Hotel was the best hotel my family and I ever stayed at. We stayed on November 5- 10 and everything there was great. I have no complaints about the room service ro food, because we stayed on the sixth floor and when we got back to our hotel everything was replaced and clean. My only complaint was how deep the pool was. It's only about 4 ft. deep, so you can't really swim, but you can play basketball and go on the water slide which keep you occupied. I'm dying to go back and I would recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel, the best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Hard Rock Hotel, stayed for 12 nights. I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. The hotel itself is out of this world, the pool and slide along with beach club is great. Not having to queue at the park was excellent, had read it was close to the parks but it was even closer than I expected. The buffet breakfast was the best selection I have ever seen, recommend the omlette station, very good omlettes. The music was great and enjoyed the outdoor table tennis and shuttle. The only criticism I would have is the temperature in the Velvet Lounge, loved the decor there but the air conditioning was really set low, you would need a jumper in there it was cold.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband(23) and I(20) spent four nights at the Hard Rock Hotel and we had a great time. We were there in July and it never seemed overcrowded. The service was very good. The best part was the fact we never had to wait more than 15 minutes to get on the rides at the parks. Also the walk to the parks is no longer than 10 minutes. The food was very good. We even ordered roomservice a couple of times and that worked very well. The rooms were nice and very clean. You could even order movies that were not even out on video yet from the comfort of your room and that was a plus for us because we love watching movies. The pool was very nice and the water slide was fun.We have no complaints about this Hotel and we are already planning a trip back. We had a Blast!

Reviews.Title: “HRH - 29th-31st October”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd read all the reviews on here and they were obviously mixed but we took the chance and it was the right choice! The hotel is amazing with great landscaping, surroundings a great pool but the best thing is the incredible atmosphere of the place. The music is perfect and the memorabilia just adds to the hotel. People had said about loud music but i found they turned it down or off at 10PM so and we couldn't hear it in our room. To top it all of was the benefits of being onsite and having Universal Express and it ended out being one of the best hotel stays we've ever had! I recommend it highly and I know I will be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for adults and kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having initially grimaced at the per night rate, I was pleasantly surprised with the overwhelming service and quality of the Hard Rock. We splurged and booked one of the kid's suites which I highly recommend for anyone with over 2 kids. The kids loved their own room and the cool pool with slide. The convenience (walking distance) to the Universal Parks makes it a hands down choice over staying on-property at Disney. The commute to Disney was less than some of the bus rides from the hotels there. The biggest impression for me was the quality of the service and courtesy from the bellhop to even the lifeguard at the pool who thanked me for staying there. I will be back at the Hard Rock when returning to Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: passionfortravel9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel with my husband and my three children aged 8, 10 and 13 for three nights at the end of September. We loved the hotel. We had anice room with two queen sized beds and a pull out couch for $160/ night. Our whole family had fun in the pool, playing basketball, sliding down the waterslide and hanging out in the hot tubs. It was beautiful at night as some of the palm trees had small white lights on their trunks. I could lay on a lounge chair with a cold drink and watch my kids play. Everyday, we had a five minute walk or boat ride to the gates of Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. We thought the express pass we got with our room keys was worth the cost of the hotel alone. We went to the front of a lot of long lines with our passes and saved alot time that would have been spent waiting in line. One of the days we were there it was particularily hot and it was great to be able to take a quick walk back to the hotel and cool off in the pool before returning to the parks. The proximity to Citywalk is handy if you want a wider selection of restaurants for dinner and there is also a huge theater compex there. If we are back in Orlando in the next few years we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not Disney!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were completely in love with the hotel, it's absolutely gorgeous. However, I have arrived at Disney hotels that have the rooms ready at 1 p.m. whereas the Hard Rock were holding fast to their 4 p.m. check-in (my husband complained and got us a room). We decided to grab a burger at the Beach Club by the pool..........rip-off central. My biggest gripe was the absolutely outrageous prices and the inability to obtain a good breakfast at a reasonable price We evn walked over to Citywalk at 7:30 a.m. and everything was closed. When we got back to the hotel our choice was the $15 per person buffet or the crappy Starbucks that had my daughter make her own iced coffee and charged the other one $5 for a Frappucinno. Thankfully we only stayed two nights and then moved on to the Caribbean Beach at Disney with it's wonderful food court that opens at 6:30 a.m. In future, as in the past, the entire stay will be at a Disneyworld Resort, the Hard Rock was a beautiful waste of time and money

Reviews.Title: “Best stay for Halloween horror Nights”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best place to stay at if you are going to halloween horror nights at universal's islands of adventure. I have been going to it for the past 5 years but this year was truly awesome because we stayed on property. I will definitely stay at one of the three every halloween. My family and I loved the hard rock hotel (I am very picky when choosing a hotel!)especially since I was coming with 3 other families with children ranging from 1 to 12 years old and my 13 year old who loves water slides(By the way, they have a pretty good slide for a hotel.) I usually read all comments that I can find before choosing a hotel and this sometimes takes a few months. I want to say that many comments were very true-like yes the hallways are as cold as your freezer which wouldn't be so bad if it was in the middle of the summer ,but we are talking about October. My friends were sitting outside late at night and they said that everytime the door opened the hotel was airconditioning the outdoors and they were freezing. Another thing was the housekeeping knocked on the door to clean at 9:30 a.m. on day of check out for my friend who was leaving a day before us. She was in the shower and they walked right in. When she complained that she called for a wake up call at that time not a walk in, she got no restitution! This must be a common thing because the very next day the same thing happen to my other friends but this time it was 8:30a.m. I was prepared. I had put my do not disturb sign out the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly. My children (6 and 8) loved the pool, especially the water slide. The kids liked that one side of the pool was a beach. I thought the idea of family movie on the beach at night was really nice. I will admit though, the rooms could have been bigger for the price you paid. The parking fee of $6 a day was a little much after paying to stay at the hotel but you had in/out priviledges. Cannot complain to much. The best thing about the hotel was: you are a five minute walk to the parks. You do not have to wait for a shuttle. You can walk! The paths are very clean and landscaped. The express passes were nice to have as well for staying on site. I will say though, we only used them once. We stayed Oct 1-Oct 5, 2003. The parks were empty. We did not wait more then 5-10 minutes for any ride. I was very pleased with the overall Universal/Hard Rock experience. I would stay their again if we choose Universal for another family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pool was extremely disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Orlando this past summer for the first time and were really disappointed with their pool. The very deepest it was (only in one small area) was 4 feet. We thought our teen-aged son would enjoy the pool - he wouldn't even go in. It is a great pool for kids aged 6 -10 or younger.Our big joke of the stay was that one area of the pool actually stated that the water was 9" deep (yes inches, not feet ) Was that for fear that someone would drown in 9" of water??? We did enjoy the memorabilia, the room was ok, the staff wasn't all that friendly. We went from there to the Polynesian in Disney World which was much better (we felt) as far as hospitality was concerned. Also, more food choices available in Disney. The only good part about the Hard Rock was the close proximity to the parks and express lines for rides. We would not stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “nice, relaxed atmosphere, a reprieve from Disney and the rest of Orlando”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveller1
Reviews.Content: nice lobby and beautiful grounds; very good location great access to Universal parks, and it is very convenient to pay for everything with your room card and bypass the regular attraction/ride line ups as a hotel guest rooms are comfortable, but try to get a room higher up; the hallways are looking a bit beat up and the room service dishes linger way too long in the hallway (up to 2 days) pool and park views are pleasant but the windows are too dirty to have a clear view I was expecting more memorabilia, but there was a rock'n'roll party atmosphere on the weekends overall it was very good value, I stayed there a week for $125.00/night plus taxes and parking parking is poor value since they have limited space and the lots get so full on the weekend the hotel guests have no place to park, a real inconvenience staff were reasonably friendly but did not go out of their way; service standards were definitely at a 4 star level, not a five star level, though turn down service was executed nicely with some pleasant suprises I was surprised how many families with young children were there, I was expecting a more youthful/mature crowd the pool is too shallow for a real swim, but is great for young children the biggest disappointment was the poolside food, we had the nachos, topped with cheap, low-grade processed cheese, not good value at all they could use more front desk staff, the line ups at check-in and check-out were too long I would stay there again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to scratch ..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like some other reviewers, we found that whilst it was an attractive, laid back, friendly place, the quality just didn't match the price. Room not made up until gone 4pm on more than one occasion, $6 a day to park (a bit penny pinching when guests are paying over $200 a night), having to chase up coffee sachets for in room coffee maker etc But worst of all was noisy residents returning at 2am - 3am from City Walk. The hotel could do more to stress to guests that not all residents appreciate hooting and hollering outside their rooms in the wee hours. If you're going, I suggest asking for a room down the corridor away from a) the lifts and b) the ice machine and keep hold of those earplugs the airline gave you!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock: An undiscovered treasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After only a short 3 weeks of planning, our family vacation finally arrived. We stayed 5 days and they were the best five days I've ever experienced. Our plane landed shortly after 4:30 August 29th and by 5:30 we were settled in our room. We weren't planning on getting a view of anything but we were pleasantly surprised when we walked in only to see a spectacular post card shot of the pool and a wonderful view of both theme parks. If I could give any advise it would be to stay on the Club Level floor (7th). It's only accessible to those who are staying on that floor so the hallways aren't as crowded or as loud. The club lounge is great and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. It is open from 7:30 am until 11 pm every day. You have free bottled water, coffee, lemonade, iced tea, and mini cans of coke, sprite or diet coke available all day long. In addition to that, you get a free breakfast with fresh doughnuts, fruit salad, bagels, muffins, and cereal every morning. If that wasn't enough, from 5:00-7:00 each night they have free beer, wine, and hors d'oeuvres (chicken kabobs one night, pasta salad and meatballs the next, mini hot dogs another night). Then from 8-9 they serve a dessert item such as cookies, brownies, ice cream, or pudding (it changes each night). Because of these convenient perks, my family only had to buy one meal a day making our trip a lot more affordable. There is always music playing throughout the hotel and they have speakers under the water in the pool so you don't miss a song. The parks opened at 9 each morning and closed between 6 and 8 each night. We stayed just as the peak season was finishing so the fireworks weren't on and the park hours were shorter. Having the front of the line access was priceless. You can do both parks in a day or do each ride at least twice all thanks to staying on site, and your hotel is at most a 15 minute walk away or a 5 minute boat ride. Everywhere you look people are laughing or smiling and enjoying themselves. It can't be put into words the happiness and joy this hotel brings to you. In my opinion, this hotel has barely been discovered and the 7th floor is only the beginning of what's to come. If you and your family are looking to get away to Universal Orlando there is NO other place to stay at and the perks are out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very muvh!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a trying trip to FL for a funeral, we decided to spend a day at Islands of Adventure before returning home. I booked 2 nights at the Hard Rock since our 3 20-something kids were with us and thought they'd enjoy it. When we arrived around 6 pm on 8/24 we found out the travel agent had booked us a room with 2 queen beds but no sofa. My husband was offered a sofa bed for $25/night more or an upgrade to club level for $50/night more, which is the option he took. We were quite pleased with that decision. The room overlooked the entrance and had a nice view, and it was quite large and comfortable for 5 adults. It was also well-kept. In fact, we got a little smudge on the white comforter when we placed our suitcase on it and the next day, they changed the comforter. The mini-bar is over-priced but fruit and drinks are available in the lounge from 7:30 to 11 so the bar wasn't used at all. The breakfast buffet and the appetizer buffet were excellent and the "kids" enjoyed hanging out at the poolside lounge. The staff is friendly and helpful, and security was discreetly evident. It's a short walk out the back door and past the pool to City Walk and the parks or you can opt for a water taxi, and showing your room key really does get you to the head of the lines! The day we went to the park, the skies opened up at about 3 pm complete with thunder and lightning. Of course we didn't have rain gear and when we realized it wasn't going to let up we slogged back to the hotel through pools of water that were higher than my ankles joking that if we were REALLY stars they'd dry us off when we got back to the room. As we approached the back door of the hotel it opened and the young man who worked at the pool greeted us all with warm towels. After we'd dried off a bit, he took the wet towels and gave us dry ones to keep wrapped in till we got upstairs. We truly felt like stars!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hard Rock!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 3 nights at the Hard Rock, from 8/31 thru 9/3. We got a special rate of $135 per night, using the Entertainment card. We thought the hotel was very nice. Our room was spacious and comfortable. It was nice to have a separate grooming area outside the bathroom. The decor was nice too - the dressing area accessories were all pewter and looked very nice. The location was great - you can walk to the Universal parks and CityWalk, or take the shuttle boat. My husband used the gym, which was very well equipped. You do have to pay a daily fee to use it, which I think was $11. We did not eat at the restaurants, but did use the pool lounge. My son loved the water slide. This is a very nice place to stay while visiting Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: MorgansSurrey_Uk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Hard Rock Hotel, which having carried out extensive rearch beforehand and reading previous reveiews were expecting something special. However we felt that although it was nice it lacked that wow factor. The rock memrobilla was scant. We would rate it as a nice four star hotel and not five as advertised in the brochure. Certain points to be aware of before you stay, are that the lobby is on the third floor which means that two floors are below. This coupled with the palm trees growing adjacent to the windows can result in restricted veiws. We were originally allocated a room on the third floor for which we had paid for a pool view. You could just see the pool between the large trees. Due to this we upgraded to the club floor. Club level does not mean exclusivity as promoted, just more large families, lots of young children, more noise and chaos when trying to eat in the club lounge. The pool is shallow with two small areas up to four feet deep. The table tenns, shuffle board and giant chess have all seen better days. The hotel is starting to look tired and would benefit from some overdue maintenence. The staff were helpful and friendly. The Sunset grill ofered good food at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK, express ride access makes it worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Spazz67
Reviews.Content: I think it's a great hotel, we just happen to get a lousy room. I knew we weren't going to be in the room much, so I didn't see spending the extra money for the pool view. However, had I known that the "garden view" room would mean putting you in the level below the main floor, then I would have paid the extra money for a pool view. We stayed in room 1123, the "garden view" window was too dirty to be able to see out of. The carpet in our room had a few stains. The room had a slight musty smell to it. The hallway to our room was very, very cold & the music was much louder than everywhere else, annoyingly so, even for someone who loves rock-n-roll music. The room next to us had their room service dirty dishes out and they sat there for hours. That was a view I didn't ask for! I would have asked to switch, but we arrived late (about 8:30 pm) and the hotel was completely full. On the bright side, all the staff were very friendly and helpful. My kids absolutely loved the pool and the hotel in general. The hotel is full of energy and fun, not stuffy- at all. But the best of all, access to express lanes was, BY FAR, THE BEST BENEFIT!! Your room key is all you need to show to hop into the express lanes. That alone is worth the extra money. If you want to go to one of the parks on the day of check-in, you can check-in early in the morning (you're room will not be ready yet however), leave your bags (if you want), grab your room keys and head off to the park to take full advantage of those express lanes. Our flight got in late, so we didn't do that. However, we did go to the park the day we checked-out (check-out is 10:00 or 11 a.m.), but we got to keep our room keys and they were good for express rides until the park closed. I think the longest we waited on any ride was 10 minutes. That is an almost "too good to be true" perk, but it's true! I'd stay in that crappy room again if I had to just for that benefit alone. However, I felt I had to base my rating on the room, the amenities and service. As I said, I wasn't happy with our room. Another disappointment was that once we were at IOA (Islands of Adventure) we discovered that for some reason their system was not allowing room charges. Apparently their computers were having problems. So, we had to go back to our room to get more cash. Bummer. We didn't eat at any of their restaurants so I can't give an opinion of that. I would have given a much higher rating if our room was more like what you would expect out of a $230/nite hotel. However, I would give it a second chance, but this time, ask for a pool view room.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: rscaso
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed in the Hard Rock Hotel! From arrival to our departure, we were treated with first class treatment (Thanks Sarah). The staff was very outgoing, friendly, and helpful. It's a great family hotel--large pool, water slide, large beach area, plenty of lounge cots and chairs at the pool. Kids activities everynight at the hotel. The music is not as loud as you may read or hear about, unless you are near the Sunset Grill Restaurant. Great access to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure--by a 5 minute walk or a 3 minute boat trip. The room key access to all the rides is AWESOME! The wait time was an average of 7 minutes. We had the budget room--non pool view side (4th floor). But that's OK, our room still had a good view and it served it's purpose. Our family decided on the last night we would stay on the "Concierge Level" (7th Floor). I would only recommend the 7th floor if money was not an issue. Our family did the 5 Park, 14 day flex-ticket (Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure, Sea World, Wet & Wild Water Park, and Busch Gardens. A great way to see the parks and a good investment! Each park had their own highs and lows for each family member. Busch Gardens: Do the rides and see the shows, you can see wildlife animals at your local zoo and you would be supporting your local zoo. Do the rides in the mornings because if the park is not crowded in the afternoons, you may find a ride or two closed down. One Note: Don't miss the Ice Show! It is totally AWESOME! Sea World: If you're looking at seeing the shows and the marine life, this is the place to do it. But if you have children who are planning on doing rides, you will be disappointed. Wet & Wild Water Park: It's compact and it will fulfill your water needs. The park is only a few minutes away from the hotel. Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure: It's a Win-Win experience. By staying at an Universal Hotel and using your room key to by-pass the lines, you will have a great time! By going this route, you almost forget about the heat and the humidity. Alaska Airlines was our air carrier and they were great! Alamo Car Rental: Very convenient at the Orlando International Airport and good service. If you stay at the Hard Rock Hotel and you are planning on renting a vehicle, have the hotel send you driving directions to and from the airport and theme parks. Also, as you travel to the hotel from the airport, you will travel through two toll-gates. Have at least two dollars of change with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to the Hard Rock for 14 nights expecting a great time and were not disappointed, from the moment we arrived to the minute we left everything was fantastic. All the staff were great and very friendly, except for the pool attendant's who thought that they were better than everyone else. Using the room keys to get front of the line access is priceless, never anymore than a 15 minute wait even when some of the lines are 120 minutes long. The food in the Palm restaurant can be quite pricey but the Sunset Grill is good and the price reasonable. There is constant music, which is great and is not as loud as some people have made out, just right. All in all a great hotel and we will certainly be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip we ever had”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hard Rock Hotel was the best we ever had. My husband, Daughter(11) and I stayed at the Hotel for 4 nights and we didn't want to leave. Everyone was so nice and accomodating, the room was very comfortable, the decor was elegant and the service could not be beat. We cannot wait to plan another stay at this fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel Ive ever stayed at! I went with my mom,dad,and sisters to this hotel in 2001, 2002, and are going in august of 2003. It is our favorite hotel ever. Right next to Universal and Islands of Adventure. GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for my 40th b-day and it was awesome! The staff was friendly and very accomodating. We stayed in a deluxe room on the club level and the room was tremendous with 2 adults and 2 kids. There was always drinks available and the food was good. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

HotelInfo.Name: Hard Rock Hotel at Universal Orlando
HotelInfo.Address: 5800 Universal Blvd, Orlando, FL 32819
